Reserves and Academy|Everton]] |years1 = 2010–2018 |clubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] |caps1 = 150 |goals1 = 21 |years2 = 2012 |clubs2 = → [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] (loan) |caps2 = 13 |goals2 = 4 |years3 = 2013 |clubs3 = → [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] (loan) |caps3 = 4 |goals3 = 0 |years4 = 2018– |clubs4 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] |caps4 = 25 |goals4 = 3 |nationalyears1 = 2008–2009 |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] |nationalcaps1 = 7 |nationalgoals1 = 2 |nationalyears2 = 2009–2010 |nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] |nationalcaps2 = 7 |nationalgoals2 = 2 |nationalyears3 = 2010–2012 |nationalteam3 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] |nationalcaps3 = 12 |nationalgoals3 = 0 |nationalyears4 = 2013 |nationalteam4 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] |nationalcaps4 = 3 |nationalgoals4 = 0 |nationalyears5 = 2011–2013 |nationalteam5 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] |nationalcaps5 = 5 |nationalgoals5 = 1 |nationalyears6 = 2013– |nationalteam6 = [[England national football team|England]] |nationalcaps6 = 26 |nationalgoals6 = 2 |club-update = 00:32, 23 March 2019 (UTC) |nationalteam-update = 00:32, 23 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Ross Barkley''' (born 5 December 1993) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as an [[attacking midfielder]] for {{English football updater|Chelsea}} club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and the [[England national football team|English national team]].
Barkley began his professional career at [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in 2008. After [[Loan (sports)|loan]] spells at [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] and [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] he became a regular in their team, playing 179 total games and scoring 27 goals for Everton. He signed for Chelsea in January 2018.
Barkley made his full international debut in 2013. He played for England at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and was selected in [[Roy Hodgson]]'s 23-man squad for [[UEFA Euro 2016]] but did not appear in any of England's matches. Managers and teammates have compared his style of play to those of [[Michael Ballack]], [[Paul Gascoigne]] and [[Wayne Rooney]].
==Early life== Barkley was born in [[Liverpool]], Merseyside.<ref>{{Hugman|22190|accessdate=5 December 2017}}</ref> He joined [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] as an 11-year-old and played for the club's youth teams. He was named as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in a first team league match in early 2010–11, and was expected to make his [[Premier League]] debut<ref>{{cite news |last=Doyle |first=Ian |title=Bank on Barkley to shine at Blues says boss Moyes |url=http://www.dailypost.co.uk/sport-news/everton-fc/2011/04/28/everton-fc-s-ross-barkley-will-break-through-next-season-says-david-moyes-55578-28596667/ |accessdate=8 August 2011 |newspaper=Liverpool Daily Post |date=28 April 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6ABtLpGgM?url=http://www.dailypost.co.uk/sport-news/everton-fc/2011/04/28/everton-fc-s-ross-barkley-will-break-through-next-season-says-david-moyes-55578-28596667/ |archivedate=25 August 2012}}</ref> before his leg was broken in one place after a collision with [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]'s [[Andre Wisdom]] during an England under-19 match in October 2010.<ref>{{cite news |title=Everton's Ross Barkley breaks leg on England U19 duty |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/e/everton/9092603.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=8 August 2011 |date=14 October 2010}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Everton=== ====Early career==== He recovered from his injury in time to join the first team for pre-season training before the beginning of 2011–12. During pre-season, [[Tim Cahill]] heralded Barkley as the most talented footballer he had worked with.<ref>{{cite web |title=Cahill Speaks To GrandOldTeam |url=http://www.grandoldteam.com/news/general-news/2011/jun/13/cahill-speaks-to-grandoldteam |publisher=GrandOldTeam |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110809065151/http://www.grandoldteam.com/news/general-news/2011/jun/13/cahill-speaks-to-grandoldteam |archivedate=9 August 2011}}</ref> He made his debut in Everton's first home match of the season, a 1–0 defeat to [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]], and was named man of the match by Radio City Sport.<ref>{{cite web |last=Lewis |first=Andy |title=Barkley handed debut |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2011/08/20/barkley-handed-debut |publisher=Everton F.C |accessdate=20 August 2011 |date=20 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6ABtMGlA5?url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2011/08/20/barkley-handed-debut |archivedate=25 August 2012}}</ref> His early performances were highly praised, with [[Martin Keown]] predicting that "[Barkley will] be one of the best players we'll ever see in this country."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14739060.stm |title=Transfer deadline quotes of the day |date=31 August 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=31 August 2011}}</ref> He signed a new four-and-a-half-year contract in December 2011.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16217561.stm |title=Teenager Ross Barkley signs long-term Everton contract |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 December 2011 |accessdate=17 December 2011}}</ref>
On 14 September 2012, Barkley joined [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] on a one-month [[Loan (sports)|loan]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19597936 |title=Sheffield Wednesday sign Everton's Ross Barkley on loan |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=14 September 2012}}</ref> making his debut the same day in an away defeat against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19515143 "Brighton 3–0 Sheff Wed"]. BBC Sport. 14 September 2012. Retrieved 27 October 2012.</ref> He scored his first goal for the club, a penalty, against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] the following week.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19614957 "Sheffield Wed 1–2 Bolton"]. BBC Sport. 22 September 2012. Retrieved 22 September 2012.</ref> His loan was extended before he was recalled by Everton after playing 13 matches for Wednesday.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20030003 "Everton's Ross Barkley extends Sheffield Wednesday loan"]. BBC Sport. 22 October 2012. Retrieved 27 October 2012.</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2012/11/19/barkley-to-return-to-blues |title=Barkley To Return To Blues |publisher=Everton F.C. |accessdate=19 November 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121122050748/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2012/11/19/barkley-to-return-to-blues |archivedate=22 November 2012 }}</ref> He again went out on loan, this time to [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] for an "initial one-month stint", in January 2013<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2013/01/11/barkley-loaned-to-leeds |title=Barkley Loaned To Leeds |date=11 January 2013 |accessdate=11 January 2013 |publisher=Everton F.C. |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Dr7svEYi?url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2013/01/11/barkley-loaned-to-leeds |archivedate=22 January 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20130111/everton-midfielder-arrives-on-loan_2247585_3038068 |title=Everton midfielder arrives on loan |date=11 January 2013 |accessdate=11 January 2013 |publisher=Leeds United F.C. |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130113061715/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20130111/everton-midfielder-arrives-on-loan_2247585_3038068 |archivedate=13 January 2013}}</ref> and made his debut for Leeds in a derby match against [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20130112/barnsley-live_2247585_3038388 |title=Barnsley vs Leeds |date=12 January 2013 |accessdate=12 January 2013 |publisher=Leeds United F.C. |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004233514/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20130112/barnsley-live_2247585_3038388 |archivedate=4 October 2013}}</ref>
====2013–2018==== [[File:DinamoKiev-Everton (8).jpg|thumb|upright|Barkley playing for [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in 2015]]
Barkley re-joined the Everton first team for the [[2013–14 Everton F.C. season|2013–14 season]]. He scored his first goal for the club on the opening day in a 2–2 draw against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]], and was later named man of the match.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23644749 |title=Norwich 2–2 Everton |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=17 August 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/287291/report |title=Premier League: Everton draw 2–2 with Norwich at Carrow Road |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=18 August 2013}}</ref> During the first half of the season, Barkley put in several man-of-the-match performances, notably against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] – the latter whom he scored the winner against.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25387089 |title=Swansea 1–2 Everton |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=23 December 2013}}</ref> He received praise from many pundits including [[Alan Hansen]] who said Barkley has absolutely everything and [[Gary Lineker]] who claimed he is a star in the making and a prodigious talent.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25297570 |title=Everton's Ross Barkley can reach the top, says Alan Hansen |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=23 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25488606 |title=Ross Barkley: Everton midfielder can star for England says Lineker |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=23 December 2013}}</ref>
Barkley's first FA Cup goal came on 4 January 2014, opening a 4–0 win over Queens Park Rangers in the third round.<ref>{{cite news |last=Reddy |first=Luke |title=Everton 4–0 QPR |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25531987 |accessdate=26 May 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 January 2014}}</ref> In March, Barkley scored a superb solo goal against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] in which he ran from his own half to net the opener in a 3–0 victory.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26404288 |title=Newcastle 0–3 Everton |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=4 June 2014}}</ref> On 18 April 2014, he was named as one of the six players on the shortlist for the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] award.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/apr/18/pfa-player-of-the-year-award-shortlist-gerrard-lallana| |title=PFA Player of the Year award shortlist: Gerrard and Lallana nominated |date=18 April 2014 |accessdate=19 April 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> He scored a total of 6 goals in 34 Premier League matches throughout the season, including a goal against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 3 May which BBC Sport described as "spectacular" and was awarded goal of the season at Everton's end of year awards.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27168536 |title=Everton 2 Manchester City 3 |date=3 May 2014 |accessdate=3 May 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2622880/Seamus-Coleman-Toffees-player-season-Ross-Barkley-wins-best-goal-Man-City-strike-Everton-awards.html |title=Seamus Coleman is Toffees' player of the season while Ross Barkley wins best goal for Man City strike at Everton awards |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |accessdate=4 June 2014}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref>
On 29 July 2014, Barkley signed a new contract with Everton, keeping him at the club until 2018.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2014/07/29/barkley-signs-new-deal |title=Barkley Signs New Deal |date=29 July 2014 |accessdate=29 July 2014 |publisher=Everton F.C.}}</ref> Before the start of the 2014–15 season he suffered an injury to his [[medial collateral ligament]],<ref>{{cite news |title=Roberto Martínez: Ross Barkley may make Everton return in eight weeks |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/aug/19/roberto-martinez-ross-barkley-everton-eight-weeks |date=12 August 2014 |accessdate=31 August 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> and did not play until 18 October 2014, setting up [[Romelu Lukaku]]'s goal in a 3–0 home league win over [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]]. He scored his first goal of the season in a 3–1 win over Queens Park Rangers on 15 December.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30373609"Everton 3–1 QPR"]. BBC Sport. 15 December 2014. Retrieved 17 March 2015.</ref>
Barkley started the 2015–16 season with goals in Everton's first two league matches.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33744642"Everton 2–2 Watford"]. BBC Sport. 8 August 2015. Retrieved 9 August 2015.</ref>
Barkley scored Everton's first goal of the 2016–17 season on the opening day of the season, netting in the fifth minute of a 1–1 home draw against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36994878 |title=Everton 1–1 Tottenham Hotspur |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 August 2016}}</ref> In May 2017, Everton manager [[Ronald Koeman]] issued an ultimatum to Barkley, stating that if he was not signing a new contract, despite being offered an extension by the club, he would be sold in the summer.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/ross-barkley-contract-everton-transfer-news-ronald-koeman-press-conference-a7730236.html |title=Ronald Koeman gives Ross Barkley ultimatum over his Everton future |date=11 May 2017 |newspaper=The Independent |access-date=15 August 2017}}</ref> Koeman said on 26 July that Barkley had told him that he was ready for a new challenge and that he would not be signing a new contract with the club.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.nsno.co.uk/everton-news/2017/07/koeman-barkley-will-not-offered-new-everton-deal/ |title=Koeman: Barkley will not be offered new Everton deal |publisher=nsno.co.uk|access-date=26 July 2017}}</ref>
Barkley did not feature for Everton in his final season with the club, having been sidelined with a long-term hamstring injury.<ref name=ChelseaTransfer/>
===Chelsea=== [[File:BarkleyvSouthampton.jpg|150px|thumb|Barkley playing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2018]]
On 5 January 2018, Barkley joined Premier League club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] for a fee of £15 million, signing a five-and-a-half-year contract with the defending champions. He was assigned shirt number 8 by the club, the same number he wore at Everton.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2018/01/barkley-joins-the-blue.html |title=Barkley joins the Blues |publisher=Chelsea Football Club |date=5 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42574404 |title=Ross Barkley: Chelsea sign midfielder from Everton for £15m |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 January 2018 |accessdate=5 January 2018}}</ref> Barkley had been close to joining Chelsea previously on the summer transfer deadline day, before a move failed to materialise due to him suffering a long-term injury and wanting to consider his options.<ref name=ChelseaTransfer>{{Cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jan/05/ross-barkley-chelsea-everton |title=Chelsea announce signing of Ross Barkley from Everton in £15m deal |newspaper=The Guardian |date=5 January 2018}}</ref> Days after its completion, the transfer was referred to [[Merseyside Police]] by the [[Mayor of Liverpool]], [[Joe Anderson (politician)|Joe Anderson]], to investigate the possibility of fraud in the transaction.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-merseyside-42626014 |title=Mayor refers Barkley transfer to police |date=10 January 2018 |work=''BBC News''}}</ref> No fraud was found.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ross Barkley transfer: 'No fraud' in Everton to Chelsea move |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-merseyside-42705253 |accessdate=17 January 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 January 2018}}</ref> Barkley made his debut in a 2–1 defeat at Arsenal in the semi-final second leg of the [[EFL Cup]] on 24 January. He came on as a first-half substitute, replacing the injured [[Willian (footballer, born 1988)|Willian]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Report: Arsenal 2 Chelsea 1 (2–1 on agg) |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2018/01/report--arsenal-v-chelsea1.html |date=24 January 2018 |publisher=Chelsea F.C.}}</ref> Barkley made his Premier League debut in a 3–0 home loss to [[AFC Bournemouth]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Chelsea Suffer Shock 3–0 Defeat to Bournemouth in Premier League Action |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2756978-chelsea-suffer-shock-3-0-defeat-to-bournemouth-in-premier-league-action |date=1 February 2018 |publisher=Bleacher Report}}</ref>
On 7 October, Barkley scored his first goal for Chelsea in a 3–0 win away to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in the Premier League after a strong start to the season under new manager [[Maurizio Sarri]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Ross Barkley takes chance as Blues pose mount title threat: five things we learned from Chelsea vs Southampton |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/chelsea-southampton-five-things-we-learned-ross-barkley-eden-hazard-a8572981.html |date=8 October 2018 |work=The Independent}} </ref> He followed that up with a last minute equaliser against [[Manchester United]] at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] on 20 October. Barkley came off the bench to help Chelsea snatch a 2-2 draw.<ref>{{cite news |title=REPORT: CHELSEA 2 MANCHESTER UNITED 2 |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2018/10/20/report--- |date=21 October 2018|publisher=Chelsea Football Club}}</ref> On 28 October, he scored for the third game running against [[Burnley FC|Burnley]] at [[Turf Moor]], netting in a 4–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=REPORT: BURNLEY 0 CHELSEA 4 |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2018/10/28/report--burnley-v-chelsea |date=28 October 2018 |publisher=Chelsea Football Club}}</ref> On 15 February 2019 Barkley scored his first European goal as Chelsea beat Malmö 2-1 in their [[Europa League]] last 32 first leg tie. He scored again in his second successive Europa League game against [[Malmö FF|Malmö]] six days later in the second-leg tie at Stamford Bridge.<ref>{{cite news |title=Malmo 1-2 Chelsea: Ross Barkley scores first European goal in Europa League last-32 first leg |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11959/11637446/malmo-1-2-chelsea-ross-barkley-scores-first-european-goal-in-europa-league-last-32-first-leg |date=15 February 2019 |work=SkySports}} </ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Chelsea 3-0 Malmo (5-1 aggregate): Maurizio Sarri's side ease into Europa League last 16 first leg |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/chelsea-vs-malmo-ff/403952 |date=21 February 2019 |work=SkySports}} </ref>
==International career== [[File:Barkley Ross.jpg|thumb|upright|Barkley playing for [[England national under-19 football team|England under-19s]] in 2012]]
Barkley was eligible to represent both England and Nigeria as he has a Nigerian grandfather. Barkley opted to represent his country of birth.<ref>[http://www.voice-online.co.uk/article/ross-barkley%E2%80%99s-rise-makes-him-world-cup-banker] The Voice. 14 January 2014. Retrieved 13 August 2013.</ref> He has represented England at [[England national under-16 football team|under-16]], [[England national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]], [[England national under-20 football team|under-20]], [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] and [[England national football team|senior level]].<ref name="thefa-profile">{{cite web |title=FA.com Profile: Ross Barkley |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/All-Teams/Players/B/Ross-Barkley |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=8 August 2011}}</ref>
He was first called up for the under-16 level in September 2008, aged 14.<ref>{{cite news |last=Johnson |first=Tim |title=Barkley follows Rodwell and Baxter into England side |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=30 September 2008}}</ref> He was selected to play in the 2009 [[Montaigu Tournament]] and [[Captain (association football)|captained]] the team to success, beating [[Germany national youth football team|Germany]] 2–1 on penalties in the final.<ref>{{cite web |title=England retain Montaigu title |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/Mens-u16s/news/2009/england_germany_report_130409 |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=8 August 2011 |date=13 April 2009}}</ref> He also helped England win the [[2010 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]] with two goals en route to the final where England beat [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spain]] 2–1.<ref>{{cite web |title=England comeback seals U17 crown |url=http://www.uefa.com/UNDER17/matches/season=2010/round=15345/match=2002343/index.html |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=8 August 2011 |date=30 May 2010}}</ref>
Barkley was called up to the England U-21 squad in August 2011. On 28 May 2013, he was named in manager [[Peter Taylor (footballer, born 1953)|Peter Taylor]]'s 21-man squad for the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]].<ref>[http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u20s/News/2013/u20s-world-cup-squad-announcement-280513 "Final squad named"]. The Football Association. 28 May 2013. Retrieved 17 June 2013.</ref> He made his debut on 16 June, in a 3–0 win in a warm-up match against [[Uruguay national under-20 football team|Uruguay]].<ref>[http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u20s/News/2013/uruguay-report-160613 "Training win for Three Lions"]. The Football Association. 16 June 2013. Retrieved 17 June 2013.</ref> He scored his first goal for England under-21s on 13 August 2013, in a 6–0 win against [[Scotland national under-21 football team|Scotland]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23690472 "England Under-21s thrash Scotland 6–0 in friendly"]. BBC Sport. 13 August 2013. Retrieved 13 August 2013.</ref>
Barkley was called up to the senior England squad in August 2013,<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23853555 "Andros Townsend and Ross Barkley in England squad"]. BBC Sport. 27 August 2013. Retrieved 27 August 2013.</ref> and earned his first senior cap the following month, coming on as a substitute for [[Jack Wilshere]] in a 4–0 win in a [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification|World Cup qualifier]] against [[Moldova national football team|Moldova]] at [[Wembley Stadium|Wembley]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23921240 "England 4–0 Moldova"]. BBC Sport. 6 September 2013. Retrieved 10 September 2013.</ref> He was named in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup squads|England squad]] for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] in Brazil,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/may/12/england-world-cup-squad-hodgson-barkley-sterling |title=England World Cup squad 2014: Ross Barkley and Raheem Sterling called up |date=12 May 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=14 May 2014}}</ref> and made his World Cup debut as a 61st-minute substitute for [[Danny Welbeck]] in England's 2–1 opening defeat to [[Italy national football team|Italy]] in [[Manaus]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=McNulty |first1=Phil |title=England 1–2 Italy |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25285071 |accessdate=19 October 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 June 2014}}</ref> He played the full match in England's final group match, a 0–0 draw with [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]] in [[Belo Horizonte]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25285354 |title=Costa Rica 0–0 England |date=24 June 2014 |accessdate=4 April 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the senior team in a 6–0 win against [[San Marino national football team|San Marino]] in a [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying|UEFA Euro 2016 qualifier]] in September 2015.<ref name="San Marino 0–6 England">{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33273427 |title=San Marino 0–6 England |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 September 2015 |accessdate=7 April 2016}}</ref>
==Style of play== In 2013, Everton manager [[Roberto Martínez]] described Barkley as a mix of [[Paul Gascoigne]] and [[Michael Ballack]].<ref name=ballack>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25294790 |title=Everton boss Roberto Martinez praises Gerard Deulofeu impact |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=23 December 2013}}</ref> England manager [[Roy Hodgson]] has said that Barkley's "pace and power" as well as his "excellent technique" are reminiscent of Paul Gascoigne,<ref name=gascoigne>{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11095/9553225/european-qualifiers-roy-hodgson-says-ross-barkley-reminds-him-of-paul-gascoigne |title=European Qualifiers: Roy Hodgson says Everton and England's Ross Barkley reminds him of Paul Gascoigne |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=2 April 2016}}</ref> and [[Frank Lampard]] stated that Barkley reminds him of a young [[Wayne Rooney]].<ref name=rooney>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/2014/jun/ross-barkley-reminds-frank-lampard-of-a-young-wayne-rooney-060614 |title=Ross Barkley reminds Frank Lampard of a young Wayne Rooney – England |publisher=The Football Association |date=6 June 2014 |accessdate=2 April 2016}}</ref> [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] midfielder [[Xavi]] said in November 2014 that Barkley is good enough to play for the [[La Liga]] club, praising his physical and technical qualities.<ref>{{cite news |title=Liverpool's Raheem Sterling good enough to play for Barcelona, says Xavi |url=http://www.squawka.com/news/emperors-empires-barcelonas-xavi-discusses-the-modern-game/217333 |accessdate=18 November 2014 |publisher=Squawka News |date=11 November 2014}}</ref>

Nicknamed ''El Pipita'' or ''Pipa'',{{cite web|url=http://www.canalenapoli.it/news-napoli/video-alla-scoperta-di-gonzalo-el-pipita-higuain-79155|title=Alla scoperta di Gonzalo "El Pìpita" Higuain|trans-title=Finding out who Gonzalo "El Pipita" Higuain is|publisher=canalenapoli.it|language=Italian|date=25 July 2013|accessdate=9 March 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20150310000320/http://www.canalenapoli.it/news-napoli/video-alla-scoperta-di-gonzalo-el-pipita-higuain-79155|archivedate=10 March 2015}} as was his father [[Jorge Higuaín|Jorge]], who was also a footballer, Gonzalo Higuaín was born in France, attaining Argentine citizenship in 2007, and now holds dual nationality.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/story/404406/higuain-to-choose-argentina-over-france-report|title=Higuain to choose Argentina over France – Report|publisher=ESPN FC|date=24 January 2007|accessdate=18 October 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.repubblica.it/rubriche/la-storia/2015/12/05/news/fratello_higuain_campionato_usa-128800562/|title=Higuain Federico, il fratello di un Dio minore. Ma ora c'è aria di rivincita|publisher=La Repubblica|language=Italian|date=5 December 2015|accessdate=20 March 2017}} He started his career with Argentine club [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]], before a transfer to [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] in January 2007 for €12 million. His time in Spain saw him win honours including three [[La Liga]] titles, and score 107 goals in 190 league appearances. He joined Italian side [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]] for €40 million in July 2013, where he won the [[Coppa Italia]] during his first season. In the [[2015–16 Serie A|2015–16 season]], he scored 36 league goals, winning the ''[[Capocannoniere]]'' title and equalling [[Gino Rossetti]]'s 87-year-old record for goals in an Italian top-flight season. As a result of his goal scoring exploits in Naples, Italian champions [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] signed him for €90 million in 2016, making him the most expensive South American footballer of all time (until Neymar's transfer to PSG in 2017); his transfer fee was the highest ever paid by an Italian team (until [[Cristiano Ronaldo]]'s transfer to Juventus in 2018) and also the highest of a player transferring within any domestic league (until [[Kylian Mbappé]]'s transfer to PSG in 2018).{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36874091|title=Gonzalo Higuain: Argentina Striker joins Juventus from Napoli|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 July 2016|accessdate=26 July 2016}} He won domestic doubles in his first two seasons with Juventus, also reaching the [[2017 UEFA Champions League Final|2017 Champions League final]] with the club. In 2018, he was loaned to [[A.C. Milan]], and later in 2019 he was loaned to [[Chelsea FC]]. Higuaín has been a full international for [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] since 2009; he has represented the country at three [[FIFA World Cup]]s and three [[Copa América]] tournaments, helping them to second-place finishes at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014 World Cup]], the [[2015 Copa América]], and the [[Copa América Centenario]] in 2016. ==Early life== {{Quote box |width=27% |align=right |quote="[[Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)|Ronaldo]], the Brazilian one, was the best at everything. He is the only player who I have watched on video and tried to imitate, but it’s very hard.” |source=Higuain on his idol growing up, Brazil striker Ronaldo.{{cite news |title="Ronaldo, the Brazilian one, was the best at everything" |url=https://en.as.com/en/2017/02/21/football/1487673113_083376.html |accessdate=10 September 2018 |work=As}}}} Higuaín was born on 10 December 1987 in [[Brest, France]], the son of the Argentine footballer [[Jorge Higuaín]], who was then playing for [[Stade Brestois 29]]. He is of Basque descent through his father.{{cite web|url=http://www.euskalkultura.com/espanol/noticias/el-delantero-uruguayo-diego-forlan-su-abuela-vasca-y-sus-deseos-de-fichar-por-el-athletic-club-de-bilbao|title=El delantero uruguayo Diego Forlán, su abuela vasca, y sus deseos de fichar por el Athlétic Club de Bilbao|publisher=}} He left France at the age of ten months and does not speak French, but retains [[French nationality law|French citizenship]] in addition to his [[Argentine nationality law|Argentine nationality]], which he successfully applied for in January 2007. Higuaín has two elder brothers, Nicolas and [[Federico Higuaín|Federico]], the latter of whom plays for [[Major League Soccer]] (MLS) club [[Columbus Crew SC|Columbus Crew]] as a deep-lying forward,{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/world-match-centre/nationalleagues/nationalleague=usa-mls-2000000103/news/newsid/210/340/2/index.html|title=Higuain: I’m not jealous of Gonzalo|publisher=FIFA.com|accessdate=18 October 2015|date=6 June 2013}} and one younger brother, Lautaro.[http://old.clarin.com/diario/2006/12/04/deportes/d-02001.htm Federico ganó el duelo de los hermanos Higuaín]. Old.clarin.com. Retrieved on 17 April 2014. ==Club career== ===River Plate=== Higuaín started playing in the youth teams and made his debut with [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] in a 2–1 defeat against [[Club de Gimnasia y Esgrima La Plata|Gimnasia y Esgrima (LP)]] on 29 May 2005.[http://www.canchallena.com/1193372-higuain-los-convence-a-todos Higuain los convence a todos (Higuain convinces all)] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120226012709/http://www.canchallena.com/1193372-higuain-los-convence-a-todos |date=26 February 2012 }} canchallena.com, 2 November 2009, in Spanish. On 12 February 2006, he scored his first league goal in a 3–1 victory over [[Club Atlético Banfield|Banfield]].{{cite web |url=http://guardian.touch-line.com/?Lang=0&CTID=29&CPID=68&pStr=Match_List&PLID=191762&ListType=9&TEID=543&Season=2005%20-%202006&mTEID=3375&t=3 |title=Gonzalo Higuaín All goals 2005–2006 (Boca Juniors) |publisher=Guardian Stats |accessdate=15 September 2010}} Higuaín ended the [[2005–06 Argentine Primera División|2005–06 season]] with 5 goals in 12 appearances.{{cite web |url=http://guardian.touch-line.com/?Lang=0&CTID=29&CPID=68&pStr=Player&PLID=191762&TEID=543 |title=Gonzalo Higuaín Facts |publisher=Guardian Stats |accessdate=15 September 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101127204526/http://guardian.touch-line.com/?Lang=0&CTID=29&CPID=68&pStr=Player&PLID=191762&TEID=543 |archivedate=27 November 2010 }} Following his [[brace (sports)|brace]] in the ''[[Superclásico]]'' [[Local derby|derby]] against [[Boca Juniors]] on 8 October 2006, River Plate manager [[Daniel Passarella]] declared that Higuaín had an "enormous future" and was "destined for superstardom".{{cite news | url = http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2006/10/09/sports/LA_SPT_SOC_River_Plate_Higuain.php | title = Passarella predicts River's 18-year-old Higuain has "enormous future"HIGUAIN is becoming one of the most dangerous strikers in the world | work = International Herald Tribune |date=9 October 2006 }} By the end of [[2006–07 Argentine Primera División|that season]], he scored 10 goals in 17 league matches. ===Real Madrid=== ====2006–07 season==== In December 2006, Spanish club [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] signed Higuaín for [[Euro|€]]12 million from River Plate. His debut came on 11 January 2007 against [[Real Betis]] in the second round of the [[Copa del Rey]] in [[Seville]]. His first league game came three days later, on 14 January 2007, against [[Real Zaragoza]] at home. Higuaín was involved in the creation of numerous scoring chances and in the assistance for the only goal, which earned Madrid the victory.{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2007/01/14/spain/primera-division/real-madrid-club-de-futbol/real-zaragoza/389446/|title=Real Madrid vs. Real Zaragoza 1 – 0|publisher=Soccerway|date=14 January 2007|accessdate=4 February 2019}} His first goal with Real came on 24 February when the team faced [[Atlético Madrid]] in the [[Madrid derby]], the equaliser (1–1) at the [[Vicente Calderón Stadium]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2007/02/24/spain/primera-division/club-atletico-de-madrid/real-madrid-club-de-futbol/389502/|title=Atlético Madrid vs. Real Madrid 1 – 1|publisher=Soccerway|date=24 February 2007|accessdate=4 February 2019}} During his first season at the [[Santiago Bernabéu Stadium|Bernabéu]], however, Higuaín raised some doubts over his performance due to his overall lack of goals. ====2007–08 season==== During the [[2007–08 Real Madrid C.F. season|2007–08 season]], Higuaín played inconsistently, although he finished strongly at the end of the season: He first scored a last minute goal to earn his team a victory in a 2–1 comeback against [[CA Osasuna|Osasuna]], which allowed Real Madrid to be mathematically crowned Liga champions for the second consecutive year.{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/marcador/futbol/2007_08/primera/jornada_35/osa_rma/asilovivimos.html |title=www.Marca.com |publisher=Marca.com |accessdate=31 May 2011}} Four days later, he scored the third goal of a 4–1 thrashing of [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in ''[[El Clásico]]''. The goal was scored just 57 seconds after he came off the bench.{{cite web|url=http://www.elpais.com/articulo/deportes/Barca/saca/hombros/Madrid/elpepidep/20080508elpepidep_2/Tes |title=El Barça saca a hombros al Madrid |work=El Pais |date=24 May 2011 |accessdate=31 May 2011}} ====2008–09 season==== In the [[2008–09 Real Madrid C.F. season|2008–09 season]], Higuaín was offered the chance to be a starter due to a serious injury suffered by [[Dutch people|Dutch]] striker [[Ruud van Nistelrooy]].{{cite web|url=http://www.elpais.com/articulo/deportes/Higuain/Espero/lesion/Van/Nistelrooy/signifique/retirada/elpepudep/20081113elpepudep_17/Tes |title=Higuaín: "Espero que la lesión de Van Nistelrooy no signifique su retirada" |work=El Pais |accessdate=31 May 2011}} In August 2008, Higuaín scored the winner in Madrid's victory over [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] in the [[Supercopa de España]].[http://archivo.marca.com/futbol/2008/supercopa/index.html Supercopa 2008] Marca.com. Retrieved 25 August 2010 Shortly afterwards, he scored all four goals in a 4–3 win against [[Málaga CF|Málaga]]. Because of this, he started to gain international recognition and became one of the leading goalscorers of La Liga, alongside his Barcelona counterpart [[Samuel Eto'o]].{{cite web |url=http://www.sportsnet.ca/soccer/2008/11/08/mardid_malaga_recap/ |title=Higuain, Eto'o both notch four goals |publisher=Sportsnet.ca |date=8 November 2008 |accessdate=31 May 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160315014049/http://www.sportsnet.ca/soccer/2008/11/08/mardid_malaga_recap/ |archive-date=15 March 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} On 21 April 2009, Higuaín played very well in the match against [[Getafe CF|Getafe]] and scored the decisive goal in the last minute, giving Real Madrid a 3–2 victory which enabled the team to keep close to [[Pep Guardiola]]'s Barcelona in the league table.{{cite web|url=http://www.as.com/futbol/articulo/higuain-casillas-especialistas-milagros/20090421dasdasftb_60/Tes |title=Higuaín y Casillas, especialistas en milagros – LIGA BBVA , Real Madrid 3 – Getafe 2 |publisher=AS.com |accessdate=31 May 2011}} Throughout the season, Higuaín was regarded as one of the most promising talents in world football in the wake of spectacular games and last-minute goals. He ended the season with 22 league goals[http://soccernet.espn.go.com/stats/topscorers?league=esp.1&year=2008&cc=5901 Spanish Primera División – Top Scorers – 2008/2009]. ESPN. Retrieved on 16 December 2010 and 24 in all competitions, around as many as established football stars including [[Diego Forlán]], [[David Villa]] and [[Thierry Henry]]. ====2009–10 season==== The [[2009–10 Real Madrid C.F. season|2009–10 season]] saw Higuaín become Real's top goalscorer with 27 league goals, 29 in total, being at the same time the La Liga's second-top goalscorer, behind only [[Lionel Messi]] and surpassing Swedish international [[Zlatan Ibrahimović]], as well as his Madrid teammate [[Cristiano Ronaldo]]. This season included him scoring his first two goals in the [[UEFA Champions League]] and his second [[hat-trick]] for the club. ====2010–11 season==== [[File:Higuaín se prepara para chutar.jpg|thumb|left|Gonzalo Higuaín during a match in the [[2010–11 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] group stage against [[A.C. Milan|Milan]].]] In June 2010, Real Madrid extended Higuaín's contract until 2016.{{cite web |url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1193040487639/1330006888664/noticia/ComunicadoOficial/Official_announcement:_Gonzalo_Higuain_s_contract_extended_to_2016.htm |title=Gonzalo Higuain's contract extended to 2016 |publisher=Real Madrid |date=7 June 2010 |accessdate=31 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110917100632/http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1193040487639/1330006888664/noticia/ComunicadoOficial/Official_announcement:_Gonzalo_Higuain_s_contract_extended_to_2016.htm |archivedate=17 September 2011 }} On 23 October 2010, he scored Real Madrid's 5,200th league goal, coming against [[Racing de Santander]] in a 6–1 thrashing by ''Los Blancos''.{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en/match/47766/real-madrid-vs-racing/index|title=Real Madrid 6-1 Racing Santander: Cristiano Ronaldo Grabs Four In Rout For Los Merengues|publisher=Goal.com|author=David Schiavone|date=23 October 2010|accessdate=5 February 2019}} On 4 November of the same year, Higuaín scored the club's 700th goal in the Champions League.{{cite web|author=Champions League |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1716/champions-league/2010/11/04/2198075/real-madrid-striker-gonzalo-higuain-pleased-to-qualify-for |title=Real Madrid Striker Gonzalo Higuain Pleased To Qualify For Knockout Stages After Milan Draw |publisher=Goal.com |date=4 November 2010 |accessdate=31 May 2011}} During the first weeks of December 2010, Higuaín was diagnosed with a herniated lumbar disc, and Real's medical staff suggested that he should have it operated.{{cite news| url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/real-madrid-wait-for-gonzalo-higuain-injury-assessment-2150267.html | location=London |work=The Independent | title=Real Madrid wait for Gonzalo Higuain injury assessment | date=3 December 2010}} On 5 January 2011, Real Madrid announced he would finally undergo surgery at the Department of Neurological Surgery of [[Chicago]]'s [[Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine]] under the command of Dr. Richard G. Fessler, [[M.D.]]{{cite web |url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330033821843/noticia/Noticia/Higuain_will_have_surgery_in_Chicago_on_Tuesday.htm |title=Higuain will have surgery in Chicago on Tuesday |publisher=Real Madrid |date=5 January 2011 |accessdate=31 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110414095901/http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330033821843/noticia/Noticia/Higuain_will_have_surgery_in_Chicago_on_Tuesday.htm |archivedate=14 April 2011 }} The surgery took place on 11 January, and Higuaín was discharged from the hospital the next day following a successful operation.{{cite web |url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330035261223/noticia/Noticia/Higuain_discharged_from_hospital.htm |title=Higuain discharged from hospital |publisher=Real Madrid |date=12 January 2011 |accessdate=31 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110320135142/http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330035261223/noticia/Noticia/Higuain_discharged_from_hospital.htm |archivedate=20 March 2011 }} He was expected to spend at least four months away from the field in the recovery process: two months spent to recover from the surgery and another two to train with the team, although he was able to make an early comeback. On 23 April 2011, Higuaín scored a hat-trick against [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] in a 6–3 away win at the [[Mestalla Stadium]], giving him eight goals in eight matches against Valencia. Higuaín also assisted two other goals for [[Karim Benzema]] and [[Kaká]] in that same match.{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/48776/valencia-vs-real-madrid/report|title=Valencia 3-6 Real Madrid: Higuain bags hat-trick & Kaka nets double as visitors win nine-goal thriller|publisher=Goal.com|author=Daniel Quinton-Navarro|date=23 April 2011|accessdate=5 February 2019}} ====2011–12 season==== [[File:Gonzalo Higuaín 48609.jpg|thumb|Higuaín in a Champions League game against [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]] in February 2012]] On 2 October, Higuaín scored his first hat-trick of the season against Espanyol in a 4–0 away win,{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en/news/%2012/spanish-football/2011/10/02/2693483/espanyol-0-4-real-madrid-higuain-hits-hat-trick-callejon|title=Espanyol 0-4 Real Madrid: Higuain hits hat-trick & Callejon nets against old club as capital giants edge to within a point of Barcelona|publisher=Goal.com|author=Ben Hayward|date=2 October 2011|accessdate=5 February 2019}} following it 13 days later with another in a 4–1 win against Betis.{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en/news/12/spain/2011/10/15/2712679/real-madrid-4-1-real-betis-higuain-hat-trick-the-highlight|title=Real Madrid 4-1 Real Betis: Higuain hat-trick the highlight as Jose Mourinho's side record comfortable win|publisher=Goal.com|author=Charlie Scott|date=15 October 2011|accessdate=5 February 2019}} Higuaín scored to put Madrid up 3–1 in a 4–1 win against local rivals Atlético Madrid in the Madrid derby on 26 November. On 31 March 2012, he scored his 100th Real Madrid goal in a match against Osasuna, also adding a second goal to make it Real's 100th goal for the [[2011–12 La Liga]] season.{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en-au/news/4016/main/2012/04/01/3005516/osasuna-1-5-real-madrid-ronaldo-higuain-at-the-double|title=Osasuna 1-5 Real Madrid: Ronaldo & Higuain at the double & Benzema hits stunner as Mourinho's men make a statement in La Liga|publisher=Goal.com|author=Daniel Quinton-Navarro|date=31 March 2012|accessdate=5 February 2019}} In the league-winning season, he scored 22 goals, more than his teammate [[Karim Benzema]], and proved to be a vital player for his team.[http://soccernet.espn.go.com/player/_/id/67310/gonzalo-higuain?cc=4716 Higuain statistics]. soccernet.espn.go.com. 27 July 2012{{cite web|url=https://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46240&season_id=141|title=Games played by Gonzalo Higuain in 2011/2012|publisher=Soccerbase.com|accessdate=5 February 2019}} ====2012–13 season==== [[File:Real Madrid v Sevilla 10 February 2013 A 2.JPG|thumb|left|Higuaín attempting to dribble past [[Emir Spahić]] of [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] in February 2013]] On 29 August 2012, Higuaín scored the opener in an eventual 2–1 win against Barcelona in the second leg of the [[2012 Supercopa de España]], which secured Real Madrid its first title of the season.{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/real-madrid/9507759/Real-Madrid-2-Barcelona-1-4-4-agg-match-report.html|title=Real Madrid 2 Barcelona 1 (4-4 agg): match report|publisher=The Telegraph|date=30 August 2012|accessdate=5 February 2019}} Higuaín scored first league goal in the season opener against Valencia CF, his favourite opponent; he netted the opening goal in the 10th minute in an eventual 1–1 home draw.{{cite web|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/r-madrid-vs-valencia/268194|title=Jonas ruins Real opener|publisher=Sky Sports|date=19 August 2012|accessdate=5 February 2019}} He scored again in the next match, a 2–1 loss to [[Getafe CF]] at [[Coliseum Alfonso Pérez]], which marked Real Madrid worst league start in 39 years.{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/la-liga/9501656/Real-Madrid-lose-further-ground-in-La-Liga-title-race-on-Barcelona-after-defeat-to-Getafe.html|title=Real Madrid lose further ground in La Liga title race on Barcelona after defeat to Getafe|publisher=The Telegraph|author=Ed White|date=27 August 2012|accessdate=5 February 2019}} In Real's away match to [[RCD Mallorca|Mallorca]] on 28 October 2012, Higuaín scored twice and provided two assists in a 5–0 victory.{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/348430/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |title=Five-star Real hammer Mallorca |publisher=ESPNFC |date=28 October 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130225020241/http://espnfc.com/en/report/348430/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |archivedate=25 February 2013 }} On 23 February 2013, he scored his 100th La Liga goal as he scored an 88th-minute winner to secure a 2–1 defeat of [[Deportivo de La Coruña]].{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/us/en/report/348285/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5901 |title=Higuain downs Depor |publisher=ESPNFC |date=23 February 2013 }} On 1 June 2013, following the end of the team's last match of the season, a 4–2 home win over Osasuna, Higuain, who scored the opening goal, confirmed that he will leave Real Madrid after seven years.{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/news/story/_/id/1465718/gonzalo-higuain-confirms-leave-real-madrid|title=Gonzalo Higuain leaving Real Madrid|publisher=ESPN FC|date=2 June 2013|accessdate=5 February 2019}} ===Napoli=== Due to Higuaín's availability, clubs like [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]] were keen to sign him. Higuaín was at the centre of much transfer speculation, with many newspapers linking him to a move to Arsenal before Napoli's president [[Aurelio De Laurentiis]] said that Higuaín, along with [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] goalkeeper [[Pepe Reina]], had passed their medicals and that the Argentine had signed a five-year deal with the [[Italy|Italian]] club, with Higuaín joining for [[Euro|€]]40 million.{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/news/story?id=1506002&cc=5901 |title=Higuain and Reina pass Napoli medicals |publisher=ESPNFC |date=24 July 2013 |accessdate=24 July 2013 }} On 27 July, Napoli confirmed the signing of Higuaín, with the Argentine being assigned the number 9 shirt.{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/news/story?id=1508152&cc=5901 |title=Napoli confirm Higuain signing |publisher=ESPNFC |date=27 July 2013 |accessdate=27 July 2013 }} ====2013–14 season==== On 10 August 2013, Higuaín played his first match as a starter in a pre-season friendly against [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]], scoring his first goal for the club in a 2–1 win. On 25 August, he made his [[Serie A]] debut in a 3–0 defeat of [[Bologna F.C. 1909|Bologna]] on the opening day of the [[2013–14 Serie A|2013–14 season]].{{cite news|url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/soccer/news/20130825/napoli-benitez-serie-a.ap/|title=Napoli vanquishes Bologna in Rafa Benitez's debut|date=25 August 2013|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=Sports Illustrated}} A week later, he opened his goalscoring account in a 4–2 win away at [[A.C. Chievo Verona|Chievo]].{{cite news|url=http://www.football-italia.net/SerieA/match/36993|title= Chievo 2 – 4 Napoli|date=31 August 2013|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=Football Italia}} He followed this up with goals in Napoli's next two fixtures: wins over [[Atalanta B.C.|Atalanta]] at home{{cite news|url=https://www.sbnation.com/soccer/2013/9/14/4730856/napoli-vs-atalanta-final-score-2-0-seriea-2013-14|title=Napoli vs Atalanta, Final Score 2–0: Rafa's reserves rescue Napoli|date=14 September 2013|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=SBS Nation}} and [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] at the [[San Siro]].{{cite news|url=https://www.sbnation.com/soccer/2013/9/22/4759446/ac-milan-napoli-final-score-result-report-goals-serie-a-2013|title=AC Milan – Napoli, final score 1–2: Napoli conquer the San Siro|date=22 September 2013|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=SBS Nation}} On 18 September, Higuaín scored in Napoli's opening [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] fixture, a 2–1 victory over [[Borussia Dortmund]] at the [[Stadio San Paolo]].{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000479/match=2011762/postmatch/report/|title=Napoli hold on to see off ten-man Dortmund|date=18 September 2013|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=UEFA}} He went on to score in home wins over [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]]{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000479/match=2011810/index.html|title=Napoli make their mark in Marseille|date=22 October 2013|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=UEFA}} and Arsenal,{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000479/match=2011842/index.html|title=Napoli victory in vain as Arsenal finish second|date=11 December 2013|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=UEFA}} but Napoli failed to qualify from the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]] despite winning four of their six matches. On 12 February 2014, Higuaín scored two goals in Napoli's 3–0 defeat of [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] in the semi-final of the [[2013–14 Coppa Italia|Coppa Italia]], taking the team to the final with a 5–3 aggregate victory.{{cite news|url=https://www.sbnation.com/soccer/2014/2/12/5405898/napoli-roma-2014-coppa-italia-final-score-result|title=Napoli vs AS Roma, 2014 Coppa Italia: Final score 3–0, Napoli set up Fiorentina final|date=12 February 2014|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=SBS Nation}} On 13 April, he scored his first hat-trick for the club in a 4–2 win over [[S.S. Lazio|Lazio]].{{cite news|url=https://www.sbnation.com/2014/4/13/5610314/napoli-vs-lazio-serie-a-2014-final-score-result|title=Napoli vs Lazio, final score 4–2: Higuain treble sinks Lazio|date=13 April 2014|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=SBS Nation}} Higuaín won his first trophy with the club on 3 May, playing for 70 minutes in the 3–1 success versus [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]] in the [[2014 Coppa Italia Final|final of Coppa Italia]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/27271913|title=Coppa Italia final: Rafael Benitez's Napoli beat Fiorentina 3-1|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 May 2014|accessdate=7 February 2019}} He concluded his first season in [[Italy]] by scoring 24 goals in 46 appearances in all competitions.{{cite web|url=https://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46240&season_id=143|title=Games played by Gonzalo Higuain in 2013/2014|publisher=Soccerbase|accessdate=7 February 2019}} ====2014–15 in a 6–2 home win over [[Hellas Verona F.C.|Hellas Verona]].{{cite news|last1=Tooth|first1=John-Paul|title=Napoli 6–2 Hellas Verona: Higuain hat-trick helps Benitez's men to big win|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/napoli-vs-hellas-verona/1836251/report|accessdate=26 October 2014|work=Goal.com|date=26 October 2014}} In the [[2014 Supercoppa Italiana]] against [[Juventus scorers in a Napoli victory.{{cite news|title=Juventus 2–2 Napoli (5–6 on pens)|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30582475|accessdate=22 December 2014|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=22 December Dinamo|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000589/match=2014612/index.html|accessdate=13 March 2015|publisher=UEFA|date=12 March 2015}} In the final game of the league season – and also the last under Napoli manager [[Rafael Benítez]] – Higuaín scored twice, but also missed a penalty, as Napoli lost 4–2 to Lazio, who took the last Champions League place at their expense.{{cite news|title=Serie A Review: Napoli miss Champions League in Benitez send-off|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/serie-review-napoli-miss-champions-league-benitez-send|accessdate=3 June 2015|work=[[FourFourTwo]]|date=31 May 2015}} ====2015–16 season==== On 8 November 2015, Higuaín recorded the 200th goal of his club career, the only goal of the match in a victory over [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]]; this was his ninth goal of the league season and his seventh consecutive home game with a goal.{{cite news|title=Napoli, Higuain oltre i 200 gol: "Sogno lo scudetto". 2015|work=Gazzetta dello Sport|date=8 November 2015|language=Italian}} Three weeks later, he scored both goals – including one after 64 seconds – in a 2–1 win over Inter which put Napoli in first place in the league for the first time in 25 years.{{cite web|url=https://www.si.com/planet-futbol/2015/11/30/napoli-inter-milan-higuain-italy-serie-a|title=Napoli beats Inter Milan, takes first in Serie A|publisher=}}{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34899294|title=Napoli 2–1 Inter Milan|publisher=BBC Sport|date=30 November 2015|accessdate=1 December 2015}} Higuaín scored
