2016|accessdate=14 May 2016}} ===Juventus=== ====2016–17 season==== [[File:Gonzalo Higuain 2017 (edited).jpg|thumb|right|Higuain playing for [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] in 2017.|150px]] After a month of transfer speculation, on 26 July 2016, Higuaín transferred to rivals [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] for a fee of €90 million paid in two installments, becoming [[List of most expensive association football transfers|one of the highest football transfers of all-time]] and highest ever transfer for an Italian club.{{cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/en/news/news/2016/higuain-joins-juventus-.php|title=Higuain joins Juventus|publisher=juventus.com|date=26 July 2016|accessdate=26 July 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://asia.eurosport.com/football/serie-a/2015-2016/gonzalo-higuain-s-78m-juventus-move-its-place-in-history-and-what-it-means-for-football_sto5699162/story.shtml|title=Gonzalo Higuain's £75m Juventus move – its place in history and what it means for football|publisher=eurosport.com|date=26 July 2016|accessdate=26 July 2016}} Three days after his move, Higuaín stated that his reason for moving to Juventus was because of his relationship with Napoli's chairman [[Aurelio De Laurentiis]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2919594/juventus-gonzalo-higuain-i-left-napoli-because-of-aurelio-de-laurentiis |title=Juventus' Gonzalo Higuain: I left Napoli because of Aurelio De Laurentiis |date=29 July 2016 |publisher=ESPN }}{{cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/en/teams/first-team/forwards/gonzalo-gerardo-higuain-/index.php|title=GONZALO GERARDO HIGUAIN|publisher=juventus.com|accessdate=19 September 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170925181637/http://www.juventus.com/en/teams/first-team/forwards/gonzalo-gerardo-higuain-/index.php|archive-date=25 September 2017|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} On 20 August, Higuaín scored the winning goal on his Juventus debut in their opening match against [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]] of a 2–1 home win.{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/90108/higuain-happy-juve-goal|title=Higuain: 'Happy with Juve goal'|publisher=Football Italia|date=20 August 2016|accessdate=21 August 2016}} On 10 September, he scored a brace in a 3–1 home win over Sassuolo.{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/91239/higuain-and-pjanic-inspire-juventus|title=Higuain and Pjanic inspire Juventus|publisher=Football Italia|date=10 September 2016|accessdate=10 September 2016}} On 29 October, he scored the winning goal against his former team, Napoli, but [[Goal celebration#Notable non-celebrations|did not celebrate his goal]], in a 2–1 home win.{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/93640/higuain-completes-napoli-nightmare|title=Higuain completes Napoli nightmare|publisher=Football Italia|date=29 October 2016|accessdate=29 October 2016}} On 5 April 2017, Higuaín scored twice against Napoli in the [[2016–17 Coppa Italia]] second semi-final leg to put Juventus through to the [[2017 Coppa Italia Final|final]] 5–4 on aggregate, in spite of a 3–2 away loss.{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/100705/coppa-higuain-ends-napoli-hopes|title=Coppa: Higuain ends Napoli hopes|publisher=Football Italia|date=5 April 2017|accessdate=5 April 2017}} The following week, he became the first player to score more than 20 goals in his debut season for Juventus since [[John Charles]] and [[Omar Sívori]] had managed the same feat during the [[1957–58 Serie A]] season, when he scored a brace against [[A.C. ChievoVerona|Chievo]].{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/100947/serie-week-31-did-you-know|title=Serie A Week 31: Did You Know?|website=Football Italia|last=Campanale|first=Susan|date=10 April 2017|accessdate=20 April 2017}} On 15 April, Higuaín scored both goals in a 2–0 away win against [[Delfino Pescara 1936|Pescara]], which included his 200th league goal in Europe.{{cite web|url=https://www.thescore.com/news/1281069|title=Higuain hits 200-goal milestone to push Juventus closer to another title|publisher=The Score|author1=Gianluca Nesci|date=16 April 2017|accessdate=17 April 2017}} On 3 June, Higuaín started in the [[2017 UEFA Champions League Final|Champions League Final]], but Juventus were defeated 4–1 by defending champions Real Madrid; he set up [[Mario Mandžukić]]'s temporary equaliser in the first half.{{cite news |date=3 June 2017 |title=Real Madrid and Cristiano Ronaldo see off Juventus to win Champions League |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/jun/03/juventus-real-madrid-champions-league-final-match-report |work=[[The Guardian]] |accessdate=3 June 2017}} ====2017–18 season==== On 28 October 2017, Higuaín scored both goals in a 2–0 away win over Milan; his first goal was his 100th goal in Serie A, making him only the second player after Zlatan Ibrahimović to score over 100 goals in two of the top European leagues in the past 20 seasons.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/club/juventus/111/blog/post/3249665/gonzalo-higuain-produces-a-9-10-display-to-help-juventus-see-off-ac-milan|title=Gonzalo Higuain produces a 9/10 display to help Juve see off Milan|publisher=ESPN FC|author1=Mina Rzouki|date=28 October 2017|accessdate=29 October 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://theworldgame.sbs.com.au/article/2017/10/29/higuain-brings-century-juventus-down-stuttering-ac-milan|title=Higuain brings up century as Juventus down stuttering AC Milan|publisher=theworldgame.sbs.com|date=29 October 2017|accessdate=29 October 2017}} Higuaín played a decisive role in Juventus's 4–3 aggregate win over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in the round of 16 of the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]]. In the first leg, held in Turin on 13 February 2018, he scored both of his side's goals in the opening ten minutes, with his second of the night coming from the penalty spot, although he later also missed another penalty right before half time, which drew criticism in the Italian media, in spite of his positive overall performance; following a comeback from Tottenham, however, the match eventually ended in a 2–2 draw.{{cite web|url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2018/matches/round=2000882/match=2021683/index.html#/|title=Juventus 2–2 Tottenham|publisher=UEFA.com|author1=Paolo Menicucci|author2=Daniel Thacker|date=13 February 2018|accessdate=9 March 2018}} In the return leg, on 7 March, he helped Juventus come from behind to win the match 2–1 at [[Wembley Stadium]], first scoring the equaliser, before setting up the match winner scored by Dybala three minutes later, thus sealing Juventus's place in the quarter-finals of the competition.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/43306558|title=Tottenham Hotspur 1–2 Juventus|publisher=BBC Sport|author1=Phil McNulty|date=7 March 2018|accessdate=9 March 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/tottenham-juventus-champions-league-match-report-paulo-dybala-gonzalo-higuain-a8244981.html|title=Paulo Dybala and Gonzalo Higuain stun Tottenham to send Juventus into Champions League quarter-finals|publisher=The Independent|author1=Luke Brown|date=8 March 2018|accessdate=9 March 2018}} ====2018–19 season: Loan to Milan==== On 2 August 2018, Higuaín was signed by [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] on a season-long loan deal.{{cite web|url=https://www.football-italia.net/125650/official-milan-sign-higuain-caldara|title=Official: Milan sign Higuain, Caldara|publisher=Football Italia|date=2 August 2018}} As per the official statement of [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]], Milan would pay a loan fee of €18 million to Juventus in the 2018–19 season; also Milan would have the option to outright buy Higuaín the following season for €36 million, payable in two installments.{{Cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/media/native/investor-relations-docs/comunicato%2002082018%20accordi%20con%20milan%20ita.pdf|title=comunicato 02082018 accordi con milan ita.pdf|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}} ====2019: Loan to Chelsea==== On 23 January 2019, [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] signed Higuaín on a loan deal for the remainder of the [[2018–19 Chelsea F.C. season|2018–19 season]], reuniting him with manager [[Maurizio Sarri]], whom he played under at Napoli during the [[2015–16 S.S.C. Napoli season|2015–16 season]].{{cite web|url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2019/1/23/gonzalo-higuain-completes-loan-transfer-to-chelsea?cardIndex=0-0|title=Gonzalo Higuaín completes loan transfer to Chelsea|publisher=[[Chelsea F.C.]] official website|date=23 January 2019|access-date=23 January 2019}} Five days later, he made his debut in a 3–0 win against [[Sheffield Wednesday]] in the fourth round of the [[FA Cup]] at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]].{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en-au/match/chelsea-v-sheffield-wednesday/report/e95luqqdgq97hrocavvwhhtuy|title=Chelsea 3 Sheffield Wednesday 0: Bayern target Hudson-Odoi nets on Higuain debut|publisher=Goal.com|date=28 January 2019}} On 30 January, he made his league debut in a 4–0 away loss against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].{{cite web|url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2019/1/30/report|publisher=chelseafc.com|title=REPORT: BOURNEMOUTH 4 CHELSEA 0|date=30 January 2019}} On 2 February, he scored his first goals for Chelsea, a brace in a 5–0 home win over [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/47011453 |title=Chelsea 5–0 Huddersfield Town |publisher=BBC Sport |author1=Matt Davis |date=2 February 2019 |accessdate=3 February 2019 }} ==International career== Higuaín is one of only three foreign-born players to have played for Argentina in a [[FIFA World Cup]], along with [[Pedro Arico Suárez]]{{FIFA player|58521|Pedro Arico Suárez}} and [[Constantino Urbieta Sosa]].{{FIFA player|59281|Constantino Urbieta Sosa}} He initially rejected calls from both the [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] and [[France national football team|France national teams]],{{cite news |url = http://www.ole.clarin.com/jsp/v4/pagina.jsp?pagId=01306412&fecha=20061110 |title = La Celeste y Blanca pesa |publisher = [[Diario Olé|Olé]] |date = 10 November 2006 |language = Spanish |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20061114043839/http://www.ole.clarin.com/jsp/v4/pagina.jsp?pagId=01306412&fecha=20061110 |archivedate = 14 November 2006 |df = dmy-all }}{{cite news | url = http://www.uefa.com/competitions/EURO/news/Kind=1/newsId=477168.html | title = Domenech turns to uncapped tyros | publisher = [[UEFA]] | date = 9 November 2006 }} claiming at the time he was undecided for which country he would prefer to play, before ultimately choosing Argentina.[https://sports.yahoo.com/sow/news?slug=reu-spainhiguain&prov=reuters&type=lgns "Higuain to choose Argentina over France"] – Yahoo sports Higuaín was called up by the [[Argentina Olympic football team|Argentina Olympic squad]] for a friendly match against [[Guatemala national football team|Guatemala]] in February 2008,{{cite web|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/nota.asp?nota_id=985239 |title=Higuaín called up for friendly against Guatemala |publisher=Lanacion.com.ar |accessdate=26 June 2010}} and scored two goals on his debut as Argentina won 5–0, though the match was not officially recognized by [[FIFA]] as an "A" international match. ===2010 FIFA World Cup=== [[File:FIFA World Cup 2010 Argentina South Korea2.jpg|thumb|right|300px| Higuaín (#9) [[Goal celebration|celebrates]] his [[hat-trick]] against [[South Korea national football team|South Korea]] with teammates during the [[FIFA World Cup 2010|World Cup]] on 17 June 2010.]] Higuaín was selected for Argentina by coach [[Diego Maradona]] for the last [[2010 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|2010 FIFA World Cup qualification games]] against [[Peru national football team|Peru]] and [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]]. He scored his first goal on his full debut, a 49th-minute strike during a 2–1 win over Peru on 10 October 2009. Following Argentina's qualification, Higuaín was included in the squad for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]]. He scored a hat-trick in Argentina's 4–1 win over [[South Korea national football team|South Korea]] in their second group match,{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2010/matches/match_18/default.stm|title=Argentina 4–1 South Korea|date=17 June 2010|work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |first=Jonathan|last=Stevenson|accessdate=17 June 2010}} becoming the third Argentinian to score a hat-trick in the World Cup finals after [[Guillermo Stábile]] in [[1930 FIFA World Cup|1930]] and [[Gabriel Batistuta]] in [[1994 FIFA World Cup|1994]] and [[1998 FIFA World Cup|1998]],{{cite news|author=Richard Williams|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/jun/17/argentina-south-korea-world-cup-2010 |title=Argentina 4–1 South Korea , World Cup 2010 match report |work=The Guardian |location=UK |date= 17 June 2010|accessdate=26 June 2010 }} and the first player to score a [[hat-trick]] in the tournament since 2002. His goal in the 3–1 win over [[Mexico national football team|Mexico]] in the second round took him to a total of four, sending him clear as the second-top goalscorer in the competition.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/jun/27/argentina-mexico-world-cup-2010|title=World Cup 2010: Carlos Tevez drives Argentina to victory over Mexico|publisher=The Guardian|author=Paul Wilson|date=28 June 2010|accessdate=3 February 2019}} ===2011 Copa América=== Higuaín was a member of [[Sergio Batista]]'s Argentine squad for the [[2011 Copa América]] on home soil, making one substitute appearance and one start in the group as [[Carlos Tevez]] was preferred at centre forward; Argentina advanced in second place behind [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]]. He started against Uruguay in the quarter-finals in [[Santa Fe, Argentina|Santa Fe]], and equalised in the 17th minute by heading Lionel Messi's cross past goalkeeper [[Fernando Muslera]]; he later had another goal disallowed for offside. Higuaín scored in the [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]] after his shot had hit both posts, but Argentina lost the shoot-out 4–5.{{cite news|last1=Edwards|first1=Daniel|title=Argentina 1–1 Uruguay (AET, 4–5 pens.): Carlos Tevez penalty miss proves costly as hosts crash out of Copa America|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/argentina-vs-uruguay/1064737/report|accessdate=20 June 2015|publisher=Goal.com|date=17 July 2011}} ===2011–2014=== On 8 October 2011, Higuaín scored a hat-trick and assisted one goal in a 4–1 win against [[Chile national football team|Chile]].{{cite web|url=https://www.deseretnews.com/article/700186098/Higuain-gets-3-as-Argentina-beats-Chile-4-1.html|title=Higuain gets 3 as Argentina beats Chile 4-1|publisher=Deseretnews.com|author=Vicente Panetta|date=7 October 2011|accessdate=5 February 2019}} On 2 June 2012, he scored the second goal in their [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|2014 World Cup qualifying]] match and assisted one goal in Argentina's 4–0 victory over [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]].{{cite web|url=https://www.eluniverso.com/2012/06/02/1/1372/ecuador-humillado-4-0-aplanadora-argentina-buenos-aires.html|title=Ecuador fue humillado 4-0 por una 'aplanadora' argentina en Buenos Aires|publisher=Eluniverso.com|language=Spanish|date=2 June 2012|accessdate=5 February 2019}} [[File:Germany and Argentina face off in the final of the World Cup 2014 -2014-07-13 (36).jpg|thumb|left|Higuaín challenging Germany's [[Mats Hummels]] and [[Manuel Neuer]] in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final|2014 World Cup Final]]]] On 7 September 2012, Higuaín scored the second goal in their 2014 World Cup South American qualifier match and assisted one goal in Argentina's 3–1 victory over [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay]].{{cite news|url=https://www.soccerway.com/matches/2012/09/08/south-america/wc-qualifying-south-america/argentina/paraguay/1172915/|title=Argentina vs. Paraguay 1 – 1|publisher=Soccerway|date=8 September 2012|accessdate=9 February 2019}} Then, on 11 September, Higuaín scored the equalizer for Argentina in a 1–1 draw with Peru in [[Lima]].{{cite news|url=https://www.emirates247.com/sports/football/higuain-rescues-point-for-subdued-argentina-2012-09-12-1.475181|title=Higuain rescues point for subdued Argentina|publisher=Emirates247.com|date=12 September 2012|accessdate=9 February 2019}} On 22 March 2013, Higuaín scored twice as Argentina beat [[Venezuela national football team|Venezuela]] 3–0{{cite news|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/news/newsid=2044048/index.html|title=Messi, Higuain power Argentina past Venezuela|date=23 March 2013|publisher=FIFA}} to make him [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)#Goalscorers|top scorer]] in the South American section of World Cup qualifying with nine goals. He ended as the joint third-top scorer in [[CONMEBOL]], alongside [[Radamel Falcao]] and behind Messi and [[Luis Suárez]].{{cite news|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/southamerica/statistics/topscorers.html|title=2014 FIFA World Cup Brazil Preliminaries: South America: Top Scorers|accessdate=22 June 2014|publisher=FIFA}} ===2014 World Cup=== Higuaín was named in Argentina's 23-man squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014 World Cup]].{{cite news|title=World Cup 2014: Argentina leave out Carlos Tevez and Erik Lamela|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27403312|accessdate=21 May 2014|newspaper=[[BBC Sport]]|date=13 May 2014}} After appearing as a half-time substitute in Argentina's 2–1 defeat of [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina]] at the [[Maracanã Stadium]], Higuaín exchanged passes with Messi to assist his captain for the winning goal.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285099|title=Argentina 2–1 Bos-Herce|date=16 June 2014|accessdate=21 June 2014|work=BBC}} He was named in the starting line-up for the team's second match against [[Iran national football team|Iran]] in [[Belo Horizonte]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285221|title=Argentina vs Iran|date=21 June 2014|accessdate=22 June 2014|work=BBC}} On 5 July, he scored the only goal of the match in the 1–0 [[2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Quarter-finals|quarter-final]] victory over [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28069209|title=Argentina 1–0 Belgium|accessdate=6 June 2014|date=5 June 2014|work=BBC}} In [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final|the final]] against Germany, Higuaín shot wide on a one-on-one chance against Germany goalkeeper [[Manuel Neuer]] after being gifted an errant, headed back-pass from [[Toni Kroos]], and had a goal disallowed for [[Offside (association football)|offside]],{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/07/13/gonzalo-higuain-miss-argentina-world-cup_n_5582561.html|title=Gonzalo Higuain Missed Argentina's Best Chance Against Germany (VIDEO/GIF)|date=13 July 2014|accessdate=15 July 2014|publisher=Huffington Post}} as Germany eventually won the match 1–0 in extra time.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jul/13/germany-argentina-world-cup-final-2014-match-report|title=Germany beat Argentina to win World Cup final with late Mario Götze goal|date=14 July 2014|accessdate=15 July 2014|publisher=The Guardian}} ===2015 Copa América=== With [[Sergio Agüero]] preferred as the lone centre-forward in a three-man Argentine attack, Higuaín made his first start of the [[2015 Copa América]] in the final [[2015 Copa América Group B|group]] match, against [[Jamaica national football team|Jamaica]] in [[Viña del Mar]]. Winning his 50th cap, he scored the only goal of the game in the 11th minute when set up by [[Ángel Di María]], sending Argentina through to the quarter-finals as group winners.{{cite news|title=Gonzalo Higuain's goal helps Argentina finish atop Group B|url=http://www.espnfc.com/copa-america/match/409841/argentina-jamaica/report|accessdate=20 June 2015|publisher=ESPN|date=20 June 2015}} On 30 June, he scored the final goal of Argentina's 6–1 win over Paraguay in the semi-finals, two minutes after coming on in place of Agüero.{{cite news|last1=Emons|first1=Michael|title=Argentina 6–1 Paraguay|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33085956|accessdate=1 July 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=1 July 2015}} On 4 July, Higuaín was one of two Argentina players to fail to convert their kicks in a penalty shootout loss to [[Chile national football team|Chile]] in the [[2015 Copa América Final]], blasting his attempt over the crossbar; during regulation time he had previously been provided with a late goalscoring opportunity, but failed to convert [[Ezequiel Lavezzi]]'s low cross.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33085977|title=Chile 0–0 Argentina|work=BBC|date=5 July 2015}}{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jul/05/chile-argentina-copa-america-final-match-report|title=Hosts Chile stun Argentina to claim first Copa América title on penalties|publisher=The Guardian|author1=Jonathan Wilson|date=5 July 2015|accessdate=12 June 2017}} ===Copa América Centenario=== At the [[Copa América Centenario]] in 2016, Higuaín was named to [[Gerardo Martino]]'s 23-man Argentina squad, and was selected as his team's starting centre forward.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/argentina/story/2876914/carlos-tevez-paulo-dybala-left-off-argentinas-copa-america-squad|title=Carlos Tevez, Paulo Dybala left off Argentina's Copa America squad|publisher=ESPN FC|date=20 May 2016|accessdate=31 May 2016}} On 18 June, he scored twice in the team's 4–1 quarter-final defeat of Venezuela.{{cite web|url=http://www.ca2016.com/matches/27|title=Match 27 : Argentina vs Venezuela|publisher=[[Copa América Centenario]]|date=18 June 2016|access-date=18 June 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160618000735/http://www.ca2016.com/matches/27|archivedate=18 June 2016}} Three days later, he once again scored two goals as Argentina defeated the hosts [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] 4–0 in the semi-final.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36593966|title=Lionel Messi breaks record as Argentina reach Copa America final|date=22 June 2016|work=BBC}} He played in the [[Copa América Centenario Final|final]] against Chile eight days later, a repeat of the previous year's final, as the ''Albiceleste'' once again lost in a penalty shootout following a 0–0 draw after extra time. Following the match, Higuaín once again came under criticism in the media for squandering a one on one opportunity for the third consecutive final with Argentina.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2016/jun/26/copa-america-2016-final-argentina-chile-live-score|title=Chile beat Argentina on penalties to win Copa América – as it happened|publisher=The Guardian|author1=Tom Lutz|date=27 June 2016|accessdate=11 July 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sportsnet.ca/soccer/xxx-wins-copa-america-centenario-title/|title=Argentina falls to Chile in Copa America Centenario final|publisher=Sportsnet.ca|date=26 June 2016|accessdate=12 June 2017}} ===2018 World Cup=== During Argentina's troublesome [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)|qualifying campaign]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia, Higuaín only managed one goal in nine appearances, and eventually lost his place in the team's starting line-up.{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/players/player/271550/profile/ |title=2018 FIFA World Cup Profile: Gonzalo Higuaín |publisher=FIFA.com |accessdate=1 July 2018 }} In May 2018, however, Higuaín was included in [[Jorge Sampaoli]]'s final 23-man Argentina squad for the tournament.{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/argentina-world-cup-squad-paulo-dybala-mauro-icardi-a8362096.html |title=Argentina World Cup squad: Paulo Dybala included but Mauro Icardi misses out on 23-man group for Russia |publisher=The Independent |date=21 May 2018 |accessdate=17 June 2018 }} He appeared in all three group matches for Argentina, but went scoreless throughout the competition, and did not feature in the round of 16 match against [[France national football team|France]] on 30 June, which saw Argentina eliminated from the World Cup following a 4–3 defeat.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/43976007 |title=France 4–3 Argentina |publisher=BBC Sport |author=Emlyn Begley |date=30 June 2018 |accessdate=30 June 2018 }}{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-cup/2018/06/30/france-vs-argentina-world-cup-2018-live-score-lionel-messi-latest/ |title=Kylian Mbappe destroys Argentina to send Lionel Messi and co home in World Cup thriller |publisher=The Telegraph |author1=Sam Wallace |date=1 July 2018 |accessdate=1 July 2018 }}{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/players/player/271550/ |title=Gonzalo Higuaín |publisher=FIFA.com |accessdate=1 July 2018 }} ==Style of play== A hardworking striker and a prolific goalscorer, Higuaín is considered to be one of the top strikers of his generation,{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2015/jul/09/strikers-premier-league-gonzalo-higuain|title=Every club wants one but where have all the (good) strikers gone?|publisher=The Guardian|author1=Amy Lawrence|date=9 July 2015|accessdate=22 November 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/75003/prandelli-%E2%80%98higuain-best-around%E2%80%99|title=Prandelli: ‘Higuain best around’|publisher=Football Italia|date=29 October 2015|accessdate=22 November 2015}} and is known in particular for his great striking ability,{{cite web|url=http://www.sscnapoli.it/Squadra/Gonzalo-Higuain|title=Prima Squadra – SSC Napoli|publisher=|access-date=14 February 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150212070151/http://www.sscnapoli.it/Squadra/Gonzalo-Higuain|archive-date=12 February 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} as well as his opportunism and clinical finishing inside the penalty area, while his height, eye for goal, and strong physique make him a dangerous aerial presence in the box. He also possesses good technical skills, and an ability to link-up with teammates, hold up the ball, and lay it off to other players. His intelligent offensive movement off the ball and pace in the final third of the pitch make him an offensive threat during counter-attacks, and also allow him to lose his markers and get on the end of passes, or create space for his teammates with his attacking runs.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2440254.html|title=How brilliant is Juventus' Gonzalo Higuaín?|publisher=UEFA.com|date=14 March 2017|accessdate=15 March 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://goal.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/09/14/higuain-finds-comfort-in-columbus/|title=Higuaín Finds Comfort in Columbus|publisher=The New York Times|author=Eric Beard|date=14 September 2012|accessdate=20 March 2017}} Because of his team-play, he has also operated as a [[Forward (association football)#False 9|false nine]] on occasion.{{cite web |url=https://www.football-italia.net/116818/crespo-%E2%80%99play-icardi-higuain%E2%80%99 |title=Crespo: ’Play Icardi with Higuain’ |publisher=Football Italia |date=6 February 2018 |accessdate=2 September 2018 }}{{cite web |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/arsene-wenger-struggling-juventus-max-10213736 |title=With Arsene Wenger struggling, Juventus' Max Allegri gave Arsenal food for thought with spot-on tactics to stun Barcelona |publisher=The Daily Mirror |author1=Darren Lewis |date=12 April 2017 |accessdate=2 September 2018 }} His playing style has earned him comparisons with compatriots [[Hernán Crespo]] and Gabriel Batistuta.{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/3277/la-liga/2011/10/18/2717055/hernan-crespo-real-madrids-gonzalo-higuain-is-my-natural|title=Hernan Crespo: Real Madrid's Gonzalo Higuain is my natural successor in the Argentina national team|publisher=Goal.com|author1=Daniel Edwards|date=18 October 2011|accessdate=11 January 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-soccer-world-penpix-argentina-idUSKBN0DF06J20140429|title=Penpix of likely Argentina squad for World Cup finals|publisher=Reuters|author1=Rex Gowar|date=28 April 2014|accessdate=20 March 2017}} Despite his impressive scoring record, Higuaín has often been criticized for failing to deliver in the most important of matches for both club and country. Notable examples include poor performances in cup finals and crucial [[UEFA Champions League]] matches during his tenures at Real Madrid, Napoli and Juventus, as well as notable missed chances for the Argentina national team in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final|2014 World Cup Final]], the [[2015 Copa América Final]] and the [[Copa América Centenario Final]].{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/en/football/international-football/2017/06/05/593573fd46163f84608b45be.html|title=Higuain's grim record in finals|publisher=Marca.com|author1=Joel del Río|date=5 June 2017|accessdate=6 June 2017}} ==Endorsements== Higuaín, along with global cover star Lionel Messi, featured on the Italian cover of [[EA Sports]]' multi-platform video game ''[[FIFA 15]]''.{{cite news|url=http://www.easports.com/it/fifa/notizie/2014/fifa-15-svelata-la-cover-italiana-it|title=FIFA 15 – Svelata la Cover Italiana|trans-title=FIFA 15 – Italian Cover revealed|publisher=[[EA Sports]]|language=Italian|date=30 August 2014|accessdate=21 September 2014}} ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 17 March 2019}}[http://soccernet-akamai.espn.go.com/players/stats?id=67310&cc=5739 Higuain Statistics]. Hazard is the son of two former footballers and began his career in Belgium playing for local youth clubs. In 2005, he moved to France where he began his senior career, joining [[Ligue 1|first division]] club [[Lille OSC|Lille]]. Hazard spent two years in the club's academy and, at the age of 16, made his professional debut in November 2007. He went on to become an integral part of the Lille team under manager [[Rudi Garcia]], racking up over 190 appearances. In his first full season as a starter, he won the [[National Union of Professional Footballers]] (UNFP) [[Trophées UNFP du football#Young Player of the Year|Young Player of the Year]] award, becoming the first non-French player to win the award.<ref name="Lille OSC">{{cite web|title=Eden Hazard prolonge son contrat au LOSC|url=http://www.losc.fr/?r=0,0,18,4500|publisher=Lille OSC|accessdate=10 April 2010|language=French}}</ref> In the [[2009–10 Ligue 1|2009–10 season]], Hazard captured the award again, becoming the first player to win the award twice.<ref name="young_player">{{cite news |title=Hazard named Young Player of Year|url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/article/hazard-named-young-player-of-year.htm|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|date=25 May 2009 |accessdate=10 April 2010 }}</ref> He was also named to the league's [[Trophées UNFP du football#Team of the Year|Team of the Year]].
In the [[2010–11 in French football|2010–11 season]], he was a part of the Lille team that won the [[Double (association football)|league and cup double]] and, as a result of his performances, was named the [[Trophées UNFP du football#Player of the Year|UNFP Ligue 1 Player of the Year]], the youngest player to win the award.<ref name="hazard_player">{{cite web|title=UNFP: Trophées UNFP du football Un petit coin de paradis...|url=http://www.unfp.org/a-la-une/article/un-petit-coin-de-paradis-22052011-5379.html |publisher=[[National Union of Professional Footballers]] |date=22 May 2011 |accessdate=22 May 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110918195945/http://www.unfp.org/a-la-une/article/un-petit-coin-de-paradis-22052011-5379.html |archivedate=18 September 2011 |df= }}</ref> Hazard was also given the [[Bravo Award]] by Italian magazine [[Guerin Sportivo]] for his performances during the 2010–11 season.<ref name="hazard_bravo">{{cite web|title=The "Bravo" Award |url=http://www.rsssf.com/miscellaneous/bravo-awards.html |publisher=[[Rec.Sport.Soccer Statistics Foundation]] |accessdate=1 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140701223750/http://rsssf.com/miscellaneous/bravo-awards.html |archivedate=1 July 2014 }}</ref> In June 2012 Hazard signed for English club Chelsea, where he went on to win the [[UEFA Europa League]] in his first season and the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] in his second. In the 2014–15 season, he helped Chelsea win the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] and [[Premier League]], earning him the [[FWA Footballer of the Year]] and the [[PFA Players' Player of the Year]] awards.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymotion.com/video/xcg949_european-players-player-award-made_shortfilms|title=European Players Player Award made by Thomas Lyte|publisher=Dailymotion|date=4 March 2010}}</ref> Two years later he won his second English title as Chelsea secured the [[2016–17 Premier League|2016–17]] Premier League.
Hazard is a [[Belgium national football team|Belgium international]], having represented his country at [[Belgium national under-17 football team|under-17]] and [[Belgium national under-19 football team|under-19]] level. Hazard made his senior international debut in November 2008, aged 17, in a [[Exhibition game|friendly match]] against [[Luxembourg national football team|Luxembourg]]. Nearly three years after his debut, Hazard scored his first international goal against [[Kazakhstan national football team|Kazakhstan]] in October 2011. He has since earned over 90 caps, and was a member of the Belgian squad which reached the quarter-finals of the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and the [[UEFA Euro 2016]]. At the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], he captained Belgium to third place which was their best finish in history, receiving the [[Golden Ball (FIFA)|Silver Ball]] as the second best player of the tournament. In 2018 he was named in the [[FIFPro#FIFA FIFPro World XI|FIFA World XI]].
==Early life== Hazard was born in [[La Louvière]] and grew up in [[Braine-le-Comte]]. His mother, Carine, and father, Thierry, were both footballers. His father spent most of his career at [[semi-professional]] level with [[R.A.A. Louviéroise|La Louvière]] in the [[Belgian Second Division]],<ref name="eden_leparisien">{{cite news | url = http://www.leparisien.fr/sports/les-hazard-une-famille-de-foot-13-05-2011-1447493.php | title = Les Hazard, une famille de foot | date = 15 March 2011 | accessdate = 19 December 2011 |work=Le Parisien | language = French }}</ref> playing mainly as a [[defensive midfielder]].<ref name="eden_leparisien"/> His mother played as a [[Striker (association football)|striker]] in the [[Belgian Women's First Division]] and stopped playing when she was three months pregnant with Eden.<ref name="eden_leparisien"/><ref name="eden_family">{{cite news|url=http://www.lavoixdessports.com/LOSC/2010/01/29/article_avant-d-etre-partagee-entre-lille-et-len.shtml|title=Avant d'être partagée entre Lille et Lens, la famille Hazard a cultivé son jardin secret|date=29 January 2010|accessdate=19 April 2011|work=La Voix des Sports|language=French}}</ref> After playing football, both parents became sports teachers.<ref name="eden_leparisien"/> Thierry retired from his position in 2009 in order to devote more time to his children.<ref name="eden_leparisien"/>

Hazard and his three brothers were raised in a comfortable environment with their parents ensuring they had whatever they needed to excel.<ref name="eden_hazard2">{{cite news |url=http://www.thenational.ae/sport/football/hazard-lights-the-way-for-belgium | title = Hazard lights the way for Belgium |date= 5 March 2010 | accessdate = 10 April 2010 | publisher=[[The National (Abu Dhabi)|The National]] }}</ref> The family lived "no more than three metres" from a football training ground and the brothers often ventured onto a training pitch through a small hole in order to hone and develop their skills.<ref name="eden_family"/> Growing up his idol was French playmaker [[Zinedine Zidane]], with Hazard "watching him on television and online for hours."<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/chelseas-eden-hazard-i-want-to-play-under-zinedine-zidane-a3174561.html |title=Chelsea's Eden Hazard: I want to play under Zinedine Zidane |work=London Evening Standard |date=6 February 2016 |accessdate=5 July 2018}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Early career=== Hazard began his football career playing for hometown club Royal Stade Brainois at the age of four. During his time at the club, one of his youth coaches described him as a "gifted" player. He added: "He knew everything. I had nothing to teach him".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nordeclair.fr/Sports/Football/2011/11/15/a-braine-le-comte-sur-les-traces-d-eden.shtml |title=À Braine-le-Comte, sur les traces d'Eden Hazard |date=15 November 2011 |accessdate=29 November 2011 |publisher=Nord Éclair |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120422040603/http://www.nordeclair.fr/Sports/Football/2011/11/15/a-braine-le-comte-sur-les-traces-d-eden.shtml |archivedate=22 April 2012 |df= }}</ref> Hazard spent eight years at the club before moving to [[A.F.C. Tubize|Tubize]]. While at Tubize, he was spotted by a Lille scout while playing in a local tournament with the club. The scout's subsequent report on the player prompted club officials to meet with Hazard's father and offer the young player an ''aspirant'' (youth) contract.<ref name="eden_contract">{{cite news |title=8 nouveaux professionnels au LOSC|url=http://www.losc.fr/?r=0,0,14,20|work=[[Lille OSC]] |accessdate=10 April 2010 | language = French}}</ref>
Hazard's parents accepted the offer from Lille with hopes that the training facilities in France would be better.<ref name="eden_hazard2"/> Hazard's father later admitted that the decision to let Eden and, later Thorgan, join clubs in the [[Nord-Pas-de-Calais|North of France]] was the best solution stating "They remained so close to home and, at the same time, they integrated at structures where they could grow, because in Belgium, unfortunately, it's a little empty for the training of youth".<ref name="eden_family"/>
===Lille=== Hazard joined Lille in 2005 and spent two years developing in the club's local sports school, due to its youth academy in Luchin not being in operation at that time.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/video/videoid=1683656.html?autoplay=true|title=Lille's Hazard looks back and forward to Trabzonspor|date=27 September 2011|accessdate=27 September 2011|publisher=[[UEFA]]}}</ref> On 28 May 2007, he signed his first professional contract agreeing to a three-year deal with Lille.<ref name="eden_contract"/> At the start of the [[2007-08 Ligue 1|2007–08 season]], at the age of 16, Hazard was promoted to the club's reserve team in the [[Championnat de France amateur]], the fourth level of [[Football in France|French football]], though he still played with Lille's under-18 team in its league and the [[Coupe Gambardella]]. Hazard made his amateur debut on 1 September 2007 in a league match against [[Racing Levallois 92|Racing Club de France]] appearing as a second-half substitute in a 3–1 defeat.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://losc.fr/?saison=20072008&r=0,2,5,,2,413|title=Racing CF 92 3–1 LOSC 2|date=1 September 2007|accessdate=19 April 2011|publisher=Lille OSC|language=French}}</ref> He made his first start a week later in the team's 1–0 defeat to [[US Lesquin|Lesquin]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://losc.fr/?saison=20072008&r=0,2,5,,2,427|title=LOSC 2 0–1 Lesquin|date=9 September 2007|accessdate=19 April 2011|publisher=Lille OSC|language=French}}</ref>
After spending the majority of October and the early part of November playing with the club's under-18 team, on 14 November, due to several players being on international duty, Hazard was called up to the senior team by manager [[Claude Puel]] to participate in a friendly match against Belgian club [[FC Bruges|Bruges]] on 16 November.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://losc.fr/?r=0,0,14,1684|title=Formation: carton plein des 18 ans Nationaux!|date=12 November 2007|accessdate=19 April 2011|publisher=Lille OSC|language=French}}</ref> He appeared as a substitute in the match and, as a result of his performance, was included in the 18-man squad to face [[AS Nancy|Nancy]] in a league match on 24 November.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://losc.fr/?saison=20072008&r=0,2,5,,1,24|title=FC Bruges 1–3 LOSC|date=16 November 2007|accessdate=19 April 2011|publisher=Lille OSC|language=French}}</ref> Hazard, subsequently, made his professional debut in the match coming on as a substitute in the 78th minute.<ref>{{cite web|title=Nancy v. Lille Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/51413 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=24 November 2007 |accessdate=10 April 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318071101/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/51413 |archivedate=18 March 2012 |df= }}</ref>
Hazard returned to the club's reserve team and spent December playing with the squad. Following the winter break, Hazard returned to the first team in January and made substitute appearances in three league matches against [[FC Metz|Metz]], [[FC Sochaux-Montbéliard|Sochaux]], and [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Metz Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/51449 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=12 January 2008 |accessdate=19 April 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318072110/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/51449 |archivedate=18 March 2012 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Sochaux v. Lille Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/51462 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=19 January 2008 |accessdate=19 April 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318071404/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/51462 |archivedate=18 March 2012 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Paris Saint-Germain Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/51476 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=26 January 2008 |accessdate=19 April 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318070855/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/51476 |archivedate=18 March 2012 |df= }}</ref> Following the match against Paris Saint-Germain, he was demoted back to amateur level where he played concurrently with the reserve team in the fourth division and the under-18 team in the Coupe Gambardella. On 17 May 2008, he scored his first amateur goal in a 3–2 victory over [[AS Vitré|Vitré]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://losc.fr/?saison=20072008&r=0,2,5,,2,679|title=LOSC 2 3–2 Vitré|date=17 May 2008|accessdate=19 April 2011|publisher=Lille OSC|language=French}}</ref> Hazard finished his amateur career with 11 appearances and one goal, helping the reserve team finished in fifth place, which was first among professional clubs' reserve teams playing in the group.<ref>{{cite web|title=Football Lille Effectif 2007/2008 |url=http://www.stat2foot.com/lclubs/lille20708.htm |publisher=Stat2Foot |accessdate=7 January 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120402031912/http://www.stat2foot.com/lclubs/lille20708.htm |archivedate= 2 April 2012 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://losc.fr/?saison=20072008&r=0,1,1,0,2,22|title=Joueurs CFA 2007/2008|date=19 April 2011|accessdate=19 April 2011|publisher=Lille OSC|language=French}}</ref>
====2008–09 season==== For the [[2008-09 Ligue 1|2008–09]] season, Hazard was given the number 26 shirt after playing with the number 33 shirt in his debut season. He was also promoted to the senior team permanently by new manager [[Rudi Garcia]]. Early on, he made substitute appearances regularly making his season debut as a substitute on 14 September 2008 against Sochaux in a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite news|title=Sochaux v. Lille Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52300 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=14 September 2008 |accessdate=19 April 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318072009/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52300 |archivedate=18 March 2012 |df= }}</ref> One of his substitute appearances proved beneficial against [[AJ Auxerre|Auxerre]] on 20 September. With Lille trailing 2–1 in the waning minutes of the match, Hazard, after Lille took a [[corner kick]], quickly scooped up a short clearance from Auxerre and took a right-footed shot just outside the box. It beat the keeper and drew the score 2–2 in the 88th minute.<ref>{{cite news |title=Eden Hazard premier but pro contre Auxerre!|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JlRlmBkXL2U |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=22 July 2010 }}</ref> With Lille's confidence high, the club won the match 3–2 in [[injury time]] following a goal from [[Tulio de Melo]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Auxerre Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52248 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=20 September 2008 |accessdate=19 April 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318071828/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52248 |archivedate=18 March 2012 |df= }}</ref> Hazard's first career goal resulted in him becoming the youngest goalscorer in the club's history.<ref name="Lille OSC"/>
Four days after scoring his first professional goal, Hazard made his first professional start in a 4–2 defeat on [[Penalty shootout (association football)|penalties]] to [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier]] in the [[Coupe de la Ligue]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Montpellier v. Lille Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/53004 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=24 September 2008 |accessdate=19 April 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318071840/http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/53004 |archivedate=18 March 2012 |df= }}</ref> After featuring as a substitute in the team's next five league matches, on 15 November, Hazard made his first professional league start against [[AS Saint-Étienne|Saint-Étienne]]. He capped the appearance by scoring the opening goal in the club's 3–0 victory.<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Saint Etienne Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52570|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|date=15 November 2008 |accessdate=10 April 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318071610/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52570 |archivedate=18 March 2012 }}</ref> His assured performances with the club resulted in Lille offering him a three-year contract extension, which he agreed to on 18 November 2008, tying him to the club until 2012.<ref>{{cite news |title=Lille va prolonger le contrat d'Eden Hazard|url=http://www.7sur7.be/7s7/fr/1509/Football-Belge/article/detail/492588/2008/11/18/Lille-va-prolonger-le-contrat-d-Eden-Hazard.dhtml|work=7sur7|date=18 November 2008 |accessdate=10 April 2010 | language = French}}</ref>
After featuring as a substitute in December, Hazard returned to the starting lineup in January. On 23 January, he scored the second goal in a 3–0 win over amateur club [[USL Dunkerque|Dunkerque]] in Round of 32 of the [[Coupe de France]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Dunkerque v. Lille Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/autresCompetitions/coupeFrance/feuille_match/53071 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=23 January 2009 |accessdate=10 April 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110823041207/http://new.lfp.fr/autresCompetitions/coupeFrance/feuille_match/53071 |archivedate=23 August 2011 |df= }}</ref> Two weeks later, he scored the match-winning goal in a league match against [[FC Sochaux-Montbéliard|Sochaux]] and, on 22 February, assisted on the winner against [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Sochaux Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52421 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=7 February 2009 |accessdate=10 April 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318070915/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52421 |archivedate=18 March 2012 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Monaco Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52441 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=22 February 2009 |accessdate=19 April 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318071131/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52441 |archivedate=18 March 2012 |df= }}</ref> In the Round of 16 of the Coupe de France, Hazard netted a goal in a 3–2 win over the competition's [[2008 Coupe de France Final|defending champions]] [[Olympique Lyonnais|Lyon]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Lyon Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/autresCompetitions/coupeFrance/feuille_match/53111 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=4 March 2009 |accessdate=10 April 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110823041307/http://new.lfp.fr/autresCompetitions/coupeFrance/feuille_match/53111 |archivedate=23 August 2011 |df= }}</ref> On 26 April, he scored the opening goal against [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]], though Lille lost the match 2–1.<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Marseille Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52561 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=26 April 2009 |accessdate=10 April 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318070703/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/52561 |archivedate=18 March 2012 |df= }}</ref> In the final ten league matches of the campaign, Hazard started eight and contributed to the team finishing in fifth place, which resulted in Lille qualifying for the newly created [[UEFA Europa League]]. After the season, he was named the National Union of Professional Footballers (UNFP) [[Trophées UNFP du football#Young Player of the Year|Young Player of the Year]], becoming the first international player to achieve the honor.<ref name="young_player"/>
====2009–10 season==== {{quote box | width=30% | align=right | quote=Eden is technically gifted and very fast. He will be a major star in the future. I would take him to [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] with my eyes closed.|source= —[[Zinedine Zidane]] on the 19-year-old Eden Hazard, August 2010.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2010/04/01/futbol/equipos/real_madrid/1270100911.html|title=Zidane: "Hazard es el crack del futuro: es muy bueno y va a serlo aún más" |publisher=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]] |date=1 April 2010|accessdate=9 August 2010 | language = Spanish}}</ref>}}
Following the 2008–09 season, constant media speculation occurred in numerous countries regarding Hazard's availability on the transfer market. Despite Lille chairman Michel Seydoux declaring the player off limits and Hazard stating that he wanted to remain at the club for at least another season, several clubs declared interest in the player.<ref>{{cite web|title=Hazard flattered by interest|url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11095_5174535,00.html|publisher=Sky Sports|date=11 April 2009|accessdate=10 April 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Hazard keen to stay put|url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11095_5165241,00.html|publisher=Sky Sports|date=9 April 2009|accessdate=10 April 2010}}</ref> These included English clubs [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], Italian club [[Internazionale Milano F.C.|Internazionale]], and Spanish clubs [[F.C. Barcelona|Barcelona]] and [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]]. French football legend [[Zinedine Zidane]] personally recommended the player to the latter club.<ref>{{cite news|title=10 things you need to know about Eden Hazard|url=http://www.mirrorfootball.co.uk/opinion/blogs/football-spy/Arsenal-transfer-target-Eden-Hazard-10-things-you-need-to-know-about-him-plus-watch-video-of-his-amazing-goals-and-skills-article737223.html|work=[[Daily Mirror]]|date=2 April 2010|accessdate=10 April 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110929232757/http://www.mirrorfootball.co.uk/opinion/blogs/football-spy/Arsenal-transfer-target-Eden-Hazard-10-things-you-need-to-know-about-him-plus-watch-video-of-his-amazing-goals-and-skills-article737223.html|archivedate=29 September 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=The next Cristiano Ronaldo, Eden Hazard declares interest in sealing summer move to Arsenal|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1215822/The-Cristiano-Ronaldo-Eden-Hazard-declares-sealing-summer-Arsenal.html|work=Daily Mail|date=25 September 2009|accessdate=10 April 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Eden Hazard agent: Man Utd, Barcelona following him for two years |url=http://www.tribalfootball.com/eden-hazard-agent-man-utd-barcelona-following-him-two-years-238625 |publisher=Tribal Football |date=16 April 2009 |accessdate=10 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100329104306/http://www.tribalfootball.com/eden-hazard-agent-man-utd-barcelona-following-him-two-years-238625 |archivedate=29 March 2010 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Eden Hazard rules out Liverpool move claiming he has eyes only for Real Madrid and Arsenal|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1263010/Eden-Hazard-rules-Liverpool-claiming-eyes-Real-Madrid-Arsenal.html|work=Daily Mail|date=2 April 2010|accessdate=10 April 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Hazard reiterates hope for Madrid or Arsenal move|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/765161/lille-starlet-hazard-reiterates-hope-for-madrid-or-arsenal-move|publisher=ESPN FC|date=2 April 2010|accessdate=10 April 2010}}</ref>
Hazard began the [[2009–10 in French football|2009–10 season]] on a positive note scoring in Lille's first competitive match of the season. The goal, contributing to the team's 2–0 victory, came against Serbian club [[FK Sevojno]] in the first leg of the club's [[UEFA Europa League 2009-10#Third qualifying round|third qualifying round]] match in the [[UEFA Europa League]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Sevojno v. Lille Match Report|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season=2010/round=2000035/match=2000643/postmatch/index.html|publisher=UEFA|date=30 July 2009|accessdate=10 April 2010}}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> On 27 August, he scored his second career [[UEFA|European]] goal in the club's second leg tie in the playoff round against Belgian club [[KRC Genk|Genk]]. It was Lille's final goal in the club's 4–2 victory.<ref>{{cite web|title=Genk v. Lille Match Report|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season=2010/round=2000036/match=2000740/postmatch/index.html|publisher=UEFA|date=27 August 2009|accessdate=10 April 2010}}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> The 6–3 aggregate scoreline assured the club progression to the [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] group stage.
On 22 October, Hazard scored a goal in Lille's important 3–0 victory over Italian club [[Genoa C.F.C.|Genoa]] in the 84th minute after entering as a substitute 10 minutes prior. Upon receiving the ball on the left wing, Hazard proceeded to dash through the midfield dribbling past six Genoa defenders before finishing at the 18-yard box.<ref>{{cite news |title=Eden Hazard VS Genoa (but)| url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VKWYdjLihR0|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=10 April 2010 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Lille looking to go the distance|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season=2010/round=2000037/match=2000814/postmatch/index.html|publisher=UEFA|date=22 October 2009|accessdate=10 April 2010}}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> A month later, Hazard was instrumental in Lille's 5–1 thrashing of Czech club [[Slavia Prague]] as he was partly responsible for the opening goal — slicing through the defense and delivering a cross near post, which went off Slavia player [[Marek Suchý]] resulting in an [[own goal]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Balmont and Lille go big-game hunting |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season=2010/round=2000037/match=2000897/index.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100228175104/http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season%3D2010/round%3D2000037/match%3D2000897/index.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=28 February 2010 |publisher=UEFA |date=18 December 2009 |accessdate=10 April 2010 |df= }}</ref>
On 20 December, Hazard scored his first league goal of the season in the club's 3–0 win over [[Le Mans Union Club 72|Le Mans]]. He also provided both the assists on the other two goals.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lille beats Le Mans 3–0 to take third place in French league, Lyon held 1–1 at Monaco |url=http://www.canadaeast.com/news/article/896237 |work=Canada East |date=20 December 2009 |accessdate=10 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120428190843/http://www.canadaeast.com/news/article/896237 |archivedate=28 April 2012 }}</ref> On 30 January, Hazard scored the only goal in Lille's win over Derby du Nord rivals [[RC Lens|Lens]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Lens Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/44823 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=30 January 2010 |accessdate=22 July 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318071520/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/44823 |archivedate=18 March 2012 |df= }}</ref> The victory helped the club achieve stability in the league by keeping them in the [[UEFA Champions League]] places. It also ended a disaster of a week which saw Lille suffer elimination from both of France's cup competitions. Five days later, Hazard and Lille reached an agreement on a contract extension, which will keep the player at the club until 2014.<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille starlet Eden Hazard signs contract extension|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/736478/lille-starlet-eden-hazard-signs-contract-extension|publisher=ESPN FC|date=4 February 2010|accessdate=10 April 2010 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Hazard seals new Lille deal|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=1445491.html|publisher=UEFA|date=5 February 2010|accessdate=10 April 2010}}</ref> On 11 March, Hazard scored the only goal in Lille's victory over English club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in the first leg of the club's [[UEFA Europa League]] tie converting a [[Direct free kick|free kick]] in the 83rd minute.<ref>{{cite web|title=Hazard hands initiative to Lille |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season=2010/round=2000039/match=2000944/postmatch/report/index.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100313073157/http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/matches/season%3D2010/round%3D2000039/match%3D2000944/postmatch/report/index.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=13 March 2010 |publisher=UEFA |date=11 March 2010 |accessdate=22 July 2010 |df= }}</ref> Three weeks later, Hazard provided two assists in the club's 4–1 win over fellow title contenders [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Lille v. Montpellier Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/44897 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=28 March 2010 |accessdate=22 July 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318071625/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/44897 |archivedate=18 March 2012 |df= }}</ref> The two passes brought his league tally to seven, tied for second in the league. For his impressive displays in the month of March, Hazard was given the [[UNFP Player of the Month]] award.<ref>{{cite web|title=Eden Hazard: La confirmation!|url=http://www.footballeurspros.fr/ligue1/trophee-du-joueur/trophees-du-mois.html?tx_unfptrophee_pi1%5Buid%5D=109&cHash=369b52d949|publisher=National Union of Professional Footballers|accessdate=16 April 2010|language=French}}</ref>
On 29 April, Hazard was nominated for the UNFP [[Ligue 1]] [[Trophées UNFP du football#Player of the Year|Player of the Year]] award. He was also nominated, for the second consecutive season, for the Young Player of the Year award.<ref>{{cite web|title=Trophées UNFP – Les nommés sont...|url=http://fr.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1202300.html?cid=rssfeed&att=|publisher=FIFA|date=29 April 2010|accessdate=30 April 2010|language=French}}</ref> On 9 May, Hazard was awarded the UNFP Young Player of the Year trophy for the second consecutive season. He became the first player since its inception in 1994 to win the award twice.<ref name="young_player"/> Hazard lost out on the Player of the Year award, which was awarded to Lyon [[Striker (association football)|striker]] [[Lisandro López]].
====2010–11 season==== Hazard began the [[2010–11 in French football|2010–11 campaign]] as a starter featuring in Lille's first six league matches of the season, as well as matches in the [[UEFA Europa League]]. On 29 August 2010, he scored his first goal of the season in a 1–1 draw with [[OGC Nice|Nice]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Lille v. Nice Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53669 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=29 August 2010 |accessdate=9 October 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101206215921/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53669 |archivedate= 6 December 2010 |df= }}</ref> In late September, Hazard began to struggle with inconsistency and was benched by Garcia in an effort to "allow him (Hazard) to breathe and learn that his performances were insufficient".<ref name="hazard_fourfourtwo">{{cite news|url=http://fourfourtwo.com/blogs/thefrenchconnection/archive/2010/11/23/hazard-a-guess-at-liverpool-s-next-big-signing.aspx |title=Hazard a guess at Liverpool's next big signing...|date=23 November 2010 |accessdate=19 April 2011 |publisher=FourFourTwo |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110117112723/http://fourfourtwo.com/blogs/thefrenchconnection/archive/2010/11/23/hazard-a-guess-at-liverpool-s-next-big-signing.aspx |archivedate=17 January 2011 }}</ref> Hazard, subsequently, appeared as a substitute in the team's 2–1 defeat to Portuguese club [[Sporting CP|Sporting]] in the Europa League and as a substitute in the next three league matches against [[Toulouse FC|Toulouse]], [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier]], and Lyon.<ref>{{cite news|title=Toulouse v. Lille Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53702 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=26 September 2010 |accessdate=7 January 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318071818/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53702 |archivedate=18 March 2012 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Lille v. Montpellier Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53740|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|date=3 October 2010 |accessdate=7 January 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318070503/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53740 |archivedate=18 March 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Lyon v. Lille Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53713 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=17 October 2010 |accessdate=7 January 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101020153139/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53713 |archivedate=20 October 2010 }}</ref> Hazard later admitted that his first bout of inconsistency affected him stating "The first two months were a bit tough. I wouldn't say that I began doubting my abilities, but I definitely went through a really patchy spell".<ref name="hazard_fifa">{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/news/newsid=1379756.html|title=Hazard: A force to be reckoned with|date=9 February 2011|accessdate=19 April 2011|publisher=FIFA}}</ref>
On 7 October, Belgium national team manager [[Georges Leekens]], citing Hazard's recent spell on the bench at Lille, said that the player needed to work harder, both physically and mentally, to regain his past year's form. The team's assistant coach, [[Marc Wilmots]], also stated that Hazard often displayed a lazy mentality while training with the national team.<ref name="hazard_leekens">{{cite news |title='Eden Hazard moet wakker worden' |url=http://www.standaard.be/artikel/detail.aspx?artikelid=7L30HMV0|work=[[De Standaard]] |date=8 October 2010 |accessdate=9 October 2010 | language = Dutch}}</ref> Garcia responded to Leekens comments the following day stating that he thought they were "excessive" and that "Eden is only 19 years old" and can still "make more progress in all areas."<ref>{{cite news |title=Point presse: l'œil de Rudi Garcia |url=http://fr.footrends.com/point-presse-l-il-rudi-garcia-279546.html |work=FooTrends |date=8 October 2010 |accessdate=9 October 2010 | language = French}}</ref> Following Belgium's match against [[Kazakhstan national football team|Kazakhstan]], in which Hazard failed to start or even appear on the substitute's bench, Leekens responded to Garcia's comments declaring that he would stand by his previous comments and that players must think about the team and not themselves.<ref>{{cite web|title=G.Leekens répond à R.Garcia |url=http://www.footlille.com/breve-losc-20003-e-hazard-g-leekens-repond-a-r-garcia.html |publisher=FootLille |date=9 October 2010 |accessdate=9 October 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101012211246/http://footlille.com/breve-losc-20003-e-hazard-g-leekens-repond-a-r-garcia.html |archivedate=12 October 2010 |df= }}</ref> Hazard, himself, later reflected on Leekens and Garcia comments in February 2011 stating "I learned a lot during those few weeks, mentally speaking. And since then things have got better. The national side has had a fair bit to do with that – I get a lot out of being a part of it".<ref name="hazard_fifa"/>
Following the international break, Hazard recaptured his scoring form netting the final goal in Lille's 4–1 victory over [[Stade Malherbe Caen|Caen]] in the [[2010–11 Coupe de la Ligue|Coupe de la Ligue]] on 27 October.<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Caen Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/73720 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=27 October 2010 |accessdate=7 November 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101031021111/http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/73720 |archivedate=31 October 2010 |df= }}</ref> Ten days later, he scored his second league goal of the season in a 3–1 win against the league table leaders [[Stade Brestois 29|Brest]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Brest Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53779 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=7 November 2010 |accessdate=7 November 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101114193743/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53779 |archivedate=14 November 2010 |df= }}</ref> On 21 November, Hazard assisted on both Lille's goals in a 2–1 win over [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Monaco Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53757 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=21 November 2010 |accessdate=9 December 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101124035555/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53757 |archivedate=24 November 2010 |df= }}</ref> The victory continued the club's domestic unbeaten streak, which led to Lille topping the league table following an emphatic 6–3 victory against [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] on 5 December.<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Lorient Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53777 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=5 December 2010 |accessdate=9 December 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101209150025/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53777 |archivedate= 9 December 2010 }}</ref> At the turn of the calendar year, Hazard scored in the team's first match against amateur club [[US Forbach|Forbach]] in the [[Coupe de France]]. Lille won the match 3–1.<ref>{{cite news|title=Forbach v. Lille Match Report |url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/FootballFicheMatch31398_217362.html |work=[[L'Equipe]] |date=8 January 2011 |accessdate=14 January 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110111064940/http://www.lequipe.fr/Football/FootballFicheMatch31398_217362.html |archivedate=11 January 2011 }}</ref> In the team's following match, he assisted on goals scored by [[Moussa Sow]] and [[Gervinho]] in a 2–0 league victory over [[OGC Nice|Nice]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Nice v. Lille Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53855 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=15 January 2011 |accessdate=16 January 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110119001711/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53855 |archivedate=19 January 2011 |df= }}</ref>
On 19 January, Hazard scored the second goal in a 3–0 victory over [[AS Nancy|Nancy]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Nancy Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/73859 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=19 January 2011 |accessdate=22 January 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318071053/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/73859 |archivedate=18 March 2012 |df= }}</ref> On 4 March, Lille officials confirmed that Hazard had added an extra year to his contract. The new deal tied him to the club until 2015 and also made him the highest paid player in Ligue 1 beginning with the 2011–12 season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Hazard prolonge avec le LOSC jusqu'en 2015 |url=http://losc.fr/?r=0,0,1,11596 |work=[[Lille OSC]] |date=4 March 2011 |accessdate=5 March 2011 | language = French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Eden Hazard: ''C'est une décision réfléchie!'' |url=http://losc.fr/?r=0,0,2,3049 |work=[[Lille OSC]] |date=4 March 2011 |accessdate=5 March 2011 | language = French}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.footmercato.net/ligue1/qui-sont-les-joueurs-les-mieux-payes-de-ligue-1_82168|title=Qui sont les joueurs les mieux payés de Ligue 1?|date=20 March 2012|work=Foot Mercato |accessdate=21 March 2012 | language = French}}</ref> In his first match after the news, Hazard scored the opening goal in Lille's 2–1 away win over title rivals Marseille.<ref>{{cite web|title=Marseille v. Lille Match Report|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53871|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|date=6 March 2011|accessdate=6 March 2011|language=French}}</ref> The goal was scored on a left-footed shot from almost {{convert|35|m|yd}} out and was clocked at {{convert|95|km/h|abbr=on}}.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lille beats Marseille 2–1 in French league|url=http://www.taiwannews.com.tw/etn/news_content.php?id=1535277|work=Taiwan News |date=6 March 2011|accessdate=6 March 2011}}</ref>
On 2 April, Hazard capped his 100th league appearance with Lille by scoring the second goal in a 3–1 win over Caen.<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille v. Caen Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53936 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=2 April 2011 |accessdate=2 April 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110405074521/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53936 |archivedate= 5 April 2011 |df= }}</ref> The goal tied his career-high for goals in a season and also moved Lille eight points clear at the top of the league table.<ref>{{cite web|title=Victory cushions Lille at summit|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1410932.html|publisher=FIFA|date=2 April 2011|accessdate=2 April 2011}}</ref> For his performances in the month of March, Hazard was named the UNFP Player of the Month for the second time in his career.<ref>{{cite web|title=Andre Ayew misses out on French Player of the Month Award|url=http://www.ghanasoccernet.com/andre-ayew-misses-out-on-french-player-of-the-month-award/|publisher=GhanaSoccerNet|date=8 April 2011|accessdate=19 April 2011}}</ref> On 19 April, after appearing as a first-half substitute, he scored the opening goal in Lille's 2–0 Coupe de France semi-final victory over [[OGC Nice|Nice]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille reach Coupe de France final|url=http://www.eurosport.com/football/ligue-1/2009-2010/lille-reach-cup-final_sto2757041/story.shtml|publisher=Eurosport|date=19 April 2011|accessdate=19 April 2011}}</ref> The victory inserted the club into the [[2011 Coupe de France Final]]; the club's first appearance in the competition's final since [[1955 Coupe de France Final|1955]]. On 7 May, Hazard converted a game-winning free-kick goal in the team's 1–0 win over Nancy.<ref>{{cite web|title=Nancy v. Lille Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53949 |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=7 May 2011 |accessdate=10 May 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110510144936/http://new.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53949 |archivedate=10 May 2011 |df= }}</ref> Three days later, he was nominated for the UNFP Ligue 1 Player of the Year award for the second consecutive season.<ref>{{cite web|title=UNFP: Trophées UNFP du football Les nommés pour le 22 mai! |url=http://www.unfp.org/a-la-une/article/les-nommes-pour-le-22-mai-21052011-5348.html |publisher=National Union of Professional Footballers |date=10 May 2011 |accessdate=10 May 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110918135401/http://www.unfp.org/a-la-une/article/les-nommes-pour-le-22-mai-21052011-5348.html |archivedate=18 September 2011 |df= }}</ref>
In the [[2011 Coupe de France Final|Coupe de France final]], Hazard played 89 minutes as Lille defeated [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] 1–0 at the [[Stade de France]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/316513?cc=5739 |title=Late Obraniak strike wins cup |date=14 May 2011 |publisher=ESPN |accessdate=19 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121025001642/http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/316513?cc=5739 |archivedate=25 October 2012 }}</ref> A week later, Lille clinched the [[2010–11 Ligue 1|Ligue 1 title]] by drawing 2–2 away to Paris Saint-Germain, achieving the club's first league championship since the [[1953–54 French Division 1|1953–54 season]] and the club's first [[Double (association football)|double]] since the [[1945–46 French Division 1|1945–46 season]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/breves2011/20110522_124004_-champions.html|title=Champions!|date=22 May 2011|work=L'Équipe|accessdate=22 May 2011|language=French|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110523223916/http://www.lequipe.fr/Football/breves2011/20110522_124004_-champions.html|archivedate=23 May 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11800_6944120,00.html|title=Ligue 1 round-up|date=21 May 2011|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=22 May 2011}}</ref> The domestic cup and league title were the first two honours in Hazard's career. On the day after Lille won the league, Hazard was named the UNFP Ligue 1 Player of the Year becoming the youngest player ever to win the award.<ref>{{cite web|title=Hazard wins French Player of the Year|url=http://msn.foxsports.com/foxsoccer/soccer/story/eden-hazard-named-french-player-of-the-year-ligue-1-france-lille--052211|publisher=[[Fox Sports (United States)|Fox Sports]]|date=22 May 2011|accessdate=22 May 2011}}</ref> He was also rewarded with a place in the organization's Team of the Year for the second consecutive season.<ref name="hazard_player"/>
====2011–12 season==== [[File:Eden Hazard 2011.jpg|right|upright|thumb|Hazard taking a [[corner kick]] for Lille in 2011]]
Ahead of the [[2011–12 in French football|2011–12 season]], Hazard switched to the number 10 shirt.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.lavoixdessports.com/L-info-Sports-en-continu/Region/2011/08/01/article_football-lille-eden-hazard-portera-certainement-l.shtml|title=Football (Lille): Eden Hazard portera certainement le numéro 10 cette saison|date=1 August 2011|work=La Voix des Sports|accessdate=15 August 2011|language=French}}</ref> In Lille's first competitive match of the season against Marseille in the [[2011 Trophée des Champions]], Hazard scored the team's second goal, which put Lille up 2–0. Marseille would later come back to win the match 5–4.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://new.lfp.fr/tropheeChampions/feuille_match/75129|title=Lille v. Marseille Match Report|date=27 July 2011|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=15 August 2011|language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318070713/http://new.lfp.fr/tropheeChampions/feuille_match/75129 |archivedate=18 March 2012 }}</ref> On 20 August, in the team's third league match of the season, Hazard assisted on Lille's opening goal, scored by [[Benoît Pedretti]], in a 2–1 win over Caen.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74392|title=Caen v. Lille Match Report|date=20 August 2011|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=11 September 2011|language=French}}</ref> A month later on 10 September, he scored two goals in a 3–1 away victory against Saint-Étienne.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74417|title=Saint-Étienne v. Lille Match Report|date=10 September 2011|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=11 September 2011|language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1508539.html|title=Hazard brace sees Lille sink Saint-Etienne|date=10 September 2011|publisher=FIFA|accessdate=11 September 2011}}</ref> Fours days after, Hazard made his [[UEFA Champions League]] debut in a 2–2 group stage draw with Russian club [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2012/matches/round=2000263/match=2007579/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Doumbia at the double as CSKA deny Lille|date=14 September 2011|publisher=UEFA|accessdate=14 September 2011}}</ref>
In Lille's next league match following his Champions League debut, he converted a penalty in a 2–2 draw with Sochaux.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74422|title=Lille v. Sochaux Match Report|date=17 September 2011|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=26 September 2011|language=French}}</ref> Three days after, Hazard scored the equalizing goal in a 1–1 draw against Bordeaux.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74431|title=Bordeaux v.
