Lille Match Report|date=20 September 2011|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=26 September 2011|language=French}}</ref> Against Turkish outfit [[Trabzonspor]] on 27 September, he assisted on Lille's only goal, scored by [[Moussa Sow]], in a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2012/matches/round=2000263/match=2007587/postmatch/report/?autoplay=true |title=Colman saves Trabzonspor from Lille loss|date=27 September 2011|publisher=UEFA|accessdate=27 September 2011 }}</ref> After going over two months without scoring a league goal, on 3 December, Hazard came on as a substitute and scored the match-winning goal in a win over [[AC Ajaccio|Ajaccio]] converting a penalty—described as an "[[Antonín Panenka]]-style chipped penalty".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=1668698.html |title=Match facts: Lille v Trabzonspor|date=4 December 2011|publisher=UEFA|accessdate=5 December 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74519 |title=Ajaccio v. Lille Match Report|date=3 December 2011|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=5 December 2011|language=French}}</ref> Two days later, Hazard was among several players nominated for [[UEFA]]'s [[UEFA Team of the Year|Team of the Year]] for the 2011 calendar year.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/community/news/newsid=1727496.html#voting+open+uefa+users+team+year |title=Voting open for UEFA.com users' Team of the Year|date=5 December 2011|publisher=UEFA|accessdate=5 December 2011 }}</ref>
In Lille's final match before the winter break, Hazard tied his career-high for league goals in a season by scoring the team's third goal in a 4–4 draw with Nice.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74519|title=Lille v. Nice Match Report|date=22 December 2011|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=24 December 2011 | language = French}}</ref> After scoring the goal, Hazard celebrated by paying tribute to Molami Bokoto, a former Lille youth academy player who had died a day prior.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foot01.com/equipe/lille/photo-l-hommage-d-hazard-a-molami-bokoto,82002|title=L'hommage d'Hazard à Molami Bokoto|date=22 December 2011|publisher=Foot01|accessdate=24 December 2011|language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.lavoixdunord.fr/Region/actualite/Secteur_Region/2011/12/22/article_molami-bokoto-ancien-espoir-du-losc-vict.shtml |title=Molami Bokoto, ancien espoir du LOSC, victime d'un différend lié à un trafic? |date=22 December 2011 |work=La Voix du Nord |accessdate=24 December 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120108052308/http://www.lavoixdunord.fr/Region/actualite/Secteur_Region/2011/12/22/article_molami-bokoto-ancien-espoir-du-losc-vict.shtml |archivedate= 8 January 2012 |df= }}</ref> In Lille's first match following the 2011–12 winter break, Hazard scored his ninth goal of the campaign in a 6–0 away win over amateur club Chantilly in the Coupe de France.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/autresCompetitions/coupeFrance/feuille_match/75742|title=Chantilly v. Lille Match Report |date=7 January 2012|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=17 January 2012|language=French}}</ref> In the following month, Lille were defeated 2–0 by league rivals Marseille and eliminated from both national cup competitions.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74564|title=Marseille v. Lille Match Report|date=15 January 2012|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=13 February 2012|language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/1007326/coupe-de-la-ligue-lyon-march-into-semis|title=Lyon march into semis|date=11 January 2012|publisher=ESPN FC|accessdate=13 February 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11813/7498100/Coupe-de-France-round-up|title=Coupe de France round-up: Holders Lille crash out at last-16 stage|date=8 February 2012|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=13 February 2012}}</ref>
On 28 January, Hazard scored the team's opening goal converting a penalty in a 3–0 win over Saint-Étienne.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74572|title=Lille v. Saint-Étienne Match Report|date=28 January 2012|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=13 February 2012|language=French}}</ref> Two weeks later, he converted a free kick goal against [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]]. Lille had been trailing 4–1 prior to the goal and eventually recovered to draw the match at 4–4, however, Bordeaux scored in injury time to secure a 5–4 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/1021202/ligue-1-bordeaux-beat-lille-5-4-in-thriller|title=Bordeaux beat Lille in thriller|date=12 February 2012|publisher=ESPN FC|accessdate=13 February 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74592 |title=Lille v. Bordeaux Match Report|date=12 February 2012|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=13 February 2012|language=French}}</ref> On 3 March, Hazard scored both team goals in a 2–2 draw with Auxerre.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74622|title=Lille v. Auxerre Match Report|date=3 March 2012|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=11 March 2012|language=French}}</ref>
On 18 March, Hazard scored a goal and assisted on two others in a 4–0 win over local rivals Valenciennes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74642|title=Lille v. Valenciennes Match Report|date=18 March 2012|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=1 April 2012|language=French}}</ref> In Lille's next match against [[Evian Thonon Gaillard F.C.|Evian]], Hazard converted a penalty and assisted on a goal by [[Dimitri Payet]] in a 3–0 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74652|title=Evian v. Lille Match Report|date=24 March 2012|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=1 April 2012 | language = French}}</ref> The following week, on 1 April 2012, Hazard converted a first-half penalty and later assisted on another Payet goal to cap a 2–1 victory over Toulouse.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/sports/2012/04/01/lille-tops-toulouse-to-close-in-on-champions-league-spot/|title=Lille tops Toulouse to close in on Champions League spot|date=1 April 2012|publisher=Fox News|accessdate=1 April 2012|language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74662 |title=Lille v. Toulouse Match Report|date=1 April 2012|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=1 April 2012|language=French}}</ref>
On 15 April, Hazard marked his 100 consecutive Ligue 1 appearance, which to date, is the longest current run in the French top flight, by scoring a goal and assisting on another in a 4–1 win over Ajaccio.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74680|title=Lille v. Ajaccio Match Report|date=15 April 2012|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=18 April 2012|language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/newscentre/features/news/newsid=1616563/index.html|title=Streaks, strikes and a new sensation|date=18 April 2012|publisher=FIFA|accessdate=18 April 2012}}</ref> A week later, Hazard scored another goal, this time in a 2–0 win over [[Dijon FCO|Dijon]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74693|title=Dijon v. Lille Match Report | date = 15 April 2012|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=30 April 2012|language=French}}</ref> On 29 April, in a vital league fixture against Paris Saint-Germain, he converted his ninth penalty of the season to draw the match at 1–1 canceling out a goal from [[Javier Pastore]]. Hazard later contributed to Lille's game-winning goal after delivering a ''[[rabona]]''-style cross into the box, which was laid onto the path of striker [[Nolan Roux]] who, subsequently, converted the goal to give Lille a 2–1 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74701 |title=Lille v. Paris Saint-Germain Match Report|date=29 April 2012|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=30 April 2012 | language = French}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2012/soccer/wires/04/29/2080.ap.soc.french.roundup.4th.ld.writethru.0836/index.html |title=Lille beats PSG 2–1 to maintain slim title hopes|date=29 April 2012|work=Sports Illustrated |accessdate=30 April 2012}}</ref>
On 28 April, for the third consecutive season, Hazard was nominated for the UNFP Player of the Year award.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unfp.org/a-la-une/article/la-bande-des-quatre-28042012-6445.html |title=UNFP: Trophées UNFP du football: La bande des quatres...|date=28 April 2012 |publisher=National Union of Professional Footballers |accessdate=14 May 2012 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120430205324/http://www.unfp.org/a-la-une/article/la-bande-des-quatre-28042012-6445.html |archivedate=30 April 2012 |df= }}</ref> Two weeks later, he was awarded the prestigious honour ahead of the likes of [[Olivier Giroud]] and [[Younès Belhanda]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unfp.org/a-la-une/article/le-palmares-complet-14052012-6476.html |title=UNFP: Trophées UNFP du football: Le palmarès complet...|date=14 May 2012 |publisher=National Union of Professional Footballers |accessdate=14 May 2012 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140303055426/http://www.unfp.org/a-la-une/article/le-palmares-complet-14052012-6476.html |archivedate=3 March 2014 }}</ref> After capturing the award, Hazard became the second player in the awards' history after former Paris Saint-Germain striker [[Pauleta]] to achieve the honour in consecutive seasons.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unfp.org/a-la-une/article/eden-fait-si-bien-les-choses-14052012-6475.html |title=UNFP: Trophées UNFP du football: Eden fait (si) bien les choses...|date=14 May 2012 |publisher=National Union of Professional Footballers |accessdate=14 May 2012 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120516182738/http://www.unfp.org/a-la-une/article/eden-fait-si-bien-les-choses-14052012-6475.html |archivedate=16 May 2012 |df= }}</ref> He was also included in the Team of the Year for the third straight season. On 20 May, Hazard appeared in his final match as a Lille player, coincidentally, against Nancy, the club he made his professional debut against. In the match, Hazard recorded his first professional hat-trick in a 4–1 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74741|title=Lille v. Nancy Match Report|date=20 May 2012|publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel|accessdate=20 May 2012|language=French}}</ref>
===Chelsea=== [[File:Eden Hazard 2012.jpg|thumbnail|Hazard preparing to take a corner kick in September 2012]]
On 4 June 2012, Chelsea officially confirmed on its website that the club had agreed terms with Lille for the transfer of Hazard. The midfielder agreed personal terms with the club and passed a medical examination. The transfer fee was reported to be priced at £32 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11813/7795393/Chelsea-confirm-Hazard-deal|title=Chelsea confirm Hazard deal|date=4 June 2012|publisher=Sky Sports|first=Rob|last=Parrish|accessdate=4 June 2012 }}</ref>
Upon signing for Chelsea, Hazard told the club's official website "I'm delighted to finally arrive here. It's a wonderful club and I can't wait to get started".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10268~2797352,00.html |title=Terms agreed for Eden Hazard |date=4 June 2012 |work=[[Chelsea F.C.]] |accessdate=4 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120605201037/http://www.chelseafc.com/page/LatestNews/0%2C%2C10268~2797352%2C00.html |archivedate= 5 June 2012 |df= }}</ref> Hazard was given the number 17, which was previously worn by [[José Bosingwa]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10268~2847897,00.html |title=NEW SQUAD NUMBERS ANNOUNCED |date=12 July 2012 |work=[[Chelsea F.C.]] |accessdate=12 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120714040001/http://www.chelseafc.com/page/LatestNews/0%2C%2C10268~2847897%2C00.html |archivedate=14 July 2012 |df= }}</ref> On 18 July, Hazard made his Chelsea debut in the club's first pre-season friendly against the [[Seattle Sounders FC|Seattle Sounders]] and played the majority of the match, opening his Chelsea scoring account.
====2012–13 season==== [[File:Hazard vs Norwich (crop).jpg|thumb|left|150px|Hazard playing for Chelsea in October 2012]]
On 12 August 2012, Hazard made his competitive debut for Chelsea in the [[2012 FA Community Shield]] against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], which ended in a 3–2 defeat at [[Villa Park]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2879166/title/match-report-chelsea-2-manchester-city-3 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130119091639/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2879166/title/match-report-chelsea-2-manchester-city-3 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=19 January 2013 |title=Match report: Chelsea 2 Manchester City 3 |publisher=[[Chelsea F.C.]] Official website |date=12 August 2012 }}</ref> A week later, he made his league debut against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] at the [[DW Stadium]]. In the contest, Hazard provided the assist for [[Branislav Ivanović]]'s opening goal and, minutes later, won a penalty, which [[Frank Lampard]] converted, earning his side a 2–0 victory.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11668/8004062/Di-Matteo-hails-perfect-start|title=Di Matteo hails perfect start|publisher=Sky Sports|date=19 August 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19231340|title=Di Matteo praises Hazard influence|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 August 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2891383/title/match-report-wigan-athletic-0-chelsea-2 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20121209103813/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2891383/title/match-report-wigan-athletic-0-chelsea-2 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=9 December 2012 |title=Match Report: Wigan Athletic 0 Chelsea 2 |publisher=Official [[Chelsea F.C.]] website |date=19 August 2012 }}</ref> He made his [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] debut in the team's next fixture, against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] on 22 August, he won another penalty from which Lampard converted. Hazard also assisted on goals by [[Gary Cahill]] and Branislav Ivanović as Chelsea won 4–2 at Stamford Bridge.<ref>{{cite web|title=Match report: Chelsea 4 Reading 2|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/matchday-live/match/64132#matchReport|publisher=Chelsea F.C.|date=22 August 2012|accessdate=23 August 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130604052346/http://www.chelseafc.com/matchday-live/match/64132 |archivedate=4 June 2013 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Mandeep|last=Sanghera|title=Chelsea 4–2 Reading |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19279583|publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 August 2012|accessdate=23 August 2012}}</ref> Three days later, Hazard scored his first goal as a Chelsea player in the team's league match against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] after scoring a penalty. Chelsea won the match 2–0.<ref>{{cite web|first=Saj|last=Chowdhury|title=Chelsea 2–0 Newcastle|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19304403|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 August 2012|accessdate=25 August 2012}}</ref>
Hazard made his [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] debut for Chelsea in the team's opening group stage game against [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]].<ref>{{cite web|first=Phil|last=McNulty|title=Chelsea 2–2 Juventus|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19567014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 September 2012 |accessdate=6 October 2012 }}</ref> On 6 October, he scored his second goal for Chelsea in a 4–1 win against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]].<ref>{{cite web|first=Mandeep|last=Sanghera|title=Chelsea 4–1 Norwich|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19776324|publisher=BBC Sport|date=6 October 2012|accessdate=6 October 2012}}</ref> During December, he scored in back-to-back games, in a 5–1 away victory over [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]],<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/20690782 "Leeds United 1–5 Chelsea"] BBC Sport. 19 December 2012. Retrieved 23 December 2012.</ref> and an 8–0 league win against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/20745787 "Chelsea 8–0 Aston Villa"] BBC Sport. 23 December 2012. Retrieved 23 December 2012.</ref>
In January 2013, Hazard scored a goal with his left-foot from 25 yards in Chelsea's 4–0 win over [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]], as Chelsea inflicted the first home defeat of the season on Stoke.<ref>{{cite news|first=Paul|last=Wilson|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/jan/13/chelsea-stoke-city-premier-league|title=Eden Hazard benefits for Chelsea briefing on what to expect at Stoke|newspaper=The Guardian|date=13 January 2013|accessdate=30 October 2013}}</ref> He scored again in the following game, with an impressive strike from the edge of the area in a 2–2 draw at home to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/20955084 "Chelsea 2–2 Southampton"] BBC Sport. 16 January 2013. Retrieved 16 January 2013.</ref>
{{quote box | width=25% | align=right | quote=I've said to him he has got absolutely everything. He's only 22, he has the world at his feet and with the way he's playing and the ability he has on the ball, he is scaring the life out of people.|source= —[[Frank Lampard]] on the 22-year-old Eden Hazard, March 2013.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/198320.html|title= Lampard compare Hazard to Zola |publisher=ESPN |date=19 March 2013|accessdate=19 March 2013 }}</ref>}}
On 23 January 2013, he was sent off in the [[EFL Cup|Football League Cup]] semi-final second leg game against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] for kicking a ball out from underneath a [[Ball boy#Association football|ball boy]] who was lying on it in order to waste time. Chelsea went on to lose the tie 2–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.sky.com/story/1042073/eden-hazard-kicks-ball-boy-during-match|title=Eden Hazard 'Kicks Ball Boy' During Match|publisher=Sky Sports|date=23 January 2013|accessdate=23 January 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/jan/23/swansea-ballboy-eden-hazard-sent-off|title=Swansea ballboy incident leads to red card for Eden Hazard|newspaper=The Guardian|date=23 January 2013|accessdate=23 January 2013}}</ref> Thereafter, he told Chelsea TV that he "apologised and the boy apologised" to each other.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3051397 |title=HAZARD APOLOGISES |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=23 January 2013 |accessdate=23 January 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130125134754/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3051397 |archivedate=25 January 2013 }}</ref> It was later revealed that the 17 year old ball boy had planned before the game to deliberately waste time.<ref name=Hazard2>{{cite news|title=Swansea City ballboy Charlie Morgan boasted about time wasting before Capital One semi-final with Chelsea|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/league-cup/9823144/Swansea-City-ballboy-Charlie-Morgan-boasted-about-time-wasting-before-Capital-One-semi-final-with-Chelsea.html|accessdate=26 October 2018|work=Telegraph|date=24 January 2013}}</ref> On 9 February, he scored on his return from suspension in a 4–1 win at home against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/21311509 "Chelsea 4–1 Wigan"] BBC Sport. 9 February 2013. Retrieved 13 February 2013.</ref>
On 21 February 2013, Hazard came on as a substitute against [[Sparta Prague]] and scored an individual goal in stoppage time, to send Chelsea through to the last 16 on a 2–1 aggregate score.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/21455163"Chelsea 1–1 Sparta Prague''] BBC Sport. 21 February 2013. Retrieved 22 February 2013.</ref><ref>[http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/281025/report "Chelsea 1–1 Prague"] BBC Sport. 21 February 2013. Retrieved 21 February 2013.</ref> Again Hazard came off the bench to make an impact for Chelsea, scoring a goal and providing an assist to [[Ramires]], as the Blues came back from 2–0 down to salvage a 2–2 draw against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in the quarter-finals of the [[2012–13 FA Cup|FA Cup]] on 10 March, setting up a replay at Stamford Bridge.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/1370152/richard-jolly-rafas-response-brings-blues-an-fa-cup-replay|title=Rafa response brings Blues a replay|publisher=ESPN FC|first=Richard|last=Jolly|date=10 March 2013}}</ref> On 17 March 2013, Hazard put in a Man of the Match performance at Stamford Bridge in a 2–0 victory over [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], assisting on Frank Lampard's 200th Chelsea goal, then scoring a solo goal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/chelsea-vs-west-ham/report/284106|title=Chelsea 2–0 West Ham United|publisher=Sky Sports|date=17 March 2013}}</ref> On 11 May 2013, at Villa Park, Hazard was the provider of Lampard's brace against Aston Villa, which enabled Lampard to break [[Bobby Tambling]]'s all-time goal scoring record for Chelsea. However an injury picked up in the same game ruled him out of the [[2013 UEFA Europa League Final]].<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=1951902.html|title=Hazard ruled out of UEFA Europa League final|date=14 May 2013|work=UEFA.com|accessdate=21 May 2018 }}</ref> Hazard ended his debut campaign at Chelsea with 13 goals in all competitions.
====2013–14 season==== [[File:Eden Hazard'13-14.JPG|thumb|left|150px|Hazard playing against [[Galatasaray S.K. (football)|Galatasaray]] in a [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] match in February 2014]]
One of Chelsea's first games of the season was against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] in the [[2013 UEFA Super Cup]], where Hazard played a vital role in the buildup to the first goal and scored the second, but went on to an eventual 5–4 defeat in the penalty shoot-out.<ref>{{cite web|last=Smith|first=Ben|title=Bayern Munich 2–2 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23877992|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=20 October 2013}}</ref> In October 2013, Hazard, as a substitute, scored the game-clinching goal in a 3–1 [[Premier League]] clash against [[Norwich City]] at [[Carrow Road]],<ref>{{cite web|last=Rose|first=Gary|title=Norwich City 1–3 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24350208|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=20 October 2013}}</ref> before scoring twice and assisting [[Samuel Eto'o]]'s first Chelsea goal in a comprehensive defeat of [[Cardiff City]] in the same competition.<ref>{{cite news|last=Findon|first=Ben|title=Chelsea 4 Cardiff City 1: match report|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/10387081/Chelsea-4-Cardiff-City-1-match-report.html|work=The Daily Telegraph|accessdate=20 October 2013}}</ref> Hazard netted his fifth goal of the season against [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke]] in a crucial 0–3 [[2013-14 UEFA Champions League group stage|Champions League Group Stage]] win.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/300931/report |title=UEFA Champions League: Schalke 0 Chelsea 3 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=22 October 2013 |accessdate=30 October 2013}}</ref> In October, Hazard was part of the 23-man shortlist of players nominated for the prestigious [[FIFA Ballon d'Or]], awarded to the player who is voted the men's world footballer of the year.<ref>{{cite news|title=Gareth Bale in running for world player of the year award|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24723510|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=30 October 2013}}</ref>
On 9 November 2013, Hazard created Chelsea's first goal against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]], which was scored by [[Samuel Eto'o]]. Later in the match Chelsea went 2–1 down, but Hazard scored a last minute penalty to clinch a point for his team.<ref>{{cite web|last=Sheringham|first=Sam|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24783075|title=Chelsea 2–2 West Bromwich Albion|publisher=BBC Sport|date=9 November 2013|accessdate=8 February 2014}}</ref> On 4 December 2013, Hazard scored a brace in a 4–3 away victory over [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Match Report: Sunderland 3 Chelsea 4 |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3562644/title/match-report-sunderland-3-chelsea-4 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=4 December 2013 |accessdate=5 December 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131206062046/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3562644/title/match-report-sunderland-3-chelsea-4 |archivedate=6 December 2013 }}</ref> with coach [[José Mourinho]] claiming that Hazard delivered his best performance of the season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/9/england/2013/12/04/4455470/mourinho-hazard-delivered-his-best-against-sunderland |title=Mourinho: Hazard delivered his best against Sunderland |publisher=Goal.com |date=4 December 2013 |accessdate=8 February 2014}}</ref> Sunderland manager [[Gus Poyet]] also praised Hazard for his individual impact on the game. Poyet said: "Eden Hazard was outstanding. He was unplayable, as a manager I haven't come up against anyone like that."<ref>{{cite web|last=Hanson|first=Peter|title=Poyet: Chelsea will win the Premier League|url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/poyet-chelsea-win-premier-league-001500001--sow.html|publisher=Yahoo! Sport|accessdate=23 December 2013}}</ref>
{{quote box | width=20% | align=right| quote=I keep saying he has to improve. He needs to have his feet on the ground. Ronaldo and Messi are Ronaldo and Messi. Eden Hazard is probably the best young player in the world with legs to go there, but give him time|source= —[[José Mourinho]] on the 23-year-old Eden Hazard, February 2014.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/espn/sport/story/279781.html |title= Eden Hazard is the world's best, says Jose Mourinho |publisher=ESPN |date= 4 February 2014 |accessdate= 5 February 2014}}</ref>}}
On 26 December 2013, Hazard scored the only goal in Chelsea's 1–0 victory over [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Match report: Chelsea 1 Swansea City 0 |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/matchday-live/match/70781#matchReport |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=26 December 2013 |accessdate=31 December 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131230002953/http://www.chelseafc.com/matchday-live/match/70781 |archivedate=30 December 2013 }}</ref> In Chelsea's next league match, Hazard scored a goal from 25 yards during Chelsea's 2–1 victory over [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Match report: Chelsea 2 Liverpool 1 |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/matchday-live/match/70812#matchReport |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=29 December 2013 |accessdate=31 December 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131228075559/http://www.chelseafc.com/matchday-live/match/70812 |archivedate=28 December 2013 }}</ref> The following week, Hazard scored the opening goal in Chelsea's 2–0 victory away to [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3616098/title/match-report-hull-city-0-chelsea-2 |title=Match report: Hull City 0 Chelsea 2 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=11 January 2014 |accessdate=11 January 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140111174132/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3616098/title/match-report-hull-city-0-chelsea-2 |archivedate=11 January 2014 }}</ref> After Hazard maintained his excellent form in Chelsea's 1–0 victory over Manchester City at the Etihad Stadium on 3 February 2014, Mourinho declared Hazard as the best young footballer in the world.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/espn/sport/story/279781.html |title=Jose Mourinho claims Eden Hazard is the world's best youngster |publisher=ESPN.co.uk |date=4 February 2014 |accessdate=8 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/9/england/2014/02/04/4593747/mourinho-hazard-is-the-best-young-player-in-the-world |title=Mourinho: Hazard is the best young player in the world |publisher=Goal.com |date=4 February 2014 |accessdate=8 February 2014}}</ref> Hazard scored his first [[List of Premier League hat-tricks|Premier League hat-trick]] against Newcastle United at Stamford Bridge on 8 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/25994877|title=Chelsea 3–0 Newcastle United|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
On 27 April 2014, Hazard won the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] award and finished as the runner-up to [[Luis Suárez]] for the [[PFA Player of the Year]] award for his fine attacking performances under José Mourinho.<ref>{{cite news|last=Riach|first=James|title=Luis Suárez of Liverpool wins PFA player of the year award|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/apr/28/luis-suarez-liverpool-pfa-player-of-year-award|newspaper=The Guardian|date=28 April 2014}}</ref> After Chelsea's Champions League exit against [[Atlético Madrid]], Hazard claimed that Chelsea are only set up to counter-attack.<ref name="sacrifice">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/27258633|title=Jose Mourinho: Eden Hazard does not sacrifice himself for Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 May 2014}}</ref> Mourinho responded by saying that Hazard "is not so mentally ready" to help his defence, blaming him for the first goal scored by the opponents.<ref name="sacrifice"/> In May 2014, Hazard was voted Chelsea's Player of the Year in his second season at Stamford Bridge.<ref>{{cite news|last=Strange|first=Joe|date=12 May 2014|title=Eden Hazard wins Chelsea Player of the Year award after fine season for Jose Mourinho's side|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2626666/Eden-Hazard-wins-Chelsea-Player-Year-award-fine-season-Jose-Mourinhos-side.html|newspaper=Daily Mail|accessdate=16 May 2014}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== {{quote box | width=20% | align=right| quote=On his day, nobody can stop him. He has such great quality on the ball. He can create something from nothing and this is the sign of a special player.|source= —[[Thierry Henry]] on the 24-year-old Eden Hazard, March 2015.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/432769/Arsenal-legend-Thierry-Henry-Eden-Hazard-is-SPECIAL-and-he-should-be-player-of-year.html |title= Arsenal legend Thierry Henry: Eden Hazard is SPECIAL... and he should be player of year |work=[[Daily Star (British newspaper)|Daily Star]] |date= 25 March 2015 |accessdate= 26 March 2015}}</ref>}}
Upon [[Juan Mata]]'s departure from the club in January 2014, Hazard was handed the number 10 shirt for Chelsea ahead of the 2014–15 season.<ref>{{cite web|title=Hazard to wear Number 10 |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3879394/title/hazard-to-wear-number-10 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=3 June 2014 |accessdate=4 June 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140606041015/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3879394/title/hazard-to-wear-number-10 |archivedate=6 June 2014 }}</ref> On 5 October, he won a penalty against Arsenal after being fouled by [[Laurent Koscielny]], and then converted it himself past [[Wojciech Szczęsny]] to open a 2–0 victory which made Chelsea the last unbeaten team in the league.<ref>{{cite web|last=McNulty|first=Phil|title=Chelsea 2–0 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/29398780|accessdate=5 October 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=5 October 2014}}</ref> In doing so, he maintained his 100% penalty record out of 16 penalties. He also became the only player in Europe who has taken more than 15 penalties and scored all of them.<ref>{{cite web|title=Eden Hazard the new penalty taker king; Julio Cesar the best stopper|url=http://www.espnfc.com/blog/espn-fc-united-blog/68/post/2075094/who-is-the-best-penalty-taker-and-saver-in-europe|accessdate=14 October 2014|publisher=ESPN FC|date=8 October 2014}}</ref> [[File:Chelsea 1 lLiverpool 0 (2-1 agg) Capital One Cup semi final 2nd leg On our way to Wembley! (16203132608) (cropped).jpg|left|thumb|224x224px|Hazard playing against Liverpool in the [[2014–15 Football League Cup|League Cup]] [[2014–15 Football League Cup#Semi-finals|semi-finals]], January 2015.]] His first goals of the [[2014-15 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] campaign came on 21 October, netting from the penalty-spot and from open play in a 6–0 home win over [[NK Maribor|Maribor]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/29362738|title=Chelsea 6–0 NK Maribor|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Gary|last=Rose|date=21 October 2014|accessdate=21 October 2014}}</ref> On 5 November, away to the Slovene team, he earned an 85th-minute penalty but had it saved by [[Jasmin Handanović]] in a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite web|last=Sever|first=Grega|title=Handanovič helps Maribor to Chelsea draw|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000548/match=2014360/postmatch/report/index.html|accessdate=5 November 2014|publisher=[[UEFA]]|date=5 November 2014}}</ref> Hazard opened the scoring in Chelsea's 2–0 win over Hull on 13 December, with the goal being only the second headed one of his entire career.<ref>{{cite web|title=Chelsea 2–0 Hull|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30357622|accessdate=13 December 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 December 2014}}</ref> The header came as a surprised for many, even Mourinho, who stated: "That he scored in the air, I was surprised. He jumps a lot but normally he closes his eyes. So I was surprised, but very good goal."<ref>{{cite news|title=Chelsea vs Hull match report: Diego Costa scores first in five after Tom Huddlestone was sent off in ill-tempered affair at Stamford Bridge|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/chelsea-vs-hull-match-report-diego-costa-scores-first-in-five-after-tom-huddlestone-was-sent-off-in-illtempered-affair-at-stamford-bridge-9923085.html|work=The Independent|first=Miguel|last=Delaney|date=13 December 2014}}</ref>
On 12 February 2015, Hazard signed a new five-and-a-half-year contract with Chelsea.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/02/hazard-signs-new-deal.html|title=Hazard signs new deal|date=12 February 2015|accessdate=12 February 2015|publisher=Chelsea F.C.}}</ref> After signing, Hazard said: "I've signed a new contract and I'm very happy because I'm playing for one of the best clubs in the world."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/02/hazard--seeking-trophies.html |title=Hazard: Seeking trophies|date=12 February 2015|accessdate=12 February 2015|publisher=Chelsea F.C.}}</ref> He played the full 90 minutes in the club's victory in the [[2015 Football League Cup Final|League Cup Final]] at [[Wembley Stadium]] on 1 March, a 2–0 win over Tottenham.<ref>{{cite web|last=McNulty|first=Phil|title=Chelsea 2–0 Tottenham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31572594|accessdate=3 May 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 March 2015}}</ref>
On 18 April, Hazard scored the only goal in a home win over [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], after he latched on to Oscar's backheel pass to score past [[David de Gea]]. He was voted Man of the Match thereafter for his performance.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32262278|last=McNulty|first=Phil|title=Chelsea 1–0 Manchester United|date=18 April 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=20 April 2015}}</ref> As a result of Hazard's impressive performances throughout the 2014–15 campaign, his manager declared him "one of the top three players in the world".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/chelsea/story/2408729/eden-hazard-among-worlds-top-three-players-and-deserves-premier-league-title-says-jose-mourinho|title=Hazard among world's top three players, deserves prem title|date=19 April 2015|publisher=ESPN|accessdate=19 April 2015}}</ref> On 26 April, Hazard was recognised as the best player of the season among his peers, winning the [[PFA Player of the Year]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Chelsea's Eden Hazard named PFA Player of the Year|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/32472834|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=26 April 2015}}</ref> A week later, he scored the only goal as Chelsea defeated Crystal Palace to win their first Premier League title since 2010. He won a penalty after being fouled by [[James McArthur]], and took it himself, heading in the rebound after it was saved by [[Julian Speroni]].<ref>{{cite web|last=McNulty|first=Phil|title=Chelsea 1–0 Crystal Palace|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32471261|accessdate=3 May 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 May 2015}}</ref>
On 26 May 2015, Hazard was voted as Chelsea's [[List of Chelsea F.C. players|Player of the Year]] for the second year in a row. There are only four other players that have done it in the past; [[Juan Mata]], [[Frank Lampard]], [[Ray Wilkins]], and [[John Hollins]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Hazard at the double|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/05/oscar-wins-goal-of-the-season.html|accessdate=31 May 2015|work=Chelsea Official Site|date=26 May 2015}}</ref>
====2015–16 season==== [[File:Eden Hazard - DK-Chel15 (6).jpg|thumb|left|150px|Hazard playing against [[FC Dynamo Kyiv|Dynamo Kyiv]] in the [[UEFA Champions League]], October 2015]]
Hazard endured a difficult start to the [[2015–16 Chelsea F.C. season|2015–16 season]], missing a penalty in the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League group stage#Group G|Champions League group stage]] against [[Maccabi Tel Aviv F.C.|Maccabi Tel Aviv]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34203636|first=Andy|last=Cryer|title=Chelsea 4–0 Maccabi Tel Aviv|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=16 September 2015}}</ref> On 27 October, in the fourth round of the League Cup away to Stoke, Hazard was the only player to miss in Chelsea's penalty shootout elimination, his attempt being saved by [[Jack Butland]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Lawton|first=Matt|title=Stoke City 1–1 Chelsea (AET, 5–4 on pens): Eden Hazard misses crucial final penalty in shootout as Jose Mourinho's side crash out of Capital One Cup to heap more misery on Portuguese boss|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3292333/Stoke-City-1-1-Chelsea-AET-5-4-pens-Eden-Hazard-misses-crucial-penalty-Jose-Mourinho-s-knocked-Capital-One-Cup.html|accessdate=28 October 2015|work=Daily Mail|date=27 October 2015}}</ref> Hazard endured a 2,358-minute scoreless run across 30 matches until 31 January 2016, when he scored from the penalty spot, his 50th goal for Chelsea in all competitions, in a 5–1 win over [[Milton Keynes Dons]] in the fourth round of the [[FA Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Fifield|first=Dominic|title=Oscar scores hat-trick in Chelsea rout of sorry MK Dons|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jan/31/mk-dons-chelsea-fa-cup-match-report|accessdate=31 January 2016|work=The Guardian|date=31 January 2016}}</ref>
In February 2016, Hazard was scrutinised when he said it would "be difficult to say no" to a move to [[Paris Saint-Germain]].<ref name="riach">{{cite news|last=Riach|first=James|title=Eden Hazard happy at Chelsea, insists Guus Hiddink after win at Bournemouth|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/apr/24/eden-hazard-chelsea-guus-hiddink-bournemouth|accessdate=3 May 2016|work=The Guardian|date=24 April 2016}}</ref> He remained scoreless in the league until 23 April, when he recorded two goals in a 4–1 victory at [[AFC Bournemouth|Bournemouth]]; after the result, interim manager [[Guus Hiddink]] insisted that Hazard would remain at Chelsea by next season.<ref name="riach"/> For the second consecutive campaign, Hazard scored the goal that decided the Premier League; he came on as a substitute at home to Tottenham on 2 May, and scored an equaliser as Chelsea came from 2–0 down at half-time to draw. The result meant [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] won the title at Tottenham's expense.<ref>{{cite web|last=Yew|first=Oliver|title=Chelsea 2–2 Tottenham: Eden Hazard strike ends Spurs' title hopes|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11661/10267226/chelsea-x-x-tottenham|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=3 May 2016|date=3 May 2016}}</ref> On 11 May 2016, Hazard scored his fourth and final league goal of the season against Liverpool, although Chelsea were unable to hold on to the lead, with fellow countryman [[Christian Benteke]] scoring in extra time as the match finished in a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite web|title=Liverpool 1 – 1 Chelsea|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/05/11/england/premier-league/liverpool-fc/chelsea-football-club/2043464/|accessdate=2 July 2016|date=11 May 2016|publisher=Soccerway}}</ref>
====2016–17 season==== [[File:EdenHazardDecember 2016.jpg|thumb|upright|Hazard in action against [[West Bromwich Albion]] during a Premier League game in December 2016]]
On 15 August 2016, in Chelsea's opening Premier League match of the season, Hazard scored a penalty in a 2–1 win over [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/report?gameId=451007 |title=Diego Costa's late winner helps Chelsea defeat West Ham in opener |date=15 August 2016 |publisher=ESPN}}</ref> Hazard recorded a total of 81 touches throughout the game, and his performance earned him the Man of the Match.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37006707|title=Chelsea 2–1 West Ham: Diego Costa's late strike gave Antonio Conte a dramatic winning start|date=15 August 2016|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 27 August, Hazard contributed another Man of the Match display in the 3–0 victory over [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], scoring the opener in the ninth minute.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37139886|title=Chelsea 3–0 Burnley|date=27 August 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Gary|last=Rose}}</ref> After voting ended on 5 September, Hazard received the most votes from the public poll, 41%, for the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] award<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/84046|title=Vote for EA SPORTS Player of the Month |date=2 September 2016 |publisher=Premier League}}</ref> although [[Raheem Sterling]] was later named the Player of the Month by a Premier League panel.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/97642|title=Sterling voted EA SPORTS Player of the Month|date=9 September 2016 |publisher=Premier League}}</ref>
On 15 October 2016, Hazard, along with [[Diego Costa]] dedicated their goals to [[Willian (footballer)|Willian]], whose mother had died earlier that week, in the 3–0 victory over the champions, Leicester City.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/10/match-report.html |title=Match report: Chelsea 3 Leicester City 0 |date=15 October 2016 |publisher=Chelsea FC}}</ref> On 23 October, he scored his fourth goal of the season in a 4–0 win over former Chelsea manager, José Mourinho's [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], equalling the number of league goals he managed in the previous season.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/10/23/chelsea-vs-man-united-live-score-and-goal-updates-as-jose-mourin/|title=Chelsea 4 Man Utd 0: Jose Mourinho suffers nightmare return as Eden Hazard-inspired hosts run riot|date=23 October 2016|work=The Daily Telegraph|first1=Jason|last1=Burt|first2=Charlie|last2=Eccleshare}}</ref> Hazard continued his excellent form, scoring the first goal and assisting the second in Chelsea's 2–0 win over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 30 October. This marked the first time that he had scored in three consecutive Premier League games.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37742966|title=Southampton 0–2 Chelsea|date=30 October 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Mandeep|last=Sanghera}}</ref> His run of form continued into the next match as he scored two goals and assisted another in Chelsea's 5–0 win against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at Stamford Bridge on 5 November. Hazard's performance against Everton earned him another Man of the Match award, his third in a row in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/nov/05/chelsea-everton-premier-league-match-report|title=Chelsea top the Premier League as Eden Hazard inspires Everton thrashing|work=The Guardian|date=5 November 2016|accessdate=5 November 2016}}</ref> On 18 November 2016, Hazard was named the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] for October.<ref name="Premier League">{{cite web|title=Hazard named Barclays Player of the Month|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/139292|publisher=Premier League|accessdate=18 November 2016}}</ref>
On 26 December 2016, Hazard led the Blues to their twelfth consecutive league victory, a new club record, in the 3–0 victory over [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]]. He also converted a penalty for his 50th Premier League goal, making him the sixth Chelsea player to achieve this feat.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/matches/2016-17/12/chelsea-bournemouth-pl.html |title=Chelsea v Bournemouth Match Report |date=26 December 2016 |publisher=Chelsea F.C.}}</ref> On 20 April 2017, Hazard was named in the [[PFA Team of the Year]] for the fourth time in his five seasons at Chelsea.<ref name="PFA1617">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39648483 |title=PFA teams of the year: Chelsea and Tottenham dominate Premier League XI |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 April 2017 |accessdate=6 May 2018}}</ref> Two days later, he scored after coming on as a substitute in Chelsea's 4–2 [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup]] semi-final victory over rivals [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39604653|title=Chelsea 4–2 Tottenham|date=22 April 2017|work=BBC}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== [[File:Hazard v Newcastle.jpg|thumb|right|Hazard (number 10) playing against [[Newcastle United]] in the [[FA Cup]], January 2018]] At the beginning of the summer, Hazard suffered an ankle injury in training during international duty.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/06/05/eden-hazard-could-miss-start-season-broken-ankle-fear-chelsea/|title=Chelsea forward Eden Hazard expected to miss start of season with broken ankle, which could end Real Madrid interest|last=Law|first=Matt|date=2017-06-05|work=The Telegraph|access-date=2018-09-16|language=en-GB|issn=0307-1235}}</ref> The injury ruled him out for 6 to 8 weeks; missing the entire preseason and the Premier League opener.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2699591-eden-hazards-ankle-injury-diagnosed-as-fracture-could-miss-6-8-weeks |title=Eden Hazard's Ankle Injury Diagnosed as Fracture, Could Miss 6–8 Weeks |date=6 June 2017 |publisher=BleacherReport}}</ref> On 25 August 2017, Hazard returned to action, playing 75 minutes for the [[Chelsea F.C. Under-23s and Academy|Chelsea U23]] side.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/08/pl2-report--chelsea-v-everton.html |title=PL2 report: Chelsea 0 Everton 3 |date=25 August 2017 |publisher=Chelsea F.C.}}</ref> On 28 October 2017, Hazard scored his first league goal of the season in a 1–0 win against Bournemouth in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/oct/28/bournemouth-chelsea-premier-league-match-report |title=Eden Hazard's solitary strike secures victory for Chelsea over Bournemouth |date=28 October 2017 |publisher=theguardian.com}}</ref> On 3 January 2018, Hazard scored in a 2–2 draw with [[Arsenal F.C.–Chelsea F.C. rivalry|rivals]] Arsenal.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42489693|title=Arsenal 2-2 Chelsea|date=2018|work=BBC Sport|access-date=2018-09-16|language=en-GB}}</ref> Two goals against [[Brighton & Hove Albion]] on 20 January made it 100 league goals in his career. Hazard's double helped Chelsea to a 4–0 win at [[Falmer Stadium]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/brighton-0-4-chelsea-eden-11883306|title=Brighton 0–4 Chelsea: Eden Hazard at the double as Blues ease to victory – 5 talking points|publisher=Daily Mirror|date=20 January 2018}}</ref> On 12 February, Hazard scored a double in a 3–0 win over West Bromwich Albion.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42940778|title=Chelsea 3-0 West Bromwich Albion|date=2018-02-12|work=BBC Sport|access-date=2018-09-16|language=en-GB}}</ref>
In the [[2018 FA Cup Final]] on 19 May, Hazard entered Manchester United's penalty area, where he was fouled by defender [[Phil Jones (footballer, born 1992)|Phil Jones]] with a sliding tackle. Hazard took the penalty kick, sending it low to the right past United goalkeeper [[David de Gea]] for the only goal of the game.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Chelsea 1–0 Manchester United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44091559|accessdate=19 May 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 May 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== Hazard scored on his first start of the [[2018–19 Chelsea F.C. season|2018–19 season]], converting a penalty in a 2–1 win against [[Newcastle United]] on 26 August.<ref>{{cite news|title=REPORT: NEWCASTLE UNITED 1 CHELSEA 2|url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2018/8/26/report--newcastle-united-v-chelsea|accessdate=27 August 2018|publisher=Chelsea Football Club|date=27 August 2018}}</ref> On 15 September, Hazard scored a hat-trick in a 4–1 win over [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45456659|title=Chelsea 4-1 Cardiff: Eden Hazard hat-trick helps Chelsea go top|date=2018-09-15|work=BBC Sport|access-date=2018-09-16|language=en-GB}}</ref> He came off the bench to give Chelsea a 2–1 come-from-behind win over [[Liverpool FC|Liverpool]] in the third round of the [[EFL Cup]] at Anfield on 26 September. It was his sixth goal in seven appearances to start the season.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.besoccer.com/new/eden-hazard-inspires-chelsea-cup-comeback-at-anfield-509597|title=Eden Hazard inspires Chelsea cup comeback at Anfield|date=2018-09-26|work=BeSoccer|access-date=2018-09-27|language=en-GB}}</ref> In the next fixture, against Liverpool in the [[Premier League]], he made it seven goals in eight games, opening the scoring in a 1–1 draw at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://tucson.com/sports/with-leveler-at-chelsea-sturridge-shows-worth-to-liverpool/article_6352a5e9-7076-5cd4-9565-3434e104e4b8.html|title=With leveler at Chelsea, Sturridge shows worth to Liverpool|date=2018-09-29|work=Arizona Daily Star|access-date=2018-09-30|language=en-GB}}</ref> On 16 December, Hazard scored and assisted a goal for [[Pedro (footballer, born 1987)|Pedro]] as Chelsea won 2–1 away to Brighton & Hove Albion in the league, before coming off the bench to send Chelsea through to the EFL Cup semi-final at the expense of Bournemouth three days later.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.espn.com.au/soccer/report?gameId=513674|title=Eden Hazard ends goal drought as Chelsea win at Brighton|date=2018-12-17|work=ESPN|access-date=2018-12-20|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://theworldgame.sbs.com.au/late-hazard-strike-sees-chelsea-scrape-into-semi-finals|title=Late Hazard strike sees Chelsea scrape into semi-finals|date=2018-12-20|work=SBS|access-date=2018-12-20|language=en-GB}}</ref> He scored both goals in a 2–1 Boxing Day win against [[Watford FC|Watford]] at [[Vicarage Road]], the first of which was his 100th Blues and 150th career goal.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.goal.com/en-au/news/hazard-scores-his-100th-goal-for-chelsea/18ri998f98soy1ub4kwcj4u4hu|title=Hazard scores 100th goal for Chelsea|date=2018-12-27|work=Goal.com|access-date=2018-12-28|language=en-GB}}</ref>
==International career== ===Youth=== Hazard played for various Belgian national youth teams, such as the [[Belgium national under-17 football team|under-17]] and [[Belgium national under-19 football team|under-19]] teams. With the under-17 team, he was a regular in the team making 17 appearances and scoring two goals. He played with the team in the [[Toto Cup]], a yearly international youth tournament held in Austria and, also, played in the [[2007 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship]], which Belgium hosted. In the tournament, Hazard scored his only goal in the team's opening match against the [[Netherlands national under-17 football team|Netherlands]] converting a penalty in a 2–2 draw.<ref>{{cite web|title=High drama for Low Countries |url=http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under17/history/season=2007/round=2248/match=300748/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=2 May 2007 |accessdate=12 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131209182240/http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under17/history/season%3D2007/round%3D2248/match%3D300748/index.html |archivedate= 9 December 2013 }}</ref> The match was a homecoming for Hazard, as it was played in Tubize, where he spent part of his youth career.<ref>{{cite web|title=Happy homecoming for Hazard by Berend Scholten|url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/news/newsid=534653.html|publisher=UEFA|date=3 May 2007|accessdate=12 April 2010}}</ref> Throughout the tournament, Hazard impressed media and coaches, which led to many in Belgium comparing him to Belgian football legend [[Enzo Scifo]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Golden boys boost Red Devils|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/newsid=1042027.html|publisher=FIFA|date=27 March 2009|accessdate=12 April 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Under 17 World Cup – Day 6 |url=http://www.soccermogul.com/under_17_world_cup_day_6.aspx |publisher=Soccer Mogul |date=23 August 2007 |accessdate=12 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081018231507/http://www.soccermogul.com/under_17_world_cup_day_6.aspx |archivedate=18 October 2008 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=El belga Eden Hazard, de 18 años, sigue mejorando con el Lille en la Ligue 1 francesa |url=http://www.futbolexclusivo.com/el-jugador-de-belga-eden-hazard-de-18-anos-sigue-mejorando-con-el-lille-en-la-ligue-1-de-francia/ |publisher=Futbol Exclusivo |date=21 December 2009 |accessdate=12 April 2010 |language=Spanish |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100527221652/http://www.futbolexclusivo.com/el-jugador-de-belga-eden-hazard-de-18-anos-sigue-mejorando-con-el-lille-en-la-ligue-1-de-francia/ |archivedate=27 May 2010 }}</ref>
Belgium suffered elimination in the semi-finals of the competition, losing to [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spain]] 7–6 on penalties. Belgium were minutes away from a victory, courtesy of an own goal from David Rochela, which Hazard was particularly instrumental in, however [[F.C. Barcelona|Barcelona]] striker [[Bojan Krkić]] equalized for his nation to send the match into extra time.<ref>{{cite news|title=Home heartache as Spain prevail |url=http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under17/history/season=2007/round=15069/match=300765/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=10 May 2007 |accessdate=12 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131209174329/http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under17/history/season%3D2007/round%3D15069/match%3D300765/index.html |archivedate= 9 December 2013 }}</ref> Due to finishing in third place at the tournament, Belgium qualified for the [[2007 FIFA U-17 World Cup]], held in South Korea. Hazard was selected to participate and played in all three group stage matches, where Belgium were eliminated.
After playing at the FIFA U-17 World Cup in August and September 2007, Hazard began earning call-ups to the under-19 team the following month in October. His first appearance came in a [[2008 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship qualification]] match against [[Romania national football team|Romania]] coming on as a substitute in a 4–0 victory.<ref>{{cite news|title=Belgium v. Romania Match Report |url=http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season=2008/round=15034/match=300607/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=12 October 2007 |accessdate=12 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131209184539/http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season%3D2008/round%3D15034/match%3D300607/index.html |archivedate= 9 December 2013 |df= }}</ref> He subsequently played in the next two group stage matches against [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]] and [[England national under-19 football team|England]]. Belgium lost both matches.<ref>{{cite news|title=Belgium v. Iceland Match Report |url=http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season=2008/round=15034/match=300633/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=14 October 2007 |accessdate=12 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131209175427/http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season%3D2008/round%3D15034/match%3D300633/index.html |archivedate= 9 December 2013 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=England v. Belgium Match Report |url=http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season=2008/round=15034/match=300659/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=17 October 2007 |accessdate=12 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131209180155/http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season%3D2008/round%3D15034/match%3D300659/index.html |archivedate= 9 December 2013 |df= }}</ref> The negative results eliminated the country from the tournament. Due to being an underage player the previous year, Hazard was eligible for the under-19 team for the 2008–09 season. Due to his growing participation with Lille's first team, Hazard was only allowed to play in [[2009 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship qualification]] matches by his club and, as a result, missed the 2008 edition of the [[Milk Cup]], which was held during Lille's preseason.
On 7 October 2008, Hazard scored his first under-19 goal in the team's 5–0 victory over [[Estonia national under-19 football team|Estonia]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Estonia v. Belgium Match Report |url=http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season=2009/round=15216/match=302166/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=7 October 2008 |accessdate=12 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131209183338/http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season%3D2009/round%3D15216/match%3D302166/index.html |archivedate= 9 December 2013 |df= }}</ref> Three days later, he scored a double in a 2–2 draw with [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Belgium v. Estonia Match Report |url=http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season=2009/round=15216/match=302191/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=10 October 2008 |accessdate=12 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131209182212/http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season%3D2009/round%3D15216/match%3D302191/index.html |archivedate= 9 December 2013 |df= }}</ref> In the [[2009 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship elite qualification|Elite Round]], Hazard led the team in goals scoring three. In the opening match against the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]], he scored the lone goal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hazard hits Ireland where it hurts |url=http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season=2009/round=15217/match=304575/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=5 June 2009 |accessdate=12 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131209184354/http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season%3D2009/round%3D15217/match%3D304575/index.html |archivedate= 9 December 2013 |df= }}</ref> In the next match, Hazard was influential in the team's 5–0 thrashing of [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]] scoring a goal and assisting on two others.<ref>{{cite news|title=Belgium set up section decider |url=http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season=2009/round=15217/match=304589/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=7 June 2009 |accessdate=12 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131209174841/http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season%3D2009/round%3D15217/match%3D304589/index.html |archivedate= 9 December 2013 |df= }}</ref> In the team's final match, they faced [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]]. Belgium needed an outright victory to progress to the [[2009 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship]], but were eliminated from qualifying after drawing 1–1 with the Swiss, despite Hazard opening the scoring for Belgium in the 21st minute.<ref>{{cite news|title=Swiss squeeze through to take final U19 slot |url=http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season=2009/round=15217/match=304603/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=10 June 2009 |accessdate=12 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131209184913/http://en.archive.uefa.com/competitions/under19/history/season%3D2009/round%3D15217/match%3D304603/index.html |archivedate= 9 December 2013 |df= }}</ref>
===Early senior=== On 18 November 2008, Hazard was called up to the [[Belgium national football team|Belgium senior team]], for the first time, by manager [[René Vandereycken]] for the team's match against [[Luxembourg national football team|Luxembourg]]. Prior to making his national team debut with Belgium, Hazard was courted by [[French Football Federation]] officials who sought the player to play for the [[France national football team|France national team]] as he had become eligible for French citizenship. Hazard did not respond to the courtship and later stated "Because of my presence in France for seven years, I feel 99% Belgian and 1% French, but the idea of French citizenship has never crossed my mind".<ref>{{cite news |title=Eden Hazard aurait pu jouer avec les Bleus | url = http://www.chronofoot.com/%E9quipe-de-france/eden-hazard-aurait-pu-jouer-avec-les-bleus_art21429.html |publisher=Chronofoot |date=15 November 2011 | accessdate = 19 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref>
Hazard made his highly anticipated debut for Belgium in the match against Luxembourg coming on as a substitute in the 67th minute for [[Wesley Sonck]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Belgium v. Luxembourg Match Report |url=http://www.footbel.be/fr/nationale_elftallen/statistieken_1/per_land.html |date=18 November 2008 |accessdate=10 April 2010 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110927140524/http://www.footbel.be/fr/nationale_elftallen/statistieken_1/per_land.html |archivedate=27 September 2011 }}</ref> On his debut, Hazard became the eighth youngest international player in Belgian football history, at 17 years and 316 days.<ref>{{cite web|title=Lille's pocket-sized pacemaker|url=http://www.uefa.com/news/newsid=1463448.html|publisher=UEFA|date=20 March 2010|accessdate=12 April 2010}}</ref> On 12 August 2009, after three consecutive substitute appearances with the team, he made his first start under coach [[Franky Vercauteren]] in the team's 3–1 [[Exhibition game|friendly]] loss to the [[Czech Republic national football team|Czech Republic]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Czech Republic 3–1 Belgium |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/match?id=268029&cc=5901 |publisher=ESPN |date=12 August 2009 |accessdate=12 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121023134934/http://soccernet.espn.go.com/match?id=268029 |archivedate=23 October 2012 }}</ref> Following the resignation of Vercauteren, he was replaced with manager [[Dick Advocaat]]. Under Advocaat, Hazard became a starter in the team and, on 14 November 2009, played a full match for the first time in his international career. In the match, which was played against [[Hungary national football team|Hungary]], Hazard assisted on two goals in a 3–0 win.
In May 2010, Advocaat was replaced as manager by [[Georges Leekens]]. After featuring as a starter in Leekens first three matches in charge, Hazard began appearing as a substitute for Belgium during the 2010–11 season. Leekens justified his benching of Hazard citing the players' domestic performance, which had been underwhelming at the time, while also admitting that Hazard displayed a lack of desire in training with the national team and often neglected his defensive duties during international matches.<ref name="hazard_leekens"/><ref>{{cite news |title=Hazard-Leekens: l'incompréhension? |url=http://www.rtbf.be/sport/football/diablesrouges/detail_hazard-leekens-l-incomprehension?id=6550763|work=RTBF.be|date=4 August 2011 |accessdate=5 August 2011 |language = Dutch}}</ref> After appearing as a substitute in two straight matches, Hazard returned to the starting lineup for the team's November 2010 friendly match against [[Russia national football team|Russia]]. In the match, which Belgium won 2–0, Hazard assisted on the team's opening goal scored by [[Romelu Lukaku]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Belgium beats Russia 2–0 in friendly |url=https://www.usatoday.com/sports/soccer/2010-11-17-2155338329_x.htm|work=USA Today |date=17 November 2010 |accessdate=5 August 2011 }}</ref>
After featuring as a starter in the team's 1–1 draw with [[Finland national football team|Finland]] in February 2011, Hazard was relegated back to the substitute's bench for the team's important March 2011 [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying]] matches as Leekens preferred [[Nacer Chadli]] and [[Mousa Dembélé (footballer, born 1987)|Mousa Dembélé]] on the wings.<ref>{{cite news |title=Un problème Hazard? |url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/breves2011/20110329_091853_un-probleme-hazard.html|work=[[L'Equipe]]|date=29 March 2011 |accessdate=5 August 2011 |language = French}}</ref> In the team's 29 March qualifier against [[Azerbaijan national football team|Azerbaijan]], he appeared as a second-half substitute and assisted on the team's final goal in a 4–1 win.<ref>{{cite news|title=La Belgique flambe avec Hazard |url=http://www.rmcsport.fr/editorial/154831/la-belgique-flambe-avec-hazard/ |work=[[Radio Monte Carlo|RMC Sport]] |date=29 March 2011 |accessdate=5 August 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120907183753/http://www.rmcsport.fr/editorial/154831/la-belgique-flambe-avec-hazard/ |archivedate=7 September 2012 }}</ref> Following the matches, French media began questioning why Hazard was struggling to be appreciated in his home country, while, at the same time, was being praised in France.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hazard n'est pas prophète en son plat pays |url=http://www.rmcsport.fr/editorial/155082/hazard-n-est-pas-prophete-en-son-plat-pays/ |work=[[Radio Monte Carlo|RMC Sport]] |date=31 March 2011 |accessdate=5 August 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120316005505/http://www.rmcsport.fr/editorial/155082/hazard-n-est-pas-prophete-en-son-plat-pays/ |archivedate=16 March 2012 }}</ref> Marc Wilmots, assistant coach of the national team, responded to the media reports stating "Some people only see Eden's qualities" and "the French press are sometimes blinded by his moments of magic".<ref>{{cite web|title=Wilmots: Hazard needs more than talent|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/news/newsid=1409933.html|publisher=FIFA|date=31 March 2011|accessdate=5 August 2011}}</ref>
In Belgium's next competitive match against [[Turkey national football team|Turkey]] on 3 June 2011, Hazard started the match, but was substituted out after 60 minutes. Disappointed with his performance and substitution, the midfielder retired to the locker room and was later spotted on television outside the stadium with his family eating a [[hamburger]] while the match was still ongoing.<ref>{{cite web|title=Leekens et Hazard pourront-ils un jour s'entendre?|url=http://sportmagazine.levif.be/sport/actualite/leekens-et-hazard-pourront-ils-un-jour-s-entendre/article-1195028318709.htm|publisher=Sportmagazine.be|date=6 June 2011|accessdate=5 August 2011|language=French}}</ref> Following the episode, which has become known as ''Burgergate'' in Belgium,<ref>{{cite web|title=Hazard a insulté Leekens!|url=http://sportmagazine.levif.be/sport/actualite/hazard-a-insulte-leekens/article-1195083841449.htm|publisher=Sportmagazine.be|date=17 August 2011|accessdate=17 August 2011|language=French}}</ref> Hazard apologized for the defection, while Leekens attributed Hazard's response to the substitution as "a young player making a mistake".<ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal target Hazard fails to impress Wenger after Belgium walkout|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2000706/Arsenal-target-Eden-Hazard-storms-Belgium-boss.html|work=Daily Mail|date=8 June 2011|accessdate=5 August 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Leekens: "Hazard, je ne lui en veux pas"|url=http://www.chronofoot.com/belgique/leekens-hazard-je-ne-lui-en-veux-pas_mrm164750.html|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130119041019/http://www.chronofoot.com/belgique/leekens-hazard-je-ne-lui-en-veux-pas_mrm164750.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=19 January 2013|publisher=Chronofoot|date=6 June 2011|accessdate=5 August 2011|language=French}}</ref>
On 4 August, Leekens announced that Hazard would be disciplined for his actions during the Turkey match and, as a result, would miss the team's 10 August friendly match against [[Slovenia national football team|Slovenia]], as well as the team's Euro qualifying return match against Azerbaijan on 2 September and friendly against the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] four days later.<ref>{{cite news |title=Slovénie – Belgique: pas de Hazard, Leekens le sanctionne |url=http://www.lalibre.be/sports/football/article/677218/belgique-slovenie-pas-de-hazard-leekens-le-sanctionne.html|work=La Libre|date=4 August 2011 |accessdate=5 August 2011 |language = French}}</ref> On 9 August, Hazard's management group issued a press release to the Belgian media. The release detailed Hazard's actions during the Turkey match, criticized the player's three-match suspension, as well as questioned Leekens constant criticism of Hazard.<ref>{{cite news |title=La réponse d'Eden Hazard à Georges Leekens |url=http://www.dhnet.be/sports/diables-rouges/article/364182/la-reponse-d-eden-hazard-a-georges-leekens.html|work=DH.be|date=9 August 2011 |accessdate=11 August 2011 |language = French}}</ref> On 25 August, it was announced that Leekens had lifted Hazard's suspension and the midfielder was subsequently named in the team to play the September fixtures.<ref>{{cite news |title=Eden Hazard rappelé chez les Diables Rouges! |url=http://www.dhnet.be/sports/diables-rouges/article/366148/eden-hazard-rappele-chez-les-diables-rouges.html|work=DH.be|date=25 August 2011 |accessdate=26 August 2011 |language = French}}</ref> Leekens decided to lift the suspension after having a meeting with Hazard that was organized by the player's agent.<ref>{{cite news |title=Les dessous du retour d'Hazard |url=http://www.dhnet.be/sports/diables-rouges/article/366195/les-dessous-du-retour-d-hazard.html|work=DH.be|date=26 August 2011 |accessdate=26 August 2011 |language = French}}</ref>
On 7 October 2011, nearly three years after his debut, Hazard scored his first international goal against [[Kazakhstan national football team|Kazakhstan]] in a 4–1 victory.<ref>{{cite news |title=Belgium overwhelm ten-man Kazakhstan |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002128/postmatch/report/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=7 October 2011|accessdate=10 October 2011}}</ref> The victory inserted Belgium into second-place position in its group in qualifying for [[UEFA Euro 2012]] with the team needing a victory over [[Germany national football team|Germany]] on 11 October to secure a place in the qualifying playoffs.<ref>{{cite news |title=Belgium must win to secure playoff spot |url=http://latino.foxnews.com/latino/sports/2011/10/10/belgium-must-win-to-secure-playoff-spot/ |publisher=Fox News |date=10 October 2011 |accessdate=10 October 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111011083605/http://latino.foxnews.com/latino/sports/2011/10/10/belgium-must-win-to-secure-playoff-spot/ |archive-date=11 October 2011 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> In the match against Germany, Hazard played the entire match as Belgium failed to earn a place in the European Championship, losing 3–1 in [[Düsseldorf]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Germany stamp out Belgium's fire |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002112/index.html |publisher=UEFA |date=11 October 2011|accessdate=11 October 2011}}</ref>
===2014 World Cup and Euro 2016=== Hazard made nine appearances in the ''Red Devils''' successful [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2014 World Cup qualification]] campaign, scoring twice.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/season=2014/teams/player=1902160/index.html|title=Eden Hazard|accessdate=12 April 2014|publisher=UEFA}}</ref> The first of these came on 22 March against the [[Republic of Macedonia national football team|Republic of Macedonia]] at the [[Philip II Arena]], converting a penalty to conclude a 2–0 win after being fouled by [[Aleksandar Lazevski]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Gasevski|first1=Emil|title=Belgium forge on with victory in Skopje|url=http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/season=2014/matches/round=2000294/match=2008530/postmatch/report/index.html|accessdate=15 October 2015|publisher=UEFA|date=22 March 2013}}</ref> Three days later in the reverse fixture, he beat two defenders before scoring the only goal of the game.<ref>{{cite news|title=Hazard gives Belgium the points against FYROM|url=http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/season=2014/matches/round=2000294/match=2008515/postmatch/report/index.html|accessdate=15 October 2015|publisher=UEFA|date=26 March 2015}}</ref>
On 13 May 2014, Hazard was named in Belgium's squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Adnan Januzaj included in Belgium's World Cup squad|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/27395150|accessdate=15 May 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 May 2014}}</ref> He assisted [[Dries Mertens]]' winning goal in the team's first game of the tournament, a 2–1 win against [[Algeria national football team|Algeria]] in [[Belo Horizonte]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Chowdhury|first=Saj|title=Belgium 2–1 Algeria|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25285127|accessdate=17 June 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 June 2014}}</ref> In Belgium's second match, he assisted [[Divock Origi]]'s 88th-minute goal, giving the Red Devils a 1–0 win over [[Russia national football team|Russia]] and qualifying them for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage|knockout stage]],<ref name="bbc">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/25285242|title=Brazil v Russia|date=22 June 2014|accessdate=22 June 2014|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> eventually reaching the quarter-finals, where they were eliminated by [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28069209|title=Argentina 1–0 Belgium|work=BBC|accessdate=6 June 2014|date=5 June 2014}}</ref>
On 7 June 2015, due to the suspension of regular skipper [[Vincent Kompany]], Hazard captained Belgium for the first time in a friendly against [[France national football team|France]] at the [[Stade de France]], scoring a penalty for Belgium's final goal in a 4–3 victory.<ref>{{cite web|title=Eden Hazard après France-Belgique (3–4): "Un très bon match même si nous aurions pu inscrire encore davantage de buts"|trans-title=Eden Hazard after France 3–4 Belgium: "A very good match even though we could have scored even more goals"|url=http://www.sudinfo.be/1305587/article/2015-06-07/eden-hazard-apres-france-belgique-3-4-un-tres-bon-match-meme-si-nous-aurions-pu|accessdate=7 June 2015|publisher=Sudinfo|date=7 June 2015|language=French}}</ref> He won another penalty in a [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying]] match on 3 September when fouled by [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina]]'s [[Ognjen Vranješ]], and converted it past his Chelsea clubmate [[Asmir Begović]] to conclude Belgium's 3–1 comeback victory.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ridge|first1=Patric|title=Belgium 3–1 Bosnia-Herzegovina: Fellaini, De Bruyne & Hazard get the job done|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/belgium-vs-bosnia-herzegovina/1653302|accessdate=3 September 2015|publisher=Goal.com|date=3 September 2015}}</ref> Three days later, he finished Mertens' cross with four minutes remaining, for the only goal in an away win over [[Cyprus national football team|Cyprus]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Cyprus 0–1 Belgium: Late Hazard strike dashes Wales hopes...for now|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/cyprus-vs-belgium/1653330/report|accessdate=15 October 2015|publisher=Goal.com|date=6 September 2015}}</ref> On 10 October, Hazard scored a spot-kick again after [[Óscar Sonejee]]'s handball, in a 4–1 win over [[Andorra national football team|Andorra]] which sealed Belgium's qualification to the continental championship for the first time since co-hosting [[UEFA Euro 2000]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Belgium claim Euro 2016 spot by trashing Andorra 4–1|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/10/10/uk-soccer-euro-andorra-idUKKCN0S40WT20151010|accessdate=15 October 2015|publisher=Reuters|date=10 October 2015}}</ref>
Due to the absence of Kompany, Hazard was named captain of Belgium for the [[UEFA Euro 2016]] finals.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccer.nbcsports.com/2016/05/12/belgium-euro-2016-roster-hazard-captain-11-other-premier-leaguers/|title=Belgium EURO 2016 roster: Hazard captain, 11 other Premier Leaguers|date=12 May 2016|publisher=NBC Sports}}</ref> He scored a solo goal against [[Hungary national football team|Hungary]] in the last 16, before Belgium were eliminated by [[Wales national football team|Wales]] in the quarter-finals.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36635145 “Hazard scores glorious solo goal”]. BBC. Retrieved 8 July 2018</ref><ref>[https://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2016/matches/round=2000449/match=2017902/index.html “Remarkable Wales shock Belgium”]. UEFA.com. Retrieved 8 July 2018</ref> Alongside [[Aaron Ramsey]], he finished as the top assist provider of the tournament with four assists.<ref name="Euro 2016 stats"/>
===2018 World Cup=== [[File:Bel-Tun (20).jpg|thumb|upright|left|Hazard [[Goal celebration|celebrating]] after scoring against [[Tunisia national football team|Tunisia]] at the [[2018 World Cup]]]] Hazard was appointed [[captain (association football)|captain]] of Belgium for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web |title=Eden Hazard lifts lid on Belgium's squad for World Cup |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/11402036/eden-hazard-lifts-lid-on-belgiums-squad-for-world-cup |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=23 June 2018 |date=12 June 2018}}</ref> In the first game against [[Panama national football team|Panama]], he assisted the third goal of the match scored by Lukaku as Belgium won 3–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44434275/|title=World Cup 2018: Belgium beat debutants Panama 3–0 in Sochi|date=18 June 2018|publisher=BBC}}</ref> He then scored twice (which included a penalty) in their second group stage victory against [[Tunisia national football team|Tunisia]].
