His penalty goal in the 6th minute was the team's second quickest goal in the history of the tournament.<ref>{{cite news |title=Romelu Lukaku and Eden Hazard run riot against Tunisia as Belgium qualify for World Cup knock-out stages |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-cup/2018/06/23/world-cup-2018-belgium-vs-tunisia-live-score-latest-updates/ |work=The Daily Telegraph |accessdate=23 June 2018 |date=23 June 2018}}</ref> Hazard did not play in Belgium's 1–0 victory over England as he, together with eight other starters in the previous two matches, was rested by Roberto Martinez. In Belgium's 3–2 victory over [[Japan national football team|Japan]] in the last 16, Hazard was instrumental in mounting a comeback from a two-goal deficit as Belgium became the first team in 52 years to come back from 0–2 down to win a World Cup knockout match.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44597759/|title=World Cup 2018: Belgium stun Japan to reach quarters|date=3 July 2018|publisher=BBC}}</ref>
[[File:Eden Hazard 2018.jpg|thumb|upright|Hazard playing for Belgium during the knockout stage of the [[2018 World Cup]]]] Hazard was again in scintillating form as he helped lead Belgium to its second World Cup semi-final in its history with a 2–1 victory over five-time champions [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]]. In that game, Hazard set a World Cup record for successful [[dribbling|dribbles]] completed in any World Cup game since 1966, with a 100% success rate in ten dribbles.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11096/11428909/how-belgium-shocked-brazil-2-1-to-reach-world-cup-semi-final|title=How Belgium shocked Brazil 2-1 to reach World Cup semi-final|date=6 July 2018|publisher=SkySports}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=World Cup Stats Insider: Brazil's Achilles heel, terrific individual performances behind Belgium's win |url=https://www.foxsports.com.au/football/world-cup/world-cup-stats-insider-brazils-achilles-heel-terrific-individual-performances-behind-belgiums-win/news-story/a9d281a49854caba4b49ae2455a9abdd |accessdate=9 July 2018 |agency=Fox Sports}}</ref> In the semi-finals, which was a tight game, Belgium were defeated by eventual champions France 1–0 courtesy of Frenchman [[Samuel Umtiti]]'s header and France's subsequent deep defense.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44692297 |title=France 1–0 Belgium |publisher=BBC Sport |author1=Shamoon Hafez |date=10 June 2018 |accessdate=10 June 2018 }}</ref> On 14 July, Hazard ensured victory for Belgium with his goal in the 82nd minute in a 2–0 victory against [[England national football team|England]] in their [[2018 FIFA World Cup#Third place play-off|third-place play-off]], his nation's best ever World Cup finish.<ref>{{cite news |title=World Cup 2018: England finish fourth after Belgium defeat |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44748604 |accessdate=14 July 2018 |agency=BBC Sport}}</ref>
At the end of the 2018 FIFA World Cup on 15 July the FIFA Technical Study Group (TSG) selected Hazard as the second best player of the tournament, awarding him the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|Silver Ball]].<ref name="autogenerated1">{{Cite news|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/157-awards-piece-2986294|title=2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ - News - Golden consolation for magical Modric |work=www.fifa.com|access-date=2018-07-16|language=en-GB}}</ref> In addition to his dribbling he scored three goals and provided two assists in total.<ref name="autogenerated1"/>
==Style of play== [[File:Hazard taking on Howson.jpg|thumb|left|Hazard taking on the [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] defence for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in October 2012]]
Hazard primarily plays as either an [[Attacking midfielders|attacking midfielder]] or a [[Left winger|winger]] and has been credited as being "possibly the outstanding talent in Europe right now".<ref>{{cite web|title=The new Belgian golden generation|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/770540/wim-van-walle-the-new-belgian-golden-generation|publisher=ESPN FC|first=Wim|last=Van Walle|date=15 April 2011|accessdate=19 April 2011}}</ref> At Lille under former manager Rudi Garcia, Hazard often played in the latter role in the team's 4–3–3 formation and regularly switched flanks because he could use both feet. Following the departures of fellow [[Playmaker|play-makers]] [[Yohan Cabaye]] and [[Gervinho]] in 2011, during the 2011–12 season, Garcia played Hazard in a creative role as a central attacking midfielder, while also allowing the player to roam back onto the wing if necessary. Two of Hazard's most common exemplary traits are his pace and [[Dribbling#Association football|technical ability]], which have been described as "astonishing" and "mesmerizing".<ref name="hazard_fifa"/> His speed and dribbling skills, combined with his creativity,<ref name="hazard_espn">{{cite web|title=Eden Hazard|url=http://www.espnfc.com/player/101390/eden-hazard|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|accessdate=19 April 2011}}</ref><ref name=" St Etienne v Lille"/><ref name="targets"/> as well as his flair, balance, agility, and low centre of gravity, courtesy of his diminutive stature (1.73 m/5 feet 8 inches),<ref name="Chelsea profile"/> allow him to retain possession, take on defenders, and beat opponents in one on one situations.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/1978449-eden-hazard-what-makes-him-the-best-player-in-the-premier-league |title=Eden Hazard Showing Class That Makes Him Best Player in the Premier League |publisher=bleacherreport.com |last1=Levene |first1=Dan |date=2 March 2014 |accessdate=17 December 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/blog/the-toe-poke/65/post/3188122/eden-hazard-among-chelsea-stars-put-through-speed-dribbling-test |title=Eden Hazard among Chelsea stars put through speed dribbling test |publisher=ESPN FC |last1=Twomey |first1=Liam |date=25 August 2017 |accessdate=17 December 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.calciomercato.com/en/news/are-romelu-lukaku-dries-mertens-and-eden-hazard-the-world-cup-s--82060 |title=Are Lukaku, Mertens & Hazard the World Cup's most complete attacking partnership? |publisher=www.calciomercato.com |date=18 June 2018 |accessdate=17 December 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.squawka.com/en/news/eden-hazard-ballon-dor/30473#g9LEXKMWOK20vLqW.97 |title=Eden's Era? The Story Behind Hazard's Ballon d'Or Nomination |publisher=www.squawka.com |last1=Linnell |first1=Chris |date=4 November 2013 |accessdate=17 December 2018 }}</ref>
At Chelsea, Hazard matured into a world class player and was primarily utilised as a left midfielder, a position which enables him to cut into the centre and strike on goal with his stronger right foot.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://it.eurosport.com/calcio/premier-league/2016-2017/diego-costa-fa-felice-conte-il-chelsea-batte-il-west-ham-all-89_sto5724264/story.shtml |title=Diego Costa fa felice Conte: il Chelsea batte il West Ham all'89' |publisher=Eurosport |language=Italian |first1=Stefano |last1=Silvestri |date=15 August 2016 |accessdate=17 December 2018 }}</ref> His development into one of the world's best players was highlighted in the [[2014–15 Premier League|2014–15 Season]]; during this season he won multiple awards<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea/11599121/Eden-Hazard-named-2015-footballer-of-the-year-by-the-Football-Writers-Association.html|title=Eden Hazard named 2015 footballer of the year by the Football Writers' Association|date=12 May 2015|work=The Daily Telegraph}}</ref> and received praise from pundits and manager alike. Manager Jose Mourinho praised Hazard, saying that "He is already a top player and his evolution has been fantastic. He is still very young and he can become the best player in the world."<ref>{{cite news|title=Eden Hazard contract: Chelsea playmaker signs new five-and-a-half year deal with Mourinho saying 'he can become best player in the world'|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/eden-hazard-contract-chelsea-playmaker-signs-new-five-and-a-half-year-deal-with-mourinho-saying-he-10041490.html|work=The Independent|first=James|last=Orr|date=12 February 2015}}</ref> Hazard's former teammate and Lille [[Captain (association football)|captain]] [[Rio Mavuba]] described Hazard as "a great player, with an immense talent. He's actually not that big, but he's so fast. He's also very difficult to dispossess and his finishing is top notch".<ref name="hazard_fifa"/> Hazard's frequent [[goal celebration]] saw him sliding on his knees; since 2018 he has stayed on his feet.<ref>{{cite news |title=Why Eden Hazard has retired his trademark knee-slide celebration |url=https://talksport.com/football/430330/eden-hazard-trademark-knee-slide-celebration-chelsea/ |accessdate=9 October 2018 |agency=Talksport}}</ref> Although Hazard's favoured role is as a left winger, he is a versatile [[Forward (association football)|attacker]],<ref name="Scheda giocatore">{{cite web |url=https://www.corriere.it/mondiali/2014/gruppo-h/belgio/eden-hazard.shtml |title=Eden HAZARD |publisher=Il Corriere della Sera |language=Italian |accessdate=17 December 2018 }}</ref> and has also been deployed as a [[Forward (association football)#Second striker|second striker]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2654292-eden-hazards-real-madrid-brace-shows-he-can-be-chelseas-second-sriker |title=Eden Hazard's Real Madrid Brace Shows He Can Be Chelsea's 2nd Striker |publisher=bleacherreport.com |author1=Garry Hayes |date=31 July 2016 |accessdate=17 December 2018 }}</ref> as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|lone striker]],<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/dec/16/brighton-chelsea-premier-league-match-report |title=Eden Hazard ensures Chelsea stay in touch at top with win at Brighton |work=The Guardian |first1=Dominic |last1=Fifield |date=16 December 2018 |accessdate=17 December 2018 }}</ref> or even as a [[Forward (association football)#False 9|false-9]] on occasion throughout his career.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/03/05/eden-hazard-reveals-frustration-false-nine-role-touching-ball/ |title=Eden Hazard reveals frustration with false-nine role after touching the ball 'three times' in Man City defeat |work=The Telegraph |date=5 March 2018 |accessdate=30 November 2018 }}</ref> Beyond his speed, creativity, technical skills, and offensive qualities, he is also an accurate [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.goal.com/en/lists/premier-league-penalty-takers-man-utd-liverpool-man-city-all/e6aap0x4pt4q1jrg1gdjlk0dg |title=Premier League penalty takers: Man Utd, Liverpool, Man City & all 20 clubs spot kick specialists |publisher=Goal.com |date=14 October 2018 |accessdate=17 December 2018 }}</ref> and [[Direct free kick|free kick]] taker.<ref name="Scheda giocatore"/>
===Reception=== [[File:Chelsea 1 Everton 0 (16325064577).jpg|thumb|upright|Acclaimed for his dribbling, creativity and ball retention skills, Hazard (number 10) is difficult to dispossess.<ref>{{cite news |title=Hazard: A force to be reckoned with |url=https://www.fifa.com/news/y=2011/m=2/news=hazard-force-reckoned-with-1379756.html |agency=FIFA.com |date=24 June 2018}}</ref>]] Hazard's pace, coupled with his finishing and ability to retain possession, led to his former coach [[Claude Puel]] dubbing him "little [[Lionel Messi|Messi]]", in reference to the [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] player.<ref name="hazard_sportsillustrated"/> Puel's sentiments were later echoed by former [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]] manager and [[media personality]] [[Rolland Courbis]] who commented "At times it looks to me like Lionel Messi on the right-hand side".<ref name="hazard_fourfourtwo"/> Hazard's "flair and tricky" style of play has been described as being similar to [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] player [[Cristiano Ronaldo]]; a comparison later repeated by former [[France national football team|French international]] [[Christophe Dugarry]].<ref>{{cite news|title=The next Cristiano Ronaldo, Eden Hazard declares interest in sealing summer move to Arsenal|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1215822/The-Cristiano-Ronaldo-Eden-Hazard-declares-sealing-summer-Arsenal.html|work=Daily Mail|date=25 September 2009|accessdate=19 April 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Dugarry compare Eden Hazard à Cristiano Ronaldo |url=http://www.topfoot.com/5452,1/lille-dugarry-compare-eden-hazard-a-cristiano-ronaldo.html |publisher=Topfoot |date=21 January 2010 |accessdate=19 April 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120331065907/http://www.topfoot.com/5452%2C1/lille-dugarry-compare-eden-hazard-a-cristiano-ronaldo.html |archivedate=31 March 2012 |df= }}</ref> His vision, described as being the trait he has improved on the most, has also allowed him to develop into an effective passer,<ref name="hazard_france24">{{cite news|title=Football: Eden Hazard, le Messi(e) de Lille |url=http://www.france24.com/fr/20110314-football-eden-hazard-le-messie-lille |work=[[France 24]] |date=14 March 2011 |accessdate=19 April 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110408120511/http://www.france24.com/fr/20110314-football-eden-hazard-le-messie-lille |archivedate=8 April 2011 }}</ref> which, combined with his finishing ability, enables him to both score and create goals.<ref name="next Messi"/><ref name="Scheda giocatore"/>
In Belgium, Hazard's talent and similar ascension up the country's football hierarchy has led to comparisons to former Belgian international [[Enzo Scifo]].<ref name="eden_hazard"/><ref name="hazard_scifo">{{cite news|title=Enzo Scifo adoube son héritier: "Eden Hazard, c'est le talent"|url=http://www.lavoixdessports.com/LOSC/2010/11/23/article_enzo-scifo-adoube-son-heritier-eden-haz.shtml|work=La Voix des Sports|date=23 November 2010|accessdate=19 April 2011|language=French}}</ref> Both players share the same birthplace and Scifo himself spent time with Hazard while he was in Tubize admitting "Eden, you know, I've coached in Tubize. During the week, I took care of the young people at least once, and he, in those days, I immediately saw he had a secure future".<ref name="hazard_scifo"/>
However, despite the positive opinions, Hazard has endured criticism from some. In 2010, former Belgium national team manager Georges Leekens questioned Hazard's work-rate.<ref>{{cite web|title=Belgium play down talk of Hazard spat|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/900525/belgium-play-down-talk-of-eden-hazard-spat|publisher=ESPN FC|date=30 March 2011|accessdate=19 April 2011}}</ref> Lille youth academy director Jean-Michel Vandamme countered both managers' criticism by arguing that Hazard simply possesses an intellectual honesty that is out of the ordinary and unexpected of today's footballer declaring "He is a real competitor, not a cheat, nor a moaner, because you don't hear him complaining when he gets fouled".<ref name="hazard_fourfourtwo"/>
==Outside football== ===Personal life=== Hazard is married to Natacha Van Honacker.<ref>{{citenews|title=Eden to the top|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/archives/news/77872/eden-to-the-top/|work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|date=24 May 2015}}</ref> On 19 December 2010, it was reported that she had given birth to a baby boy, Yannis. She gave birth to their second son, Leo, in February 2013,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dhnet.be/sports/football/article/336077/eden-hazard-est-papa.html | title = Hazard est papa |date= 19 December 2010 | accessdate = 19 December 2010 | publisher=DH.be | language = French }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.maxifoot.fr/info-129358_101219/football.php | title = Hazard déjà papa! |date= 19 December 2010 | accessdate = 19 December 2010 | publisher=Maxifoot | language = French }}</ref> and a third son, Samy, in September 2015.<ref>{{cite web | title=Hazard voor derde keer vader | date=27 September 2015 | accessdate=7 December 2015 | url=http://www.demorgen.be/binnenland/hazard-voor-derde-keer-vader-b5b1ec80/ | language=Dutch}}</ref>
===Sponsorship=== In 2012, Hazard signed a sponsorship deal with sportswear and equipment supplier, [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]]. He appeared in an advert for the Nike Green Speed II alongside [[Mario Götze]], [[Theo Walcott]], [[Raheem Sterling]], [[Christian Eriksen]] and [[Stephan El Shaarawy]] in November 2012.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.footballboots.co.uk/7963-chelseas-eden-hazard-wears-the-nike-gs-2.html | title = Eden Hazard Wears the Nike GS2 | publisher = Football Boots | accessdate = 26 November 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.footballboots.co.uk/nike-gs.html | title = Nike GS2 Football Boots| publisher = FootballBoots.co.uk | accessdate = 26 November 2012 }}</ref> Hazard features on the cover of [[EA Sports]]' [[FIFA (video game series)|''FIFA'']] video game ''[[FIFA 15]]'' in Belgium, the UK, the Netherlands and France, along with [[Lionel Messi]].<ref>[http://www.easports.com/uk/fifa/news/2014/fifa-15-cover-eden-hazard?&cid=25363&ts=1408631917926 "Eden Hazard – FIFA 15 cover star"]. EA Sports. Retrieved 8 September 2014</ref> Hazard, [[Marco Reus]], [[James Rodríguez]] and [[Anthony Martial]] were announced as the official ambassadors of the game and were the finalists to be the new face of the ''[[FIFA 17]]'' game.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/english-premier-league/story/2908015/ea-sports-announces-fifa-17-cover-vote-finalists |title=FIFA 17 cover vote: Anthony Martial, Eden Hazard, James, Marco Reus |date=5 July 2016 |publisher=ESPN}}</ref>
Since March 2016, Hazard has been appearing in adverts for Belgium-based [[Lotus Bakeries]] promoting their Biscoff biscuit range. The advert shows him successfully taking a [[free kick]], sending a ball into a gap in 10,000 cups.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/eden-hazard-takes-the-biscuit-watch-chelsea-star-avoid-smashing-10000-coffee-cups-in-free-kick-a3205066.html |title=Eden Hazard takes the biscuit! Watch Chelsea star avoid smashing 10,000 coffee cups in free kick challenge |date=23 May 2018 |publisher=Evening Standard}}</ref>
===Club ownership=== On 26 June 2017, Hazard became a part-owner of expansion [[North American Soccer League]] franchise [[San Diego 1904 FC]] to begin play in 2018, alongside [[Demba Ba]], [[Yohan Cabaye]] and [[Moussa Sow]].<ref>{{cite news |url = http://www.nasl.com/news/2017/06/26/nasl-announces-expansion-club-in-san-diego-for-2018-season |title = NASL announces expansion club in San Diego for 2018 season |publisher= North American Soccer League |date = 26 June 2017 |accessdate =26 June 2017 }}</ref>

{{IPA-pt|ˈpedɾu, -ðɾu|lang}} | gender = Male | meaning = Rock | region = [[Spain]], [[Latin America]], [[Portugal]], [[The Philippines]] | language = [[Spanish language|Spanish]], [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] | origin = [[Saint Peter|Peter]] | alternative spelling = Pêro{{cn|date=June 2018}} | nickname = | variant forms = | related names = [[Peter (given name)|Peter]], [[Pierre]], [[Boutros]], | name day = | derived = | popularity = | footnotes = }} '''Pedro''' (alternate archaic spelling '''Pêro'''){{cn|date=June 2018}} is a masculine given name. Pedro is the [[Spanish language|Spanish]], [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]], and [[Galician language|Galician]] name for ''[[Peter (given name)|Peter]]''.[http://www.mfnames.com/mnames/p/origin-and-meaning-of-pedro.htm MFnames.com - Origin and Meaning of Pedro] Its French equivalent is [[Pierre]] while its English and Germanic form is Peter. The counterpart [[patronymic]] [[surname]] of the name Pedro, meaning "son of Peter" (compare with the English surname [[Peterson (name)|Peterson]]) is [[Pérez]] in Spanish, and [[Peres]] in Galician and Portuguese, [[Pires (disambiguation)|Pires]] also in Portuguese, and [[Peiris]] in coastal area of [[Sri Lanka]] (where it originated from the Portuguese version), with all ultimately meaning "son of Pêro". The name Pedro is derived via the Latin word "petra", from the Greek word "η πετρα" meaning "stone, rock".[http://www.mfnames.com/mnames/p/origin-and-meaning-of-peter.htm MFnames.com - Origin and Meaning of Peter] The name [[Peter (name)|Peter]] itself is a translation of the [[Aramaic language|Aramaic]] ''Kephas'' or ''[[Aramaic of Jesus#Cephas_.28.CE.9A.CE.B7.CF.86.CE.B1.CF.82.29|Cephas]]'' meaning "stone". Cup]]}} {{Medal|1st|[[2001 FIFA World Youth Championship|2001 Argentina]]|}} }} '''Wilfredo Daniel''' "'''Willy'''" '''Caballero Lazcano''' (born 28 September 1981) is an Argentine professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for {{English football updater|Chelsea}} club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and the [[Argentina national football team|Argentina national team]].
He spent most of his career in Spain, representing [[Elche CF|Elche]] and [[Málaga CF|Málaga]] and competing in [[La Liga]] with the latter club. In the summer of 2014 he signed for [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], helping them win the [[2016 Football League Cup Final|2016 League Cup]].
Caballero made his senior debut for [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] in 2018. He represented the nation at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]], and was also a non-playing member of the squads that won a gold medal at the [[Football at the 2004 Summer Olympics|2004 Summer Olympics]] and finished runners-up at the [[2005 FIFA Confederations Cup|2005 Confederations Cup]].
==Club career== ===Early career=== Born in [[Santa Elena, Entre Ríos]], Caballero started his playing career with [[Boca Juniors]] in 2001, where he won three major titles in 2003. On 14 December of that year he witnessed – from [[Substitute (association football)|the bench]] – his team beat [[A.C. Milan]] 3–1 on [[Penalty shootout (association football)|penalties]], in the [[2003 Intercontinental Cup|2003]] [[Intercontinental Cup (football)|Intercontinental Cup]].<ref name=ICUP>{{cite news|url=http://mundod.lavoz.com.ar/futbol/10-anos-del-titulo-intercontinental-de-boca-ante-milan#!/login|title=A 10 años del título Intercontinental de Boca ante Milan|trans-title=10 years from Boca's Intercontinental title against Milan|newspaper=[[La Voz del Interior]]|language=es|date=14 December 2013|accessdate=6 January 2018}}</ref>
Caballero joined [[Elche CF|Elche]] of [[Spain]] in 2004, and when his daughter was diagnosed with cancer he agreed to a brief loan spell back in his country with [[Arsenal de Sarandí]] to care for her.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ivoox.com/22436520|title=Padre antes que portero|trans-title=Father before goalkeeper|publisher=Ivoox|language=es|date=4 December 2017|accessdate=5 December 2017}}</ref> With the former, after a rough [[2004–05 Segunda División|first season]], he went on to become the undisputed starter, appearing in nearly 200 [[Segunda División]] games.
===Málaga=== On 10 February 2011, Caballero was transferred to [[Málaga CF|Málaga]] in [[La Liga]] for [[Euro|€]]900,000 and two-and-a-half years, as an emergency transfer – after the transfer deadline of 31 January – due to a serious [[knee]] injury to [[Sergio Asenjo]] (their previous starter, [[Rubén Iván Martínez|Rubén]], was also unavailable due to physical problems);<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/11/transfer-zone/2011/02/11/2348382/official-malaga-sign-willy-caballero-from-elche|title=Official: Malaga sign Willy Caballero from Elche|publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|last=Mondal|first=Subhankar|date=11 February 2011|access-date=5 August 2015}}</ref> he made his league debut on 20 February, starting in a 1–1 draw at [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/302121?cc=5739|title=Villarreal left disappointed again|publisher=[[ESPN FC|ESPN Soccernet]]|date=20 February 2011|accessdate=28 February 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110628234200/http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/302121?cc=5739|archivedate=28 June 2011}}</ref> and played all the matches until the end of [[2010–11 La Liga|the campaign]], with the [[Andalusia]]ns finally escaping relegation.
On 1 October 2011, Caballero entered Málaga's history books as he kept his [[Shutout|goal clean]] for 480 minutes, beating the club's previous record of 429 held by [[Pedro Contreras]] since the [[2001–02 La Liga|2001–02 season]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.laopiniondemalaga.es/malagacf/2011/10/02/willy-caballero-historia-viva-malaga-cf/454131.html|title=Willy Caballero ya es historia viva del Málaga CF|trans-title=Willy Caballero becomes living history at Málaga CF|newspaper=La Opinión de Málaga|last=Puga|first=Manu|language=es|date=2 October 2011|accessdate=19 December 2014}}</ref> On 16 October, he was [[Ejection (sports)|sent off]] midway through the first half of an away fixture against [[Levante UD|Levante]] after touching the ball with his hands just outside the box – the hosts eventually won it 3–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/323959?cc=5739|title=Levante go second|publisher=ESPN Soccernet|date=16 October 2011|accessdate=21 October 2011|archive-url=https://archive.is/20120720133452/http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/323959?cc=5739|dead-url=yes|archive-date=20 July 2012}}</ref>
On 18 January 2012, Caballero signed a contract extension, tying him to the club until 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.malagacf.com/es/noticia/actualidad/willy-caballero-amplia-su-vinculacion-malaga-club-futbol-temporada-20152016/131/56271|title=Willy Caballero amplía su vinculación con el Málaga Club de Fútbol hasta la temporada 2015–2016|trans-title=Willy Caballero extends Málaga Club de Fútbol link until 2015–2016 season|publisher=Málaga CF|language=es|date=18 January 2012|access-date=5 August 2015}}</ref> On 25 March, playing against [[RCD Espanyol|Espanyol]], he fractured his left [[hand]] early into the game, being sidelined for the rest of [[2011–12 La Liga|the season]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2012/03/27/futbol/equipos/malaga/1332875721.html|title=Caballero se operará de la fractura en su mano|trans-title=Caballero to undergo hand fracture surgery|newspaper=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|language=es|date=27 March 2012|access-date=5 August 2015}}</ref>
Caballero returned to full fitness for [[2012–13 La Liga|2012–13]], featuring in all but two games and helping the ''Boquerones'' to the sixth position. Goal.com named him as the best player in his position for the campaign.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/3277/la-liga/2013/05/14/3977718/la-liga-team-of-the-season-messi-ronaldo-falcao-make-up-all-star-|title=La Liga Team of the Season: Messi, Ronaldo & Falcao make up all-star front line|publisher=Goal|date=14 May 2013|access-date=5 August 2015}}</ref> At the end of [[2013–14 La Liga|the following season]], he was nominated as the best goalkeeper in the league alongside [[Thibaut Courtois]] of [[Atlético Madrid]] and [[Keylor Navas]] of Levante.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/chelsea-duo-thibaut-courtois-filipe-luis-nominated-la-liga-awards-1470026|title=Chelsea duo Thibaut Courtois and Filipe Luis nominated for La Liga awards|newspaper=[[International Business Times]]|last =Fernandez-Abascal|first=Eduardo|date=14 October 2014|access-date=5 August 2015}}</ref>
===Manchester City=== [[file:Willy Caballero.jpg|thumb|Caballero warming up for [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in 2014]] On 8 July 2014, Caballero signed a three-year deal with [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], for a fee believed to be in the region of [[Pound sterling|£]]6 million excluding add-ons. He reunited at his new club with former Málaga manager [[Manuel Pellegrini]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football-28195661|title=Willy Caballero: Man City sign Malaga goalkeeper for £4.4m|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=8 July 2014|accessdate=5 August 2015|dead-url=yes|archive-url=https://archive.is/20140709172255/http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football-28195661|archive-date=9 July 2014}}</ref> and his competitive debut came on 10 August in the [[2014 FA Community Shield]], playing the full 90 minutes in a 0–3 loss to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] at [[Wembley Stadium]];<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28647186|title=Arsenal 3–0 Manchester City|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Sanghera|first=Mandeep|date=10 August 2014|accessdate=10 August 2014}}</ref> a week later, in the [[Premier League]] opener, he was an unused substitute at [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28730044|title=Newcastle United 0–2 Manchester City|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Chowdhury|first=Saj|date=17 August 2014|accessdate=17 August 2014}}</ref>
Caballero's second official appearance for City occurred on 24 September 2014, in the [[2014–15 Football League Cup|7–0 home routing]] of [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] for the [[Football League Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/29233053|title=Manchester City 7–0 Sheffield Wednesday|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 September 2014|accessdate=1 July 2018}}</ref> He made his first league appearance away against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] three days later, relegating longtime incumbent [[Joe Hart]] to the bench in a 4–2 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29289927|title=Hull City 2–4 Manchester City|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Keegan|first=Mike|date=27 September 2014|accessdate=1 October 2014}}</ref>
Caballero's third league match was on 26 September 2015, a 1–4 defeat at [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] which was described as 'a day to forget'.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3250053/Harry-Kane-gets-mark-Willy-Caballero-day-forget-goal-Manchester-City-PLAYER-RATINGS.html|title=Harry Kane gets off the mark as Willy Caballero has a day to forget in goal for Manchester City – Player ratings|newspaper=[[Daily Mail]]|last=Al-Samarrai|first=Riath|date=26 September 2015|accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref> Throughout [[2015–16 Premier League|the season]], he was first-choice in the [[2015–16 Football League Cup|League Cup]], receiving criticism in the national press before [[2016 Football League Cup Final|the final]] following the [[2015–16 FA Cup|1–5 loss]] to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in the [[FA Cup]] where he was adjudged to be at fault for two goals;<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/article-3465960/HOT-NOT-Manchester-City-huge-gamble-Willy-Caballero-Marc-Andre-Ter-Stegen-proves-worth-Barcelona.html|title=HOT OR NOT: Manchester City to take huge gamble on Willy Caballero while Marc-Andre Ter Stegen proves his worth for Barcelona|newspaper=Daily Mail|last=Ladyman|first=Ian|date=26 February 2016|accessdate=1 March 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3467857/Manchester-City-goalkeeper-Willy-Caballero-shrugs-criticism-amid-calls-Joe-Hart-replace-Capital-One-Cup-final-don-t-care-people-think.html|title=Manchester City goalkeeper Willy Caballero shrugs off criticism amid calls for Joe Hart to replace him in Capital One Cup final: 'I don't care what people think'|newspaper=Daily Mail|last=Banerjee|first=Rohan|date=26 February 2016|accessdate=1 March 2016}}</ref> in the decisive match at [[Wembley Stadium]], he saved three attempts in the 3–1 penalty shootout triumph against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]],<ref name=LCUP>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/35264205|title=League Cup final: Man City win on penalties|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Rostance|first=Tom|date=28 February 2016|accessdate=28 February 2016}}</ref> and Pellegrini subsequently said he would rather lose the match to keep his word, whilst several pundits added that both player and manager deserved an apology with some remarking the performance was a lesson in loyalty.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35683434|title=Capital One Cup: Manuel Pellegrini's selection policies pay off|publisher=BBC Sport|last=McNulty|first=Phil|date=29 February 2016|accessdate=1 March 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/manchester-citys-willy-caballero-owed-10963105|title=Manchester City's Willy Caballero owed an apology after producing stunning League Cup winning display|newspaper=[[Manchester Evening News]]|last=Brennan|first=Stuart|date=1 March 2016|accessdate=1 March 2016}}</ref>
Following the appointment of manager [[Pep Guardiola]] in the 2016 off-season, Caballero became the starter over Hart.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/manchester-city-news-pep-guardiola-defends-decision-to-drop-joe-hart-for-in-form-willy-caballero-a7189501.html|title=Manchester City news: Pep Guardiola defends decision to drop Joe Hart for 'in-form' Willy Caballero|newspaper=[[The Independent]]|last=Rich|first=Tim|date=13 August 2016|accessdate=17 August 2016}}</ref> Soon after, with the signing of [[Claudio Bravo]], he returned to his backup role.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/willy-caballero-lavishes-praise-joe-8765211|title=Willy Caballero lavishes praise on Joe Hart and backs him to succeed in Serie A with Torino|newspaper=[[Daily Mirror]]|last=McLeman|first=Neil|date=4 September 2016|accessdate=17 January 2017}}</ref>
On 19 October 2016, Caballero appeared as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in a 0–4 defeat by [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] at the [[Camp Nou]] in [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League|the group stage]] of the [[UEFA Champions League]]. After replacing the red-carded Bravo in goal, he saved a [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty]] from [[Neymar]] in the 87th minute of the match.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/sport/soccer/barcelona-hand-manchester-city-champions-league-thrashing-as-lionel-messi-scores-treble-20161019-gs6bi6.html|title=Barcelona hand Manchester City Champions League thrashing as Lionel Messi scores treble|newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|date=20 October 2016|accessdate=22 February 2017}}</ref> Two weeks later, he deputised for the suspended Bravo in the 3–1 home win over the same opponent for the same competition.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37823784|title=Manchester City 3–1 Barcelona|publisher=BBC Sport|last=McNulty|first=Phil|date=1 November 2016|accessdate=22 February 2017}}</ref>
On 1 February 2017, Caballero replaced Bravo after a run of form which had seen the Chilean concede 28 goals from 22 appearances.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/2749074/manchester-city-claudio-bravo-worst-goalkeeper-premier-league|title=Claudio Bravo dropped by Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola: Here is why he is officially the worst goalkeeper in the Premier League|newspaper=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|last=Fraser|first=Dave|date=31 January 2017|accessdate=22 February 2017}}</ref> On his return to the starting XI, he kept a clean sheet in a 4–0 win over [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] at the [[London Olympic Stadium]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38740421|title=West Ham United 0–4 Manchester City|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Begley|first=Emlyn|date=1 February 2017|accessdate=22 February 2017}}</ref> Late into the month, in a 5–3 Champions League [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League knockout phase#Round of 16|round of 16]] win over [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]], he saved a penalty from [[Radamel Falcao]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/02/21/manchester-city-vs-monaco-champions-league-live-score-updates/|title=Manchester City 5 Monaco 3: City stun manic visitors in showstopping eight goal thriller|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|last=Wallace|first=Sam|date=21 February 2017|accessdate=22 February 2017}}</ref>
On 25 May 2017, it was announced Caballero would leave the club on the expiry of his contract, which occurred on 30 June.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/2017/05/25/willy-caballero-leaves-man-city-news/1495554392043|title=Willy Caballero to leave Man City|publisher=Manchester City F.C|date=25 May 2017|access-date=25 May 2017}}</ref>
===Chelsea=== [[File:Willy Caballero 20180106.jpg|thumb|150px|left|Caballero playing for Chelsea in 2018]] On 1 July 2017, Caballero signed for [[2016–17 Premier League|title holders]] Chelsea on a [[Free transfer (association football)|free transfer]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40466921|title=Willy Caballero: Chelsea sign former Manchester City goalkeeper|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 July 2017|access-date=1 July 2017}}</ref> He made his competitive debut on 20 September, in a [[2017–18 EFL Cup|5–1 home win]] against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] for the League Cup.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41249727|title=Chelsea 5–1 Nottingham Forest|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Phillips|first=Owen|date=20 September 2017|access-date=21 September 2017}}</ref>
On 17 January 2018, Caballero saved a penalty from [[Nélson Oliveira]] in the shootout of a [[2017–18 FA Cup|third round FA Cup replay win]] over [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]], which had finished 1–1 after [[Overtime (sports)|extra time]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/906252/Chelsea-1-Norwich-1-Batshuayi-FA-Cup-Conte-Caballero-Pedro-Morata|title=Chelsea 1 – Norwich City 1 (Blues win 5–3 on pens): Caballero the hero in FA Cup thriller|newspaper=The Independent|last=Dunn|first=Matthew|date=18 January 2018|accessdate=18 January 2018}}</ref> Due to an ankle injury to first-choice [[Thibaut Courtois]], he made his Premier League debut away to [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] two days later, in a 4–0 success.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.londonnewsonline.co.uk/hazards-brace-inspires-blues-to-thump-brighton-4-0/|title=Hazard's brace inspires Blues to thump Brighton 4–0|newspaper=[[South London Press]]|last=Lagan|first=Paul|date=20 January 2018|accessdate=20 January 2018}}</ref>
On 24 February 2019, during the [[2019 EFL Cup Final]] against cup holders Manchester City, with the match at 0–0 and a penalty shootout imminent, Chelsea goalkeeper [[Kepa Arrizabalaga]] refused to be substituted off for Caballero to face his old club as the team went on to lose 3–4.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2019/02/24/chelsea-vs-manchester-city-carabao-cup-final-2019-live-score/|title=Manchester City take the honours after Kepa Arrizabalaga antics overshadow otherwise drab League Cup final|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|last1=Burt|first1=Jason|last2=Tyers|first2=Alan|date=24 February 2019|accessdate=25 February 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.sky.com/story/watch-kepa-arrizabalaga-defies-furious-chelsea-boss-maurizio-sarri-in-carabao-cup-final-11647428|title=WATCH: Kepa Arrizabalaga defies furious Chelsea boss Maurizio Sarri in Carabao Cup final|publisher=[[Sky News]]|date=25 February 2019|accessdate=25 February 2019}}</ref>
==International career== Caballero played for [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] at [[Argentina national under-20 football team|under-20 level]], helping the nation win the [[2001 FIFA World Youth Championship]] by playing in the competition's last two games.<ref>{{FIFA player|181440}}</ref> In 2004, he was picked for the [[Football at the 2004 Summer Olympics|gold medal]]-winning squad at the [[2004 Summer Olympics]] as backup to [[Germán Lux]] (also first-choice in the previous tournament).
Caballero was an unused member for the senior squad at the [[2005 FIFA Confederations Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.lanacion.com.ar/711611-nos-debiamos-un-partido-asi|title="Nos debíamos un partido así"|trans-title="We had a game like this coming our way"|newspaper=[[La Nación]]|language=es|date=10 June 2005|accessdate=23 March 2018}}</ref> In November 2014, he was called by manager [[Gerardo Martino]] for [[Exhibition game|friendlies]] against [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]] and [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12026/9537920/tevez-earns-argentina-recall|title=International football: Argentina recall Carlos Tevez for Croatia and Portugal friendlies|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|date=27 October 2014|accessdate=1 March 2016}}</ref> He only won his first [[Cap (sport)|cap]] nearly four years later at the age of 36, starting in a 2–0 defeat of [[Italy national football team|Italy]] on 23 March 2018 in another exhibition game, played in [[Manchester]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.lanacion.com.ar/2119543-argentina-italia-amistoso-internacional-rumbo-al-mundial-rusia-2018-horario-tv-y-formaciones|title=Con goles de Banega y Lanzini, y sin Messi, Argentina le ganó 2–0 a Italia|trans-title=With goals from Banega and Lanzini, and without Messi, Argentina beat Italy 2–0|newspaper=La Nación|language=es|date=23 March 2018|accessdate=23 March 2018}}</ref>
Caballero was included in the final squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44203700|title=World Cup 2018: Messi and Aguero in Argentina squad but Icardi out|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 May 2018|accessdate=23 May 2018}}</ref> He started the tournament due to the injury of habitual first-choice [[Sergio Romero]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://sports.abs-cbn.com/2018fifaworldcup/news/2018/05/24/argentina-goalkeeper-romero-world-cup-injury-42025|title=Argentina goalkeeper Romero out of World Cup with injury|publisher=[[ABS-CBN]]|date=24 May 2018|accessdate=16 June 2018}}</ref> and made his debut in [[FIFA World Cup|the competition]] on 16 June in a 1–1 group stage draw against [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44422188|title=Argentina 1–1 Iceland|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Bevan|first=Chris|date=16 June 2018|accessdate=16 June 2018}}</ref> In the next match against [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]], his mistake handed the opposition the first goal in a 0–3 defeat,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/world-cup-2018/6594879/world-cup-2018-willy-caballero-mistake-argentina-croatia|title=CAB FOR WILLY World Cup 2018: Willy Caballero’s mistake slammed by fans as Croatia smash Argentina|newspaper=The Sun|last=Chapman|first=Anthony|date=21 June 2018|accessdate=22 June 2018}}</ref> and he was subsequently dropped by manager [[Jorge Sampaoli]] in favour of [[Franco Armani]] for the team's final group match against [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]], which ended in a 2–1 win;<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-soccer-worldcup-nga-arg/aguero-and-caballero-dropped-by-argentina-idUSKBN1JM2G8|title=Aguero and Caballero dropped by Argentina|publisher=[[Reuters]]|date=26 June 2018|accessdate=1 July 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44439263|title=Nigeria 1–2 Argentina|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Skelton|first=Jack|date=26 June 2018|accessdate=1 July 2018}}</ref> he also did not feature in the round of 16 game, a 3–4 loss to [[France national football team|France]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/43976007|title=France 4–3 Argentina|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Begley|first=Emlyn|date=30 June 2018|accessdate=1 July 2018}}</ref>

Russia]]|}} }} '''Mateo Kovačić''' ({{IPA-sh|matěo kǒʋatʃitɕ|hr}};{{cite web|url=http://hjp.znanje.hr/index.php?show=search_by_id&id=e1tnXBk%3D&keyword=Sv.|title=Màtej|quote=Matèo|website=Hrvatski jezični portal|accessdate=17 March 2018|language=sh}}{{cite web|url=http://hjp.znanje.hr/index.php?show=search_by_id&id=ellgUBQ%3D|title=kòvati|quote=Kòvačič|website=Hrvatski jezični portal|accessdate=17 March 2018|language=sh}} born 6 May 1994) is a Croatian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for English club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], on loan from [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], and the [[Croatia national football team|Croatia national team]]. Kovačić is usually deployed as a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfielder]] or [[Midfielder#Deep-lying playmaker|deep-lying playmaker]], but he is considered to be a versatile midfielder, having played in different positions and adapted to playing either [[Midfielder#Winger|wide]] on the left or as an [[midfielder|attacking midfielder]].{{cite web |title=Who is Inter new boy Mateo Kovacic? |url=http://forzaitalianfootball.com/2013/02/who-is-inter-new-boy-mateo-kovacic/ |publisher=Forza Italian Football |date=3 February 2013 |accessdate=8 April 2013}} Kovačić began his professional career with [[GNK Dinamo Zagreb|Dinamo Zagreb]] at the age of 16, with whom he won two consecutive league titles, before joining [[Inter Milan|Inter]] in 2013. After the [[2014–15 Inter Milan season|2014–15 season]], he moved to Real Madrid, where he has won the Champions League on three occasions. A full Croatian international since 2013, Kovačić represented the nation at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], [[UEFA Euro 2016]] and the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], including a runner's up finish in the latter tournament. He is nicknamed ''Il Professore (The Professor).''{{cite news |title=Mateo Kovacic: Scout Report Inter’s creative midfield talent |url=http://outsideoftheboot.com/2014/01/23/mateo-kovacic-scout-report/ |publisher=Outside of the Boot |date=23 January 2014 |accessdate=22 September 2015}}{{cite news |title=Kovavic il migliore con la Croazia, soprannominato dai compagni "il Professore" |url=http://www.diggita.it/story.php?title=Kovavic_il_migliore_con_la_Croazia_soprannominato_dai_compagni_il_Professore-1 |publisher=diggita.it |date=26 March 2013 |accessdate=22 September 2015}} ==Club career== ===Youth career=== Born in [[Linz]], Austria, to [[Bosnian Croat]] parents who had moved there from [[Kotor Varoš]] in Bosnia and Herzegovina, Kovačić began playing at an early age at the local [[LASK Linz]]'s academy.{{cite news |url=http://www.jutarnji.hr/mateo-kovacic-kao-maradona--modric--pele---/905740/ |title=Meteor Kovačić: Svi su ludi za dječakom koji je već sa 13 igrao zrelo kao nekad Maradona |last=Židak |first=Tomislav |work=[[Jutarnji list]] |date=22 November 2010 |language=Croatian |accessdate=22 November 2010}} In 2007, when Kovačić was 13, he was spotted by scouts from several prominent European clubs, including [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]], [[Inter Milan]], [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] and [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]], but his family opted to move to [[Zagreb]] instead, where he joined the [[GNK Dinamo Zagreb Academy|academy]] of Croatian giants [[NK Dinamo Zagreb|Dinamo Zagreb]].{{cite news |url=http://www.jutarnji.hr/mateo-kovacic--kako-je-stvoren-igrac-od-100-milijuna-kuna/1082758/ |title=Cijela istina o Mateu Kovačiću |last=Cigoj |first=Mark |work=Jutarnji list |date=2 February 2013 |language=Croatian |accessdate=1 June 2014}} Kovačić suffered a serious injury in 2009 in which his leg was broken, but he returned to the pitch after a lengthy recovery on 31 May 2010, appearing in the last match of the [[Prva HNL Academy|Croatian under-17 academy league]], a 5–0 win against [[RNK Split]] under-17s.{{cite news |url=http://www.hrsport.net/vijesti/398143/nogomet-1-hnl/kadeti-dinama-za-naslov-prestigli-hajduk |title=Kadeti Dinama za naslov prestigli Hajduk |last=Rupnik |first=Borna |date=31 May 2010 |publisher=[[Sportnet.hr|Sportnet]] |language=Croatian |accessdate=22 November 2010}} ===Dinamo Zagreb=== Kovačić started training with the club's senior squad under manager, [[Vahid Halilhodžić]], four months later, on 6 October 2010,{{cite news |url=http://sportske.jutarnji.hr/mateo-kovacic-od-danas-trenira-sa-seniorima-dinama--plasi-me-nadimak-hrvatski-messi/892846/ |title=Mateo Kovačić od danas trenira sa seniorima Dinama: Plaši me nadimak Hrvatski Messi |date=6 October 2010 |newspaper=[[Sportske novosti]] |language=Croatian |accessdate=20 November 2010}} but continued to appear for the club in academy league matches during October. Later that month, it was reported by the local sports daily, ''[[Sportske novosti]]'', that [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]'s chief scout, Steve Rowley, had arrived in Zagreb to watch him perform in under-17 matches against [[HNK Cibalia|Cibalia]] and [[NK Zagreb]].{{cite news |url=http://sportske.jutarnji.hr/arsenal-dosao-po-matea-kovacica--dinamo-nasao-novo-cudo-od-djeteta---miralema-ramica/899213/ |title=Arsenal došao po Matea Kovačića, Dinamo našao novo čudo od djeteta — Miralema Ramića |date=29 October 2010 |newspaper=Sportske novosti |language=Croatian |accessdate=22 November 2010}} Kovačić eventually had his professional league debut in the [[2010–11 Prva HNL]] away match against [[NK Hrvatski dragovoljac|Hrvatski Dragovoljac]] on 20 November 2010, in which he scored Dinamo's fourth goal in their 6–0 win.{{cite news |url=http://www.hrsport.net/vijesti/407740/nogomet-1-hnl/i-kovacic-strijelac-u-dinamovoj-sestici |title=I Kovačić strijelac u Dinamovoj šestici |last=Rupnik |first=Borna |date=20 November 2010 |publisher=Sportnet |language=Croatian |accessdate=20 November 2010}} This made him the youngest goalscorer in the history of the league, at the age of 16 years and 198 days, breaking the record set only a week earlier by [[Dino Špehar]] who had scored for [[NK Osijek]] at the age of 16 years and 278 days on 13 November 2010.{{cite news |url=http://www.tportal.hr/sport/TcomPrvaHNL/97374/Mateo-Kovacic-najmladi-je-strijelac-Prve-HNL.html |title=Mateo Kovačić najmlađi je strijelac Prve HNL |date=20 November 2010 |publisher=TPortal |language=Croatian |accessdate=20 November 2010}}{{cite news |url=http://www.hrsport.net/vijesti/407385/nogomet-1-hnl/spehar-spasio-bijelo-plave |title=Špehar spasio bijelo-plave |last=Plavčić |first=Mario |date=13 November 2010 |work=Sportnet.hr |language=Croatian |accessdate=22 November 2010}} In his first senior season with Dinamo Zagreb he managed to appear in 7 matches, making a contribution in winning the league title. In the [[2011–12 Prva HNL|2011–12]] season, Kovačić rapidly established himself as a first team regular. He played mainly in the position of left midfielder in 4–2–3–1 system. In the beginning of the season, he helped the team reach the Group Stage of the season's [[2011–12 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] for the first time in 12 years. Being only 17 years old, he appeared in the starting lineup of Dinamo's first group match against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]]. He finished his first European season with Dinamo by scoring a goal against [[Olympique Lyonnais]] in the last game of the Group Stage in [[Zagreb]] and thus became the second youngest ever scorer in the Champions League. In the domestic league, he was a regular starter, appearing in 25 league matches and scoring five goals in the process. During a league match against [[NK Lučko]], he became the youngest player to wear the captain's armband in Dinamo's history, taking the captaincy from [[Leandro Cufre]].{{cite web |title=Kvačić najmlađi kapetan u Dnamovoj povijesti |url=http://www.tportal.hr/sport/prvaliga/145385/Kovacic-najmladi-kapetan-Dinama-u-povijesti.html#.UQm78x32_Wo |date=27 August 2011 |work=Tportal.hr |accessdate=31 January 2013}} It was another successful season for him in domestic competitions as he appeared in 32 domestic league and cup matches during that season, helping Dinamo to win their seventh consecutive league title. He also scored in the [[Croatian Football Cup|Croatian Cup]] final against [[NK Osijek]] on [[Maksimir Stadium]]. In December 2011, he was named [[Croatian Footballer of the Year#Hope of the Year|Croatian Football Hope of the Year]].{{cite news |title=Kovačiću trofej Nada godine: Liga prvaka je bila uživancija |url=http://www.24sata.hr/nogomet/kovacicu-trofej-nada-godine-liga-prvaka-je-bila-uzivancija-248104 |newspaper=[[24sata (Croatia)|24sata]] |date=31 December 2011 |language=Croatian |accessdate=31 December 2011}} In the beginning of [[2012–13 Prva HNL|2012–13]] season, he suffered a metatarsal bone injury that caused him to miss several games on the club's qualifying road to another Champions League. He returned just in time to play in Dinamo's first Champions League game against [[FC Porto|Porto]]. Kovačić played in all six Dinamo Zagreb's matches in the [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League group stage]], against Porto, [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] and [[FC Dynamo Kyiv|Dynamo Kyiv]]. He continued to impress with his mature performances at a young age during the first half of the season. In October 2012, he was nominated for [[Golden Boy (award)|Golden Boy]], an award given by sports journalists to a young player from Europe perceived to have been the most impressive during a season.{{cite news |title=Kovačić kandidat za prestižnu nagradu "Golden Boy 2012." |url=http://www.24sata.hr/nogomet/kovacic-kandidat-za-prestiznu-nagradu-golden-boy-2012-287471 |newspaper=24sata |date=20 October 2012 |language=Croatian |accessdate=31 January 2013}} During the season's winter break, Dinamo's board threw away the speculations about Kovačić leaving the club in the near future by saying they are building a new team around him and another rising star, [[Alen Halilović]].{{cite web |title=Kovačića i Halilovića nećemo prodati! |url=http://www.index.hr/sport/clanak/dinamo-sporting-nam-se-nije-javio-kovacica-i-halilovica-necemo-prodati/652404.aspx |publisher=index.hr |date=15 December 2012 |language=Croatian |accessdate=8 April 2013}} However, on 30 January 2013, the media surprisingly revealed Kovačić was sold to Italian [[Serie A]] club Inter Milan. During his time with Dinamo, Kovačić won two domestic league titles and two Croatian Cup titles, appearing in a total of 73 official matches, including 12 appearances in the UEFA Champions League. ===Inter Milan=== [[File:Mateo Kovacic.jpg|170px|right|thumb|Kovačić with Inter in February 2013.]] On 31 January 2013, Kovačić agreed to a transfer to Inter Milan. It was revealed the deal was worth €15 million in total, with €11 million paid immediately and €4 million when and if Inter qualifies for the [[UEFA Champions League]].{{cite news |title=Inter, Kovacic da 10, Maglia e calcio senza paura |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Squadre/Inter/02-02-2013/inter-kovacic-10-video-maglia-calcio-senza-paura-914107775713.shtml |first=Luca |last=Taidelli |newspaper=[[La Gazzetta dello Sport]] |date=2 February 2013 |language=Italian |accessdate=29 August 2014}} Upon his arrival, Kovačić was given the number 10 shirt, previously worn by [[Wesley Sneijder]]. ====2012–13 season==== Kovačić made his Inter Milan debut three days later on 3 February, coming on as a half-time substitute in a [[2012–13 Serie A|Serie A]] match against [[S.S. Robur Siena|Siena]].{{cite news |title=Siena-Inter 3-1, Stramaccioni affonda sotto i gol di Sestu e Emeghara |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Squadre/Siena/03-02-2013/siena-inter-3-1-male-nerazzurri-sestu-emeghara-dominano--914124870634.shtml |first=Valerio |last=Clari |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |date=3 February 2013 |language=Italian |accessdate=8 April 2013}} On 14 February, Kovačić made his European debut before the home crowd at [[San Siro]] in [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]] match against [[CFR Cluj]]. He provided the winning assist for [[Rodrigo Palacio]], who made it 2–0 for Inter, impressing the crowd with his performance, and was given standing ovations while being substituted off in the 89th minute.{{cite news |title=Inter-Cluj 2-0: Doppio Palacio, ottimo Kovacic, ma infortunio per Milito |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Squadre/Inter/14-02-2013/inter-cluj-2-0-doppio-palacio-ottimo-kovacic-ma-infortunio-milito-923391317.shtml |first=Valerio |last=Clari |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |date=15 February 2013 |language=Italian |accessdate=29 August 2014}} He also played full 90 minutes in the 3–0 away win against CFR Cluj as Inter proceeded to the next round of the [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League]].{{cite news |title=Europa League, Cluj-Inter 0-3: doppietta di Guarin, poi Benassi. Paura Ranocchia |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Squadre/Inter/21-02-2013/cluj-inter-0-3-doppietta-guarin-poi-benassi-ma-paura-ranocchia-92118521931.shtml |first=Valerio |last=Clari |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |date=21 February 2013 |language=Italian |accessdate=29 August 2014}} Kovačić made his first domestic league start for Inter in the next round of Serie A in a 1–4 away loss against [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]]. In the round of 16 of the UEFA Europa League, Inter was drawn to play against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]. After a 3–0 loss in London, Inter needed a 4–0 win in [[Milan]] to proceed to the next round. The match ended in a 4–1 win for Inter after the match went into extra time, with Kovačić playing as a starter. He impressed with his composure and playmaking ability, once again receiving ovations by the fans.{{cite news |title=Inter-Tottenham 4-1, Cassano da applausi, ma non basta: Spurs ai quarti |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Squadre/Inter/14-03-2013/europa-league-inter-tottenham-92474067493.shtml |first=Valerio |last=Clari |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |date=14 March 2013 |language=Italian |accessdate=29 August 2014}} Then-Inter manager [[Andrea Stramaccioni]] hailed his performances on several occasions, describing him as a "star for the future".{{cite web |title=Inter Milan coach Andrea Stramaccioni hails Mateo Kovacic |url=http://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/inter-milan/news/stramaccioni-hails-kovacic_74900.html |last=Mondal |first=Subhankar |date=18 March 2013 |publisher=Sportsmole.co.uk |accessdate=8 April 2013}} On 30 March, Kovačić was a starter in his first ''[[Derby d'Italia]]'' against Juventus at San Siro. The derby ended in a 1–2 win for Juventus, with Kovačić starting the action that resulted in Rodrigo Palacio's 1–1 equalizer.{{cite news |title=Inter-Juve. Con Kovacic e Pirlo, precisione al potere |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/SerieA/Bigmatch/31-03-2013/inter-juve-kovacic-pirlo-precisione-potere-92754618835.shtml |first=Andrea |last=Schianchi |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |date=31 March 2013 |language=Italian |accessdate=31 March 2013}} Kovačić was a starter in Inter's next Serie A match, a 0–2 away win against [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]], as well as in their surprising 3–4 loss to [[Atalanta B.C.|Atalanta]] at San Siro, where he provided an assist for [[Ricky Álvarez]]'s goal.{{cite news |title=Sampdoria-Inter 0-2, decide la doppietta di Palacio |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Squadre/Sampdoria/03-04-2013/solito-palacio-stende-samp-inter-stramaccioni-respirano-92805504703.shtml |first=Jacopo |last=Gerna |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |date=4 April 2013 |language=Italian |accessdate=29 August 2014}}{{cite news |title=Inter-Atalanta 3-4, tripletta di Denis fra errori, botte e rimonte |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Squadre/Inter/07-04-2013/inter-atalanta-3-4-tripletta-denis-errori-botte-rimonte-92875894700.shtml |first=Valerio |last=Clari |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |date=8 April 2013 |language=Italian |accessdate=29 August 2013}} By the end of the second half of the season, he was a starter in all of the club's Serie A fixtures, as Inter finished in disappointing ninth place on the Serie A table. In May, he was given the "Gentleman Revelation of the Year" award, awarded by Inter fans.{{cite news |title=Zanetti fa 13: vince ancora il Gentleman Kovacic e De Sciglio i migliori giovani |url=http://archiviostorico.gazzetta.it/2013/maggio/09/Zanetti_vince_ancora_Gentleman_Kovacic_ga_0_20130509_a099669c-b86c-11e2-bc10-72b41185888f.shtml |first=Francesco |last=Velluzzi |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |date=9 May 2013 |language=Italian |accessdate=29 August 2013}} ====2013–14 season==== Kovačić missed most of the pre-season training with the squad due to series of small ChievoVerona|Chievo]] and scored a wonder goal in a 2–2 drawn against Lazio. On 6 January 2015, he was sent-off in a 1–1 draw with Juventus for a foul on [[Stephan Lichtsteiner]].{{cite news |title=Juventus 1-1 Inter Milan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30687617 |accessdate=7 January 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 January 2014}} Three days later, Kovačić renewed his contract with Inter until June 2019.{{cite news |title=Kovačić extends Inter deal till 2019 |url=http://www.inter.it/en/news/47286 |accessdate=9 January 2015 |work=[[Inter Milan|inter.it]] |date=9 January 2014}} ===Real Madrid=== [[File:Mateo Kovačić 2015.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Kovačić playing for Real Madrid in a Champions League match against Shakhtar Donetsk in 2015.]] On 16 August 2015, Inter manager [[Roberto Mancini]] confirmed the club was forced to sell Kovačić to [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] due to [[UEFA Financial Fair Play Regulations|Financial Fair Play]] regulations. Speaking during a press conference after a friendly against Greek club [[AEK Athens F.C.|AEK Athens]], Mancini said, "There are rules that have to be respected. I don't think anyone wanted this to happen but we have the Financial Fair Play regulations to follow. We're all sorry about it: myself, the president, the management and the players themselves."{{cite web |url=http://www.inter.it/en/news/48790 |title=Mancini: "We had our chances" |date=16 August 2015 |publisher=[[Inter Milan]] |accessdate=18 August 2015}} Real Madrid also confirmed the transfer two days later, announcing Kovačić had signed a six-year contract with the club.{{cite web |url=http://www.realmadrid.com/en/news/2015/08/official-announcement-mateo-kova%C4%8Di%C4%87 |title=Official announcement: Mateo Kovačić |date=18 August 2015 |publisher=[[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid Club de Fútbol]] |accessdate=18 August 2015}}{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/aug/16/real-madrid-internazionale-mateo-kovacic |title=Real Madrid agree €32m fee with Internazionale to sign Mateo Kovacic |last1=Christenson |first1=Marcus |last2=Romano |first2=Fabrizio |date=16 August 2015 |accessdate=28 August 2015 |work=The Guardian}} The transfer fee was €29 million, according to Inter's financial filing in the section Management Report ({{lang-it|Relazione sulla Gestione}}).F.C. |url=http://www.realmadrid.com/en/news/2015/08/kovacic-being-at-the-biggest-club-in-the-world-is-really-special |title=Kovacic: "Being at the biggest club in the world is really special" |date=19 Jarni]] and [[Luka Modrić]], to join Real Madrid.{{cite web |title=Kovačić peti Hrvat u dresu Kraljevskog kluba |url=http://sport.hrt.hr/295444/kovacic-peti-hrvat-u-dresu-kraljevskog-kluba 2015–16 season]] Four days after his presentation, he made his debut as a 70th-minute substitute for [[Isco]] as Real Madrid began the [[La Liga|Liga]] [[2015–16 La Liga|season]] with a goalless draw at promoted [[Sporting de Gijón]].{{cite news |title=Sporting spoil Benítez debut |url=http://www.marca.com/en/2015/08/23/en/football/real_madrid/1440360649.html |accessdate=23 August 2015 |work=Marca|location=Spain |date=23 August 2015}} He scored his first goal in an 8–0 home win over [[Malmö FF]] on 8 December 2015.{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2016/matches/round=2000634/match=2015746/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Ronaldo rampant as Madrid put eight past Malmö |publisher=[[UEFA]] |date=8 December 2015}} On 3 January 2016, Kovačić received a straight red card in a 2–2 draw at [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] for a foul on [[João Cancelo]].{{cite news |last1=Begley |first1=Emlyn |title=Valencia 2–2 Real Madrid |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35155362 |accessdate=3 January 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 January 2016}} Until the end of his first season with ''Los Blancos'', he made a total of 34 appearances. In the opening months of the season, he was used quite regularly by then Real Madrid manager [[Rafael Benítez]], playing in almost every midfield position there is – sometimes central, sometimes wide, sometimes further forward. However, after [[Zinedine Zidane]] replaced Benítez in early January, Kovačić's appearances became increasingly infrequent. With the Frenchman preferring to use a very defined starting 11 whenever possible instead of the more specific-lineups-for-specific-opponents approach employed by his predecessor, there was little room for Kovačić. He made eight appearances and scored one goal en Real Madrid's route to the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League]] title.{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2016/matches/round=2000638/match=2015789/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Spot-on Real Madrid defeat Atlético in final again |date=28 May 2016 |publisher=UEFA}} Kovačić scored his first Liga goal on 29 January 2017 in a 3–0 win over [[Real Sociedad]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38719239|title=Real Madrid 3–0 Real Sociedad|date=29 January 2017|publisher=bbc.co.uk}} He was a part-time starter when Madrid won the [[2016–17 La Liga]]{{cite web|url=http://www.laliga.es/noticias/real-madrid-campeon-de-laliga-santander-2016-17|title=El Real Madrid, campeón de LaLiga Santander 2016/17|date=21 May 2017|work=laliga.es}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39926301|title=Real Madrid win La Liga title with victory at Malaga|date=21 May 2017|work=bbc.com}} and the [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League]].{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2017/matches/round=2000787/match=2019641/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Majestic Real Madrid win Champions League in Cardiff|date=3 June against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on 18 August, appearing as a second-half substitute.{{cite web|url=https://www.givemesport.com/1374987-mateo-kovacics-individual-highlights-against-arsenal-have-now-emerged|title=Mateo Kovacic's individual highlights against Arsenal have now emerged|date=19 August 2018|work=GiveMeSport}} ==International career== [[File:Mateo Kovacic - Croatia vs. Portugal, 10th June 2013.jpg|290px|thumb|Kovačić with the national team in June 2013.]] Kovačić appeared for the Croatian national team at various youth levels, debuting in May 2008 in an under-14 friendly match against Slovakia.{{cite web |url=http://www.hns-cff.hr/?ln=hr&w=statistike&repka=U&id=156397 |title=Statistike — Nastupi: Mateo Kovačić |publisher=[[Croatian Football Federation]] |language=Croatian |accessdate=20 November 2010}} Since 2011, he was a regular member of the Croatia under-19 and under-21 teams. In August 2012, Kovačić received his first competitive call-up for the [[Croatia national football team|Croatian senior team]] match against [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]], but did not play because of injury.{{cite news |title=Štimac pozvao Kovačića |url=http://sportske.jutarnji.hr/igor-stimac-za-svicarsku-pozvao-malocu--vukusica--kovacica--sammir-jos-uvijek-na-cekanju/1044377/ |date=30 July 2012 |language=Croatian |accessdate=31 January 2013}} Subsequently, he received a call up for [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification]] matches in March 2013. He made his senior debut in a qualification match against [[Serbia national football team|Serbia]] on 22 March 2013, playing as a central midfielder alongside Luka Modrić, instead of a regular team starter, [[Ognjen Vukojević]].{{cite web |title=Štimac: "Odluku o Kovačiću 'prelomio' sam sinoć, odigrao je za desetku" |url=http://www.hrsport.net/vijesti/458465/nogomet-reprezentacija/stimac-odluku-o-kovacicu-prelomio-sam-sinoc-odigrao-je-za-desetku/ |publisher=Sportnet |date=22 March 2013 |language=Croatian |accessdate=23 March 2013}} Four days later, he played against [[Wales national football team|Wales]] at [[Liberty Stadium]], coming on as a second-half substitute in a 1–2 win. His third match of the campaign came in June, when Croatia faced [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] in Zagreb and suffered a frustrating defeat as they were unable to score despite a string of good chances. By the end of the qualifiers, Kovačić made two more competitive appearances for Croatia, as Croatia scraped into the [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Second Round|FIFA World Cup play-offs]] having taken only one point from their last four qualifiers. Although he didn't participate in the scoreless first leg of the play-off against [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]] in [[Reykjavík]], Kovačić started the second and decisive leg between the two national teams in Zagreb, making an assist for the team's second goal as they reached the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] finals 2–0 on aggregate.{{cite news |title=Ten-man Croatia reached the 2014 World Cup finals |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/24907602 |date=19 November 2013 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=31 January 2014}} On 2 June 2014, Kovačić was confirmed as a member of Croatia's [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] squad.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/croatia/10810185/Croatia-World-Cup-2014-squad.html |title=Croatia World Cup 2014 squad |date=2 June 2014 |work=The Telegraph |accessdate=19 June 2014}} He was in Croatia's starting team for the opening game of the tournament, a 3–1 defeat to World Cup hosts [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] at the [[Arena Corinthians]], São Paulo, where he played for his team for 60 minutes before being substituted.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285029 |title=Brazil 3-1 Croatia |date=12 June 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=20 June 2014}} He went to play all the remaining games in the group stage, as Croatia was eliminated in a group stage. On 7 June 2015, he scored his first international goal in a 4–0 victory over [[Gibraltar national football team|Gibraltar]], coming in his 20th appearance for the team.{{cite web|url=https://www.croatiaweek.com/croatia-4-0-gibraltar-mission-accomplished-kovac|title=Croatia 4-0 Gibraltar: ‘Mission Accomplished’- Kovač|publisher=Croatia Week|accessdate=23 June 2018}} On 4 June 2018, Kovačić was selected in Croatia's 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].{{cite web|url=https://www.sportsnet.ca/soccer/modric-rakitic-headline-croatias-world-cup-squad|title=Modric, Rakitic headline Croatia’s World Cup squad|publisher=Sportsnet|accessdate=23 June 2018}} On 22 June, Kovačić provided an assist to his teammate [[Ivan Rakitić]] as he scored Croatia's third goal in a 3–0 win over [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] in their second group stage match of the tournament.{{cite web|url=https://www.whoscored.com/Matches/1249922/Live/International-FIFA-World-Cup-2018-Argentina-Croatia|title=Argentina 0-3 Croatia - FIFA World Cup 2018 Live|publisher=Whoscored.com|accessdate=23 June 2018}} Croatia was beaten 4–2 by [[France national football team|France]] in [[2018 FIFA World Cup Final|the final]] on 15 July.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44754965|title=France 4–2 Croatia: France beat Croatia in thrilling World Cup final |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 July 2018|access-date=15 July 2018|last=McNulty|first=Phil}} ==Style of play== [[File:Mateo Kovacic 21032013 2 Zagrebello roberta f.jpg|170px|left|thumb|Kovačić training with the [[Croatia national football team]] in March 2013]] Kovačić has been described as a great technician with excellent [[Dribbling#Association football|dribbling]] abilities.{{cite news |title=Kovacic compared with Roberto Baggio |url=http://www.football-italia.net/30222/kovacic-compared-baggio |date=1 February 2013 |publisher=football-italia.net |accessdate=17 February 2013}}{{cite web |last=Mehrotra |first=Aakriti |title=Mateo Kovacic: Scout Report — Inter’s creative midfield talent |url=http://outsideoftheboot.com/2014/01/23/mateo-kovacic-scout-report/# |work=Outside of the Boot |accessdate=1 February 2014}}{{cite web |title=Stats Show Mateo Kovacic As One Of Europe’s Best Dribblers |url=http://www.zimbio.com/Mateo+Kovacic/articles/Eyd0yinCbnH/Stats+Show+Mateo+Kovacic+One+Europe+Best+Dribblers |publisher=interfanclub.com |accessdate=1 February 2014}} He is considered to be a versatile midfielder, having played in different midfield positions. He started off as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]] at Dinamo Zagreb, but he transformed his game at Inter where he was deployed out wide and also as a central midfielder, functioning as a deep-lying playmaker, while being coached by Andrea Stramaccioni. One of his trademarks is dropping deep to receive the ball and then driving forward, often performing his slalom runs. Under the coach, Walter Mazzarri, he was often used in a more advanced position. Former manager [[Giovanni Trapattoni]] once claimed that Kovačić knows how to really reach the ball from deep and drive up the pitch like a 'raging bull'.{{cite web |last=Higgins |first=Timm |title=Could Mateo Kovacic Be The Heir To Luka Modric’s Crown? |url=http://www.managingmadrid.com/2017/2/10/14557684/could-mateo-kovacic-be-the-heir-to-luka-modrics-crown |work=Managing Madrid |accessdate=12 February 2017 |date=10 February 2017}} Proven by his pass completion percentages, Kovačić is known for distributing the ball up the pitch. ;Reception The Croatia under-17 manager, [[Martin Novoselac]], reportedly said of Kovačić, "I haven't seen a youngster with so much talent since the days of Robert Prosinečki," referring to his fast development and talent. Kovačić revealed that precisely Prosinečki is the player he admired the most while growing up.{{cite web |title=Kovačić otkrio Talijanima koga je 'snimao' |url=http://www.tportal.hr/sport/nogomet/242330/Kovacic-otkrio-Talijanima-koga-je-volio-gledati.html |publisher=Tportal.hr |date=8 February 2013 |language=Croatian |accessdate=12 May 2013}} His compatriot, [[Zvonimir Boban]], who played for [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] for over a decade, in an interview with [[Sky Italia]] (in 2013) said, "He has talents that could make him even better than me, he is an incredibly serious professional for someone his age. Kovačić is a complete player. He is not a born regista but he is playing there now. He is a complete talent that can still grow — he has incredible potential."{{cite news |title=Inter snap up Kovacic and Kuzmanovic |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/1320857/inter-snap-kovacic-kuzmanovic?cc=5739 |date=31 January 2013 |publisher=[[ESPN]] |accessdate=3 February 2013}} Trapattoni described him as "a mixture of [[Kaká]] and [[Clarence Seedorf]]", because of his style of play and technical characteristics.{{cite news |title='Kovacic is a mix of Kaka and Seedorf' - Trapattoni |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/10/italy/2013/11/24/4428536/kovacic-is-a-mix-of-kaka-and-seedorf-trapattoni |date=24 November 2013 |publisher=Goal.com |accessdate=5 December 2013}} Long-time Inter captain [[Javier Zanetti]] stated that, with the exception of [[Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)|Ronaldo]], who had arrived to Inter when he was 21, Kovačić was the most promising youngster he had seen in his 19 years at the club.{{cite web |title=Face to face: Javier Zanetti |url=http://www.worldsoccer.com/features/face-to-face-javier-zanetti |first=Jamie |last=Rainbow |date=12 August 2013 |publisher=WorldSoccer |accessdate=1 February 2014}} ==Personal life== Kovačić is a devout [[Catholicism|Roman Catholic]] and he attends church every Sunday.{{cite web |title=Mateo Kovačić: Hrvati, uzdajmo se u Boga! Dičimo se svojim i ne vrijeđajmo druge |url=http://www.zupa-svanastazija.com/novost/mateo-kovacic-hrvati-uzdajmo-se-u-boga-dicimo-se-svojim-i-ne-vrijedajmo-druge/582/ |accessdate=22 June 2016}} He speaks five languages; English, Croatian, German, Spanish and Italian.{{cite news |title=El vídeo que demuestra que Kovacic habla ¡5 idiomas! |date=7 December 2016 |publisher=Marca {{Medal|RU|[[UEFA Euro 2016|2016 France]]|}} | club-update = 04:16, 28 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 22 March 2019 }} '''Olivier Jonathan Giroud''' ({{IPA-fr|ɔlivje ʒiʁu}}; born 30 September 1986) is a French professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for {{English football updater|Chelsea}} club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and the [[France national football team|France national team]].
He began his career at [[Grenoble Foot 38|Grenoble]] in [[Ligue 2]] before joining [[Tours FC|Tours]] in 2008. In his [[2009–10 Ligue 2|second season]] at Tours, he was the division's top scorer with 21 goals, earning him a move to top-flight side [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier]]. Giroud was again the top scorer with 21 goals in the [[2011–12 Ligue 1|2011–12 season]], giving the club their first ever [[Ligue 1]] title before moving to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]. Giroud won the [[FA Cup]] with Arsenal in [[2014 FA Cup Final|2014]], [[2015 FA Cup Final|2015]] and [[2017 FA Cup Final|2017]], and totalled 105 goals in 253 games for the club. In January 2018, he transferred to Chelsea on an 18-month contract.
Giroud made his full international debut for France in 2011. He has earned over 80 caps, and was part of the teams which reached the quarter-finals at [[UEFA Euro 2012]] and the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], the final of [[UEFA Euro 2016]] in which he received the [[UEFA Euro 2016#Awards|Bronze Boot]] as joint second-highest goalscorer, and won the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].
==Early career== Giroud was born in [[Chambéry]], France in the [[Rhône-Alpes]] [[Regions of France|region]], and was raised in the nearby village of [[Froges]], close to [[Grenoble]].<ref name="giroud_career">{{cite news |title=Interview Olivier Giroud avant RC Strasbourg – Tours FC |url=http://toursfc.over-blog.com/article-interview-olivier-giroud-avant-rc-strasbourg-tours-fc-38281708.html|work=[[Tours FC]] | date= 27 October 2009 |accessdate=5 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref> Giroud is of Italian descent through both of his grandmothers.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rfgenealogie.com/s-informer/infos/celebrites/aux-origines-de-payet-giroud-et-griezmann|title=Aux origines de Payet, Giroud et Griezmann|first=eZ|last=Systems|website=La revue française de Généalogie}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sofoot.com/giroud-la-marseillaise-et-sa-mamie-223738.html|title=Giroud, la Marseillaise et sa mamie|website=''SOFOOT.com''}}</ref> Giroud began his football career playing for his hometown club, Olympique Club de Froges. He spent six years training at the club before joining professional club [[Grenoble Foot 38|Grenoble]] at the age of 13.<ref name="giroud_career"/>
==Club career== ===Grenoble=== Giroud spent five years developing in Grenoble's youth academy before signing his first professional contract at the age of 21. He later admitted that signing his first contract was an important part in his development as a player, stating "It took me signing my first professional contract to become aware of my abilities. If you [a club] trusted me, it was because I must have had some qualities."<ref name="giroud_lemonde">{{cite news |title=Olivier Giroud, buteur né |url=http://www.lemonde.fr/sport/article/2011/10/30/ligue-1-olivier-giroud-buteur-ne_1595293_3242.html|work=Le Monde | date= 30 October 2011 |accessdate=5 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref> Ahead of the [[2005–06 Ligue 2|2005–06 season]], he was promoted to the club's reserve team, which was playing in the [[Championnat de France amateur 2]], the fifth level of [[Football in France|French football]].
