Giroud quickly became an important player in the team scoring 15 goals in 15 matches.<ref name="giroud_lemonde"/> His performances over seven months with the reserve team resulted in the player being called up to the senior team in March 2006 by manager [[Thierry Goudet]]. Giroud made his professional debut on 27 March appearing as a late-match substitute in a 1–1 draw with [[FC Gueugnon|Gueugnon]] in [[Ligue 2]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Gueugnon v. Grenoble Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/50374|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=24 March 2006 |accessdate=5 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> He remained a part of the senior team for the rest of the campaign making five more substitute appearances.
Giroud was promoted to the senior team permanently for the [[2006–07 Ligue 2|2006–07]] season by new manager Payton Pouliquen and Nicola Malgeri and was assigned the number 22 shirt. After appearing as a substitute in the team's first league match of the campaign, he made his first professional start in a 2–1 defeat away to [[Chamois Niortais F.C.|Niort]] playing the entire match.<ref>{{cite news |title=Niort v. Grneoble Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/50922|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=4 August 2006 |accessdate=5 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> On 26 February 2007, Giroud scored his first professional goal netting the [[injury time]] winner against [[Le Havre AC|Le Havre]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Grenoble v. Le Havre Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/51254|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=26 February 2007 |accessdate=5 February 2012 }}</ref> He described the goal as "a fantastic memory. I could not dream better for a first pro goal". A month later, Giroud made his third start of the campaign against Gueugnon. In the match, which ended 0–0, Giroud incurred his first professional [[Penalty card|red card]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Gueugnon v. Grenoble Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/51172|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=30 March 2007 |accessdate=5 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> He finished the campaign with 18 total appearances and two goals as Grenoble finished in fifth place.
====Loan to Istres==== In an attempt to earn some playing time, Giroud spent the [[2007–08 Championnat National|2007–08 season]] on loan at [[FC Istres|Istres]] in the [[Championnat National]], the third level of football in France.<ref name="giroud_lemonde"/> Under the tutelage of manager [[Frédéric Arpinon]], he continued his development as a striker and, in his second match with the club, scored his first goal in a 2–1 win over [[Stade Lavallois|Laval]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Laval v. Istres Match Report |url=http://www.foot-national.com/match-foot-laval-istres-8958.html|work=Foot-National | date=11 August 2007 |accessdate=5 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> Two weeks later, Giroud scored goals in back-to-back matches against [[Vannes OC|Vannes]] and [[US Créteil-Lusitanos|Créteil]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Istres v. VannesMatch Report |url=http://www.foot-national.com/match-foot-istres-vannes-9052.html|work=Foot-National | date=25 August 2007 |accessdate=5 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Créteil v. Istres Match Report |url=http://www.foot-national.com/match-foot-creteil-istres-9114.html|work=Foot-National | date=1 September 2007 |accessdate=5 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> He scored his first double of the season in a 2–0 win against [[AC Arles-Avignon|Arles-Avignon]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Arles-Avignon v. Istres Match Report |url=http://www.foot-national.com/match-foot-arles-avignon-istres-9292.html|work=Foot-National | date=22 September 2007 |accessdate=5 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> A fortnight later, Giroud converted two goals again, this time in a 3–2 win over [[Pau FC|Pau]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Pau v. Istres Match Report |url=http://www.foot-national.com/match-foot-pau-istres-8978.html|work=Foot-National | date=6 October 2007 |accessdate=5 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> After going through the months of November and December without scoring a league goal, Giroud returned to form in January scoring goals in a 3–2 defeat to Vannes and a 2–0 win over [[AS Beauvais Oise|Beauvais]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Vannes v. Istres Match Report |url=http://www.foot-national.com/match-foot-vannes-istres-9053.html|work=Foot-National | date=26 January 2008 |accessdate=5 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Beauvais v. Istres Match Report |url=http://www.foot-national.com/match-foot-beauvais-istres-9175.html|work=Foot-National | date=16 February 2008 |accessdate=5 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> He finished the campaign by scoring goals in April league fixtures against [[Paris FC|Paris]] and [[FC Martigues|Martigues]], which brought his total goal tally with Istres to 14.<ref>{{cite news |title=Paris v. Istres Match Report |url=http://www.foot-national.com/match-foot-paris-fc-istres-9151.html|work=Foot-National | date=5 April 2008 |accessdate=5 February 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Martigues v. Istres Match Report |url=http://www.foot-national.com/match-foot-martigues-istres-9059.html|work=Foot-National | date=19 April 2008 |accessdate=5 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> Of the 14 goals, Giroud only scored four at the [[Stade Parsemain]], Istres' home stadium.<ref>{{cite news |title=Olivier Giroud: Saison 2007/2008 en National avec Istres |url=http://www.foot-national.com/28-2380-92-saison-football-Giroud-Olivier.html|work=Foot-National |accessdate=5 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref>
After a successful loan stint, Giroud returned to Grenoble with hopes of receiving some significant playing time as the club was now playing in [[Ligue 1]]. However, club manager [[Mehmed Baždarević]], who was hired while Giroud was on his loan stint at Istres, deemed the player surplus to requirements and, subsequently, listed him for transfer. According to reports, Baždarević had declared that Giroud "did not have the level to play among the elite".<ref name="giroud_lemonde"/> In 2011, Giroud reevaluated his departure from Grenoble stating "I am neither resentful nor vengeful. I am just disappointed with what happened to Grenoble when there was great potential".<ref name="giroud_lemonde"/>
===Tours=== [[File:Olivier giroud.jpg|thumb|upright|Giroud playing for Tours in 2010]] On 28 May 2008, it was reported that Giroud had agreed to a three-year deal with Ligue 2 club [[Tours FC|Tours]]. The striker was lured to the club by sporting director Max Marty who had previously served as the chief executive officer of Grenoble, Giroud's former club.<ref name="giroud_lemonde"/> Giroud was also fond of Tours' manager [[Daniel Sanchez (French footballer)|Daniel Sanchez]] stating "It's always a plus to have a former striker as a coach. His advice to me really helped a lot. With him, I progressed in my positioning and also in front of goal".<ref name="giroud_lemonde"/> Giroud was given the number 12 shirt and, due to injury, made his club debut on 3 September 2008 in a 2–1 defeat to [[US Boulogne|Boulogne]] in the [[2008–09 Coupe de la Ligue|Coupe de la Ligue]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Tours v. Boulogne Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/52984|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=3 September 2008 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> He made his league debut a week later playing the entire match in a 1–0 win over [[Nîmes Olympique|Nîmes]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Nîmes v. Tours Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/52658|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=12 September 2008 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> A month later, Giroud scored his first goal for the club converting the opener in a league match against [[RC Lens|Lens]]. In the second half, he scored another goal to cap a 3–1 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tours v. Lens Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/52697|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=20 October 2008 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> Two weeks later, Giroud scored his third goal for the club in a victory over [[AC Ajaccio|Ajaccio]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Tours v. Ajaccio Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/52599|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=31 October 2008 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref>
In the [[2008–09 Coupe de France|Coupe de France]], Giroud scored five goals in two matches. In the eighth round of the competition, he scored the team's only goal in a 1–0 win over semi-professional club [[Pacy Vallée-d'Eure]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Pacy v. Tours Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/autresCompetitions/coupeFrance/feuille_match/53033|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=13 December 2008 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> In the ensuing round against [[Réunion]]ais club [[SS Jeanne d'Arc|Jeanne d'Arc]], Giroud scored four goals in a 7–1 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Jeanne d'Arc v. Tours Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/autresCompetitions/coupeFrance/feuille_match/53049|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=3 January 2009 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref><ref name="giroud_charme">{{cite news |title=Olivier Giroud, buteur de charme |url=http://www.sofoot.com/blogs/footaises/olivier-giroud-buteur-de-charme-148616.html|work=So Foot | date=4 November 2011 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> Tours would later be eliminated in the next round by [[FC Lorient|Lorient]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Lorient v. Tours Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/autresCompetitions/coupeFrance/feuille_match/53102|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=30 January 2009 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> After his four-goal display against Jeanne d'Arc, Giroud followed up the performance by scoring goals in back-to-back league matches against [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier]] and [[FC Metz|Metz]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Montpellier v. Tours Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/52602|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=9 January 2009 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Tours v. Metz Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/52776|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=16 January 2009 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> After a double against Nîmes on 20 February 2009,<ref>{{cite news |title=Tours v. Nîmes Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/52813|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=20 February 2009 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> the striker suffered an injury, which forced him to miss three league matches. After making two substitute appearances on his return, in his first start since the injury on 3 April against [[Angers SCO|Angers]], Giroud scored the team's opening goal in a 3–1 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tours v. Angers Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/52869|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=3 April 2009 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> Giroud later re-aggravated the previous injury in training, which led to him missing the entire month of April as Tours were contesting a promotion battle with several clubs. Despite losing Giroud, the club went unbeaten in the four league matches he missed. On his return against Boulogne on 8 May, Giroud scored his final goal of the season in a victory.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tours v. Boulogne Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/52963|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=8 May 2009 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> In Tours' final three league matches of the campaign, the club failed to achieve a win, which resulted in the club failing to earn promotion to [[Ligue 1]]. Giroud finished the season with 27 total appearances and 14 goals.
In the [[2009–10 in French football|2009–10 season]], Giroud was promoted to the lead striker role following the departure of [[Tenema N'Diaye]] to [[FC Nantes|Nantes]]. The promotion immediately paid off as Giroud scored two goals in the team's opening match of the season; a 2–1 win over [[Le Havre AC|Le Havre]] in the [[2009–10 Coupe de la Ligue|Coupe de la Ligue]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Tours v. Le Havre Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/53499|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=1 August 2009 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> On 18 August 2009, he scored his first league goal against the same opposition in another win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tours v. Le Havre Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/53113|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=18 August 2009 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> Following another league goal in a win over [[En Avant de Guingamp|Guingamp]],<ref>{{cite news |title=Tours v. Guingamp Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/53114|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=30 August 2009 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> on 18 September, Giroud scored all four of Tours' goals in a 4–2 win over Arles-Avignon.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tours v. Arles-Avignon Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/53192|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=18 September 2009 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Tours FC – Un quadruplé pour Olivier Giroud |url=http://www.espoirsdufootball.com/8533-8533.html|work=Espoirs du Football | date=19 September 2009 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> It was his second career four-goal match at the professional level and his third overall having had one at amateur level while playing with the Grenoble reserve team.<ref name="giroud_interview">{{cite news |title=Interview d'Olivier Giroud (football) |url=http://www.interviewsport.fr/olivier_giroud.php|work=Espoirs du Football | date=11 January 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> In the team's next 15 matches in all competitions, Giroud remained on form scoring ten goals. During that span, the striker scored in consecutive matches on three occasions. Giroud finished the fall campaign with 16 goals, 13 of which came in league play.<ref name="giroud_interview"/>
On 26 January 2010, it was reported that Ligue 1 club [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier]] had signed Giroud from Tours on a three and a half-year deal.<ref name="giroud_montpellier">{{cite news|title=Olivier Giroud a signé |url=http://www.mhscfoot.com/liste-saisons/saison-2009-2010/articles/olivier-giroud-en-approche |work=[[Montpellier HSC]] |date=26 January 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120622044649/http://www.mhscfoot.com/liste-saisons/saison-2009-2010/articles/olivier-giroud-en-approche |archivedate=22 June 2012 }}</ref> The transfer fee was priced at €2 million and it was also announced that Montpellier would loan Giroud back to Tours until the end of the 2009–10 season.<ref name="giroud_montpellier"/><ref>{{cite news|title=Olivier Giroud signe à Montpellier à partir de l'été |url=http://fr.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1162434.html |work=[[FIFA|Fédération Internationale de Football Association]] |date=26 January 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121105110026/http://fr.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=1162434.html |archivedate=5 November 2012 }}</ref> The striker admitted the move to Montpellier would benefit him the most stating "I feel that here (Montpellier), the coach and staff will be able to help me make real progress. The environment is ideal, the training center is good, the group is healthy, and there's a beautiful stadium with an audience that responds to this".<ref>{{cite news|title=Olivier Giroud: "Cette équipe me plait beaucoup" |url=http://www.mhscfoot.com/liste-saisons/saison-2009-2010/articles/olivier-giroud |work=[[Montpellier HSC]] |date=26 January 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120229200143/http://www.mhscfoot.com/liste-saisons/saison-2009-2010/articles/olivier-giroud |archivedate=29 February 2012 }}</ref> Following the transfer, Giroud went three weeks without scoring a goal before converting one on 19 February 2010 in a win over Arles-Avignon.<ref>{{cite news |title=Arles-Avignon v. Tours Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/53461|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=19 February 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> Two weeks later, he scored the team's only goal in a 2–1 defeat to Nantes.<ref>{{cite news |title=Nantes v. Tours Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/53355|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=5 March 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> On 19 March, Giroud scored two goals in a shutout win against [[LB Châteauroux|Châteauroux]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Châteauroux v. Tours Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/53371|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=19 March 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> A week later, he scored in another shutout victory over [[RC Strasbourg|Strasbourg]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Tours v. Strasbourg Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/53386|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=26 March 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> After the goal against Strasbourg, Giroud went seven matches without scoring before netting on the final matchday of the season against Nîmes.<ref>{{cite news |title=Nîmes v. Tours Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/feuille_match/53138|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=14 May 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> He finished the season with 42 appearances and 24 goals. Giroud scored 21 in the league and was named the league's top goalscorer. After the season, he was named the [[National Union of Professional Footballers]] (UNFP) [[Ligue 2]] [[Trophées UNFP du football#Player of the Year|Player of the Year]]. Giroud was also named to the league's [[Trophées UNFP du football#Team of the Year|Team of the Year]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Trophées UNFP: Olivier Giroud à l'honneur |url=http://www.webmhsc.com/trophees-unfp-olivier-giroud-a-lhonneur-av3462.html|work=Web MHSC |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref>
===Montpellier=== Giroud officially joined Montpellier on 1 July 2010. He simultaneously made his club and [[UEFA|European]] debut on 29 July in the first leg of Montpellier's [[2010–11 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]] third qualifying round with [[Hungary|Hungarian]] club [[Győri ETO FC|Győri ETO]]. In the match, Giroud scored his first goal for the club in the first half.<ref>{{cite news |title=Győr v. Montpellier Report |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2011/matches/round=2000126/match=2002775/index.html|work=[[UEFA|Union of European Football Associations]] |date=29 July 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> Montpellier won the match courtesy of Giroud's goal, but were defeated on aggregate after losing on penalties in the second leg.<ref>{{cite news |title=Montpellier v. Győr Report |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2011/matches/round=2000126/match=2002810/index.html|work=[[UEFA|Union of European Football Associations]] |date=5 August 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> Giroud made his league debut in the team's first match of the campaign; a 1–0 win over [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Montpellier v. Bordeaux Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53671|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=8 August 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> On 28 August, he scored his first league goal in a 1–0 away win against [[Valenciennes FC|Valenciennes]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Valenciennes v. Montpellier Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53651|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=28 August 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> On 25 September, Giroud scored two goals in a home victory over Arles-Avignon.<ref>{{cite news |title=Montpellier v. Arles-Avignon Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53700|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=25 September 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> The double brought his career goal tally to nine against the [[Bouches-du-Rhône]]-based club. A week later, he scored Montpellier's lone goal in a 3–1 loss to [[Lille OSC|Lille]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Lille v. Montpellier Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53740|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=3 October 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref> In November 2010, Giroud scored game-winning goals in consecutive weeks against [[Toulouse FC|Toulouse]] and [[OGC Nice|Nice]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Montpellier v. Toulouse Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53753|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=13 November 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Nice v. Montpellier Match Report |url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53759|work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | date=20 November 2010 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French}}</ref>
In the [[2010–11 Coupe de la Ligue|Coupe de la Ligue]], Montpellier surprisingly reached [[2011 Coupe de la Ligue Final|the final of the competition]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fff.fr/coup/clig/actualite/536138.shtml |publisher=[[French Football Federation]] |title=Montpellier et Marseille en finale! |date=19 January 2011 |accessdate=7 February 2012 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121009005332/http://www.fff.fr/coup/clig/actualite/536138.shtml |archivedate=9 October 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/article/une-finale-olympique-de-marseille-montpellier-herault-sc.htm | publisher = [[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Une finale Olympique de Marseille – Montpellier Hérault SC | date = 26 January 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20120521184727/http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/article/une-finale-olympique-de-marseille-montpellier-herault-sc.htm | archivedate = 21 May 2012 | df = dmy-all }}</ref> In the semi-finals against [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]], Giroud played the entire match, which went into [[extra time]]. In the 117th minute, he scored the match-winning goal to send Montpellier to its first major final since the 1993–94 season when the club reached [[1994 Coupe de France Final|the final of the Coupe de France]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/73785 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Montpellier v. Paris Saint-Germain Report |date = 18 January 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.ligue1.com/coupeLigue/article/late-late-goal-takes-montpellier-through.htm | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Late, late goal takes Montpellier through |date = 18 January 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 }}</ref> In the 2011 Coupe de la Ligue Final, Montpellier faced Marseille and were defeated 1–0 courtesy of a goal by [[Taye Taiwo]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/article/l-om-conserve-son-trophee.htm | publisher = Ligue de Football Professionnel | title = L'OM conserve son trophée! | date = 23 April 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20120317134737/http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/article/l-om-conserve-son-trophee.htm | archivedate = 17 March 2012 | df = dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rmcsport.fr/editorial/158602/taiwo-paye-sa-coupe/ |publisher=[[Radio Monte Carlo|RMC Sport]] |title=Taiwo paye sa Coupe! |date=23 April 2011 |accessdate=7 February 2012 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120316005238/http://www.rmcsport.fr/editorial/158602/taiwo-paye-sa-coupe/ |archivedate=16 March 2012 }}</ref> Giroud played the entire match.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/73933 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Marseille v. Montpellier Report |date = 23 April 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref> Following his goal against Paris Saint-Germain, Giroud went scoreless for nearly two months before converting both club goals against the same opposition in a 2–2 draw at the [[Parc des Princes]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53882 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Paris Saint-Germain v. Montpellier Report |date =13 March 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref> Towards the end of the league season, Giroud scored goals against title contenders Marseille and [[Olympique Lyonnais|Lyon]]. However, Montpellier lost both matches.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53917 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Montpellier v. Marseille Report |date =17 April 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/53966 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Lyon v. Montpellier Report |date =27 April 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref> After finishing the season as the club's top scorer, on 31 May 2011, Giroud signed a contract extension with Montpellier until 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://msn.foxsports.com/foxsoccer/europe/story/montpellier-striker-olivier-giroud-extends-contract-until-2014-053111 |publisher=[[Fox Sports]] |title=Giroud signs new Montpellier contract |date=31 May 2011 |accessdate=7 February 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131011151238/http://msn.foxsports.com/foxsoccer/europe/story/montpellier-striker-olivier-giroud-extends-contract-until-2014-053111 |archivedate=11 October 2013 }}</ref>
Giroud began the [[2011–12 in French football|2011–12 campaign]] on form scoring in the team's first two league matches of the season against [[AJ Auxerre|Auxerre]] and the [[2010–11 Ligue 1|defending champions]] Lille.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74375 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Montpellier v. Auxerre Report |date =6 August 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74381 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Lille v. Montpellier Report |date =14 August 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref> Montpellier won both matches. After scoring a double in a 2–2 draw with [[Stade Brestois 29|Brest]],<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74420 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Brest v. Montpellier Report |date =17 September 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref> French newspaper ''[[Le Parisien]]'' affectionately dubbed him ''le buteur de charme'' (''the charm striker'').<ref name="giroud_leparisien">{{cite news |title=Giroud, le buteur de charme |url=http://www.leparisien.fr/sports/giroud-le-buteur-de-charme-17-09-2011-1612049.php|work=Le Parisien | date= 17 September 2011 |accessdate=6 February 2012 | language = French, Javanese, Malay }}</ref> The nickname paid tribute to his goalscoring ability, as well as personality and looks and was, subsequently, used by several other media outlets in France to describe the player.<ref name="giroud_charme"/><ref name="lexpress.fr">{{cite web | url = http://www.lexpress.fr/actualite/sport/football/olivier-giroud-qui-c-est-celui-la_1049246.html?xtor=x |work=L'Express | title = Olivier Giroud, qui c'est celui-là? |date =10 November 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref> In the team's next 18 matches in all competitions, Giroud lived up to the nickname by scoring 13 goals. The impressive output consisted of [[hat-tricks]] against [[Dijon FCO|Dijon]] and [[FC Sochaux-Montbéliard|Sochaux]],<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74464 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Montpellier v. Dijon Report |date =15 October 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74517 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Sochaux v. Montpellier Report |date =26 November 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref> match-winning goals against [[AS Nancy|Nancy]], Lyon, and Nice, and a goal each in the [[2011–12 Coupe de la Ligue|Coupe de la Ligue]] and [[2011–12 Coupe de France|Coupe de France]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74484 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Montpellier v. Nancy Report |date =29 October 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74565 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Montpellier v. Lyon Report |date =14 January 2012 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74575 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Nice v. Montpellier Report |date =28 January 2012 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/75648 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Montpellier v. Lorient Report |date =26 October 2010 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/autresCompetitions/coupeFrance/feuille_match/75758 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Prix-Lès-Mézières v. Montpellier Report |date =8 January 2012 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref>
As a result of Giroud's performance and the team as a whole, Montpellier topped the league table in November 2011.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/989014/ligue-1:-giroud-hat-trick-sends-montpellier-top?cc=5901 | publisher=[[ESPN]] | title = Giroud hat-trick sends Montpellier top |date =26 November 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012}}</ref> In January 2012, Giroud was linked with a transfer to several clubs. Montpellier's owner Louis Nicollin responded to the rumours on French radio station ''[[RTL (French radio)|RTL]]'' and surprised many by deeming one club "not big enough" for Giroud, while also declaring that the striker would cost "at least €50 or €60 million".<ref>{{cite news | url = https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/dec/28/newcastle-olivier-giroud-arsenal-montpellier | title = Newcastle 'too small' for Olivier Giroud who would cost '£42m or £50m' |date =28 December 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | location=London}}</ref> At the start of the second half of the campaign, Giroud scored in back-to-back league matches against Lyon and [[OGC Nice|Nice]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74565 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Montpellier v. Lyon Report |date =14 January 2012 | accessdate = 17 June 2012 | language = French }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74575 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Nice v. Montpellier Report |date =28 January 2012 | accessdate = 17 June 2012 | language = French }}</ref> Two weeks later against [[AC Ajaccio|Ajaccio]], he assisted on Montpellier's second goal and scored the team's final goal in a 3–0 win.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74595 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Montpellier v. Ajaccio Report |date =11 February 2012 | accessdate = 17 June 2012 | language = French }}</ref> On 24 March 2012, Giroud scored in the 1–0 win over [[AS Saint-Étienne|Saint-Étienne]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuille_match/74654 | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Montpellier v. Saint-Étienne Report |date =24 March 2012 | accessdate = 17 June 2012 | language = French }}</ref> The victory placed Montpellier at the top of the table and the club remained there for the rest of the campaign capturing its first league title in club history after beating [[AJ Auxerre|Auxerre]] 2–1 on the final day of the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Montpellier wins French title for first time |url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2012/soccer/wires/05/20/2080.ap.soc.french.roundup.2nd.ld.writethru.0916/index.html |work=Sports Illustrated |date=20 May 2012 |accessdate=20 May 2012 |language = French}}</ref> Giroud finished the season with a league-leading 21 goals and 9 assists. Despite being tied on goals with Paris Saint-Germain attacker [[Nenê (footballer born 1981)|Nenê]], he was named the league's top scorer by the Ligue de Football Professionnel due to finishing with more goals in open play.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/article/olivier-giroud-couronne.htm | publisher=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | title = Olivier Giroud couronné |date =20 May 2012 | accessdate = 17 June 2012 | language = French }}</ref>
===Arsenal=== ====2012–13 season==== [[File:Giroud Arsenal.jpg|thumb|right|upright|Giroud warming up for Arsenal in 2012]] On 26 June 2012, Arsenal won the race to sign Giroud on a long-term contract for a fee believed to be around £9.6 million (€12.4 million).<ref>{{cite news | url = https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/arsenal/9370031/Arsenal-signing-Olivier-Giroud-forces-Montpellier-to-change-clubs-policy-on-buy-out-clauses.html | title = Arsenal signing Olivier Giroud forces Montpellier to change club's policy on buy-out clauses | work = The Telegraph | accessdate = 24 January 2013 | location=London | first=Joe | last=Hare | date=2 July 2012}}</ref> He was given the number 12 shirt.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/olivier-giroud-agrees-deal-to-join-arsenal | title = Olivier Giroud agrees deal to join Arsenal | publisher = Arsenal FC | accessdate = 26 June 2012 | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/6ANV0GpaQ?url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/olivier-giroud-agrees-deal-to-join-arsenal | archivedate = 2 September 2012 | df = dmy-all }}</ref> He made his debut on 18 August as a substitute for fellow debutant [[Lukas Podolski]] in a goalless home draw against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] in the [[Premier League]]<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19221271 "Arsenal 0–0 Sunderland"] BBC Sport. 18 August 2012.</ref> and scored his first goal for Arsenal on 26 September, in a 6–1 win against [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] in the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19645217 "Arsenal 6–1 Coventry"] BBC Sport. 26 September 2012.</ref> His first Premier League goal came on 6 October, with the equaliser in a 3–1 win against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], in which he also assisted a [[Theo Walcott]] goal.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19768703 "West Ham 1–3 Arsenal"] BBC Sport. 6 October 2012.</ref> On 30 October, he helped Arsenal to a historic comeback in a League Cup tie against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]], as Arsenal were 4–0 down before coming back to win the game 7–5 after extra-time, with Giroud scoring Arsenal's second goal.<ref>{{cite web|last=Smith|first=Ben|title=Reading 5 – 7 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20053678|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=30 December 2012|date=30 October 2012}}</ref> Giroud scored his first [[UEFA Champions League]] goal for Arsenal in a 2–2 draw at [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]] on 6 November<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20134482 |title=Schalke 2–2 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 November 2012 |accessdate=7 November 2012}}</ref> and four days later he scored twice in a 3–3 draw at home to [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20190108 "Arsenal 3–3 Fulham"] BBC Sport. 10 November 2012.</ref> Giroud's form earned him a place in the Premier League team of the week.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.tv2.no/play/sport/premierleague/berbatov-skjoet-seg-inn-paa-ukens-lag-678584.html | title=Premier League Team of the Week round 11 | work=TV 2 Sporten | date=12 November 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/profile.overview.html/olivier-giroud |title=Player Profile: Olivier Giroud |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=31 August 2012 }}</ref>
On 17 November, Giroud scored the third goal in Arsenal's 5–2 [[North London derby|derby]] win over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham]].<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20278355 | title=Arsenal 5–2 Tottenham | publisher=BBC Sport | date=17 November 2012 | accessdate=17 November 2012 | last=Ornstein | first=David}}</ref> Four days later, Giroud assisted both [[Jack Wilshere]]'s and [[Lukas Podolski]]'s goals in Arsenal's 2–0 victory over former club Montpellier, which allowed Arsenal to qualify for the knockout stages of the tournament.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20321623 "Arsenal 2–0 Montpellier"] BBC Sport. 21 November 2012. Retrieved 21 November 2012.</ref> The Arsenal fans have warmed to Giroud as he has started to pick up form after a shaky start; a run of goals in consecutive games has led to a chant mimicking [[The Beatles]]' "[[Hey Jude]]" of 'Na na na, Na na naaaa, Na na naaaa, Giroud' echoing around the [[Emirates Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Poldi & Merte: Arsenal feiert "Big Fucking German"|url=http://www.neuepresse.de/Sport/Fussball/Poldi-Merte-Arsenal-feiert-Big-Fucking-German|accessdate=9 December 2015|work=Neue Presse|date=18 November 2015|language=German}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Giroud grandit à Arsenal|url=http://www.europe1.fr/sport/football/articles/giroud-grandit-a-arsenal-1320021|accessdate=9 December 2015|work=[[Europe 1]]|date=21 November 2012|language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Taisne|first1=Emery|title=Giroud : "Ça me prenait la tête"|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Giroud-ca-me-prenait-la-tete/318498|accessdate=9 December 2015|work=[[L'Equipe]]|date=9 October 2012|language=French}}</ref> On 29 December 2012, Giroud scored a brace and hit the crossbar after coming on as a substitute for [[Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain]] in the 80th minute, as Arsenal beat [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] 7–3 at the Emirates Stadium.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/9767432/Arsenal-7-Newcastle-United-3-match-report.html | title=Arsenal 7 Newcastle United 3: match report | work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] | date=29 December 2012 | accessdate=30 December 2012 | last=Kelso | first=Paul | location=London}}</ref>
On 23 January, Giroud scored a brace as Arsenal beat West Ham 5–1,<ref>{{cite web|last=Rose|first=Gary|title=Arsenal 5–1 West Ham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21038749|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=24 January 2013|date=23 January 2013}}</ref> and did the same in a Man of the Match performance against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] in the fourth round of the FA Cup three days later.<ref>{{cite web|last=Rose|first=Gary|title=Brighton 2–3 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21096118|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=26 January 2013|date=26 January 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/fa-league-cups/match-report-arsenal-need-the-cavalry-to-restore-order-in-brighton-8468218.html | title=Match Report: Arsenal need the cavalry to restore order in Brighton | work=The Independent | date=26 January 2013 | accessdate=26 January 2013 | last=Tongue | first=Steve | location=London}}</ref> On 30 January, Giroud scored as Arsenal fought back to earn a 2–2 draw, from 2–0 down at home to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]. Giroud scored a header from a Wilshere free kick, and provided an assist for Theo Walcott.<ref name="sky-2-2">{{cite news | url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/267550/report | title=Premier League: Arsenal come from two down to draw 2–2 at home to Liverpool | work=Sky Sports | date=30 January 2013}}</ref> For January, Giroud was awarded with the Arsenal Fan's Player of the Month Award.<ref>{{cite web|title=Giroud is EA SPORTS Player of the Month |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/giroud-is-ea-sports-player-of-the-month|publisher=Arsenal F.C.|accessdate=1 April 2013|date=8 February 2013}}</ref> On 13 April 2013, Giroud played a big part of Arsenal's 3–1 win against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] at home, winning a penalty that led to the equalizer in the 85th minute. He then sent Arsenal ahead himself two minutes later and set up for Lukas Podolski. This victory sent Arsenal to third in the table, climbing past London-rivals [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and Tottenham.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22049748|title=Arsenal 3–1 Norwich|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|last=Chase|first=Graham|date=13 April 2013|accessdate=15 May 2013}}</ref> He received his first red card for Arsenal against Fulham, which meant he would miss three of Arsenal's last four games of the season. He had his appeal rejected by [[the Football Association]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2313564/Olivier-Girouds-red-card-appeal-dismissed-Football-Association.html|title=Olivier Giroud's red card appeal dismissed by the Football Association|work=[[Daily Mail]]|date=23 April 2013|accessdate=15 May 2013|location=London|first=Jim|last=Van Wijk}}</ref> Giroud finished the season with 17 goals and 11 assists in 47 appearances.
====2013–14 season==== [[File:Olivier Giroud x Mesut Özil v Southampton - 23 Nov 2013 (cropped).jpg|thumb|left|upright|Giroud and [[Mesut Özil]] before kick-off against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in November 2013]] Giroud scored in the opening game of the Premier League season against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]], a 3–1 loss for Arsenal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal 1–3 Aston Villa|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23644714|publisher=[[BBC]]|date=17 August 2013|accessdate=7 September 2013|last=Ornstein|first=David}}</ref> His scored the only goal in the North London derby against Tottenham Hotspur on 1 September.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal 1–0 Tottenham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23831033|publisher=[[BBC]]|date=1 September 2013|accessdate=7 September 2013|last=Magowan|first=Alistair}}</ref> On 26 October, Giroud scored the second goal in a 2–0 win at Crystal Palace, keeping Arsenal at the top of the [[Premier League]], and almost a month later scored a double against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]], following a mistake from the Saints' goalkeeper [[Artur Boruc]], and then he converted a penalty in a 2–0 win. Giroud's last goal of 2013, and Arsenal's last of the year, came against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]]. His flicked header from [[Theo Walcott|Theo Walcott's]] free kick gave Arsenal a narrow 1–0 win and placed them at the top of the table going into 2014. He then scored on his return to the first team against [[Aston Villa]] after an ankle injury, a match that ended 2–1 in Arsenal's favour.
On 8 March 2014, Giroud scored twice against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in the FA Cup quarter-final, helping Arsenal to a 4–1 win.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26395193|title=Arsenal 4–1 Everton|date=8 March 2014|accessdate=18 May 2014|publisher=BBC}}</ref> On 12 April, Giroud scored one of the penalties in the shootout against [[Wigan Athletic]] to send Arsenal to the final of the [[2013–14 FA Cup|FA Cup]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26897266|title=Arsenal 1–1 Wigan|date=12 April 2014|accessdate=18 May 2014|publisher=BBC}}</ref> On 17 May, Giroud started in the [[2014 FA Cup Final]] as Arsenal beat [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] 3–2 at [[Wembley Stadium]] and assisted [[Aaron Ramsey]]'s cup-winning goal.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27354148| title=Arsenal 3–2 Hull|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=18 May 2014}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== Giroud started the season by scoring the third goal in [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] 3–0 win against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in the [[2014 FA Community Shield]], a 25-yard shot which dipped over goalkeeper [[Willy Caballero]], thus winning Giroud's second title for Arsenal. Despite only coming on as a half-time substitute, he was named [[Man of the match]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/competitions/fa-community-shield/2014/aug/arsenal-v-manchester-city-the-fa-community-shield-wembley-match-report-100814 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20140811163009/http://www.thefa.com/news/competitions/fa-community-shield/2014/aug/arsenal-v-manchester-city-the-fa-community-shield-wembley-match-report-100814 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=11 August 2014 |title=Arsenal hit three past Man City to lift Community Shield |work=The FA.com |date=10 August 2014}}</ref> Shortly after scoring the equaliser in a 2–2 draw against [[Everton F.C|Everton]] on 22 August, he broke his left tibia and was ruled out for four months.<ref>{{cite news|title=Olivier Giroud: Arsenal striker ruled out for up to four months|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28933940|accessdate=28 August 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 August 2014}}</ref>
On 30 September 2014, his 28th birthday, Giroud signed a new contract at Arsenal, keeping him at the club until 2018 and increasing his weekly wage to £80,000.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Wilson|first1=Jeremy|title=Arsenal forward Olivier Giroud signs new contract|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/arsenal/11129716/Arsenal-forward-Olivier-Giroud-signs-new-contract.html|accessdate=21 May 2016|work=The Telegraph|date=30 September 2014}}</ref>
Giroud returned to action quicker than expected, replacing [[Aaron Ramsey]] for the last 13 minutes of a 1–2 home defeat against [[Manchester United]] on 22 November and scoring Arsenal's consolation goal in added time.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal 1–2 Man Utd|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30065812|accessdate=22 November 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 November 2014}}</ref> Later, he scored twice in a 4–1 home victory against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on 13 December.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal's Olivier Giroud and Santi Cazorla inspire win over Newcastle|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/dec/13/arsenal-newcastle-premier-league-match-report|accessdate=13 December 2014|work=The Guardian|date=13 December 2014}}</ref> Thirteen days later, he was sent off in Arsenal's 2–1 win over [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] for a headbutt on [[Nedum Onuoha]] after being pushed by the QPR defender.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Lewis|first1=Aimee|title=Arsenal 2–1 QPR|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30544277|accessdate=26 December 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 December 2014}}</ref> He later returned from his three-game suspension to feature in a 3–0 victory at home against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] on 11 January.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal 3–0 Stoke City|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30670776|accessdate=20 January 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=11 January 2015}}</ref> On 18 January, he scored the second goal in a 2–0 victory against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], giving the gunners their first victory at the [[City of Manchester Stadium|Etihad Stadium]] since 2010.<ref>{{cite news|title=Man City 0–2 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30766356|accessdate=20 January 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=18 January 2015}}</ref> Giroud carried on his Premier League form by opening the scoring and by setting up [[Mesut Özil]] for the second goal of the match as Arsenal beat [[Aston Villa]] 5–0.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Dawkes|first1=Phil|title=Arsenal 5–0 Aston Villa|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30971833|accessdate=9 December 2015|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=1 February 2015}}</ref> [[File:Arsenal Vs Burnley (24642895021).jpg|thumb|right|Giroud taking on the [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] defence in January 2016]] On 15 February, he netted two goals in the space of three minutes as Arsenal defeated [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] 2–0 to reach the quarter-finals of the FA Cup.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Jennings|first1=Patrick|title=Arsenal 2–0 Middlesbrough|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31423103|accessdate=15 February 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 February 2015}}</ref> His first goal concluded a move in which every Arsenal player touched the ball without Middlesbrough taking possession.<ref>{{cite news|title=FA Cup: Arsenal 1 (Giroud 27') Middlesbrough 0|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31480408|accessdate=16 February 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 February 2015}}</ref>
On 25 February, Giroud was substituted 60 minutes into Arsenal's 3–1 [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League knockout stage|Champions League round of 16]] loss to [[AS Monaco FC|AS Monaco]] after missing several good chances for his club.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31608951|title=Arsenal 1–3 Monaco|date=25 February 2015|accessdate=2 March 2015|publisher=BBC}}</ref> Four days later, on 1 March, he scored Arsenal's opening goal in a 2–0 Premier League defeat of Everton.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/mar/01/arsenal-everton-premier-league-match-report|title=Arsenal's Olivier Giroud recovers from midweek nightmare to down Everton|accessdate=2 March 2015|work=The Guardian}}</ref> Giroud kept up his fine form by netting one goals each against [[Queens Park Rangers]], [[West Ham United]] and two against [[Newcastle United]] in the Premier League<ref name="player-of-the-month-march 2015">{{cite news |title=Giroud and Wenger secure Barclays Monthly Awards |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2014-15/apr/030415-olivier-giroud-and-arsene-wenger-claim-barclays-monthly-awards.html |publisher=Premier League |date=3 April 2015 |accessdate=3 April 2015}}</ref> while also scoring against [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] in the Champions League.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Wallace|first1=Sam|title=Monaco vs Arsenal match report: Olivier Giroud and Aaron Ramsey goals not enough as Gunners crash out of the Champions League|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/monaco-vs-arsenal-match-report-olivier-giroud-and-aaron-ramsey-goals-not-enough-for-gallant-gunners-10114979.html|accessdate=9 December 2015|work=[[The Independent]]|date=18 March 2015}}</ref> Giroud was announced as the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] for March.<ref name="player-of-the-month-march 2015"/><ref>{{cite news|last1=Orr|first1=James|title=Arsenal scoop Double in Premier League awards for March – Olivier Giroud Player of the Month and Arsene Wenger Manager of the Month|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/arsenal-scoop-double-in-premier-league-awards-for-march-with-olivier-giroud-player-of-the-month-and-10154004.html|accessdate=9 December 2015|work=[[The Independent]]|date=4 April 2015}}</ref> On 4 April, Giroud scored the fourth goal for his team in a 4–1 win over Liverpool.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Arsenal 4–1 Liverpool|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32097847|accessdate=4 April 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 April 2015}}</ref>
On 30 May, Giroud scored Arsenal's fourth goal after appearing as a substitute in the team's 4–0 [[2015 FA Cup Final]] victory over Aston Villa at Wembley Stadium.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/32563518|title=FA Cup final – FT: Arsenal 4–0 Villa|date=30 May 2015|publisher=BBC}}</ref>
====2015–16 season==== Giroud scored Arsenal's first goal of the season, a [[Bicycle kick|sideways scissor kick]] from an Özil assist at [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] in a 2–1 loss.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Jennings|first1=Patrick|title=Crystal Palace 1–2 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33839766|accessdate=10 December 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 August 2015}}</ref> On 20 October 2015, he came off the bench to score the first goal in a 2–0 win against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] in the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League]] group stage.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Arsenal 2–0 Bayern Munich|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34128978|accessdate=9 December 2015|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=20 October 2015}}</ref> On 9 December, he scored his first competitive Arsenal [[hat-trick]] in a 3–0 away victory at [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]] helping the Gunners, who needed a two-goal win, make the last-16 of the Champions League.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Hytner|first1=David|title=Arsenal's recovery complete after Olivier Giroud's treble sinks Olympiakos|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2015/dec/09/olympiakos-arsenal-champions-league-match-report|accessdate=9 December 2015|work=The Guardian|date=9 December 2015}}</ref> Giroud scored the first goal in a 2–0 victory over [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] four days later, becoming only the seventh Arsenal player to reach 50 Premier League goals for the club.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Dawkes|first1=Phil|title=Aston Villa 0–2 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/35018974|accessdate=14 December 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 December 2015}}</ref> On 8 March, Giroud ended a 12-match scoreless run, with a brace in a 4–0 away victory over [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] in a [[2015–16 FA Cup|FA Cup replay]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35693501|title=Hull City 0–4 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=11 March 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/blog/the-match/60/post/2824667/arsenal-strikers-end-drought-in-welcomed-fa-cup-win-at-hull|title=Jolly: Welcome win for Arsenal at Hull|publisher=ESPN|access-date=11 March 2016}}</ref>
On 8 May 2016, Giroud scored in a 2–2 against Manchester City at the [[City of Manchester Stadium]] to end a run of 15 Premier League matches without a goal. He also assisted the team's second goal, scored by [[Alexis Sánchez]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/au/news/giroud-delighted-end-15-game-goal-drought#:y82e3JgXjyY35A|title=Giroud delighted to end 15-game goal drought|date=9 May 2016|work=FourFourTwo}}</ref> A week later, in the team's final match of the season, Giroud scored a hat-trick against Aston Villa to end [[2015–16 Arsenal F.C. season|2015–16]] with 16 goals in the [[2015–16 Premier League|Premier League]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12028/10283818/tottenhams-harry-kane-clinches-premier-league-golden-boot|title=Tottenham's Harry Kane clinches Premier League Golden Boot|date=15 May 2016|work=Sky Sports}}</ref> and 24 in all competitions.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/arsenal-4-0-aston-villa-7943479|title=Arsenal 4–0 Aston Villa: Olivier Giroud bags a hat-trick as Gunners finish above Spurs – 5 things we learned|date=15 May 2016|work=The Mirror}}</ref> [[File:Ludogorets vs arsenal 2-3.jpg|thumb|right|385px|[[Cosmin Moți]] ([[Ludogorets]], left) in the air battle against Olivier Giroud (Arsenal), moment of Ludogorets vs Arsenal 2–3, [[UEFA Champions League]], 1 November 2016]]
====2016–17 season==== Giroud made only three appearances in Arsenal's first nine matches of the [[2016–17 Premier League]], all of them coming on as a substitute. On 29 October 2016, after coming onto the pitch as a substitute in the 69th minute on matchday 10 of the Premier League, Giroud scored two goals with his first two touches in Arsenal's 4–1 away win against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/oct/29/sunderland-arsenal-premier-league-match-report-olivier-giroud-alexis-sanchez|title=Olivier Giroud and Alexis Sánchez at the double as Arsenal ease past Sunderland|work=The Guardian|date=29 October 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3885522/Arsenal-boss-Arsene-Wenger-ready-partner-Alexis-Sanchez-Olivier-Giroud-goals-against-Sunderland.html|title=Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger ready to partner Alexis Sanchez with Olivier Giroud after goals against Sunderland|work=Daily Maildate=29 October 2016}}</ref> On 19 November, Giroud scored an 89th-minute equalising goal after appearing as a substitute in a 1–1 draw with Manchester United at [[Old Trafford]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37959760|title=Manchester Utd 1–1 Arsenal|date=19 November 2016|publisher=BBC}}</ref> On 26 December, he scored in a 1–0 home defeat of [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on his first Premier League start of the season.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/12/26/arsenal-v-west-brom-premier-league-live/|title=Arsenal 1 West Brom 0: Olivier Giroud heads late winner to keep slim title hopes alive|date=26 December 2016|work=The Telegraph}}</ref> On 1 January 2017, Giroud scored with a backheeled "scorpion kick" volley in a 2–0 win against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], a goal described by [[Arsène Wenger]] as the greatest he had seen at the [[Emirates Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-4080544/Arsene-Wenger-hails-Olivier-Giroud-s-scorpion-kick-greatest-goal-seen-Emirates-Stadium.html|title=Arsene Wenger hails Olivier Giroud's scorpion kick as the greatest goal he has ever seen at the Emirates Stadium |date=1 January 2017|work=Daily Mail}}</ref> The goal later earned him the [[FIFA Puskás Award]] for the goal of the year.<ref name=PK>{{cite web|url=http://kwese.espn.com/football/blog/fifa/243/post/3241038/olivier-giroud-wins-fifas-puskas-award-for-best-goal-of-the-year|title=Olivier Giroud wins FIFA's Puskas Award for best goal of the year|publisher=ESPN|date=23 October 2017|accessdate=24 October 2017}}</ref>
On 12 January 2017, Giroud, alongside teammates [[Francis Coquelin]] and [[Laurent Koscielny]] signed a new long-term contract with Arsenal.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20170112/french-trio-sign-new-long-term-contracts|title=French trio sign new long-term contracts|date=12 January 2017|accessdate=12 January 2017|publisher=Arsenal F.C.}}</ref> During the [[2017 FA Cup Final]] against Chelsea at Wembley, Giroud came on in the 78th minute with the score 1–1, and a minute later he delivered an assist for [[Aaron Ramsey]] to score the winning goal which saw Arsenal lift the Cup for a record-breaking thirteenth time.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39984089|title=Arsenal 2–1 Chelsea|publisher=BBC}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== On 28 September 2017 during Arsenal's [[Europa League]] group game away to [[FC BATE Borisov|BATE Borisov]], Giroud scored his 100th goal for the club in a 4–2 victory.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41417665|title=BATE Borisov 2–4 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
===Chelsea=== [[File:Chelsea 4 Hull 0 (26465519758).jpg|thumb|left|Giroud (left) playing for Chelsea in February 2018]] On 31 January 2018, Giroud signed an 18-month contract with [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2018/01/giroud-signs-for-chelsea.html|title=Giroud signs for Chelsea|publisher=Chelsea F.C.|access-date=31 January 2018}}</ref> He made his debut five days later in a Premier League away game at [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], where he come on in the 64th minute replacing [[Pedro (footballer, born July 1987)|Pedro]]. However, the result was a 4–1 loss.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Begley|first1=Emlyn|title=Watford 4–1 Chelsea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42855189 |accessdate=5 February 2018| date=5 February 2018}}</ref> On 12 February, Giroud started his first game for the club in which he provided an assist for [[Eden Hazard]] in a 3–0 home win against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/15116/11248353/chelsea-3-0-west-brom-olivier-girouds-first-start-for-blues-assessed|title=Chelsea 3–0 West Brom: Olivier Giroud's first start for Blues assessed|website=SkySports|date=12 February 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal in the FA Cup fifth round against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] in the 4–0 home win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/chelsea-4-hull-city-0-olivier-giroud-off-the-mark-as-willian-inspires-convincing-progress-to-last-a3769031.html|title=Chelsea 4 Hull City 0: Olivier Giroud off the mark as Willian inspires convincing progress to last eight|website=London Evening Standard|date=17 February 2018}}</ref> On 14 April, Giroud came off the bench to score twice as Chelsea recovered from a 2–0 deficit to beat [[Southampton FC|Southampton]] 3–2 at [[St Mary's Stadium]]. It was his first time scoring in the Premier League with his new club.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/dcunited/giroud-leads-chelsea-fightback-in-3-2-win-at-southampton/2018/04/14/46452f7e-3fe8-11e8-955b-7d2e19b79966_story.html?noredirect=on|title=Giroud leads Chelsea fightback in 3–2 win at Southampton|website=The Washington Post|access-date=14 April 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== On 8 November, Giroud registered his first goal of the season away to [[BATE Borisov]] in matchday four of the [[2018–19 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] group stage. It was the only goal of the match, sending Chelsea through to the knockout stages of the tournament.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://theworldgame.sbs.com.au/giroud-sends-chelsea-into-europa-knockout-rounds|title=Giroud sends Chelsea into Europa knockout rounds|website=SBS|access-date=9 November 2018}}</ref> In his next outing, he scored his first Premier League goal of the season in a 3–1 away loss to [[Tottenham Hotspur]] on 24 November.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.beinsports.com/en/premier-league/video/premier-league-tottenham-3-chelsea-1-match-re/1041417|title=Premier League – Tottenham 3 Chelsea 1 – Match Report|website=bein Sports|access-date=25 November 2018}}</ref> Giroud then made it four goals in three games, bagging a brace at home to [[PAOK]] in matchday five of the Europa League. Chelsea won the match 4–0.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.foxsportsasia.com/football/europa-league/987577/chelsea-4-paok-0-giroud-doubles-up-as-blues-top-group-l/|title=Chelsea 4 PAOK 0: Giroud doubles up as Blues top Group L|website=FOX Sports Asia|access-date=30 November 2018}}</ref> On his 500th career appearance, Giroud scored a free kick to equalise and preserve Chelsea’s unbeaten Europa League group stage campaign. The match against [[MOL Vidi FC|Vidi]] at [[MOL Aréna Sóstó]] finished 2–2.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2018/12/13/report--vidi-v-chelsea|title=REPORT VIDI 2 CHELSEA 2|website=Chelsea Football Club|access-date=14 December 2018}}</ref> Giroud scored his first Chelsea hat trick on 14 March in a 5–0 (8–0 aggregate) win over [[Dynamo Kyiv]] in the second leg of the Europa League round of 16 tie at [[NSC Olimpiyskiy]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/47559773|title=Dynamo Kyiv 0-5 Chelsea|website=BBC Sport|access-date=15 March 2019}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Giroud.JPG|thumb|right|upright|Giroud playing for France against [[Georgia national football team|Georgia]] on 22 March 2013]] Prior to representing the [[France national football team|senior national team]], Giroud did not earn any caps with the [[France national youth football team|national youth teams]]. In 2001, he was called up to the [[France national under-16 football team|under-16 team]] alongside the likes of [[Yoann Gourcuff]], [[Yohan Cabaye]], and [[Sylvain Marveaux]] by coach [[Pierre Mankowski]] to participate in a training camp held at the [[INF Clairefontaine|Clairefontaine]] academy.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.fff.fr/selections/m16ans/9956.shtml | publisher=[[French Football Federation]] | title = La liste des participants au rassemblement du CTNFS |date =17 August 2001 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref> After the camp, Giroud was not called up for the duration of the 2001–02 under-16 campaign.
On 3 November 2011, in an effort to reward Giroud for his performances domestically with Montpellier, national team coach [[Laurent Blanc]] named the striker in the squad to play in [[Exhibition match|friendly matches]] against the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] and [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]] on 11 and 15 November 2011, respectively.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.france24.com/en/20111103-football-striker-top-scorer-giroud-joins-france-squad-montpellier-sport | publisher=France 24 | title = Top scorer Giroud joins France squad |date =3 November 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=1715051.html | publisher=[[UEFA|Union of European Football Associations]] | title = Giroud and Gonalons out to seize France chance |date =10 November 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012}}</ref> Giroud described the call up as "a childhood dream come true", while also stating it is "immensely satisfying and a privilege" to represent the national team.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.midilibre.fr/2011/11/03/le-footballeur-montpellierain-olivier-giroud-selectionne-en-equipe-de-france,411880.php | publisher=Midi Libre | title = Le joueur du MHSC Olivier Giroud sélectionné en équipe de France |date =3 November 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | language = French }}</ref> He made his international debut in the match against the United States appearing as a substitute. France won the match 1–0.<ref>{{cite news | url = https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/nov/12/usa-france-jurgen-klinsmann-laurent-blanc | title = France 1–0 USA |date =11 November 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012 | location=London}}</ref> Against Belgium, Giroud earned another cap appearing as a substitute as the match ended 0–0.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.mail.com/int/sports/soccer/845752-belgium-draws-0-0-france-uneventful-friendly.html | publisher=Mail.com | title = Belgium draws 0–0 at France in uneventful friendly |date =15 November 2011 | accessdate = 7 February 2012}}</ref> On 29 February 2012 Giroud scored his first career international goal in a 2–1 friendly victory over [[Germany national football team|Germany]]. Three months later, he was named to the squad to participate in [[UEFA Euro 2012]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/international/yoann-gourcuff-omitted-as-france-announce-euro-2012-squad-7800136.html|title=Yoann Gourcuff omitted as France announce Euro 2012 squad|date=29 May 2012 |work=The Independent|accessdate=3 June 2012|location=London}}</ref> Two days prior to the announcement of the final squad, Giroud assisted on two goals in France's 3–2 friendly comeback win over [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2012/soccer/05/27/france.iceland.euro.warmup.ap/index.html|title=Ribery, France beat Iceland in Euro warm up |work=Sports Illustrated |date= 27 May 2012 |accessdate= 5 June 2012}}</ref>
On 16 October 2012, Giroud equalised for France in their 1–1 draw against [[Spain national football team|Spain]] in a [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification|2014 FIFA World Cup qualifier]]. Coming on as a substitute in the 88th minute, he scored a headed goal from a [[Franck Ribéry]] cross in the fourth minute of injury time.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/match/92434/spain-vs-france/report|title=Spain 1–1 France: Giroud strikes late to earn Deschamps' side vital point|date=16 October 2012|accessdate=14 May 2014|publisher=Goal.com}}</ref> Due to his goal against Spain and good form with [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], Giroud, along with Arsenal teammate [[Laurent Koscielny]], received a call for France's tie against [[Italy national football team|Italy]] on 14 November.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/45828/international-watch-gunners-away-on-duty|title=Olivier Giroud and Laurent Koscielny earn France call-up|work=Sports Update | date= 10 November 2012 | accessdate = 11 November 2012}}</ref> In the match, Giroud had a few chances, but then was substituted with five other players in the second half as France came back from behind to win the match 2–1.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/257628/report|title=France come from behind to win the friendly 2–1|date=14 November 2012 |work=Skysports |accessdate=16 November 2012}}</ref> Giroud scored twice and was named man of the match in a 6–0 win over [[Australia national association football team|Australia]] on 11 October 2013 in an international friendly. [[File:FRA-ARG (18).jpg|thumb|left|Giroud with [[Raphaël Varane]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]]] On 13 May 2014, Giroud was named in [[Didier Deschamps]]' squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|title=World Cup 2014: Samir Nasri and Gael Clichy not in France squad|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27401306|accessdate=14 May 2014|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=13 May 2014}}</ref> After appearing as a second-half substitute in France's opening match against [[Honduras national football team|Honduras]],<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285092|title=France 3–0 Honduras|date=15 June 2014|accessdate=16 June 2014|publisher=BBC}}</ref> Giroud was named in the starting line-up for the team's second group fixture against [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]]. He scored the opening goal of the match in the 17th minute to record his first [[FIFA World Cup]] goal and the 100th at the tournament in the French national team's history, as ''Les Bleus'' ran out 5–2 winners to qualify for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage|knockout stage]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285207|title=Switzerland 2–5 France|date=20 June 2014|accessdate=21 June 2014|publisher=BBC}}</ref>
In the [[UEFA Euro 2016 Group A|opening match of Euro 2016]] on 10 June 2016, [[France national football team|France]] defeated [[Romania national football team|Romania]] 2–1. Giroud earned his 50th France cap by being in the starting line-up of that match and played every minute of it; he scored the opening goal by heading [[Dimitri Payet]]'s cross into the goal in the 57th minute.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.euronews.com/sport/3205635-payet-stunner-gives-france-2-1-win-over-romania-in-opener/|title=Payet's late stunner helps France floor Romania.|accessdate=11 June 2016|archive-url=https://archive.is/20160615084434/http://www.euronews.com/sport/3205635-payet-stunner-gives-france-2-1-win-over-romania-in-opener/|archive-date=15 June 2016|dead-url=yes}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2016/matches/round=2000448/match=2017877/postmatch/report/|title=Payet stunner gives hosts France opening win|publisher=UEFA|date=10 June 2016}}</ref> He scored a brace in a 5–2 win against [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]] in the [[UEFA Euro 2016 knockout phase#France vs Iceland|Quarter-finals]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2016/matches/round=2000449/match=2017904/postmatch/report/|title=Slick France end Iceland saga|publisher=UEFA|date=3 July 2016}}</ref> Following France's defeat to [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] in the [[UEFA Euro 2016 Final|final]] of the tournament, Giroud finished the competition as the joint second-highest scorer, with 3 goals and 2 assists, and was awarded the [[UEFA Euro 2016#Awards|Bronze Boot]].<ref name="golden-boot-winner">{{cite news |title=France forward Antoine Griezmann wins Golden Boot |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/news/newsid=2390091.html |quote=France forward Antoine Griezmann claimed the UEFA EURO 2016 adidas Golden Boot with six goals, three ahead of Silver Boot laureate Cristiano Ronaldo and Bronze Boot winner Olivier Giroud. |publisher=UEFA.com (Union of European Football Associations) |date=10 July 2016 |accessdate=11 July 2016 }}</ref>
In a [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Group A|2018 World Cup qualifier]] against [[Luxembourg national football team|Luxembourg]] in March 2017, which France won 3–1, Giroud scored twice, taking his total to 23 and moving him into his country's top ten goalscorers of all time.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/france/story/3089716/didier-deschamps-satisfied-with-win-but-says-france-couldve-scored-more |title=Didier Deschamps satisfied with win but says France 'could've scored more' |agency=PA Sport |publisher=ESPN |date=26 March 2017 |accessdate=26 March 2017}}</ref>
On 2 June 2017, Giroud scored a [[hat-trick]] at [[Roazhon Park]] for France in a friendly against Paraguay which finished 5–0 to the hosts. In that game, he also become the first player to score a hat-trick for Les Bleus in 17 years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://m.ligue1.com/autresCompetitions/article/five-star-france-flay-paraguay.htm|title=Five star France flay Paraguay|website=Ligue 1.com}}</ref>
On 17 May 2018, he was called up to the 23 man [[French national football team|French squad]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.skysports.com/amp/football/news/12025/11376691/alexandre-lacazette-and-anthony-martial-on-standby-for-france-world-cup-squad-and-dimitri-payet-out|title=Alexandre Lacazette and Anthony Martial on standby for France World Cup squad and Dimitri Payet out – soccer News – Sky Sports|website=''skysports.com''}}</ref> On 28 May 2018, Giroud scored his 31st international goal for France during a home game against [[Ireland]], equalling [[Zinedine Zidane]]'s record, and becoming the fourth highest goal scorer of all time for the country.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.euronews.com/2018/05/28/giroud-scores-landmark-goal-as-france-beat-ireland|title=Giroud scores landmark goal as France beat Ireland|date=28 May 2018|website=euronews}}</ref> Giroud's inclusion in the team as a big man towering over opposing defenders was designed to create more freedom for [[Antoine Griezmann]] and [[Kylian Mbappé]] to generate offensive chances.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jun/21/france-peru-world-cup-group-c-match-report|title=France seal last-16 spot as Kylian Mbappé earns victory over Peru|last=Lawrence|first=Amy|date=21 June 2018|website=The Guardian|access-date=16 July 2018}}</ref> Giroud played in all seven matches, and though he failed to register a shot on net on 13 shots, his physical presence and link-up play was credited with Griezmann and Mbappé each scoring four goals.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/world-cup-2018/6786022/world-cup-2018-france-giroud-shots/|title=World Cup 2018: France star Olivier Giroud goes entire tournament without a single shot on target|date=15 July 2018|work=The Sun|access-date=16 July 2018}}</ref> On 30 June 2018, Giroud set up Mbappé's second goal in a [[2018 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#France vs Argentina|4–3 win]] over [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/43976007 |title=France 4–3 Argentina |publisher=BBC Sport |author=Emlyn Begley |date=30 June 2018 |accessdate=30 June 2018 }}</ref> In the [[2018 FIFA World Cup Final|final of the tournament]] on 15 July, France defeated [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]] 4–2 to win their second FIFA World Cup title.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/world-cup-2018/6786022/world-cup-2018-france-giroud-shots/|title=World Cup 2018: France star Olivier Giroud goes entire tournament without a single shot on target|last=161385360554578|date=15 July 2018|website=The Sun}}</ref>
==Style of play== Giroud is capable of playing in several offensive positions, but usually plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] or as a [[Forward (association football)#Centre-forward|centre-forward]]; he has also occasionally been used as a [[Forward (association football)#Second striker|second striker]], or even as a [[Forward (association football)#False 9|false 9]]. A hard-working striker, he is known in particular for his reliable goal scoring rate, size, physical strength, heading accuracy, powerful shot, ability to hold up the ball with his back to goal, and link-up play, or create space for his teammates with his movement off the ball.<ref name="giroud_dauphine">{{cite news |url=http://www.ledauphine.com/actualite/2011/11/07/giroud-un-avenir-en-bleu |title=Giroud, un avenir en bleu |trans-title=Giroud, a future in blue |work=[[Le Dauphiné libéré|Le Dauphiné]] |language=French |date=8 November 2011 |accessdate=5 February 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/arsenal/story/2909082/arsenal-should-play-with-two-up-front-to-get-most-out-of-olivier-giroud-henry|title=Arsenal should play with two up front to get best out of Olivier Giroud – Henry|publisher=ESPN FC|author=Mattias Karen|date=7 July 2016|accessdate=12 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://metro.co.uk/2017/01/01/arsenal-have-the-perfect-second-striker-in-olivier-giroud-says-jamie-carragher-6355485/|title=Arsenal have the perfect second striker in Olivier Giroud, says Jamie Carragher|work=Metro|location=UK|author1=Mark Brus|date=1 January 2017|accessdate=3 January 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/feb/15/arsene-wenger-olivier-giroud|title=Arsène Wenger hails Olivier Giroud as a wholly 'different player'|work=The Guardian|author1=John Ashdown|date=15 February 2015|accessdate=19 October 2017}}</ref><ref name="mission">{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jul/08/olivier-giroud-france-striker-no-goals-hope-belgium |title=No goals? No problem.
