nationalcaps4 = 21 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | nationalcaps5 = 23 | nationalgoals5 = 1 | club-update = 16:19, 3 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 16 November 2018 }} '''Andreas Bødtker Christensen ''' ({{IPA-da|ˈkʁɛsdn̩sn̩|pron}}; born 10 April 1996) is a Danish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[centre back]] for {{English football updater|Chelsea}} club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and the [[Denmark national football team|Denmark national team]].
He began his career at [[Brøndby IF|Brøndby]] and joined Chelsea at the age of 15 in February 2012, making his professional debut in October 2014. From 2015 to 2017 he was loaned to [[Bundesliga]] club [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]], where he made 82 appearances and scored 7 goals. Christensen made his full international debut for Denmark in June 2015, and represented the nation at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Chelsea=== ====Early career==== [[File:Andreas Christensen.jpg|thumb|upright|Christensen playing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2013]]
The son of former [[Brøndby IF]] goalkeeper Sten Christensen, he began his career with Brøndby IF. He spent eight years there, attracting the interest of Europe's elite clubs including [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], and [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]]. On 7 February 2012, Christensen signed for Chelsea on a free transfer, near the end of [[André Villas-Boas]]' tenure as the club's manager. Upon joining the [[London]] side, Christensen said: "I have chosen Chelsea because they play the kind of football I like.”<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2896/premier-league/2012/02/07/2892141/chelsea-complete-signing-of-15-year-old-brondby-defender-andreas-|title=Chelsea complete signing of 15-year-old Brondby defender Andreas Christensen on a free transfer|date=7 February 2012|website=Goal.com|accessdate=7 February 2012}}</ref>
Christensen was first included in a Chelsea senior squad for their last game of the [[2012–13 Chelsea F.C. season|2012–13 season]] on 19 May 2013, but did not feature in the match, which ended a 2–1 home win over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in [[Rafael Benítez]]'s last match as manager.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Phillips|first1=Owen|title=Chelsea 2–1 Everton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22499152|accessdate=28 October 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 May 2013}}</ref> In the pre-season tour of the United States before the [[2013–14 Chelsea F.C. season|2013–14 season]], he was part of the senior team squad and signed a professional contract thereafter.<ref name=chelsea>{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/teams/first-team/andreas-christensen.html |title=Christensen Chelsea Profile |date=7 February 2012 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |accessdate=7 February 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140815081559/http://www.chelseafc.com/teams/first-team/andreas-christensen.html |archivedate=15 August 2014 |df= }}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== He made his professional debut on 28 October 2014, playing the full 90 minutes at right back as Chelsea won 2–1 away to [[Shrewsbury Town F.C.|Shrewsbury Town]] in the fourth round of the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Chowdhury|first1=Saj|title=Shrewsbury 1–2 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29699744|accessdate=28 October 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 October 2014}}</ref> Christensen did not play again until 24 January 2015, when he was utilized in the same position for Chelsea's 2–4 home defeat to [[EFL League One|League One]] team [[Bradford City A.F.C.|Bradford City]] in the [[FA Cup]] fourth round.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Emons|first1=Michael|title=Chelsea 2–4 Bradford|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30860394|accessdate=24 January 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 January 2015}}</ref>
Although Christensen played no further part in the campaign, Chelsea won the League Cup with a 2–0 victory over [[Chelsea F.C.–Tottenham Hotspur F.C. rivalry|rival]] club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in [[2015 Football League Cup Final|the final]]. When asked who was [[man of the match]] for the final, manager [[José Mourinho]] said "Man of the match was Andreas Christensen who played well against Shrewsbury. There are more than [[John Terry]] (the official Man of the match for the final) because we are a team. I am proud of the guys."<ref>{{cite news|title=Matic's kit, phone calls, but no party: Chelsea's cup celebrations|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31687889|accessdate=2 March 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 March 2015}}</ref>
On 13 April 2015, Christensen played for Chelsea U19 in the final of the 2014–15 [[UEFA Youth League]] against [[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]] in Switzerland and although he scored an own goal to cancel out [[Izzy Brown]]'s opener in the first-half, Chelsea still ended with a 3–2 victory.<ref>http://www.uefa.com/uefayouthleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000561/match=2016409/postmatch/report/index.html#brown+inspires+chelsea+youth+league+glory</ref> He made his [[Premier League]] debut against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] on 24 May, replacing [[John Obi Mikel]] with 12 minutes remaining in a 3–1 home victory.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Winton|first1=Richard|title=Chelsea 3–1 Sunderland|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32770811|accessdate=24 May 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 May 2015}}</ref> Although Christensen only made one league appearances out of the whole season, Mourinho stated that he would receive a replica medal from his club for his contributions this season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/chelsea/story/2450893/jose-mourinho-every-chelsea-player-to-get-prem-medal |title=Every Chelsea player to get a Premier League medal says Jose Mourinho |publisher=ESPN |date=15 May 2015 |accessdate=26 August 2018}}</ref>
====Loan to Borussia Mönchengladbach==== On 10 July 2015, Christensen joined [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]] on a two-year [[loan (sports)|loan]] deal from Chelsea.<ref>{{cite web|title=German loan for Christensen|url=https://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/07/german-loan-for-christensen.html|publisher=Chelsea F.C.|date=10 July 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.borussia.de/english/season/news/borussia-news/news-detailansicht.html?tx_ttnews%5Btt_news%5D=14343&cHash=fdce92ddca7a52a6d25fe4c765c9add5 |title=Borussia bring in Chelsea's Andreas Christensen on loan|publisher=Borussia Mönchengladbach|date=10 July 2015|accessdate=10 July 2015}}</ref> He made his debut on 10 August against [[FC St. Pauli]] in the first round of the [[2015–16 DFB-Pokal|DFB-Pokal]], winning 4–1.<ref>{{citation|title=St. Pauli vs. Borussia M'gladbach 1 – 4|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/08/10/germany/dfb-pokal/fc-st-pauli-von-1910-ev/borussia-monchengladbach/2038932/|website=Soccerway|date=10 August 2015}}</ref> Five days later, Christensen made his [[Bundesliga]] debut in a 4–0 loss at [[Borussia Dortmund]].<ref>{{citation|title=Borussia Dortmund vs. Borussia M'gladbach 4 – 0 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/08/15/germany/bundesliga/bv-borussia-09-dortmund/borussia-monchengladbach/2054192/|website=Soccerway|date=15 August 2015}}</ref> He scored his first professional goals on 5 February 2016, a brace in a 5–1 win over [[Werder Bremen]] at [[Borussia-Park]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Mönchengladbach delight at dismantling Bremen|url=https://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Bundesliga/blmd20n-borussia-moenchengladbach-5-1-sv-werder-bremen-post-match-reaction.jsp|accessdate=29 December 2017|publisher=Bundesliga|date=5 February 2016}}</ref>
After an impressive debut season, Christensen was voted the team's Player of the Season, ahead of [[Granit Xhaka]], the team [[captain (association football)|captain]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://metro.co.uk/2016/06/13/chelsea-prodigy-andreas-christensen-wins-borussia-monchegladbach-player-of-the-year-ahead-of-arsenals-granit-xhaka-5942365/|title=Chelsea prodigy Andreas Christensen wins Borussia Monchegladbach player of the year ahead of Arsenal's Granit Xhaka|website=Metro|publisher=Metro|date=13 June 2016|accessdate=16 June 2016}}</ref> After the success of his first season, Monchegladbach made multiple attempts to move his loan move into a permanent during the [[List of English football transfers summer 2016|2016 summer]], although it was reported Chelsea rejected the £14.25 million bid from the German side.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11668/10506225/chelsea-reject-borussia-monchengladbach-bid-for-andreas-christensen-sky-sources |title=Chelsea reject Borussia Monchengladbach bid for Andreas Christensen – Sky sources |date=19 July 2016 |publisher=Sky Sports}}</ref>
In the [[2016–17 UEFA Europa League]], Christensen scored the final goal of a 4–2 win away to [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]] in the second leg of the last 32 to assure a 4–3 aggregate win.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fiorentina 2–4 Borussia Mönchengladbach|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39068922|accessdate=29 December 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 February 2017}}</ref> He was on target again in the next round against neighbours [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke]], who won on away goals after a 3–3 aggregate draw.<ref>{{cite news|title=Borussia Monchengladbach 2 Schalke 2 (3-3 agg, Schalke win on away goals): Bentaleb penalty sends visitors through|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/borussia-monchengladbach-2-schalke-2-3-3-agg-schalke-win-away-goals-bentaleb-penalty-sends|accessdate=29 December 2017|website=FourFourTwo|date=16 March 2017}}</ref>
====Return to Chelsea==== On 12 August 2017, Christensen made his first appearance for Chelsea following his two-year loan spell in Germany, coming off the bench following captain [[Gary Cahill]] being sent off, in Chelsea's 3–2 opening day home defeat against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40835426|title=Chelsea 2–3 Burnley|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 August 2017}}</ref> Eight days later, he made his first Premier League start in a 2–1 victory over Tottenham Hotspur at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/40914668|title=Tottenham Hotspur 1–2 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 August 2017}}</ref> On 9 January 2018, Christensen signed a new four-and-half-year deal with Chelsea running until 2022, after establishing himself in the first team.<ref>{{cite web |title=Christensen commits |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2018/01/christensen-commits-.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=9 January 2018 |accessdate=9 January 2018}}</ref> Christensen made 40 appearances for the Blues in 2017–18, including three in the victorious [[FA Cup]] campaign. However, a back injury meant he was not involved in the final.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Revealed: Why Andreas Christensen was not in Chelsea's squad for FA Cup victory over Man United |url=https://www.football.london/chelsea-fc/players/christensen-chelsea-fa-cup-final-14680790 |publisher=football.london |date=20 May 2018 |accessdate=21 May 2018}}</ref> Prior to the season's finish, he was awarded the club's [[Chelsea Young Player of the Year|Young Player of the Year]] award.<ref>{{cite web |title=Christensen: Great to play on the big stage |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2018/05/christensen--great-to-play-on-the-big-stage.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=15 May 2018 |accessdate=21 May 2018}}</ref>
New manager [[Maurizio Sarri]] preferred to pair [[David Luiz]] and [[Antonio Rüdiger]] in central defence, and by February 2019 Christensen had made 15 appearances, only two of which in the league. However, he ruled out wanting to leave the club.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Burton |first1=Chris |title=Christensen had ‘doubts’ but never considered leaving Chelsea |url=https://www.goal.com/en-gh/news/christensen-had-doubts-but-never-considered-leaving-chelsea/1onure75w5lpv1lfg1tlqzis4y |accessdate=26 February 2019 |publisher=Goal.com |date=18 February 2019}}</ref>
==International career== On 8 June 2015, Christensen made his senior international debut for [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]] in a 2–1 home friendly win against [[Montenegro national football team|Montenegro]] at the [[Viborg Stadium]], as a 69th-minute substitute for [[Pierre-Emile Højbjerg]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Olsen|first1=Allan|title=Pierre-Emile er vores panzerwagen!|trans-title=Pierre-Emile is our tank!|url=http://ekstrabladet.dk/sport/kommentarer/allanolsen/pierre-emile-er-vores-panzerwagen/5598839|accessdate=8 June 2015|newspaper=Ekstra Bladet|location=Copenhagn|date=8 June 2015|language=Danish}}</ref> On 24 March 2016, Christensen made his first Denmark start in a 2–1 victory over [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]], playing the full 90 minutes of the friendly at the [[MCH Arena]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Denmark vs. Iceland (2 : 1) |url=https://www.onefootball.com/en-US/match/denmark-vs-iceland-lineup-24-473799?period=FullTime |publisher=OneFootball |date=25 March 2016 |access-date=25 March 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160406031642/https://www.onefootball.com/en-US/match/denmark-vs-iceland-lineup-24-473799?period=FullTime |archive-date=6 April 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
Christensen played six matches in Denmark's successful [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification]] campaign. On 14 November 2017 he scored his first international goal to equalise in a 5–1 win over the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] in the second leg of the play-off.<ref name=ireland/> Manager [[Age Hareide]] called him up for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|final]] tournament in Russia.<ref>{{cite news |title=World Cup 2018: Nicklas Bendtner left out of Denmark squad because of injury |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44350548 |accessdate=26 February 2019 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 June 2018}}</ref> He partnered [[Simon Kjær]] in central defence, having been able to play in that position due to [[Andreas Bjelland]]'s absence through injury, but played in defensive midfield in the final group game against [[France national football team|France]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Wallace |first1=Sam |title=Andreas Christensen gives next Chelsea manager food for thought with commanding midfield display |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-cup/2018/06/26/andreas-christensen-gives-next-chelsea-manager-food-thought/ |accessdate=26 February 2019 |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=26 June 2018}}</ref> In the last 16 against [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]], he remained in midfield to combat the opponents' strength in that sector, but made an error that allowed [[Mario Mandžukić]] to equalise as the Croats went on to win on penalties.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Watson |first1=Jack |title=Croatia vs Denmark, World Cup 2018: Andreas Christensen falls flat on his face in midfield audition – scouting report |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/croatia-vs-denmark-world-cup-2018-andreas-christensen-chelsea-analysis-manager-maurizio-sarri-a8425921.html |accessdate=26 February 2019 |work=The Independent |date=1 July 2018}}</ref>
==Style of play== Christensen is a [[centre back]]. In 2018, Chelsea manager [[Antonio Conte]] said the Dane had displayed "great maturity" adding that he has "a lot of trust in Christensen. This player is a player for the present for Chelsea, and for Chelsea's future for 10 or 12 years. He can also become the captain of this team in the future".<ref>{{cite news|title=Chelsea boss Antonio Conte backs Andreas Christensen to become club captain|first=Vaishali|last=Bhardwaj|date=23 February 2018|accessdate=24 February 2018|newspaper=London Evening Standard|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/antonio-conte-backs-andreas-christensen-to-become-chelsea-captain-a3774486.html}}</ref>

'''César Azpilicueta Tanco''' ({{IPA-es|ˈθesaɾ aθpiliˈkweta ˈtaŋko}}; born 28 August 1989) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for {{English football updater|Chelsea}} club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and the [[Spain national football team|Spain national team]] primarily as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|full back]] but also as a [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|central defender]].
A youth product of [[CA Osasuna|Osasuna]], he spent three seasons in [[La Liga]] before switching to [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]], winning four major honours with the French club. In the summer of 2012, he moved to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], winning the [[2013 UEFA Europa League Final|Europa League]] in his first season and a domestic [[Double (association football)|double]] [[2014–15 Chelsea F.C. season|two years later]].
Azpilicueta earned 55 [[Cap (sport)|caps]] for [[Spain national youth football team|Spain at youth level]] in all age groups, and represented the [[Spain national under-21 football team|under-21s]] in two [[UEFA European Under-21 Championship|European Championships]], [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|winning the 2011 edition]]. He made his first appearance with [[Spain national football team|the full side]] in 2013, and was selected for two [[FIFA World Cup|World Cups]] as well as [[UEFA Euro 2016|Euro 2016]].
==Club career== ===Osasuna=== Azpilicueta was born in [[Pamplona]], [[Navarre]]. A [[CA Osasuna Juvenil|product]] of hometown club [[CA Osasuna]]'s youth system, he made his [[La Liga]] debut on 8 April 2007 in a 0–2 away loss against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], while still registered with [[CA Osasuna B|the reserve team]];<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/report/_/id/204057?cc=5739|title=Real Madrid 2–0 Osasuna|publisher=[[ESPN FC|ESPN Soccernet]]|date=8 April 2007|accessdate=24 August 2012}}</ref> he started his career as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] then switched to [[midfielder]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://trolacas.wordpress.com/2009/02/20/cesar-azpilicueta-intentad-atacar-por-la-otra-banda/|title=César Azpilicueta, intentad atacar por la otra banda|trans-title=César Azpilicueta, try the other wing|publisher=El Blog de los Trolacas|language=es|date=20 February 2009|accessdate=24 August 2012}}</ref> and, throughout both his club and international career (senior and youth), appeared in several positions including [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|central defender]] and [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfielder]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ideal.es/granada/deportes/futbol/seleccion-espanola/201411/12/azpilicueta-nuevo-seguro-bosque-20141112195750-rc.html|title=Azpilicueta, el nuevo 'seguro' de Del Bosque|trans-title=Azpilicueta, Del Bosque's new 'insurance'|newspaper=[[Ideal (newspaper)|Ideal]]|language=es|date=12 November 2014|accessdate=20 October 2015}}</ref>
In [[2007–08 La Liga|2007–08]], due to injuries in the main squad, Azpilicueta established himself as a first-team regular at the age of just 18, albeit as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right-back]]. He went on to retain this position for [[2008–09 La Liga|the following season]], appearing in all but two league games.
===Marseille=== [[File:César Azpilicueta 5401.jpg|thumb|left|Azpilicueta playing for Marseille in the [[2010–11 Olympique de Marseille season|2010–11 season]].]] On 21 June 2010, [[France|French]] club [[Olympique de Marseille]] confirmed an agreement had been reached with Osasuna for the transfer of Azpilicueta, in a four-year contract for [[Euro|€]]7 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.om.net/fr/Saison/101005/Actualites/47377/Accord_de_principe_pour_le_transfert_de_Cesar_Azpilicueta|title=Accord de principe pour le transfert de César Azpilicueta|trans-title=Deal arranged for transfer of Azpilicueta|publisher=Olympique Marseille|language=fr|date=21 June 2010|accessdate=23 June 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.les-transferts.com/ligue-1/lom-regle-le-probleme-a-droite.html|title=OM: Azpilicueta et Modesto arrivent!|trans-title=OM: Azpilicueta and Modesto arrive!|publisher=Les Transferts|language=fr|date=22 June 2010|accessdate=15 April 2014}}</ref> A week later, the Navarrese confirmed the agreement, with the transfer fee possibly rising to as much as €9.5 million depending on appearances.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mercato365.com/infos-clubs/marseille/article_429807_OM-Azpi-pour-95-millions-d-euros-.shtml|title=Azpi pour 9.5 million euros?|trans-title=Azpi for 9.5 million euros?|publisher=Mercato 365|language=fr|date=28 June 2010|accessdate=28 June 2010}}</ref> In his [[UEFA Champions League]] debut he scored the match's only goal in a [[2010–11 UEFA Champions League|group stage home match]] against [[FC Spartak Moscow]], albeit in [[Own goal|his own net]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/matches/season=2011/round=2000118/match=2002819/index.html|title=Spartak sucker punch downs Marseille|publisher=UEFA|date=15 September 2010|accessdate=19 September 2010}}</ref>
On 27 November 2010, in the early minutes of a 4–0 home win against [[Montpellier HSC]] – which meant Marseille [[2010–11 Ligue 1|climbed to the top of the league]] – Azpilicueta ruptured the [[anterior cruciate ligament]]s in his left knee.<ref>[https://int.soccerway.com/news/2010/November/28/marseille-go-top-but-pay-high-price/ Marseille go top but pay high price] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101129014337/http://www.soccerway.com/news/2010/November/28/marseille-go-top-but-pay-high-price/|date=29 November 2010}}; Soccerway, 27 November 2010</ref> He was sidelined for six months.
In August 2012, amid speculation of clubs showing interest in Azpilicueta, including [[Premier League]] club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], Marseille confirmed that he could leave, saying, "If Chelsea makes a fair offer for Azpi [Azpilicueta], we will let him leave."<ref>[http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11668/7988728/Marseille-confirm-need-to-sell Marseille confirm need to sell]; [[Sky Sports]], 14 August 2012</ref> Despite his loyalty to Marseille, the player said he was willing to leave if his "departure can help Marseille's finances".<ref>[http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/12691/8007076/Azpilicueta-open-to-Blues-move Azpilicueta open to Blues move]; Sky Sports, 21 August 2012</ref>
===Chelsea=== [[File:César Azpilicueta Chelsea vs AS-Roma 10AUG2013.jpg|thumb|upright|Azpilicueta in action against [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] in 2013]] On 24 August 2012, Chelsea completed the signing of Azpilicueta for an undisclosed fee, reported as [[Pound sterling|£]]7 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2898781|title=Azpilicueta signs|publisher=Chelsea F.C|date=24 August 2012|accessdate=24 August 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120830171700/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2898781|archivedate=30 August 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11668/8014372/Azpilicueta-joins-Chelsea|title=Azpilicueta joins Chelsea|publisher=Sky Sports|date=24 August 2012|accessdate=24 August 2012}}</ref> According to teammate and countryman [[Juan Mata]], "He is a strong running right-back who has pace as well, so I think he is already a complete player."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2899038/title/di-matteo%3A-cesar-offers-options|title=Di Matteo: Cesar offers options|publisher=Chelsea F.C|date=24 August 2012|accessdate=24 August 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120830171757/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2899038/title/di-matteo:-cesar-offers-options|archivedate=30 August 2012}}</ref> Due to his surname being difficult for some speakers of English to pronounce, club fans gave him the [[Mononymous person|mononymous]] nickname "Dave".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/cesar-dave-azpilicueta-shows-the-attitude-to-delight-chelsea-manager-jose-mourinho-9759011.html|title=Cesar 'Dave' Azpilicueta shows the attitude to delight Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho|newspaper=[[The Independent]]|first=Glenn|last=Moore|date=26 September 2014|accessdate=18 October 2014}}</ref>
Azpilicueta made his debut on 25 September 2012, starting in a 6–0 home win against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] in a [[2012–13 Football League Cup|League Cup]] tie.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19632463|title=Chelsea 6–0 Wolves|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=25 September 2012|accessdate=26 September 2012}}</ref> He played his first Premier League game the following week, coming on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Branislav Ivanović]] in a 4–1 success over [[Norwich City F.C|Norwich City]], also at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/19776324|title=Chelsea put their off-field troubles aside as they emphatically beat struggling Norwich to continue to set the Premier League pace.|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Mandeep|last=Sanghera|date=6 October 2012|accessdate=26 July 2017}}</ref>
On 3 November 2012, Azpilicueta made his first league start, appearing against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] in a 1–1 away draw.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/report?gameId=345755|title=Swansea City 1–1 Chelsea|publisher=ESPN FC|date=3 November 2012|accessdate=3 November 2012}}</ref> He played 48 official contests in [[2012–13 Premier League|his first year]] with the [[Rafael Benítez]]-led side, including eight in the Blues' [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League|victorious campaign]] in the [[UEFA Europa League]]. In [[2013 UEFA Europa League Final|the final]] against [[S.L. Benfica]] his 67th-minute handball led to [[Óscar Cardozo]] equalising through a [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty kick]], in an eventual 2–1 win in [[Amsterdam]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2013/matches/round=2000361/match=2010095/postmatch/report/index.html#ivanovic+heads+chelsea+europa+league+glory|title=Ivanović heads Chelsea to Europa League glory|publisher=UEFA|date=15 May 2013|accessdate=16 May 2013}}</ref>
Azpilicueta scored his first competitive goal for Chelsea on 29 October 2013, netting the first in a 2–0 victory at [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in the fourth round of the [[2013–14 Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24619361|title=Arsenal 0–2 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Alistair|last=Magowan|date=29 October 2013|accessdate=30 October 2013}}</ref> Following the arrival of new manager [[José Mourinho]], he began appearing regularly as a left-back, taking the place of longtime incumbent [[Ashley Cole]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/122498/fc-schalke-04-vs-chelsea-fc/report|title=Schalke 0–3 Chelsea: Impressive Torres bags double|publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|first=Peter|last=Thompson|date=22 October 2013|accessdate=18 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/chelseas-cesar-azpilicueta-ready-keep-2785715|title=Chelsea's Cesar Azpilicueta ready to keep sub standard Ashley Cole on the bench|newspaper=[[Daily Mirror]]|first=Darren|last=Lewis|date=12 November 2013|accessdate=18 December 2013}}</ref> Mourinho said of him: "Azpilicueta is the kind of player I like a lot. I think a team with 11 Azpilicuetas would probably win the competition (Champions League) because football is not just about pure talent".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/news/premier-league-mourinho-team-azpilicuetas-win-champions-league-094720824--sow.html|title=Premier League – Mourinho: A team of Azpilicuetas would win the Champions League|publisher=[[Eurosport]]|date=26 February 2014|accessdate=13 May 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140515031426/https://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/news/premier-league-mourinho-team-azpilicuetas-win-champions-league-094720824--sow.html|archivedate=15 May 2014}}</ref> At the end of [[2013–14 Chelsea F.C. season|the season]], he was voted the club's Player's Player of the Year.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2626666/Eden-Hazard-wins-Chelsea-Player-Year-award-fine-season-Jose-Mourinhos-side.html|title=Eden Hazard wins Chelsea Player of the Year award after fine season for Jose Mourinho's side|newspaper=[[Daily Mail]]|first=Joe|last=Strange|date=12 May 2014|accessdate=24 August 2012}}</ref>
[[File:César Azpilicueta - Сесар Аспиликуэта (22362918831).jpg|thumb|left|Azpilicueta in 2015]] Before the start of the [[2014–15 Premier League|2014–15 season]], Cole was released and the club spent £15.8 million on [[Filipe Luís]], but Azpilicueta began the season as first-choice left-back.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/jose-mourinho-has-taught-me-to-put-the-collective-first--chelseas-filipe-luis-happy-to-play-waiting-game-9755093.html|title=Jose Mourinho has taught me to put the collective first – Chelsea's Filipe Luis happy to play waiting game|newspaper=[[London Evening Standard]]|first=Simon|last=Johnson|date=25 September 2014|accessdate=19 October 2014}}</ref> On 2 September 2014, he signed a new five-year contract with the club<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2014/09/new-contract-for-azpilicueta.html |title=New contract for Azpilicueta|publisher=Chelsea F.C|date=2 September 2014|accessdate=2 September 2014}}</ref> and, on 18 October, he was [[Ejection (sports)|sent off]] in the first half of a 2–1 win at [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] for a foul on [[Mile Jedinak]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/oct/18/crystal-palace-chelsea-premier-league-match-report|title=Chelsea stay top after Cesc Fàbregas nets winner at Crystal Palace|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|first=Dominic|last=Fifield|date=18 October 2014|accessdate=18 October 2014}}</ref>
Azpilicueta started as Chelsea [[2015 Football League Cup Final|won the League Cup]] on 1 March 2015. In the second half, he was injured in a collision with [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]'s [[Eric Dier]], and had to leave the pitch for a bandage to be wrapped around his head.<ref name=LC>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2015/mar/01/chelsea-v-tottenham-hotspur-capital-one-cup-final-live|title=Chelsea v Tottenham Hotspur: Capital One Cup final – as it happened|newspaper=The Guardian|first=Jacob|last=Steinberg|date=1 March 2015|accessdate=2 March 2015}}</ref> [[2014–15 Chelsea F.C. season|The campaign]] ended with the additional conquest of the domestic league title, after a five-year wait.
On 2 August 2015, Azpilicueta featured for 69 minutes in the [[2015 FA Community Shield|1–0 loss]] to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in the [[FA Community Shield]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33667216|title=Arsenal 1–0 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Andy|last=Cryer|date=2 August 2015|accessdate=2 August 2015}}</ref> Nineteen days later, he scored the team's third goal in a 3–2 away win over [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]], for what was his first Premier League goal,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33950789|title=West Bromwich Albion 2–3 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|last1=Magowan|first1=Alistair|date=23 August 2015|accessdate=23 August 2015}}</ref> and he netted again in a 2–2 draw in the reverse fixture on 13 January 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35239779|title=Chelsea 2–2 West Bromwich Albion|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Mike|last=Henson|date=13 January 2016|accessdate=21 August 2016}}</ref>
Although Azpilicueta was initially used as a left-back under new coach [[Antonio Conte]], after two consecutive league defeats the latter converted into a back-three formation, with the former playing as a centre-back in the following match against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] on 1 October 2016, which ended in a 2–0 away win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37459840|title=Hull City 0–2 Chelsea|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Mike|last=Henson|date=1 October 2016|accessdate=18 October 2016}}</ref> On 13 December 2016 he signed a new three-and-a-half-year contract with Chelsea, running until 2020;<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/dec/13/cesar-azpilicueta-signs-new-three-and-a-half-year-contract-chelsea|title=César Azpilicueta extends Chelsea stay but Terry's situation stays on hold|newspaper=The Guardian|first=Dominic|last=Fifield|date=13 December 2016|accessdate=13 December 2016}}</ref> in his first appearance following the agreement he made his 200th competitive appearance for the club, in a 1–0 away victory over [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/matches/2016-17/12/sunderland-chelsea-pl.html|title=Sunderland 0–1 Chelsea|publisher=Chelsea F.C|date=14 December 2016|accessdate=17 December 2016}}</ref>
Azpilicueta played every minute of [[2016–17 Premier League|the season]] as his team won the domestic league, and scored in a 4–3 home win against [[Watford F.C|Watford]] after the title was already won.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/804975/Chelsea-Cesar-Azpilicueta-Watford-Premier-League-goal|title=Chelsea star reflects on 'special moment' after Watford win|newspaper=[[Daily Express]]|first=Charles|last=Perrin|date=16 May 2017|accessdate=25 May 2017}}</ref> In late July 2017, after the departure of [[John Terry]], he was appointed [[Captain (association football)|vice-captain]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/07/captain-cahill--delighted--proud-and-excited.html|title=Captain Cahill: Delighted, proud and excited|publisher=Chelsea F.C|date=26 July 2017|accessdate=26 July 2017}}</ref>
On 12 September 2017, Azpilicueta scored his first Champions League goal, in a [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League|6–0 group stage home win]] against [[Qarabağ FK]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/09/12/chelsea-6-qarabag-0-davide-zappacosta-marks-full-debut-goal/|title=Chelsea 6 Qarabag 0: Davide Zappacosta marks full debut with goal as half-strength hosts run riot|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|first=Matt|last=Law|date=12 September 2017|accessdate=12 September 2017}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:César Azpilicueta U21.jpg|thumb|right|Azpilicueta playing for the [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain under-21s]]]]
===Youth=== In [[2007 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2007]], Azpilicueta helped the [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spanish under-19 team]] win the [[UEFA European Under-19 Championship|UEFA European Championship]]. Shortly after he moved to [[Spain national under-21 football team|the under-21s]], being picked for the [[2009 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2009 European Championships]] in [[Sweden]] where he started three matches in an eventual group stage exit.
On 11 May 2010, 20-year-old Azpilicueta was named by [[Spain national football team|senior side]] manager [[Vicente del Bosque]] in a provisional list of 30 players, in view of [[2010 FIFA World Cup|the forthcoming edition]] of the [[FIFA World Cup]]. Eventually, he did not make the final cut.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2010/05/10/futbol/seleccion/1273509662.html|title=Valdés, De Gea, Azpilicueta, Javi Martínez y Pedro entran en la preselección de 30|trans-title=Valdés, De Gea, Azpilicueta, Javi Martínez and Pedro make shortlist of 30|newspaper=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|language=es|date=10 May 2010|accessdate=15 April 2014}}</ref>
Azpilicueta was picked for [[Spain national under-23 football team|Spain's squad]] for the [[2012 Summer Olympics]], after missing out on selection for the [[UEFA Euro 2012]] tournament.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/olympics/18693622|title=Euro 2012 trio Mata, Alba & Martinez in Spain Olympic squad|publisher=BBC Sport|date=5 July 2012|accessdate=8 September 2017}}</ref> Due to the presence of [[Álvaro Domínguez Soto|Álvaro Domínguez]], he only appeared in the last group match, a 0–0 draw with Morocco at [[Old Trafford]], as the national team [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics|exited in the group stage]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/spain-u23-vs-morocco-u23/1281843/report|title=Spain 0–0 Morocco: La Roja fail to fire again to finish bottom of Olympics Group D|publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|date=1 August 2012|accessdate=14 August 2018}}</ref>
===Senior=== On 1 February 2013, Azpilicueta was named in the squad for the upcoming international [[Exhibition game|friendly]] against [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]]. The manager said of the selection: 'Azpilicueta is playing many games for Chelsea. He has a lot of energy, defends well and is always willing to attack. We have a lot of hope for him.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3061623/title/azpilicueta-called-up-by-spain|title=Azpilicueta called up by Spain|publisher=Chelsea F.C|date=1 February 2013|accessdate=1 February 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130203184252/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3061623/title/azpilicueta-called-up-by-spain|archivedate= 3 February 2013|df=}}</ref> He made his debut five days later, playing the full 90 minutes in the 3–1 win in [[Doha]], [[Qatar]];<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11668/8478541/Cesar-Azpilicueta-Isco-and-Mario-Suarez-all-impressed-Spain-boss-Vicente-del-Bosque-on-their-debuts|title=Azpilicueta impresses Spain boss Vicente del Bosque on debut|publisher=Sky Sports|date=7 February 2013|accessdate=7 February 2013}}</ref> after the match, he said that it was his "dream to play for Spain" at the senior level.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11668/8492406/Cesar-Azpilicueta-happy-after-Spain-debut-and-Chelsea-win|title=Cesar Azpilicueta happy after Spain debut|publisher=Sky Sports|date=11 February 2013|accessdate=11 February 2013}}</ref>
Azpilicueta was selected to the [[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup]] tournament held in Brazil:<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2013/06/05/futbol/copa_confederaciones/espana/1370452028.html|title=Azpilicueta: "España todavía tiene hambre"|trans-title=Azpilicueta: "Spain are still hungry"|newspaper=Marca|first=Miguel Ángel|last=Lara|language=es|date=5 June 2013|accessdate=14 November 2013}}</ref> he started in the second group game against [[Tahiti national football team|Tahiti]] which Spain won 10–0 in a record for the largest margin of victory in the competition,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/confederationscup/matches/round=255199/match=300222467/summary.html|title=Spain hit ten in record-smashing win|publisher=FIFA|date=20 June 2013|accessdate=14 November 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131105172119/http://www.fifa.com/confederationscup/matches/round%3D255199/match%3D300222467/summary.html|archivedate=5 November 2013|df=}}</ref> and replaced [[Álvaro Arbeloa]] at [[half-time]] in [[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup Final|the final]] against [[Brazil national football team|the hosts]], in an eventual 3–0 loss.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/confederationscup/matches/round=255211/match=300222461/summary.html|title=Fred and Neymar claim Confeds for Brazil|publisher=FIFA|date=30 June 2013|accessdate=14 November 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130702190636/http://www.fifa.com/confederationscup/matches/round%3D255211/match%3D300222461/summary.html|archivedate=2 July 2013}}</ref>
In June 2014, Azpilicueta was selected to represent Spain in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/spain/10810213/Spain-World-Cup-2014-squad.html|title=Spain World Cup 2014 squad|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|date=2 June 2014|accessdate=14 June 2014}}</ref> He was the starting right-back during the first two fixtures, against the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/25285043|title=Spain 1–5 Netherlands|publisher=BBC Sport|first=David|last=Ornstein|date=13 June 2014|accessdate=26 June 2014}}</ref> and [[Chile national football team|Chile]], as the nation was eliminated at the group stage.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/25285155|title=Spain 0–2 Chile|publisher=BBC Sport|first=David|last=Ornstein|date=18 June 2014|accessdate=26 June 2014}}</ref>
Azpilicueta was also included in the 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/morata-misses-out-on-spain-world-cup-squad/1ub1qz7jod09i1lfvdcy84ea2l|title=Morata misses out on Spain's 23-man World Cup squad|publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|date=21 May 2018|accessdate=21 May 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== Azpilicueta's older brother, Juan Pablo (born 1980), was also a footballer. A midfielder, he competed exclusively in lower league football.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ivoox.com/entrevista-el-penalty-a-juan-pablo-azpilicueta-audios-mp3_rf_2597911_1.html|title=Entrevista en El Penalty a Juan Pablo Azpilicueta jugador del C.D. Tudelano|trans-title=El Penalty interview to Juan Pablo Azpilicueta C.D. Tudelano player|publisher=iVoox|language=es|date=28 November 2013|accessdate=20 October 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.diariodenavarra.es/noticias/deportes/futbol/2014/03/26/juan_pablo_azpilicueta_reaparecio_despues_dos_meses_baja_152926_1022.html|title=Juan Pablo Azpilicueta reapareció después de dos meses de baja|trans-title=Juan Pablo Azpilicueta reappeared after two months out|newspaper=Diario de Navarra|first=Fermín|last=Astráin|language=es|date=26 March 2014|accessdate=20 October 2015}}</ref>
