FC Köln]] (loan) | caps5 = 0 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2014–2015 | clubs6 = → [[1. FC Köln II]] (loan) | caps6 = 2 | goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2015–2016 | clubs7 = → [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] (loan) | caps7 = 43 | goals7 = 0 | years8 = 2016–2018 | clubs8 = → [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] (loan) | caps8 = 69 | goals8 = 1 | years9 = 2018– | clubs9 = → [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] (loan) | caps9 = 27 | goals9 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2009–2010 | nationalteam1 = [[Czech Republic national under-17 football team|Czech Republic U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 12 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2010 | nationalteam2 = [[Czech Republic national under-18 football team|Czech Republic U18]] | nationalcaps2 = 5 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2011 | nationalteam3 = [[Czech Republic national under-19 football team|Czech Republic U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 8 | nationalgoals3 = 1 | nationalyears4 = 2013 | nationalteam4 = [[Czech Republic national under-20 football team|Czech Republic U20]] | nationalcaps4 = 3 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | nationalyears5 = 2011–2015 | nationalteam5 = [[Czech Republic national under-21 football team|Czech Republic U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 23 | nationalgoals5 = 0 | nationalyears6 = 2012– | nationalteam6 = [[Czech Republic national football team|Czech Republic]] | nationalcaps6 = 18 | nationalgoals6 = 2 | club-update = 15:37, 10 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20 November 2018 }} '''Tomáš Kalas''' (born 15 May 1993) is a Czech professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]], on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. He plays as a [[centre back]], but has also been played as a [[right back]].
Having begun his career at [[Sigma Olomouc]], he signed for Chelsea for a reported £5.2 million in 2010. He spent most of his tenure out on loan, first back at Sigma, then at [[Vitesse Arnhem]], [[1. FC Köln]], [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] and [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].
Kalas earned 42 caps and scored once for the Czech youth international teams, and made his senior international debut in 2012.
==Club career==
===Chelsea===
====Early career==== Born in [[Olomouc]], Kalas started his career in his hometown with [[SK Sigma Olomouc|Sigma Olomouc]], making his debut in a 2–0 victory over [[FC Slovan Liberec|Slovan Liberec]] on 5 May 2010.<ref name="Thomas Kalas">{{cite web|title=Thomas Kalas|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/thomas-kalas/129944/|publisher=Soccerway|accessdate=7 July 2010}}</ref> He then signed for [[Premier League]] champions [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], on 7 July 2010, for a reported figure of around £5.2 million, although it was agreed that he would stay at Sigma Olomouc for the 2010–11 season.<ref name="Chelsea sign teenage Czech defender Tomas Kalas">{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/chelsea/8797276.stm|title=Chelsea sign teenage Czech defender Tomas Kalas|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=7 July 2010|accessdate=7 July 2010}}</ref> Kalas arrived at Chelsea for the second half of the [[2010–11 in English football|2010–11 season]] and made his Chelsea [[Chelsea F.C. Reserves and Academy|reserve team]] debut in a 2–2 away draw to [[Aston Villa F.C. Reserves and Academy|Aston Villa]] on 21 February.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.chelseafc.com/page/TheReservesNews/0,,10268~2298926,00.html | title=Reserve Report: Aston Villa 2 Chelsea 2 | accessdate=3 March 2011 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110320140716/http://www.chelseafc.com/page/TheReservesNews/0,,10268~2298926,00.html | archivedate=20 March 2011 | df=dmy-all }}</ref>
On 22 August 2011 Kalas joined Dutch football club [[Vitesse Arnhem]] on [[Loan (association football)|loan]] for the [[2011–12 Eredivisie|2011–12]] season.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.vitesse.nl/nieuws/bericht/presentatie-nieuwe-nummer-2-tomas-kalas/1784 | title=Presentatie nieuwe nummer 2: Tomáš Kalas | accessdate=22 August 2011 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121104155705/http://www.vitesse.nl/nieuws/bericht/presentatie-nieuwe-nummer-2-tomas-kalas/1784 | archivedate=4 November 2012 | df=dmy-all }}</ref> He was given the number 2 jersey. He made his debut for Vitesse on 17 September 2011 against [[Roda JC Kerkrade]] which ended in a 5–0 win for Vitesse.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.weaintgotnohistory.com/2011/9/22/2442698/chelsea-fc-loan-roundup-9-22-11 | title=Chelsea FC loan roundup}}</ref>
In March 2012, Kalas admitted that he did not yet know where he will be playing next season, but was happy on loan at Vitesse. "Ideally I'll stay another year at this club," he told. "Simply put, there are three options. I'll stay here, go back to Chelsea or they will loan me to another club abroad. In late March I will talk with my managers about next season and know more."<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11668/7601619/Kalas-unsure-over-future | title=Kalas unsure over future}}</ref>
On 17 May 2012, Kalas scored the opening goal in the 22nd minute, for Vitesse against RKC Waalwijk; the match ended in a 3–1 win for Vitesse. This goal was Kalas' first goal of his professional career.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/05/17/netherlands/eredivisie/rkc-waalwijk/sbv-vitesse/1283674/ | title=RKC Waalwijk vs. Vitesse 1 – 3 |publisher=US Soccerway | accessdate=13 December 2014}}</ref>
On 11 July 2012, Kalas rejoined Vitesse on a new loan deal until the end of the [[2012–13 Eredivisie|2012–13]] season. He also extended his contract with Chelsea until the summer of 2017.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.chelseafc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10268~2841591,00.html | title=VITESSE LOANS FOR YOUNG PAIR | publisher=Chelseafc.com | accessdate=11 July 2012 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120714024653/http://www.chelseafc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10268~2841591,00.html | archivedate=14 July 2012 | df=dmy-all }}</ref> Kalas scored his first Eredivisie goal of the season for Vitesse in a 3–0 defeat of [[FC Groningen]] on 16 September 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/us/en/gamecast/statistics/id/343517/statistics.html?soccernet=true&cc=5901 |title=FC Groningen 0 – 3 Vitesse Arnhem |publisher=ESPNFC |date=16 September 2012}}</ref>
During his second loan spell at Vitesse, Kalas was mainly deployed as a right-back instead of his natural centre-back. Kalas ended up playing a total of 76 games overall competition during his two-year stay at Vitesse.
====2013–2015==== On 10 July 2013 Chelsea manager [[José Mourinho]] confirmed Kalas would stay and fight for his place at Chelsea for the coming season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3234245/title/mourinho-early-report---part-one|title=Home|website=ChelseaFC|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130802041005/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3234245/title/mourinho-early-report---part-one|archivedate=2 August 2013|df=dmy-all}}</ref> During Chelsea's 2013 pre-season Asia tour, Kalas made 3 appearances for Chelsea, in wins against the Singha All Stars, the Malaysian XI, and the Indonesian XI. During pre-season training, Kalas suffered fractured fibula, cutting his action with the first-team short as the rest of the team flew over to America for the [[2013 International Champions Cup|Guinness International Champions Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Tomas Kalas suffers fractured fibula and will be out for about a month|url=http://weaintgotnohistory.sbnation.com/2013/7/30/4572860/tomas-kalas-injury-out-for-one-month/|accessdate=30 July 2013}}</ref>
After finally recovered from his injuries, Kalas made his competitive debut for the senior squad on 29 October 2013 as a substitute for Juan Mata, in a 2–0 win at Arsenal in the [[Football League Cup|Capital One Cup]]. Speaking of his role at Chelsea, Kalas said in an interview with a Czech chat show: "I am a player for training sessions. If they need a cone they put me there instead."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/KHaring75/status/460396999670779904|title=Karel Häring|work=Twitter}}</ref>
On 18 March 2014, Kalas made his [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] debut against [[Galatasaray S.K. (football)|Galatasaray]], replacing Willian in stoppage time; Chelsea won 2–0.<ref>{{cite web|title=Chelsea vs. Galatasaray 2 – 0 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/03/18/europe/uefa-champions-league/chelsea-football-club/galatasaray-sk/1611887/|accessdate=18 March 2014}}</ref>
On 27 April 2014, Kalas was given his debut in the [[Premier League]] for Chelsea, at [[Anfield]] against Liverpool, starting in place of the injured [[John Terry]]. He played the whole 90 minutes in a 2–0 win that kept Chelsea in contention for the league title.<ref>{{cite web|title=TEAM NEWS: LIVERPOOL V CHELSEA|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3790508/title/team-news-liverpool-v-chelsea|accessdate=27 April 2014}}</ref>
On 11 June 2014, [[1. FC Köln]] announced that Kalas would spend the 2014–15 season on loan at their club.<ref>{{cite web|title=FC leiht Tomas Kalas aus|url=http://www.fc-koeln.de/news/detailansicht/?tx_ttnews[tt_news]=7838&cHash=94f330fc63ab4a1f13e2f770879a4c9a|publisher=1. FC Koln|accessdate=11 June 2014|date=11 June 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=KALAS LOAN TO COLOGNE|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3898104/title/kalas-loan-to-cologne|publisher=chelseafc.com|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=11 June 2014}}</ref> On 24 September, Kalas made his debut for Köln II, FC Köln's reserve team, against [[Borussia Mönchengladbach|Borussia Mönchengladbach II]]; the game ended in a 2–1 win for Köln II.<ref>{{cite web|title=Chelsea's Koln Loanee Tomas Kalas Falling by the Wayside|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2225751-chelseas-koln-loanee-tomas-kalas-falling-by-the-wayside|accessdate=8 December 2014}}</ref> On 25 October 2014, Kalas made another appearance for Köln II against [[SC Verl]]; the game ended in a 2–0 loss for Köln II.<ref>{{cite web|title=Koln II vs Verl|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/10/25/germany/regionalliga/1-fc-koln-ii/sc-verl-1924/1766355/|accessdate=8 December 2014}}</ref>
Kalas, himself, did not know why he had been given the cold shoulder at Köln, where he played only two reserve games. During an interview, Kalas said "At first they were happy with my performances but then I didn’t play in {{sic|any game}}. I don’t know what went wrong." With the lack of playing time, Kalas was linked to a move to multiple English clubs, as well as his former team Vitesse in the January 2015 [[transfer window]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Tomas Kalas set for change of scene with Chelsea 'nervous and disappointed' over Koln loan|url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/537270/Tomas-Kalas-Koln-loan-Chelsea-January-move|accessdate=22 December 2014}}</ref>
====2015–==== On 9 January 2015, [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] announced that Kalas would spend the remainder of the 2014–15 season on loan at the [[Football League Championship|Championship]] club.<ref>{{cite web|title=KALAS LOAN TO MIDDLESBROUGH|url=http://www.mfc.co.uk/news/article/2014/chelsea-tomas-kalas-boro-aitor-karanka-stamford-bridge-2193371.aspx|accessdate=9 January 2015|date=9 January 2015}}</ref> The day after signing with the Boro, Kalas made his debut for Middlesbrough in a 0–0 draw against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]].<ref>{{cite web|title=BBC Sport – Reading v Middlesbrough|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30663415|accessdate=10 January 2015|date=10 January 2015}}</ref> Manager [[Aitor Karanka]] praised Kalas' aptitude to the right-back position, where Middlesbrough had been challenged following a long-term injury to [[Damià Abella]] in September 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Tomas Kalas: Middlesbrough boss Aitor Karanka happy with full-back|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30778977|accessdate=18 January 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=12 January 2015}}</ref>
Kalas retained his position as the right-back against [[Huddersfield Town]] and [[Cardiff City]]. During the game against Cardiff City on 20 January 2015, Kalas suffered a high ankle sprain.<ref>{{cite news|title=Middlesbrough vs. Cardiff City 2 – 1|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/01/20/england/championship/middlesbrough-football-club/cardiff-city-fc/1705283/|accessdate=20 January 2015|date=20 January 2015}}</ref> On 10 February 2015, Kalas returned to the starting line-up in a 2–1 away win against [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Blackpool vs Middlesbrough 1 – 2|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/02/10/england/championship/blackpool-fc/middlesbrough-football-club/1705353/|accessdate=12 April 2015|date=10 February 2015}}</ref> On 14 April 2015, Kalas provided an assist to fellow Chelsea loanee [[Patrick Bamford]] as Middlesbrough beat [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolves]] 2–1 at home.<ref>{{cite news|title=Middlesbrough vs. Wolves 2 – 1|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3038837/Middlesbrough-2-1-Wolves-Patrick-Bamford-inspires-Boro-secure-play-position.html|accessdate=15 April 2015|date=14 April 2015}}</ref>
Due to regulations of a short-term loan, Kalas was unable to finish out his season playing for the Boro. Although he missed the final three games of the season, he did ask permission to stay with Middlesbrough and train with the team until the season finished.<ref>{{cite news|title=Tomas Kalas, owned by Chelsea, discusses returning to loan club Middlesbrough|url=http://hereisthecity.com/en-gb/2015/04/20/tomas-kalas-owned-by-chelsea-discusses-returning-to-loan-club-mi/|accessdate=25 April 2015|date=19 April 2015}}</ref> Kalas played a big role in the Boro making it to the [[2015 Football League play-offs|play-offs]], although they were unable to beat [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] in the final to achieve promotion to the Premier League.<ref>{{cite news|title=Middlesbrough 0–2 Norwich: Norwich returns to Premier League|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/32776552|date=25 May 2015}}</ref>
On 13 July 2015, Kalas moved on to Middlesbrough for a second time until the end of the 2015–16 season.<ref>{{cite news|title=Tomas Kalas: Boro sign Chelsea starlet for second loan spell|url=http://www.gazettelive.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/tomas-kalas-boro-sign-chelsea-9643397|accessdate=13 July 2015|date=13 July 2015}}</ref> On 23 July 2015, Kalas signed a new three-year deal at Chelsea, therefore keeping him at the club until 2018.<ref>{{Cite news |title=New contract for Kalas |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/07/new-contract-for-kalas.html |publisher=Chelsea FC |date=23 July 2015}}</ref> On 9 August 2015, Kalas started against [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] in the opening game of the season, where he retained his spot as right-back from the previous season.<ref>{{cite news|title=Preston North End vs. Middlesbrough 0 – 0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/08/09/england/championship/preston-north-end-fc/middlesbrough-football-club/2043869/|date=9 August 2015}}</ref> During the first half of the season, Kalas was the starting right-back, but was dropped later on for the in-form [[Emilio Nsue]]. Even though he was playing a lot less, Middlesbrough manager [[Aitor Karanka]] stated that Kalas was still important in their chase for promote to the [[Premier League]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Aitor Karanka on Tomas Kalas: 'He's been unlucky recently but he's still an important player for us'|url=http://www.gazettelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/aitor-karanka-tomas-kalas-hes-10743445|date=16 January 2016}}</ref> On 19 April 2016, Kalas played his last game for the Boro coming on as a late substitute as the Boro held out for the draw against league leaders [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Burnley vs. Middlesbrough 1 – 1|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/04/19/england/championship/burnley-fc/middlesbrough-football-club/2044486/|date=16 April 2016}}</ref>
Although there were talks about Kalas returning to Middlesbrough for a third spell, nothing materialise while Kalas received interest from other teams.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Middlesbrough target permanent deal for Chelsea defender Tomas Kalas |url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2912164/middlesbrough-target-permanent-deal-for-chelsea-defender-tomas-kalas |publisher=ESPN |date=13 July 2016}}</ref> <ref>{{Cite news |title=Chelsea defender Tomas Kalas ends Middlesbrough FC speculation by agreeing Fulham loan move |url=http://www.gazettelive.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/chelsea-defender-tomas-kalas-ends-11611744 |date=13 July 2016}}</ref> On 13 July 2016, Kalas joined [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on a season-long loan, with this being his fifth loan.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Kalas Joins On Loan |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/july/13/tomas-kalas-joins-on-loan |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=13 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=Kalas loaned to Fulham |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/07/kalas-loaned-to-fulham.html|publisher=Chelsea F.C.|date=13 July 2016}}</ref>
On 5 August, Kalas made his debut in a 1–0 home victory over [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]]. Kalas made an injury-time block to deny [[Matt Ritchie]]'s goal-bound shot, as he helped Fulham hold out for the clean-sheet.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/aug/05/fulham-newcastle-united-championship-match-report|title=Matt Smith’s winner for Fulham ends Newcastle’s hopes on opening night|date=5 August 2016|publisher=The Guardian}}</ref> Kalas missed his first league game on 24 September 2016 after picking up a hamstring injury.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fulham.vitalfootball.co.uk/article.asp?a=464208 |title=Barnsley v Fulham |date=14 October 2016|accessdate=19 October 2016}}</ref> On 29 October 2016, Kalas returned from his injury and went on to score his first goal for Fulham in a 5–0 win over [[Huddersfield Town]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37736406|title=Fulham 5–0 Huddersfield|publisher=BBC|date=29 October 2016 |accessdate=31 October 2016}}</ref> Fulham qualified for the playoffs but lost 2–1 on aggregate in the semi-finals to [[Reading F.C.|Reading]], with Kalas conceding the winning penalty by committing handball.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Williams|first1=Adam|title=Reading 1–0 Fulham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39853033|accessdate=21 December 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 May 2017}}</ref>
On 27 July 2017, Kalas signed a new four-year contract with Chelsea and rejoined Fulham on loan for a second season.<ref>{{Cite news |title=New contract and loan for Kalas |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/07/new-contract-and-loan-for-kalas.html |publisher=Chelsea Official Site |date=27 July 2017 |accessdate=27 July 2017}}</ref> He was sent off after 39 seconds on 12 August in a 1–1 draw at Reading for a foul on [[Mo Barrow]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Fulham's Tomas Kalas lasts all of 39 seconds before red card against Reading|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/fulhams-tomas-kalas-lasts-all-39-seconds-red-card-against-reading|accessdate=21 December 2017|work=FourFourTwo|date=14 August 2017}}</ref>
==International career==
===Czech Republic U17=== Kalas made his debut for the U-17 on 5 September 2009 coming on as a 61st-minute substitute in a European Under-17 Championship Qualifying match against [[Belarus national under-17 football team|Belarus]] which the Czechs won 1–0. He went on to be picked for the final tournament. He played 65 minutes of his 9th appearance, against [[Greece national football team|Greece]], before being sent off.<ref name="Tomas Kalas red card">{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/matches/season=2010/round=15342/match=2002339/index.html|title=Tomas Kalas gets sent off|publisher=UEFA.com|date=8 July 2010|accessdate=8 July 2010}}</ref>
===Czech Republic U21=== Kalas made his debut for the U-21 on 1 June 2012 in a UEFA U-21 Championship game against the Montenegro which ended in a 2–1 victory for the Czechs.
===Czech Republic===
Kalas made his senior debut in a 3–0 [[Exhibition game|friendly]] win against [[Slovakia national football team|Slovakia]] at his hometown's [[Andrův stadion]] on 14 November 2012, coming on as a substitute for [[David Limberský]] in the 74th minute.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/11/14/world/friendlies/czech-republic/slovakia/1395163/|title=Czech vs Slovakia 3–0|publisher=Soccerway|date=14 November 2012|accessdate=28 June 2015}}</ref> Kalas was included in the squad during the [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying|Euro 16 qualifiers]]. On 13 October 2015, Kalas came off the bench replacing [[Josef Šural]], as Czech Republic held on for the 3–2 victory<ref>{{cite news|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/10/13/europe/european-championship-qualification/netherlands/czech-republic/1653395/|title=Netherland 2–3 Czech|publisher=Soccerway|date=13 October 2015|accessdate=13 July 2016}}</ref> and winning the group in the process.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/33544119|title=Netherlands' bid to qualify for Euro 2016 ended in failure|publisher=BBC Sports|date=13 October 2015|accessdate=13 July 2016}}</ref>

'''Todd Arthur Lucien Kane''' (born 17 September 1993) is an English [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Hull City A.F.C.| Hull City]] on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], as a [[Defender (association football)|right back]], but can also play at right wing back, right midfielder or left back.
==Career==
===Chelsea=== Kane joined [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] at under-8 level and progressed through the youth system at the club.<ref name="Chelsea profile">{{cite web | url=http://www.chelseafc.com/chelsea-article/article/908966/title/todd-kane | publisher=Chelsea F.C | title=Chelsea Profile | accessdate=5 December 2012 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121001004954/http://www.chelseafc.com/chelsea-article/article/908966/title/todd-kane | archivedate=1 October 2012 | df=dmy-all }}</ref> He signed his first professional contract with the club in July 2011.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://thechels.net/2011/07/blues-sign-four-to-pro-deals/| publisher=The Chels | title=Blues Sign Four To Pro Deals|accessdate=5 December 2012}}</ref> He was a part of the side that won the [[2011–12 FA Youth Cup]], beating [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] in the final.<ref name="Chelsea profile"/>
On 3 August 2015, Kane signed a new three-year deal at Chelsea, therefore keeping him at the club until 2018.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Signed a new 3 year contract for Chelsea football club today. The club I have supported my whole life and grew up playing for from the age of 7. Can't be more happier |url=https://instagram.com/p/57FP5Xsn7j/ |publisher=Todd Kane (Instagram) |date=3 August 2015}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=New deal for Kane |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/08/new-deal-for-kane.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=3 August 2015}}</ref> On 23 September 2016, Kane signed another new three-year, extending his stay until 2019.<ref>{{Cite news |title=New deal for Kane |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/09/new-deal-for-kane.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=23 September 2016 |accessdate=23 September 2016}}</ref>
====Loan to Preston North End==== In November 2012, he joined [[Football League One]] side [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] on loan until January 2013.<ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20451239| publisher=BBC Sport | title=Todd Kane: Chelsea loan defender to Preston North End|accessdate=5 December 2012}}</ref> He made his professional debut on 24 November 2012, in a 2–0 defeat to [[Leyton Orient F.C.|Leyton Orient]].<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.elite.gd/news/todd-kane-makes-league-debut/| publisher=EMA| title=Todd Makes League Debut| accessdate=5 December 2012}}{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}</ref> He made a total of five appearances in all competitions during his time at [[Deepdale]].
====Loans to Blackburn Rovers==== On 9 January 2013, he signed for [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] on a one-month loan deal.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.rovers.co.uk/news/article/kane-capture-completed-587886.aspx/| publisher=Blackburn Rovers F.C. | title=Rovers complete Kane capture|accessdate=9 January 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3035471/title/kane-starts-loan-spell-at-blackburn | archive-url=https://archive.is/20130215174502/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3035471/title/kane-starts-loan-spell-at-blackburn | dead-url=yes | archivedate=15 February 2013 | publisher=Chelsea F.C. | title=Kane Starts Loan Spell at Blackburn | accessdate=9 January 2013 }}</ref> He made his debut for Rovers on 11 January in a 1–1 draw against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].<ref>{{cite web| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20907515 | publisher=BBC Sport | title=Wolves 1 : 1 Blackburn |accessdate=11 January 2013}}</ref> On 15 March 2013, Blackburn re-signed Kane on another month-long loan deal.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11676/8568635/| publisher=Sky Sports | title=Blackburn have re-signed Chelsea defender Todd Kane on loan|accessdate=15 March 2013}}</ref> Kane later extended his contract with Blackburn until the end of the 2012–13 season.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://bleacherreport.com/tb/daaP1| publisher=Sky Sports| title=Chelsea defender Todd Kane extends Blackburn loan until end of season|accessdate=17 April 2013}}</ref> On 25 April 2013, Kane signed a new contract with Chelsea which keeps him at the club until 2016.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3156350/title/new-deal-for-defender-kane | publisher=Chelsea F.C. | title=New Deal for Defender Kane | accessdate=25 April 2013 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130529013548/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3156350/title/new-deal-for-defender-kane | archivedate=29 May 2013 | df=dmy-all }}</ref>
On 25 June 2013, Kane rejoined [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] on loan for the entire [[2013–14 Blackburn Rovers F.C. season|2013–14 Football League Championship]] season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rovers.co.uk/news/article/chelsea-starlet-set-to-sign-878659.aspx| publisher=Blackburn Rovers F.C. |title=Chelsea Starlet Set To Sign|accessdate=25 April 2013}}</ref> He scored his first professional goal against [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] on 24 August 2013 in a 5–2 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23736833| publisher=BBC Sport |title=Blackburn 5 Barnsley 2|accessdate=24 August 2013}}</ref> He scored his second goal for Blackburn in their 4–2 victory over [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham]] which turned out to be his last game for Blackburn.
====Loan to Bristol City==== On 14 November 2014, [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] signed Todd on a two-month loan until 18 January 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://weaintgotnohistory.sbnation.com/2014/11/15/7225211/todd-kane-joins-bristol-city-on-two-month-loan |title=Todd Kane joins Bristol City on two-month loan|accessdate=16 November 2014}}</ref> On 15 November 2014, Todd made his debut for Bristol City as a substitute for Scott Wagstaff in the 75th minute against Swindon Town, the game ended in a 1–0 loss for Bristol City. On 7 December Todd made his first start for Bristol City against [[A.F.C. Telford United|Telford United]] in the second round proper of the FA Cup, where Todd played the full 90 minutes; the game ended in a 1–0 win for Bristol City. In the dying minutes, Todd suffered a shoulder injury from Godfrey Poku.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/409703/gamecast.html|title= Bristol City 1–0 Telford United|accessdate=7 December 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bcfc.co.uk/news/article/kane-injury-not-as-bad-as-first-feared-2133568.aspx|title=Kane injury not as bad as first feared|accessdate=7 December 2014}}</ref>
====Loan to Nottingham Forest==== After his loan spell at Bristol City expired, Kane was loaned to Championship club [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] until the end of the 2014–15 season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/article/forest-bring-in-chelsea-defender-2188440.aspx |title=Chelsea defender signs |publisher=Nottingham Forest F.C. |date=8 January 2015 |accessdate=1 February 2018}}</ref> Kane made his debut for Nottingham Forest on 10 January 2015 against [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]], which ended in a 2–0 loss for Forest.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/01/10/england/championship/nottingham-forest-fc/sheffield-wednesday-fc/1705247/ |title=Nottingham Forest vs. Sheffield Wednesday 0–2 |date=10 January 2015 |publisher=Soccerway |accessdate=1 February 2018}}</ref> After his debut, Kane made three consecutive start under the management of [[Stuart Pearce]] including a 2–1 away win against [[Derby County]].<ref name="soccerway">{{Soccerway|todd-kane/245833}}</ref>
After [[Dougie Freedman]] replaced Stuart Pearce Kane's role in the squad was reduced greatly, only making the bench twice and ending up as an unused substitute for both games.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/dougie-freedman-new-nottingham-forest-5087620 |title=Dougie Freedman named new manager of Nottingham Forest replacing Stuart Pearce |newspaper=Daily Mirror |first=Alex |last=Richards |date=1 February 2015 |accessdate=1 February 2018}}</ref> On 7 March 2015 Kane returned to the starting line-up in the match against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]]; the match ended in a 2–1 win for Forest.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/03/07/england/championship/nottingham-forest-fc/middlesbrough-football-club/1705507/|title=Nottingham 2–1 Middlesbrough |publisher=Soccerway |accessdate=7 March 2015}}</ref> On 6 April 2015, Kane came off the bench replacing fellow goal-scorer, [[Tyler Walker (footballer)|Tyler Walker]], in the 75th minute against [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]]. In just two minutes after coming off the bench, Kane scored from a cross Ben Osborn to the far post; though the two-goal lead was not enough for a win as Forest drew 2–2.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3027626/Brentford-2-2-Nottingham-Forest-Bees-earn-late-point-maintain-Premier-League-promotion-push.html|title=Brentford 2–2 Nottingham Forest: Jota earns The Bees a late point after Tyler Walker fires visitors ahead |newspaper=Daily Mail |first=James |last=Andrew |date=6 April 2015 |accessdate=1 February 2018}}</ref>
====Loan to NEC Nijmegen==== On 6 August 2015, Kane joined [[N.E.C. (football club)|NEC Nijmegen]] on a season-long loan to gain first team experience abroad.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Dutch loan for Kane |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/08/dutch-loan-for-kane.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=6 August 2015}}</ref> On 12 August, Kane made his debut coming off the bench in a match against [[S.B.V. Excelsior|Excelsior]] which ended in a 1–0 win for NEC Nijmegen.<ref>{{Cite news |title=NEC vs. Excelsior 1 – 0 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/08/12/netherlands/eredivisie/nijmegen-eendracht-combinatie/sbv-excelsior/2039256/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=12 August 2015}}</ref> On 23 August, Kane made his first start in a 2–0 loss against [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=NEC vs. Ajax 0 – 2 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/08/23/netherlands/eredivisie/nijmegen-eendracht-combinatie/afc-ajax/2039271// |publisher=Soccerway |date=23 August 2015}}</ref> Kane scored his first and only goal of the season in a 3–1 loss against [[FC Utrecht]] on April 10, 2016.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Utrecht vs. NEC 3 - 1 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/04/10/netherlands/eredivisie/stichting-fc-utrecht/nijmegen-eendracht-combinatie/2039517/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=10 April 2016}}</ref>
Kane's season was cut short when he suffered an injury during the game against [[PEC Zwolle]] on April 20, 2016. Kane was stretched off the pitch in the closing stages of the game. After an MRI scan, it was confirmed that Kane had torn his anterior cruciate ligament, ruling him out for 4–6 months.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Chelsea Loanee Todd Kane tears cruciate ligament |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1862/premier-league/2016/04/22/22681732/chelsea-loanee-todd-kane-tears-cruciate-ligament/ |publisher=Goal|date=22 April 2016}}</ref>
====Loan to Groningen==== On 5 July 2017, following his recovery from a knee injury, Kane returned to the Netherlands to join [[FC Groningen]] on a season-long loan.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Kane crosses the North Sea |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/07/kane-crosses-the-north-sea.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=5 July 2017 |accessdate=5 July 2017}}</ref> On the opening day of the season, he made his debut during Groningen's 3–3 draw with [[SC Heerenveen|Heerenveen]], replacing [[Mike te Wierik]] in the 83rd minute.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Groningen vs. Heerenveen |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/matches/2017/08/13/netherlands/eredivisie/stichting-fc-groningen/sportclub-heerenveen/2462346/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=13 August 2017 |accessdate=30 January 2018}}</ref> Two weeks later, Kane made his first start for Groningen during their 2–1 home victory over [[FC Utrecht|Utrecht]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Groningen vs. Utrecht |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/matches/2017/08/27/netherlands/eredivisie/stichting-fc-groningen/stichting-fc-utrecht/2462364/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=27 August 2017 |accessdate=30 January 2018}}</ref> On 30 January 2018, after only appearing in twelve games all season, Kane's loan spell with Groningen was terminated.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Todd Kane returned to Chelsea |url=https://www.fcgroningen.nl/nieuws/todd-kane-terug-naar-chelsea/2 |publisher=Groningen F.C. |language=Dutch |date=30 January 2018 |accessdate=30 January 2018}}</ref>
====Loan to Oxford United==== On 31 January 2018 Kane joined [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] on loan for the remainder of the season.<ref>{{cite web|title=Oxford United sign Chelsea defender Todd Kane on deadline day|url=http://www.oxfordmail.co.uk/sport/15909998.Oxford_United_sign_Chelsea_defender_Todd_Kane_on_deadline_day/|newspaper=[[Oxford Mail]]|date=31 January 2018|accessdate=31 January 2018|first=David|last=Pritchard}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Todd Kane: Chelsea right-back joins Oxford United on loan|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42890810|publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 January 2018|accessdate=31 January 2018}}</ref>
====Loan to Hull City==== On 17 July 2018, Kane joined [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] on a season-long loan.<ref>{{cite web|title=Todd Kane: Hull City sign Chelsea defender on season-long loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44860609|publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 July 2018|accessdate=17 July 2018}}</ref> He made his debut in the first match of the 2018–19 season on 6 August 2018 at home to [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in a 1–3 defeat.<ref>{{cite news | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45001925 | title = Hull City v Aston Villa | date = 6 August 2018 | work = BBC Sport | publisher = BBC | accessdate = 6 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Kane was first called up by [[England National Football Team|England]] to represent [[England national under-19 football team|the U19s]] at a friendly tournament in Limoges during October 2011. On 8 August 2013, he was called up to [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] squad for the first time for a friendly match against [[Scotland national under-21 football team|Scotland]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-under-21s/News/2013/scotland-squad-announced-080813.aspx| publisher=thefa.com |title=Roy Hodgson names a 25-man squad for game with Scotland at Bramall Lane |accessdate=8 August 2013}}</ref>

Having come through the academy system of the [[New York Red Bulls]], he made his debut in the [[2013 Major League Soccer season]] and won two [[Supporters' Shield|MLS Supporters' Shield]]s with the team. ==Club career== ===Youth=== From [[Clifton, New Jersey]], Miazga attended [[Clifton High School (New Jersey)|Clifton High School]] for one yearCowen, Richard. [http://archive.northjersey.com/news/passaic-soccer-kids-meet-clifton-player-who-made-it-to-the-red-bulls-1.1392187 "Passaic soccer kids meet Clifton player who made it to the Red Bulls"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170217142733/http://archive.northjersey.com/news/passaic-soccer-kids-meet-clifton-player-who-made-it-to-the-red-bulls-1.1392187 |date=February 17, 2017 }}, ''[[The Record (Bergen County)]]'', August 13, 2015. Accessed February 16, 2017. "Miazga said he played for Clifton High School for one year before moving on to the Red Bulls development program." before he left and joined the [[New York Red Bulls Academy]] in 2009 at under-14 level.{{cite web|title=Red Bulls Sign Home Grown Defender Matt Miazga|url=http://www.newyorkredbulls.com/news/2013/05/red-bulls-sign-home-grown-defender-matt-miazga|work=New York Red Bulls|accessdate=June 30, 2013}} While with the under-16 side, Miazga helped the Red Bulls win the [[U.S. Soccer Development Academy]] National Championship in 2012. In 2013, Miazga had signed a [[letter of intent]] to play for the [[Michigan Wolverines men's soccer]] program.{{cite web|title=Daley Adds 10 Signees, One Transfer for 2013 Season|url=http://www.mgoblue.com/sports/m-soccer/spec-rel/050813aaa.html|website=Michigan Athletics|publisher=MGoBlue.com|accessdate=February 1, 2016}}{{cite web|title=Matt Miazga Bio|url=http://www.mgoblue.com/sports/m-soccer/mtt/matt_miazga_846140.html|website=Michigan Wolverines Athletics|publisher=MGoBlue.com|accessdate=February 1, 2016}} However, after offers from Europe and the New York Red Bulls, Miazga turned down his scholarship offer to play in college and signed with the Red Bulls at the professional level. ===New York Red Bulls=== [[File:Miazga Defends Defoe.jpg|left|thumb|Matt Miazga tackles [[Toronto FC]]'s [[Jermain Defoe]] in June 2014]] On May 30, 2013, it was announced Miazga had signed a [[Homegrown Player Rule (Major League Soccer)|homegrown contract]] with the New York Red Bulls, becoming the eighth player to sign a homegrown contract with the club. Miazga made his first-team debut at age 18 as a substitute for [[Markus Holgersson]] in the 76th minute of a 4–1 win at [[Houston Dynamo]] on September 8, 2013. Miazga started playing more frequently during the 2014 season. Also, in August 2014, he signed an endorsement deal with [[Nike Inc.|Nike]] and played in the [[Major League Soccer Homegrown Game]].{{cite news|last1=Stanmyre|first1=Matthew|title=NJ's Matt Miazga, Red Bulls rookie, living dream from mom and dad's at 19|url=http://www.nj.com/redbulls/index.ssf/2014/08/livin_the_dream_from_home_local_kid_matt_miazga_making_mark_with_red_bulls.html|accessdate=April 9, 2016|publisher=NJ.com|date=August 28, 2014}} Miazga made his [[CONCACAF Champions League]] debut in a 1–1 draw against the [[Montreal Impact]] on October 22.http://www.concacaf.com/category/champions-league/game-detail/203204 During the 2015 season, Miazga established himself as a starter for the club, forming a partnership in the backline with [[Damien Perrinelle]]. He was sent off for two bookings in a 2–1 victory against [[New York City FC]] in the first ever [[Hudson River Derby]] match on May 10.{{cite news|title=RED CARD: Matt Miazga is sent off in the first half after a second yellow card|url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2015/05/10/red-card-matt-miazga-sent-first-half-after-second-yellow-card|accessdate=April 9, 2016|publisher=Major League Soccer|date=May 10, 2015}} On June 28, he scored his first goal as a professional in a 3–1 derby victory over the same opponents at [[Yankee Stadium]]. He celebrated by pretending to swing a baseball bat, making fun of the fact that their rivals play in a baseball stadium.{{cite news|last1=Giocometti|first1=Eric|title=It's high, it's far, it is gone! Matt Miazga on his "Home run" celebration at Yankee Stadium|url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2015/06/30/its-high-its-far-it-gone-matt-miazga-his-home-run-celebration-yankee-stadium|accessdate=April web|url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2015/06/29/team-week-wk-17-darlington-nagbe-matt-miazga-shine-during-mls-heineken-rivalry-week|title=Team of the Week (Wk 17): Darlington Nagbe, Matt Miazga shine reported £3.5 million (US$5 million).{{Cite news |title=Miazga move completed |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/01/miazga-move-completed.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=January web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/match?gameId=451100/ |title=FC Twente 2–1 Vitesse (9/25/16) |date=September 25, 2016}} On December 14, Miazga scored his first and only goal for Vitesse in a [[KNVB Cup]] tie against [[CVV de Jodan Boys|Jodan Boys]], which finished 4–0.{{Cite news |title=Vitesse vs. Jodan Boys |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/12/14/netherlands/knvb-beker/sbv-vitesse/cvv-de-jodan-boys/2367512/ |publisher=Soccerway |date= December 14, 2016 |accessdate=December 14, 2016}} He went on to win the Cup with Vitesse in his first season at the club by beating [[AZ Alkmaar]] 2–0 in the final. He played in every match of the successful Cup campaign. On July 28, 2017, Miazga's loan spell at Vitesse was extended for the [[2017–18 Eredivisie|2017–18 campaign]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/07/vitesse-extension-for-miazga.html|title=Vitesse extension for Miazga|website=www.chelseafc.com|language=en-gb|access-date=July 28, 2017}} ====FC Nantes (loan)==== On August 6, 2018, Miazga joined [[Ligue 1]] club [[FC Nantes|Nantes]] on a season-long loan deal.{{cite web|url=https://www.fcnantes.com/articles/article2809.php?num=24691|title=MATT MIAZGA EST NANTAIS!|date=August 6, 2018|accessdate=August 6, 2018|language=French}} Miazga made his Ligue 1 debut on August 18, 2018, starting and playing 90 minutes in a 2–0 loss to [[Dijon FCO]].https://www.fcnantes.com/articles/feuillematch1819.php?num=3 ====Reading (loan)==== On January 25, 2019, Miazga joined [[Football League Championship|Championship]] club [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] until the end of the season after returning from Nantes.https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2019/1/25-/miazga-loaned-to-reading ==International career== Internationally, Miazga has represented the United States at under-14, −15, −18, −20 and −23 levels. He also played one match for the [[Poland national under-18 football team|Poland under-18 team]] in 2012.{{cite web |url=http://www.przegladsportowy.pl/pilka-nozna/reprezentacja-polski,mateusz-miazga-a-reprezentacja-polski-mateusz-miazga-a-kadra-usa,artykul,154227,1,291.html |title=Przez półtora miesiąca zagrał dla Polski i USA |last1= |first1= |last2= |first2= |date=December 19, 2012 |website=Przegląd Sportowy |publisher=Ringier Axel Springer Polska |accessdate=March 14, 2015 | language = Polish}} In May 2013, Miazga played for the [[United States men's national under-18 soccer team|United States under-18]] side that participated in the 19th Annual International Juniors Tournament in Portugal.{{cite web|title=Under-18 Men's National Team Commence 10-Day International Trip to Lisbon|url=http://www.ussoccer.com/news/u-18-mnt/2013/05/u18-mnt-commence-10-day-trip-to-portugal.aspx|work=United States Soccer Federation|accessdate=June 30, 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131030022153/http://www.ussoccer.com/news/u-18-mnt/2013/05/u18-mnt-commence-10-day-trip-to-portugal.aspx|archivedate=October 30, 2013}} In August and September 2014, Miazga turned down two separate call-ups to the [[Poland national under-20 football team|Poland under-20 team]]. He cited previous commitments to the [[United States men's national under-20 soccer team|United States under-20 team]] and maintained he had not made a final decision about which nation to represent at senior level. In October 2014, Poland U-20 coach [[Marcin Dorna]] stated he had not given up on Miazga and that the Red Bulls player might still play for his team.{{cite web |url=http://www.przegladsportowy.pl/pilka-nozna/reprezentacja-polski,reprezentacja-polski-u-20-pawel-cibicki-i-mateusz-miazga-powolani,artykul,505124,1,291.html |title=Reprezentacja U-20: Cibicki i Miazga powołani |last1= |first1= |last2= |first2= |date=September 25, 2014 |website=Przegląd Sportowy |publisher=Ringier Axel Springer Polska |accessdate=March 14, 2015 | language = Polish}}{{cite web |url=http://www.przegladsportowy.pl/pilka-nozna/reprezentacja-polski,powolania-do-reprezentacji-polski-u-20-na-mecz-z-niemcami,artykul,514727,1,291.html|title=Miazga poza kadrą Polski. Dorna: Temat nie jest zamknięty |last1= |first1= |last2= |first2= |date=October 31, 2014 |website=Przegląd Sportowy |publisher=Ringier Axel Springer Polska |accessdate=March 14, 2015 | language = Polish}} Miazga played for the U.S. under-20 team at the [[2015 CONCACAF U-20 Championship]] and helped the team qualify for the [[2015 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in New Zealand. Miazga was a standout performer at the 2015 U-20 World Cup, in which the Americans fell in the quarter finals to eventual champions [[Serbia national under-20 football team|Serbia]] on penalties.{{cite web |url=http://www.ussoccer.com/players/2014/04/09/10/08/matthew-miazga|title=Matt Miazga |last1= |first1= |last2= |first2= |website=U.S. Soccer |publisher=U.S. Soccer |accessdate=March 14, 2015 }} On November 5, 2015, Miazga was quoted as saying, "I'm totally undecided. I'll wait to see who calls me first to the main national team and see what happens then."{{cite web|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/matt-miazga-polish-american-centre-back-whos-caught-eye-chelsea#eQXdh01cqg6tyK9d.99|title=Matt Miazga: The Polish-American centre-back who's caught the eye of Chelsea|work=FourFourTwo}} He received his first [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] call-up for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – CONCACAF Fourth Round|2018 FIFA World Cup qualifiers]] matches.{{cite web|url=http://www.newyorkredbulls.com/post/2015/11/06/new-york-red-bulls-defender-matt-miazga-earns-first-call-us-men%E2%80%99s-senior-national|title=New York Red Bulls Defender Matt Miazga Earns First Call Up To U.S. Men's Senior National Team|work=New York Red Bulls}} He earned his first senior cap against [[Saint Vincent and the Grenadines national football team|Saint Vincent and the Grenadines]] on November 13, 2015, coming on as a 63rd-minute substitute in a 6–1 win at [[Busch Stadium]] in [[St. Louis]].{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=2000062536/match=300334136/index.html#nosticky|title=2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ - Matches - USA-St. Vincent / Grenadines - FIFA.com|work=FIFA.com}} On July 15, 2017, Miazga scored the Americans' third goal in a 3–0 win over [[Nicaragua national football team|Nicaragua]] in the [[2017 CONCACAF Gold Cup]] ==Personal life== During his time at the Red Bulls, Miazga lived with his parents Adam and Elżbieta in Clifton. His family is of [[Polish Americans|Polish descent]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mgoblue.com/sports/m-soccer/11021914 |title=Red Bulls new player, Miazga |website=Men's Soccer |date=2015 }}{{dead link|date=September 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} Miazga's idols are [[Rafael Márquez]], [[Carles Puyol]] and [[Gerard Piqué]].{{cite web|url=http://www.northjersey.com/sports/soccer/stay-at-home-defenseman-1.1284387?page=all|title=MLS: Clifton's Miazga hopes to become a star for the Red Bulls|publisher=NorthJersey.com|date=March 7, 2015}} Miazga is a devout [[Christianity|Christian]] who frequently makes reference to his faith in social media posts.{{cite web|url=http://www.xtheline.co.uk/matt-miazga/|work=Cross The Line|title=Chelsea defender Matt Miazga- ‘Stay humble, stay focused and everything else will fall into place’|author=Liam Flint|date=February 23, 2018|accessdate=March 13, 2018}} ==Career statistics== team|Nigeria]] | nationalcaps3 = 43 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | ntupdate = 14:39, 18 December 2018 (UTC) }} '''Kenneth Josiah Omeruo''' (born 17 October 1993) is a Nigerian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for [[Club Deportivo Leganés|CD Leganés]] on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and the [[Nigerian national football team|Nigeria national team]].{{cite web|author=Eredivisie |url=http://eredivisielive.nl/eredivisie/speler/857253/kenneth-omeruo/ |title=Kenneth Omeruo, ADO Den Haag |publisher=Eredivisielive.nl |date= |accessdate=31 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120514112702/http://eredivisielive.nl/eredivisie/speler/857253/kenneth-omeruo/ |archivedate=14 May 2012 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.worldfootball.net/spieler_profil/kenneth-omeruo/ |title=Kenneth Omeruo |publisher=Worldfootball.net |date=17 October 1993 |accessdate=31 May 2012}} Omeruo signed for Chelsea from [[Standard Liege]] in January 2012 and upon signing went on loan to Dutch top-flight side [[ADO Den Haag]]. Then only 19, he impressed enough in the [[Eredivisie]] to earn a call up to the Nigerian national team. Now a regular international, Omeruo has represented Nigeria at the [[2013 Africa Cup of Nations]] and the [[2013 Confederations Cup]] in Brazil. Omeruo cemented a place in the starting line-up at the Africa Cup of Nations as it turned into a wonderful tournament for the Super Eagles and they emerged from the tournament victorious.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25204040|title=Is Nigeria's Kenneth Omeruo Chelsea's best kept secret?|date=4 December 2013|accessdate=6 January 2014|publisher=BBC Sport}} ==Club career== ===Early career=== Omeruo had spells at [[Sunshine Stars F.C.|Sunshine Stars]] and [[Anderlecht (football club)|Anderlecht]] as a trialist before he was signed from the Anderlecht academy by [[Standard Liège]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/talentspotter-meet-kenneth-omeruo-best-chelsea-player-youve-never-heard?|title=Meet Kenneth Omeruo, the best Chelsea player you've never heard of|date=6 January 2014|accessdate=6 January 2014|publisher=FourFourTwo}} ===Chelsea=== In January 2012, Chelsea signed Omeruo from Liège and immediately loaned him out to [[Eredivisie]] club [[ADO Den Haag]].{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/1005272/chelsea-linked-with-move-for-standard-defender-kenneth-omeruo?cc=5901 |title=Chelsea linked with move for Standard defender Kenneth Omeruo |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=7 January 2012 |accessdate=31 May 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-india/news/222/transfer-zone/2012/01/08/2836305/chelsea-sign-nigerian-youngster-kenneth-omeruo |title=Chelsea Sign Nigerian Youngster Kenneth Omeruo |publisher=Goal.com |date=8 January 2012 |accessdate=8 January 2012}} In May 2014 Nigeria World Cup-bound Omeruo agreed a new three-year contract with [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]].{{cite web|url=http://africanfootball.com/news/430249/Omeruo-agrees-new-Chelsea-contract|title=OMERUO AGREES NEW CHELSEA CONTRACT|publisher=africanfootball.com |date=26 May 2014 |accessdate=28 May 2014}} On 31 August 2016, Omeruo signed a one-year contract extension until 2019, before leaving on loan again.{{cite web|url=https://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/08/new-contract-and-loan-for-omeruo.html |title=New contract and loan for Omeruo |date=31 August 2016 |publisher=Chelsea F.C.}} ====Loan to ADO Den Haag==== Omeruo joined [[ADO Den Haag]] on an 18-month loan deal which kept him at the club until the end of the 2012–13 season.{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11661/7416126/Chelsea-linked-to-Omeruo |title=Chelsea linked to Omeruo |publisher=Sky Sports |date=7 January 2012 |accessdate=7 January 2012}} On 3 March 2012, Omeruo made his debut for ADO Den Haag against [[SC Heerenveen]] which ended in a 0–0 draw.{{citation|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/03/03/netherlands/eredivisie/hfc-ado-den-haag/sportclub-heerenveen/1120519/ |title=ADO Den Haag vs. Heerenveen 0 - 0|publisher=Soccerway |date=3 March 2012|accessdate=31 May 2012}} On 19 April 2012, in a game against [[FC Groningen]] Omeruo scored his first goal for ADO Den Haag.{{cite news|author=Barry Glendenning |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/may/09/football-the-knowledge |title=The Knowledge | English football's only joint own goal|publisher=Guardian |date= 9 May 2012|accessdate=31 May 2012 |location=London}} On 28 April 2012, Omeruo scored against [[VVV-Venlo]] in the 19th minute, although just three minutes later scored an own goal.{{citation|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/04/28/netherlands/eredivisie/vvv-venlo/hfc-ado-den-haag/1120594/ |title=VVV-Venlo v.s. ADO Den Haag 2-1|publisher=Soccerway |date=28 April 2012|accessdate=31 May 2012}} He is the only player in the Dutch league ever to score a goal, an own goal and receive a red card in one match. ====Loan to Middlesbrough==== On 7 January 2014, Omeruo joined [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] on loan until the end of the [[2013–14 in English football|2013–14]] season.{{Cite web|title=Boro Seal Omeruo Loan |url=http://www.mfc.co.uk/page/news/latest/0,,1~3607917,00.html |work=Middlesbrough FC |date=7 January 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140515143919/http://www.mfc.co.uk/page/news/latest/0%2C%2C1~3607917%2C00.html |archivedate=15 May 2014 |df= }} On 1 February 2014, Omeruo made his debut for Middlesbrough in a 0–0 draw against [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]].{{Cite web |title=Doncaster Rovers vs. Middlesbrough 0 - 0 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/02/01/england/championship/doncaster-rovers-fc/middlesbrough-football-club/1484373/ |work=Soccerway |date=1 February 2014}} On 8 April 2014, Omeruo was sent off in the 82nd minute after picking up a second yellow. Although Boro had to finish the game with 9-men ([[Ben Gibson (footballer)|Ben Gibson]] was also sent off late in the game), they still managed to earn a 3–1 win victory against [[Birmingham City]].{{Cite web |title=Middlesbrough v.s. Birmingham 3 - 1 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/04/08/england/championship/middlesbrough-football-club/birmingham-city-fc/1484516/ |work=Soccerway |date=8 April 2014}} He rejoined Middlesbrough for the [[2014–15 in English football|2014–15]] season,{{Cite web |title=Middlesbrough complete Kenneth Omeruo loan deal from Chelsea |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28662451 |work=BBC Sport |date=6 August 2014}} making his first appearance against [[Birmingham City|Birmingham]] in a 2-0 win. ====Loan to Kasımpaşa==== On 21 July 2015, Omeruo joined [[Kasımpaşa Spor Kulübü|Kasımpaşa]] on a season-long loan with an option to purchase the player at the end of the spell.{{Cite news |title=Omeruo Kasımpaşamızda |url=http://www.kasimpasaspor.org.tr/haberler/haber/1010555-omeruo-kasimpasamizda |publisher=Kasımpaşa |date=21 July 2015}} On 16 August 2015, Omeruo made his debut for Kasımpaşa in a match against [[Gaziantepspor]], the match ended in a 3–0 victory for Kasımpaşa.{{Cite news |title=Gaziantepspor vs. Kasımpaşa 0 - 3 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/08/16/turkey/super-lig/gaziantepspor/kasimpasa-sk/2074329/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=16 August 2015}} Five days later, Omeruo made his home debut against [[İstanbul Başakşehir F.K.]] which ended in a 1–0 victory for Kasımpaşa.{{Cite news |title=Kasımpaşa vs. İstanbul Başakşehir 1 - 0 |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/08/21/turkey/super-lig/kasimpasa-sk/istanbul-buyuksehir-bsk/2074340/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=21 August 2015}} Omeruo had an up and down season, suffering from a couple injuries, however started whenever he was fit. Although the loan deal had an option to buy, Kasımpaşa decided to pass on the option due to a lack of funds, which led to Omeruo returning to Chelsea for pre-season.{{Cite news |title=Kenneth Omeruo To Return To Chelsea For Pre-Season Training |url=http://www.allnigeriasoccer.com/read_news.php?nid=19196/ |publisher=AllNigeriaSoccer |date=27 May 2016}} ====Loan to Alanyaspor==== On 31 August 2016, after he served out for Kasımpaşa, Omeruo joined [[Alanyaspor]] on a season-long loan. He was given the number 44. On 10 September 2016, Omeruo made his debut in a 0–0 draw against [[Gençlerbirliği S.K.|Gençlerbirliği]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/09/10/turkey/super-lig/genclerbirligi/alanyaspor/2291169/ |title=Gençlerbirliği vs. Alanyaspor 0 - 0 |date=10 September 2016 |publisher=Soccerway }} On 25 February 2017, Omeruo scored his first goal for Alanyaspor in their 4–1 home victory over [[Adanaspor]], netting in the hosts' second in the 37th minute.{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2017/02/25/turkey/super-lig/alanyaspor/adanaspor-fk/2291338/ |title=Alanyaspor vs. Adanaspor |date=25 February 2017 |publisher=Soccerway }} ====Return to Kasımpaşa==== On 25 August 2017, preceding signing a new three-year deal at Chelsea, Omeruo returned to [[Kasımpaşa S.K.|Kasımpaşa]] on a season-long loan.{{Cite news |title=New contract and loan for Omeruo |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/08/new-contract-and-loan-for-omeruo.html |publisher=Chelsea Official Site |date=25 August 2017 |accessdate=25 August 2017}} ====Loan to CD Leganés==== On 15 August 2018, Omeruo joined [[Club Deportivo Leganés|CD Leganés]] on a season-long loan.{{Cite news |title=Leganes Loan For Omeruo |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2018/8/15/leganes-loan-for-omeruo.html |publisher=Chelsea Official Site |date=15 August 2018 |accessdate=15 August 2018}} In October 2018 he stated that he was enjoying playing in Spain.https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45939555 ==International career== [[File:Argentina-Nigeria (3).jpg|thumb|Omeruo with Nigeria against Argentina in a friendly match in 2017]] Omeruo played for the Nigerian Under-20 team that reached the quarter-finals at the [[2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in [[Colombia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/89/africa/2012/03/02/2942516/under-20-nigeria-international-kenneth-omeruo-set-for-dutch |title=U-20 Nigeria international, Kenneth Omeruo set for Dutch debut.|publisher=Goal.com |date=2 March 2012 |accessdate=31 May 2012}} On 9 January 2013, at the age of 19 he played for the senior team for the first time in a goalless draw against [[Cape Verde national football team|Cape Verde]]. He then went on to play in all of Nigeria's matches at the [[2013 Africa Cup of Nations]] as Nigeria went on to win the competition for the third time.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20970786|title=Nations Cup 2013: Nigeria pick six locally-based players|author=Oluwashina Okeleji|date=10 January 2013|accessdate=10 January 2013|publisher=BBC Sport}} Later that year he was selected for Nigeria's squad at the [[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup]] and played in all of the three group games as Nigeria finished third in their group.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22827902|title=Nigeria to take new-look squad to Confederations Cup|date=9 June 2013|accessdate=10 June 2013|publisher=BBC Sport}} Omeuro was named in Nigeria's final squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and started in all four games as Nigeria finished second in their group and were eliminated by France at the Round of 16.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27969976 |title=France scored twice in the final 11 minutes in Brasilia to beat Nigeria and reach the World Cup quarter-finals. |work=BBC Sport |date=30 June 2014 |accessdate=22 October 2014 }} He was selected by Nigeria for their 35-man provisional squad for the 2016 Summer Olympics,{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36623763|title=Kelechi Iheanacho included in Nigeria's Olympics squad|date=24 June 2016|accessdate=25 June 2016|author=Oluwashina Okeleji|publisher=BBC Sport}} but did not make the final 18- man squad.{{cite web|url=http://punchng.com/mikel-makes-olympics-squad-awoniyi-standby/|title=Mikel makes Olympics squad, Awoniyi on standby|date=24 July 2016|accessdate=24 July 2016|publisher=Punch}} In May 2018 he was named in Nigeria's preliminary 30 man [[Nigeria national football team|squad]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.{{Cite news|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb|title=Revealed: Every World Cup 2018 squad - 23-man & preliminary lists & when will they be announced? {{!}} Goal.com|access-date=1 June 2018|language=en}} ==Playing style== Omeruo has been described as a "tall, rangy but strong centre-back" and a "level-headed and (Ghana)|Dreams FC]] | youthyears2 = 2010–2011 | clubs1 = → [[Asante Kotoko F.C.|Asante Kotoko]] (loan) | years1 = 2011–2012 | caps1 = 25 | goals1 = 0 | clubs2 = [[SpVgg Greuther Fürth|Greuther Fürth]] | years2 = 2012–2014 | caps2 = 44 | goals2 = 2 | years3 = 2014–2015 | clubs3 = [[FC Augsburg]] | caps3 = 31 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2015– | clubs4 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps4 = 15 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2016–2017 | clubs5 = → [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]] (loan) | caps5 = 13 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2018–2019 | clubs6 = → [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]] (loan) | caps6 = 3 | goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2019– | clubs7 = → [[Stade de Reims|Reims]] (loan) | caps7 = 1 | goals7 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalteam1 = [[Ghana national under-20 football team|Ghana U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 7 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalteam2 = [[Ghana national football team|Ghana]] | nationalyears2 = 2014– | nationalcaps2 = 24 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 21 February 2019 | nationalteam-update = 17 January 2017 }} '''Abdul Rahman Baba''', commonly known as '''Baba Rahman''' (born 2 July 1994) is a Ghanaian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|left-back]] for [[Ligue 1]] side [[Stade de Reims|Reims]], on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], and for the [[Ghana national football team|Ghana national team]]. Beginning his career at [[Dreams F.C. (Ghana)|Dreams FC]], he played in the [[Ghanaian Premier League]] with [[Asante Kotoko]]. In 2012, he signed for [[Bundesliga]] club [[Greuther Fürth]], where he spent two seasons. He then played for [[FC Augsburg]] before joining Chelsea in 2015 for a fee of £14 million, potentially rising to £22 million. Rahman made his international debut in 2014 and was part of their squad which were runners-up at the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations]]. ==Club career== ===Ghana=== Rahman began his career at [[Dreams F.C. (Ghana)|Dreams FC]] of the [[Ghana Football Leagues|Ghana Division Two]]. After impressive performances, he was then transferred on loan to [[Asante Kotoko SC|Asante Kotoko]] of the [[Ghanaian Premier League]] for one season. For the 2012 season, Rahman was a finalist for the league's Discovery of the Year Award, eventually losing to [[Joshua Oniku]].{{cite web|title=Daniel Nii Adjei wins Player of the Season Award|url=http://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/NewsArchive/artikel.php?ID=242181|publisher=GhanaWeb|accessdate=20 June 2012}} After becoming a sought after player during his time with the [[Kumasi]]-based club, serious enquiries were made about the player by [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] of the [[Premier League]] and [[Parma F.C.|Parma]] of [[Serie A]].{{cite web|title=Arsenal, Man City deals loom for Kotoko left-back Abdul-Rahman|url=http://www.ghanasoccernet.com/arsenal-man-city-deals-loom-for-kotoko-left-back-abdul-rahman/|publisher=GhanaSoccerNet|accessdate=20 June 2012}} ===Germany=== However, Rahman eventually signed with newly promoted [[SpVgg Greuther Fürth|Greuther Fürth]] in the [[Bundesliga]] on 12 June 2012. Rahman stated that his decision to join Fürth was because the club offered, "the best conditions in which to develop my career."{{cite web|title=German club Greuther Furth beats Arsenal to sign Rahman|url=http://www.mtnfootball.com/africa/ghana/news/2012/june/13-german-club-greuther-furth-beats-arsenal-to-sign-rahman.html|publisher=MTN Football|accessdate=20 June 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120707170745/http://www.mtnfootball.com/africa/ghana/news/2012/june/13-german-club-greuther-furth-beats-arsenal-to-sign-rahman.html|archivedate=7 July 2012|df=dmy-all}} In the derby against [[1. FC Nürnberg]] on 11 August 2014 he scored his first two goals for Fürth in a 5–1 home victory.{{cite web|title=Doppelpacker Baba lässt das Kleeblatt tanzen|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/2bundesliga/spieltag/2-bundesliga/2014-15/2/2407543/spielanalyse_spvgg-greuther-fuerth-82_1-fc-nuernberg-81.html|publisher=kicker.de|accessdate=15 August 2014}} The next day he signed with [[FC Augsburg]] of the same division.{{cite web|title=Baba-Wechsel zum FCA perfekt|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/2bundesliga/vereine/609563/artikel_baba-wechsel-zum-fca-perfekt.html|publisher=kicker.de|accessdate=15 August 2014}} In Rahman's 2014–15 season with Augsburg, he made 108 tackles, more than any other player in the Bundesliga that season. Using aspects of his strength and pace, he was able to win 90 of those tackles, coming out to an 83% successful tackle rate. That season, Rahman also had 83 interceptions and won 80 contested aerial balls.{{Cite web|title = Chelsea transfer news: Who is Baba Rahman?|url = https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea/11795039/Chelsea-transfer-news-Who-is-Baba-Rahman.html|website = Telegraph.co.uk|access-date = 20 February 2016}} ===Chelsea=== ====2015–16 season==== On 16 August 2015, Rahman signed for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on a five-year deal for an undisclosed fee, reported to be an initial £14 million, rising to a potential fee of almost £22 million.{{Cite news |title=Baba Rahman moves to Stamford Bridge from Augsburg |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33953803 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2015}}{{Cite news |title=Rahman signs |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/08/rahman-signs.html |publisher=Chelsea FC |date=16 August 2015}}{{Cite news |title=Baba moves to Chelsea |url=http://fcaugsburg.de/cms/website.php?id=/index/news/allenews/data21397.htm |publisher=FC Augsburg |date=16 August 2015}} {{dead link|date=February 2019}}{{cite web|last1=Dudko|first1=James|title=Baba Rahman Completes Transfer to Chelsea from Augsburg|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2529710-baba-rahman-transfer-news-latest-rumours-speculation-on-augsburg-defender|publisher=[[Bleacher Report]]|accessdate=2 September 2015|date=16 August 2015}} He made his debut on 23 September in the third round of the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]], playing the full 90 minutes in a 4–1 win away to [[Football League One|League One]] club [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]].{{cite news|title=Walsall 1-4 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34265632|accessdate=23 September 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 September 2015}} He made his [[Premier League]] debut in a 2–0 win over [[Aston Villa]] at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] on 17 October.{{cite news|last1=Dawkes|first1=Phil|title=Chelsea 2-0 Aston Villa|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34493710|accessdate=21 October 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 October 2015}} Rahman has played an important role at left-back in a couple of Chelsea's victories including their 2–1 [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] win over [[FC Dynamo Kyiv|Dynamo Kyiv]]; Sportsmail's Bob Treasure said that Rahman "was very lively at left back" and that he "showed excellent anticipation to make a handful of interceptions and start attacking moves."{{Cite web|title = Chelsea 2-1 Dynamo Kiev PLAYER RATINGS|url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3304178/Chelsea-2-1-Dynamo-Kiev-PLAYER-RATINGS-Willian-shows-class-Baba-Rahman-catches-eye-Blues-clinch-Champions-League-win-Stamford-Bridge.html|website = Mail Online|access-date = 13 February 2016}} Rahman also played the full 90 minutes against French side [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] in Chelsea's 2–1 Champions League defeat on 16 February 2016. Rahman was presented with this opportunity following the injuries to centre-backs Kurt Zouma and John Terry. Although Chelsea failed to stop PSG from scoring twice, "Rahman looked like a class full back" according to Kristian Downer for Metro.co.uk.{{Cite web|title = Five things we learned from Chelsea's Champions League defeat in Paris|url = http://metro.co.uk/2016/02/17/five-things-we-learned-from-chelseas-champions-league-defeat-against-paris-saint-germain-5692170/ |website = Metro |accessdate = 20 February 2016 |first = Kristian Downer for |last = Metro.co.uk}} [[File:Baba Rahman 20160416.jpg|thumb|Baba Rahman playing for Chelsea in 2016]] On 27 February, Rahman made an error which allowed [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]'s [[Shane Long]] to score in the 42nd minute; he was substituted for [[Kenedy (footballer)|Kenedy]] at half time but Chelsea eventually won 2–1 at [[St. Mary's Stadium|St. Mary's]].{{cite news|last1=Sanghera|first1=Mandeep|title=Southampton 1-2 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35619625|accessdate=27 February 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 February 2016}} ====Schalke 04 (loan)==== On 2 August 2016, Schalke confirmed that Baba Rahman has moved on a season-long loan to the club after failing to impress the new Chelsea manager [[Antonio Conte]] during pre-season. Baba was given the number 14 jersey for the upcoming season. His return to [[Bundesliga]] links him back with former Augsburg manager, [[Markus Weinzierl]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/08/baba-makes-schalke-switch.html|title=Baba makes Schalke switch|last=|first=|date=2 August 2016|website=www.chelseafc.com|publisher=Chelsea F.C.|access-date=2 August 2016}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.schalke04.de/en/news/160802_baba/page/2362--86-86-.html|title=Abdul Rahman Baba joins S04 on loan|date=2 August 2016|website=www.schalke04.de|publisher=FC Schalke 04|access-date=2 August 2016}} After the completion of this loan move, Rahman told the local paper Ruhr Nachrichten, [[Antonio Conte]] advised him to leave on loan because he was mainly focused on a defensive philosophy. With the defensive focus, Rahman was told his playing-time would be very limited due to his attacking-style.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/english-premier-league/story/2922205/baba-rahman-too-attacking-for-chelsea-manager-antonio-conte|title=Baba Rahman 'too attacking' for Chelsea manager Antonio Conte|last=Buczko|first=Stefan|publisher=ESPN|date=3 August 2016}} Rahman made his competitive debut for the [[Gelsenkirchen]] team on 20 August, as a winger instead of a defender in a 4–1 victory against [[FC 08 Villingen]] in the first round of the [[2016–17 DFB-Pokal|DFB-Pokal]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/08/20/germany/dfb-pokal/fc-08-villingen/fc-schalke-04/2244383/|title=Villingen 1-4 Schalke 04|date=20 August 2016|publisher=Soccerway}} He made his league debut on 27 August, coming on for [[Sead Kolašinac]] in the 62nd minute of an eventual 1–0 loss at [[Eintracht Frankfurt]] on the first day of the season.{{cite news|title=Frankfurt hold on to beat Schalke|url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Bundesliga/blmd1n-eintracht-frankfurt-1-0-fc-schalke-04-report.jsp|accessdate=15 September 2016|publisher=Bundesliga|date=27 August 2016}} Rahman scored his first goal for Schalke on 15 September, the game's only in a Europa League victory at [[OGC Nice]].{{cite news|title=Nice 0-1 Schalke: Baba Rahman's late strike earns Schalke victory over Nice as Mario Balotelli fails to shine for Ligue 1 outfit|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3791677/Nice-0-1-Schalke-Baba-Rahman-s-late-strike-earns-Schalke-victory-Nice-Mario-Balotelli-fails-shine-Ligue-1-outfit.html|accessdate=15 September 2016|work=Daily Mail|date=15 September 2016}} ====Schalke 04 (second loan)==== In January 2018, Rahman joined [[FC Schalke 04]] on loan for the second time agreeing an 18-month stay until summer 2019.{{cite news|last1=Cann|first1=James|title=Chelsea left-back Baba Rahman joins Schalke on 18-month loan|url=https://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/chelsea-leftback-baba-rahman-joins-schalke-on-18month-loan-36543246.html|accessdate=29 January 2018|work=Irish Independent|date=29 January 2018}}{{cite news|title=Bis 2019: Schalke leiht Baba erneut aus|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/715626/artikel_bis-2019_schalke-leiht-baba-erneut-aus.html|accessdate=29 January 2018|work=kicker Online|date=29 January 2018|language=German}} ====Reims (loan)==== In January 2019, he returned early to Chelsea and was immediately loaned to [[Stade de Reims]] until the end of the season.{{cite news|title=Baba Rahman loaned to Reims|url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2019/1/28/baba-rahman-loaned-to-reims/|work=Chelsea FC|date=29 January 2019}} ==International career== Rahman played every minute of [[Ghana national football team|Ghana]]'s campaign at the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations]] in [[Equatorial Guinea]], providing the cross from which [[André Ayew]] headed in the winner against [[South Africa national football team|South Africa]] to win [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations Group C|Group C]].{{cite news|title=South Africa 1-2 Ghana|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30891882|accessdate=17 August 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 January 2015}} In the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations Final|final]] against the [[Ivory Coast national football team|Ivory Coast]], Rahman scored in the [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]] in which his team lost 9–8.{{cite news|last1=Smith|first1=Alan|title=Ivory Coast win the Africa Cup of Nations on penalties – as it happened|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2015/feb/08/africa-cup-of-nations-final-ivory-coast-v-ghana-live|accessdate=17 August 2015|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=8 February 2015}} ==Personal life== Rahman has "Baba" on the back of his jersey, the name of his Chelsea-supporting father.{{cite news|last1=Perrin|first1=Charles|title=Revealed: Chelsea new boy Baba Rahman explains
