(on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) | clubnumber = 17 | youthyears1 = 2007–2017 | youthclubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | years1 = 2017– | clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2018– | clubs2 = → [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] (loan) | caps2 = 30 | goals2 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 5 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 8 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2016–2018 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 25 | nationalgoals3 = 1 | club-update = 12:27, 17 March 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 21:49, 26 July 2018 (UTC) }} '''Dujon Henriques Sterling''' (born 24 October 1999) is an English [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right-back]] for [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. ==Club career== ===Chelsea=== Sterling joined [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2007 at under-8 level and made his under-19 debut in a [[UEFA Youth League]] fixture against [[Sporting CP]] in December 2014. Although, recently Sterling has been deployed as a [[Defender (association football)#Wing-back|wing-back]], he has also been played as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] or [[Forward (association football)#Centre-forward|centre-forward]] and impressed during Chelsea's [[2015–16 FA Youth Cup]] campaign, netting in both the semi-final and final.{{Cite news |title=Manchester City 1-1 Chelsea: The FA Youth Cup Final (first leg) |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2016/apr/22/fa-youth-cup-final-first-leg-report |publisher=The FA |date=22 April 2016 |accessdate=20 September 2017}} Following an impressive campaign, Sterling was promoted to the U23 squad for the 2016–17 season as a 16-year-old and became a key figure, featuring twenty-four times and scoring four goals.{{Cite news |title=Dujon Sterling |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/teams/development-squad/development-squad/u21-player-profiles/dujon-sterling.html |publisher=Chelsea Official Site |accessdate=20 September 2017}} In October 2016, Sterling signed his first professional contract upon his 17th birthday. On 20 September 2017, Sterling made his Chelsea debut during their [[EFL Cup]] third round tie against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]], replacing [[Davide Zappacosta]] for the final 14 minutes of the 5–1 victory at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]].{{Cite news |title=Chelsea 5-1 Nottingham Forest |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41249727 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 September 2017 |accessdate=20 September 2017}} ====Loan to Coventry City==== On 27 June 2018, it was agreed that Sterling would join newly-promoted [[EFL League One|League One]] side [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on a season-long loan.{{cite news |title=Chelsea's Sterling in Coventry loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44635689 |accessdate=27 June 2018 |publisher=[[BBC]] |date=27 June 2018}} ==International career== Sterling was born in England and is of Jamaican descent.{{cite web|url=http://www.worldfootball.net/player_summary/dujon-sterling/|title=Dujon Sterling|website=worldfootball.net}} Sterling has represented England from [[England national under-16 football team|under-16]] to [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] level. He represented [[England national under-17 football team|England Under-17]] at the [[2016 UEFA European Under-17 Championship|2016 U-17 Euros]]{{Cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2016/may/04/euro-finals-squad-announced-040516|title=England Under-17s squad named for Euro Championship|date= 4 May 2016 |publisher=The Football Association|accessdate=2 December 2017 }} and was included in the team of the tournament.{{cite web|title=2016 UEFA under-17 Team of the Tournament|url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/season=2016/technical-report/uefa-technical-team/index.html|publisher=UEFA.com|accessdate=2 December 2017}} In September 2016, Sterling made his debut for the [[England national under-19 football team|England Under-19]] team in a 1–1 draw against the [[Netherlands national under-19 football team|Netherlands]].{{Cite news |title=England U19 1-1 Holland U19 (9-8 pens) |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3769273/England-U19-1-1-Holland-U19-9-8-pens-Young-Lions-prevail-shoot-Everton-s-Tom-Davies-scores-Telford-friendly.html |publisher=Daily Mail |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=20 September 2017}} In June 2017 he was selected to represent England at the [[2017 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2017/jun/26/england-u19-squad-for-euros-260617|title=England squad selected for UEFA European Under-19 Championship|date= 26 June 2017 |publisher=The Football Association|accessdate=2 December 2017 }} Despite Sterling scoring an [[Own goal#Association football|own goal]], England went on to defeat [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal]] 2-1 in the final.{{cite web|title=European Under-19 Championship: England beat Portugal in final|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40619862|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 July 2017|accessdate=2 December 2017}} He was subsequently named in the team of the tournament.{{cite web|title=2017 UEFA under-19 Team of the Tournament|url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2017/technical-report/uefa-technical-team/index.html|publisher=UEFA.com|accessdate=5 October 2017}} ==Career statistics== {{Updated|match played on 16 (on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) | clubnumber = 5 | youthyears1 = 2005–2016 | youthclubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | years1 = 2016– | clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps1 = 1 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2017 | clubs2 = → [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] (loan) | caps2 = 9 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2017–2018 | clubs3 = → [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] (loan) | caps3 = 25 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2018– | clubs4 = → [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] (loan) | caps4 = 24 | goals4 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2016 | nationalteam1 = [[Canada men's national under-20 soccer team|Canada U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 3 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2016 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps2 = 5 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2016–2017 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps3 = 15 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2017– | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps4 = 11 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | club-update = 22:16, 9 January 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 23:05, 13 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Oluwafikayomi Oluwadamilola "Fikayo" Tomori''' (born 19 December 1997) is a professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[defender (association football)|defender]] for [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]], on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. ==Club career== ===Chelsea=== Tomori joined [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] at under-8 level and progressed through the clubs academy system.{{Cite news |title=Fikayo Tomori |url=http://thechels.info/wiki/Fikayo_Tomori |publisher=TheChels.info}} He was part of the Chelsea youth side which recorded back to back triumphs in both the [[UEFA Youth League]] and the [[FA Youth Cup]] in 2015 and 2016. On 11 May 2016, Tomori was named upon the first-team substitute bench along with fellow academy players [[Tammy Abraham]] and [[Kasey Palmer]], in Chelsea's 1–1 draw with [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]. However, he failed to make an appearance at [[Anfield]].{{Cite news |title=Liverpool 1–1 Chelsea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35738639 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 May 2016}} On 15 May 2016, in Chelsea's final game of the 2015/16 campaign, Tomori made his professional debut in a 1–1 draw with [[Premier League]] champions [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]], replacing [[Branislav Ivanović]] in the 60th minute.{{Cite news |title=Chelsea 1–1 Leicester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36240331 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 May 2016}} Although Tomori was included in the United States pre-season tour, he did not make a single appearance.{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/international/world/international-champions-cup/2016/north-america/r34980/ |title=Summary: International Champions Cup |accessdate=15 September 2016}} On 1 August 2016, Tomori signed a new four-year contract ahead of the 2016–17 campaign.{{Cite news |title=Tomori new deal on tour|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/07/tomori-signs-new-deal-on-tour.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=1 August 2016 |accessdate=1 August 2016}} On 12 August 2016, Tomori was handed the number 33 shirt prior to the season's beginning, switching from his previous number 43.{{cite web|title=Squad list announced|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/08/squad-list-announced.html|publisher=Chelsea F.C.|accessdate=12 August 2015}} ====Loan to Brighton & Hove Albion==== On 23 January 2017, Tomori joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] for the remainder of the [[2016–17 Brighton & Hove Albion F.C. season|2016–17]] campaign.{{Cite news |title=Albion sign Chelsea defender on loan |url=http://www.seagulls.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/brighton-hove-albion-chelsea-3535018.aspx |publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion Official Site |date=23 January 2017 |accessdate=23 January 2017}} Five days later, Tomori made his Brighton debut in a 3–1 away defeat against [[National League (division)|National League]] side [[Lincoln City F.C.|Lincoln City]] in the [[FA Cup]] fourth round, in which he scored an own goal to give Lincoln the lead.{{Cite news |title=Lincoln City 3-1 Brighton & Hove Albion |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38700730 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 January 2017 |accessdate=28 January 2017}} On 18 February 2017, Tomori made his league debut for Brighton, in their 2–0 away victory against [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]], replacing [[Anthony Knockaert]] in stoppage time of the second half.{{Cite news |title=Barnsley 0-2 Brighton & Hove Albion |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38940106 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 February 2017 |accessdate=23 February 2017}} On 18 March 2017, Tomori was given his first start for Brighton in their 2–0 away defeat against [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]], featuring for the entire 90 minutes.{{Cite news |title=Leeds United 2-0 Brighton & Hove Albion |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39239223 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 March 2017 |accessdate=20 March 2017}} ==== Loan to Hull City ==== On 31 August 2017, Tomori joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] on a season long loan deal.{{cite news |title=Hull City sign Chelsea defender on loan |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/11015154/hull-city-sign-chelsea-defender-fikayo-tomori-on-season-long-loan |publisher=Sky Sports|date=31 August 2017 |accessdate=31 August 2017}} He made his debut on 13 September 2017, in a 2–1 defeat away to [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].{{cite news | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41169976 | title = Fulham 2–1 Hull City | date = 13 September 2017 | work = BBC Sport | publisher = BBC | accessdate = 13 September 2017}} ==== Loan to Derby County ==== On 6 August 2018, Tomori joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Derby County FC|Derby County]] on a season long loan.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45088815|title=Fikayo Tomori: Chelsea defender joins Derby County on loan|date=6 August 2018|publisher=|accessdate=6 August 2018|work=BBC Sport}} He made his debut on 11 August in a 1-4 loss against [[Leeds United]].{{cite news |title=DERBY COUNTY VS LEEDS UNITED |url=https://www.leedsunited.com/derby |newspaper=Leeds United |date=11 August 2018 |accessdate=11 August 2018}}{{cite news |title=Derby 1-4 Leeds - Bielsa's side thrash Rams with brilliant attacking display |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/live/football/44797130 |newspaper=BBC Sport |date=11 August 2018 |accessdate=11 August 2018}} ==International career== Tomori is eligible to represent [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]] at international level through his parents,{{cite news|url=http://weaintgotnohistory.sbnation.com/2016/5/13/11669160/fikayo-tomori-chelsea-academy-first-team-canada|title=Chelsea teenager Fikayo Tomori turning heads on both sides of the Atlantic|author= David Paszto|publisher =Vox Media|date=13 May 2016|accessdate=11 July 2016}} Canada through his birth in Calgary and [[England national football team|England]] through his upbringing having lived in the country since he was a toddler.{{Cite news |title=Canada U-20 Fikayo Tomori named Chelsea FC's Academy Player of the Year |url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2016/05/12/canada-youth-international-fikayo-tomori-turning-heads-chelsea-fc |publisher=MLS |date=14 May 2016}} ===Canadian national youth team=== On 27 March 2016, Tomori captained [[Canada men's national under-20 soccer team|Canada U20]] to a 2–1 victory over England U20 on his third appearance for the nation.{{Cite news |title=England Under-19s squad named for Mexico double header |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/development/2016/may/england-under-19s-squad-named-for-mexico-150516 |publisher=TheFA |date=16 May 2016}} ===England national youth teams=== On 16 May 2016, in the next international break and a day after making his professional club debut, Tomori was called up to the [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] squad. On 4 June 2016, Tomori made his England U19 debut in a 2–0 defeat against [[Mexico national under-20 football team|Mexico U20]]s, playing the full 90 minutes.{{Cite news |title=England Under-19s succumb to second-half goals in Mexico |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/development/2016/jun/mexico-2-0-england-report-040616 |publisher=TheFA |date=4 June 2016 |accessdate=26 July 2016}} Tomori was also part of the England [[2016 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]] squad which reached the semi-finals before being knocked out by [[Italy national under-19 football team|Italy]]. ==== 2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup ==== Tomori was selected for the [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20 team]] in the [[2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup]]. Tomori however scored an own goal in England's second group game against Guinea.{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/chelsea-transfer-news-blues-duo-fikayo-tomori-jake-clarkesalter-in-demand-after-englands-u20s-world-a3562451.html |title=Chelsea duo Fikayo Tomori and Jake Clarke-Salter in demand after England's U20s World Cup win |first=Simon |last=Johnson |work=Evening Standard |date=12 June 2017 | accessdate=13 June 2017}} Nevertheless, Tomori would help England beat Venezuela in the final 1–0, which is England's first win in a global tournament since their [[1966 FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] victory of 1966.{{cite news |url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40237981 |title= Under-20 World Cup: England beat Venezuela in final |work=BBC Sport |date= 11 June 2017 | accessdate=13 June 2017}} ==Career statistics== '''Kurt Happy Zouma''' (born 27 October 1994) is a French professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[centre-back]] for [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], on loan from fellow [[Premier League]] club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], and the [[France national football team|France national team]].
Zouma began his career at [[AS Saint-Étienne|Saint-Étienne]], making his professional debut aged 16. Zouma won the [[Coupe de la Ligue]] with the club [[2013 Coupe de la Ligue Final|in 2013]], and joined Chelsea for £12 million in January 2014. Chelsea loaned him back to his first club for the remainder of the season, and in his first full campaign in England, Zouma helped Chelsea win the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] and the [[Premier League]]. In July 2017 Zouma joined [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] on loan for the [[2017–18 Premier League|2017–18]] season.
Zouma represented France at youth levels, up to [[France national under-21 football team|under-21]]. He made his [[France national football team|senior international]] debut against [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]] on 29 March 2015.
==Club career==
===Early career=== Born in [[Lyon]], Zouma began his career at age nine with Vaulx-en-Velin until he was 15. He played as a right winger and also as a striker before switching to his current position of a defender.<ref>{{cite news |title=Teenage kicks: Kurt Zouma |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/01/teenage-kicks--kurt-zouma.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=31 December 2014 |accessdate=25 February 2016}}</ref>
===Saint-Étienne=== Zouma joined [[AS Saint-Étienne|Saint-Étienne]] in 2009. On 2 April 2011, he signed his first professional contract, agreeing to a three-year deal.<ref>{{cite news |title=Kurt Zouma signe pro à Saint-Etienne |url=http://www.footransferts.com/index.php/2011/04/kurt-zouma-signe-pro-a-saint-etienne/ |work=Foot Transferts |date=2 April 2011 |accessdate=31 August 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120730094958/http://www.footransferts.com/index.php/2011/04/kurt-zouma-signe-pro-a-saint-etienne/ |archivedate=30 July 2012 |df= }}</ref> He was subsequently promoted to the senior team by [[Coach (sport)|manager]] [[Christophe Galtier]] ahead of the [[2011–12 in French football|2011–12 season]], and initially played without a name on his shirt in order to protect him from media attention.<ref name=four/>
Zouma made his professional debut at 16 years old, on 31 August 2011 in a [[Coupe de la Ligue]] match against [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]], playing the entire match in a 3–1 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Saint-Étienne v. Bordeaux Match Report |url=http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/75397 |work=[[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] |date=31 August 2011 |accessdate=31 August 2011 |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120916074223/http://new.lfp.fr/coupeLigue/feuille_match/75397 |archivedate=16 September 2012 |df= }}</ref> On 17 September, he made his [[Ligue 1]] debut in a 3–0 loss at [[FC Lorient|Lorient]]; his first professional goal came on 19 November, replacing [[Paulo Afonso Santos Júnior|Paulão]] after nine minutes and finishing a [[corner kick]] to confirm a 2–0 win before half time at [[OGC Nice]].<ref>{{cite news|title=NICE 0–2 SAINT-ETIENNE|url=http://www.ogcnice.com/fr/actualite/7201/nice-0-2-saint-etienne|accessdate=4 May 2016|publisher=OGC Nice|date=19 November 2011|language=French}}</ref> He totalled 21 league games in his first season – 13 starts – and his other goal came on 14 January 2012, heading [[Banel Nicolita]]'s corner for the only goal against lowly [[FC Sochaux-Montbéliard|Sochaux]] at the [[Stade Geoffroy-Guichard]].<ref>{{cite news|title=St. Etienne edges troubled Sochaux|url=http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/story/st-etienne-1-0-sochaux-match-report-ligue-1-zouma-nets-game-winner-011412|accessdate=4 May 2016|publisher=Fox Sports|date=14 January 2012}}</ref>
On 20 April 2013, Zouma played in Saint-Étienne's 1–0 win over [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]] in the [[2013 Coupe de la Ligue Final|final]] of the Coupe de la Ligue.<ref>{{cite web|title=AS Saint-Etienne 1–0 Stade Rennais FC|url=http://www.ligue1.com/coupeLigue/feuille_match/77456|publisher=[[Ligue 1]]}}</ref> Eight days later in the [[Derby du Rhone]] away to [[Olympique Lyonnais|Lyon]], he opened a 1–1 draw by heading [[Yohan Mollo]]'s corner after half an hour of play.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lyon on course for third|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/lyon-vs-st-etienne/285668|accessdate=4 May 2016|publisher=Sky Sports|date=28 April 2013}}</ref> On 7 November 2013, Zouma was banned for ten games following a challenge that left [[FC Sochaux-Montbéliard|Sochaux]]'s [[Thomas Guerbert]] with a broken right leg and a dislocated ankle.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Devine|first1=Chris|title=Zouma given 10-match ban following horror tackle|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/90/france/2013/11/07/4391643/zouma-given-10-match-ban-following-horror-tackle|accessdate=11 January 2015|work=Goal.com|date=7 November 2013}}</ref>
===Chelsea=== ====2014–15 season==== [[File:Chelsea 1 lLiverpool 0 (2-1 agg) Capital One Cup semi final 2nd leg On our way to Wembley! (16204857347).jpg|thumb|right|175px|Zouma holding a banner celebrating Chelsea reaching the [[2015 Football League Cup Final]]]] On 31 January 2014, Zouma joined [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on a five-and-a-half-year contract for a fee believed to be around £12 million (€14.6 million).<ref name=twelve>{{cite news|title=Transfer Deadline Day: Kurt Zouma joins Chelsea for £12m|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25973862|accessdate=29 January 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=31 January 2014}}</ref> He remained at Saint-Étienne on loan for the remainder of the [[2013–14 Ligue 1|2013–14 season]].<ref name=twelve/>
Zouma first appeared as a first-half substitute for Chelsea in a pre-season friendly against [[Wycombe Wanderers F.C.|Wycombe Wanderers]]. He scored his first goal for the club in a 2–1 friendly win against Slovene club [[Olimpija Ljubljana|Olimpija]], on 27 July 2014.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2014/07/match-report--nk-olimpija-ljubljana-1-chelsea-2.html|title=Match report: NK Olimpija Ljubljana 1 Chelsea 2|publisher=[[Chelsea F.C.]]|date=27 July 2014|accessdate=27 July 2014}}</ref> He was given the number 5 shirt, previously worn by [[Michael Essien]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Squad number changes|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2014/08/squad-number-changes.html?WT.mc_id=social_20140815_29820286|publisher=[[Chelsea F.C.]]|accessdate=15 August 2014}}</ref>
On 24 September, Zouma made his first competitive appearance for Chelsea, scoring the opener in a 2–1 win against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] in the third round of the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Chelsea 2–1 Bolton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29233095|accessdate=24 September 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 September 2014}}</ref> He made his second Chelsea start and first [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] appearance on 21 October against [[NK Maribor|Maribor]], helping his side keep a clean sheet in a 6–0 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29362738 |title=Didier Drogba scored his first goal since rejoining Chelsea as they recorded their biggest-ever Champions League win with a dominant victory against Maribor at Stamford Bridge. |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 October 2014 |accessdate=21 October 2014 }}</ref> He made his Premier League debut as an added-time substitute for [[Willian (footballer)|Willian]] in the 1–1 draw with [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] at [[Old Trafford]] on 26 October 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29679403 |title=Manchester United 1–1 Chelsea |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 October 2014 |accessdate=26 October 2014 }}</ref>
On 4 January 2015, Zouma scored the third goal for Chelsea in the 3–0 victory over [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] in the [[FA Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Chelsea 3–0 Watford|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30614332|accessdate=11 January 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 January 2015}}</ref> Six days later, he started in the Premier League for the first time, partnering [[John Terry]] in place of [[Gary Cahill]] and keeping a clean sheet in a 2–0 home win over [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]], which put Chelsea back into first place in the league table.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Reddy|first1=Luke|title=Chelsea 2–0 Newcastle|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30663822|accessdate=11 January 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=10 January 2015}}</ref> With [[Nemanja Matić]] suspended and [[John Obi Mikel]] injured, Zouma played in defensive midfield as Chelsea won the [[2015 Football League Cup Final|League Cup Final]] on 1 March after a 2–0 victory over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Chelsea 2–0 Tottenham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31572594|accessdate=2 March 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 March 2015}}</ref> On 3 May, he featured as a substitute for the final five minutes in place of Willian as Chelsea defeated [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] 1–0 to win the league title.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Chelsea 1–0 Crystal Palace|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32471261|accessdate=14 May 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 May 2015}}</ref>
====2015–17==== [[File:Newcastle United vs Chelsea, 26 September 2015 (10).JPG|thumb|Zouma in action against Newcastle in September 2015]] On 2 August 2015, Zouma was a 69th-minute substitute for [[César Azpilicueta]] as Chelsea lost 1–0 to [[Arsenal F.C.–Chelsea F.C. rivalry|rivals]] [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in the [[2015 FA Community Shield|Community Shield]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Cryer|first1=Andy|title=Arsenal 1–0 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33667216|accessdate=2 August 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 August 2015}}</ref> Starting ahead of John Terry, he scored his first Premier League goal on 19 September, heading in [[Cesc Fàbregas]]' cross to open a 2–0 home win over the same opposition.<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|title=Chelsea 2–0 Arsenal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34191867|accessdate=20 September 2015|date=19 September 2015}}</ref> On 24 November, as a late substitute for the injured Terry, he scored his first European goal to conclude a 4–0 win at [[Maccabi Tel Aviv]] in the Champions League [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Rose|first1=Gary|title=M'bi Tel Aviv 0–4 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34896622|accessdate=25 November 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 November 2015}}</ref>
Under interim manager [[Guus Hiddink]], Zouma regularly started alongside Terry as Chelsea's form improved. On 7 February 2016, Zouma ruptured the anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee after landing awkwardly from a jump in a match against [[Manchester United]]. He required surgery and was ruled out for six months.<ref name=injury>{{cite news|title=Kurt Zouma: Chelsea defender out for six months & needs surgery|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35527443|accessdate=9 February 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 February 2016}}</ref>
In the summer of 2016, Zouma traveled and trained with the first-team during preseason.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/07/zouma--coming-back-stronger.html |title=Zouma: Coming back stronger |date=20 July 2016 |publisher=Chelsea F.C.}}</ref> Chelsea also rejected a loan offer from [[FC Schalke 04|Schalke 04]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/704672/Chelsea-Antonio-Conte-Schalke-Kurt-Zouma-Premier-League-John-Terry-Gary-Cahill-News |title=Chelsea in talks with Schalke over transfer of young defender |date=28 August 2016|work=Daily Express}}</ref> On 24 October, Zouma made his first competitive appearance after being out of action for nine months, playing 45 minutes for the [[Chelsea F.C. Reserves and Academy|Chelsea under-23]] side in a 2–2 draw against Derby County.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/10/pl2-report--chelsea-v-derby-county.html |title=PL2 report: Chelsea 2 Derby 2 |date=24 October 2016 |publisher=Chelsea F.C.}}</ref> On 8 January 2017, Zouma made his first team comeback in Chelsea's 4–1 [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup]] third-round win over [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough United]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/jan/08/chelsea-peterborough-united-fa-cup-match-report|title=John Terry sees red but comfortable Chelsea ease past Peterborough|date=9 January 2017|work=The Guardian}}</ref> On 4 February, he made his first appearance of the [[2016–17 Premier League]] season as a substitute in a 3–1 win against rivals [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2017/feb/04/chelsea-arsenal-premier-league-live|title=Chelsea 3–1 Arsenal|date=1 March 2017|work=The Guardian}}</ref>
====2017–18 season: Loan to Stoke City==== Following agreeing to a new six-year deal with Chelsea, on 21 July 2017, Zouma joined fellow Premier League side [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] on loan for the [[2017–18 Stoke City F.C. season|2017–18]] season.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Zouma signs new deal and heads to Stoke |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/07/new-contract-and-loan-for-zouma.html |publisher=Chelsea Official Site |date=21 July 2017 |accessdate=21 July 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Kurt Zouma: Chelsea defender joins Stoke on season-long loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40684771|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=21 July 2017}}</ref> On 12 August, he made his debut in a 1–0 loss at [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/everton-vs-stoke/373101 |title=Everton 1–0 Stoke |date=12 August 2017 |publisher=SkySports}}</ref>
In November 2017, Stoke captain [[Ryan Shawcross]] expressed his surprise that Chelsea had loaned out Zouma, who had only missed one match, against his parent club.<ref name=shawcross>{{cite news|title=Ryan Shawcross surprised Chelsea allowed 'ultimate defender' Kurt Zouma to leave on loan|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11701/11128404/ryan-shawcross-surprised-chelsea-allowed-ultimate-defender-kurt-zouma-to-leave-on-loan|accessdate=26 November 2017|publisher=Sky Sports|date=16 November 2017}}</ref> On 20 November he headed his first goal for the Potters, in a 2–2 draw at [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bysouth|first1=Alex|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 2–2 Stoke City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41964596|accessdate=26 November 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 November 2017}}</ref> Zouma played 37 matches for Stoke in 2017–18 as the club suffered relegation to the [[EFL Championship]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Swansea 1–2 Stoke|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44020155|website=BBC Sport|accessdate=13 May 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19 season: Loan to Everton==== On 10 August 2018, Zouma joined fellow Premier League side [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on loan for the [[2018–19 Everton F.C. season|2018–19]] season.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2018/08/10/zouma|title=Zouma Joins Everton On Season-Long Loan|date=10 August 2018|accessdate=10 August 2018|publisher=Everton Official Site}}</ref> He made his debut on 25 August as a last-minute substitute for the injured [[Michael Keane (footballer, born 1993)|Michael Keane]] in a 2–2 draw at [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Sutcliffe |first1=Steve |title=Bournemouth 2–2 Everton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45230638 |accessdate=4 October 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 August 2018}}</ref>
Zouma scored his first goal for Everton on 13 January 2019, a header to open a 2–0 home win also against Bournemouth.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Hunter |first1=Andy |title=Kurt Zouma nods home to steer Everton towards nervy win over Bournemouth |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2019/jan/13/everton-bournemouth-premier-league-match-report |accessdate=17 February 2019 |work=The Guardian |date=13 January 2019}}</ref> He was sent off for dissent after the final whistle in a 1–0 loss at [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on 9 February.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Prentice |first1=David |title=Everton defender Kurt Zouma red-carded AFTER the final whistle at Watford |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-defender-kurt-zouma-red-15806796 |accessdate=17 February 2019 |work=Liverpool Echo |date=9 February 2019}}</ref>
==International career== Zouma is a [[France national youth football team|France youth international]] having represented his nation at [[France national under-16 football team|under-16]] and [[France national under-17 football team|under-17]] level. He played with the under-17 team at the [[2011 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship]] and [[2011 FIFA U-17 World Cup]]. Zouma has been the captain for the [[France national under-21 football team|French under-21]] side.<ref>{{cite web|title=Zouma strike makes it a perfect six for France|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2015/matches/round=2000412/match=2011566/postmatch/report/index.html|publisher=UEFA|date=4 March 2014}}</ref> He was part of the [[France national under-20 football team|under-20 team]] that won the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2013 World Cup]] in Turkey. In the quarter-finals against [[Uzbekistan national under-20 football team|Uzbekistan]] in [[Rize]], he headed the last goal of a 4–0 victory.<ref>{{cite news|title=Uzbeks no match for in-form France|url=https://www.fifa.com/u20worldcup/matches/round=259231/match=300234903/match-report.html|accessdate=4 May 2016|publisher=FIFA|date=6 July 2013}}</ref>
Senior France manager [[Didier Deschamps]] wanted to build a defence around Zouma and fellow youngster [[Raphaël Varane]],<ref name=four/> and on 19 March 2015, he was called him up for the first time for friendlies against [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]] and [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Holyman|first1=Ian|title=Nabil Fekir and Kurt Zouma named in France squad for friendlies|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/international-friendly/story/2356374/nabil-fekir-and-kurt-zouma-named-in-france-squad-for-friendlies|accessdate=20 March 2015|publisher=ESPN|date=19 March 2015}}</ref> He made his debut in the latter match ten days later, a 2–0 win at his former club ground with Saint-Étienne, the [[Stade Geoffroy-Guichard]], replacing [[Morgan Schneiderlin]] for the last eight minutes of the game.<ref>{{cite news|title=France 2–0 Denmark: Lacazette and Giroud on target|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/france-vs-denmark/1703395/report?ICID=MP_MS_5|accessdate=29 March 2015|work=Goal.com|date=29 March 2015}}</ref> After his injury for Chelsea in February, Zouma missed France's hosting of [[UEFA Euro 2016]].<ref name=injury/>
He returned to the squad in August 2017, replacing the injured [[Raphaël Varane]] for a [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|World Cup qualifier]] against the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/world-cup-qualifying-uefa/story/3190974/stoke-defender-kurt-zouma-replaces-raphael-varane-in-france-squad |title=Stoke defender Kurt Zouma replaces Raphael Varane in France squad |date=28 August 2017 |publisher=ESPN}}</ref> He was put on standby for France's squad at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|final tournament]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Benson|first1=Michael|title=World Cup 2018: Chelsea, Manchester United and Manchester City stars included in France's squad for finals|url=https://talksport.com/football/world-cup-2018-chelsea-manchester-united-and-manchester-city-stars-included-frances-squad|accessdate=24 May 2018|publisher=Talksport|date=17 May 2018}}</ref> Zouma earned his first France cap in over three years on 11 October 2018 as a substitute in a 2–2 friendly draw with [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]], coming on as a substitute and winning the equalising penalty.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Pringle |first1=Ben |title=Chelsea player ratings – International break: Morata and Giroud flop again, Ampadu injured |url=https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/1030543/Chelsea-player-ratings-international-break-Morata-Giroud-Ampadu |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=Daily Express |date=12 October 2018}}</ref>
==Style of play== [[File:Kurt Zouma (03-08-2011).jpg|thumb|right|150px|Zouma with Saint-Étienne in 2011]] A November 2013 report by ''[[FourFourTwo]]'' noted Zouma's strength, reading of the game, and aerial presence, while mentioning his occasional lapses in concentration.<ref name=four>{{cite news|last1=Simon|first1=Tim|title=Everything you need to know about... Kurt Zouma|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/everything-you-need-know-about-kurt-zouma#:LTIsiA1MqkpNyA|accessdate=4 May 2016|work=FourFourTwo|date=13 November 2013}}</ref> In January 2014, Zouma was named by British newspaper ''[[The Observer]]'' as one of the ten most promising young players in Europe. The newspaper wrote, "Blessed with exceptional power and technique, Zouma is also coveted by many for his leadership qualities."<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/jan/19/next-10-big-things-europes-top-youngsters|title=The next 10 big things: Europe's top youngsters and stars of the future|date=18 January 2014|work=The Observer}}</ref>
''[[Match of the Day]]'' pundit, [[Danny Murphy (footballer, born 1977)|Danny Murphy]] linked Zouma to [[Marcel Desailly]], another Frenchman who played in defence for Chelsea. Writing after a draw with [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], which included a strong run and perfectly-executed sliding tackle on [[Sergio Agüero]], Murphy noted Zouma's reliability and confidence against the strong opponent, in addition to his pace. He predicted that Zouma could be a Chelsea mainstay for years to come, and would be an ideal replacement for captain [[John Terry]], then aged 34.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Murphy|first1=Danny|title=Chelsea 1–1 Man City: 'Kurt Zouma reminds me of Marcel Desailly'|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31078757|accessdate=1 February 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 February 2015}}</ref>
Shawcross called Zouma the "ultimate defender" for his speed, jump, passing, shooting and tackling, and said that [[Tottenham Hotspur]]'s [[Toby Alderweireld]] was the only central defender on his level.<ref name=shawcross/>
==Personal life== Zouma's parents emigrated to France from the [[Central African Republic]].<ref>{{cite news|title=France: Kurt Zouma parle de la paix en Centrafrique|trans-title=France: Kurt Zouma speaks of peace in the Central African Republic|url=http://www.journaldebangui.com/article.php?aid=7416|accessdate=28 August 2015|work=Journal de Bangui|date=8 October 2014|language=French}}</ref> His older brother [[Lionel Zouma|Lionel]] plays in the same position for French club [[Football Bourg-en-Bresse Péronnas 01|Bourg-en Bresse]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Les retrouvailles des " jumeaux " Zouma|trans-title=The reunion of the Zouma "twins"|url=http://www.leparisien.fr/espace-premium/sports/les-retrouvailles-des-jumeaux-zouma-23-03-2014-3697943.php|accessdate=29 January 2015|work=[[Le Parisien]]|date=23 March 2014|language=French}}</ref> Zouma is named after Kurt Sloane, [[Jean-Claude Van Damme]]'s character in the 1989 film [[Kickboxer (1989 film)|''Kickboxer'']], while his middle name Happy reflects an African tradition of using positive words as middle names.<ref>{{cite news|last1=de Menezes|first1=Jack|title=Chelsea vs Aston Villa: Kurt Zouma reveals he is named after Jean-Claude Van Damme...and why he has reason to smile all the time|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/chelsea-vs-aston-villa-kurt-zouma-reveals-he-is-named-after-jean-claude-van-dammeand-why-he-has-9755954.html|accessdate=4 May Bridge|url=http://www.thesportreview.com/tsr/2015/12/photo-chelsea-star-relaxes-with-his-kids-at-stamford-bridge/|accessdate=9 February 2016|work=The Sports Review|date=20 December He only officially signed for Chelsea in 2015, after he was able to obtain a work permit after spending three years in the country.{{Cite news |title=Victorien Angban - TheChels.info - The Chelsea Football Club Wiki |url=http://thechels.info/wiki/Victorien_Angban|publisher=TheChels.info}} ====Loan to Sint-Truiden==== On 14 July 2015, it was announced that Angban would spend the season on loan at Belgian club [[Sint-Truidense V.V.|Sint-Truiden]].{{Cite news |title=Loan for young midfielder |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/07/loan-for-young-midfielder.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=14 July 2015}} On 24 July 2015, Angban made his professional debut as a 64th-minute substitute in a 2–1 victory over [[Club Brugge KV|Club Brugge]] in their first game of the season.{{Cite news |title=Belgium Pro League: STVV - Club Brugge - FIFA.com |url=https://www.fifa.com/world-match-centre/nationalleagues/nationalleague=belgium-pro-league-2000000009/matches/match=stvv-club-brugge-300325171/index.html |publisher=FIFA|date=24 July 2015}} Angban made his first start for the team on 8 August, against [[K.V. Oostende]] which ended in a 1–1 draw.{{Cite |title=STVV 1-1 K.V. Oostende |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/08/08/belgium/pro-league/sint-truidense-vv/kv-oostende/2038964/ |publisher=Soccerway|date=8 August 2015}} On 27 September 2015, Angban was sent off in the 79th minute in the game against [[R.S.C. Anderlecht]] in a 1–0 loss.{{Cite |title=Anderlecht 1-0 STVV |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/09/27/belgium/pro-league/royal-sporting-club-anderlecht/sint-truidense-vv/2039009/ |publisher=Soccerway|date=27 September 2015}} On 29 January 2016, Angban was again sent off in a match against Anderlecht in the closing minutes of a 2–1 loss.{{Cite |title=STVV 1-2 Anderlecht |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/01/29/belgium/pro-league/sint-truidense-vv/royal-sporting-club-anderlecht/2039136/ |publisher=Soccerway|date=29 January 2016}} On 5 March 2016, Angban was sent off for the third time this season a match against [[Club Brugge KV]] after picking up two yellows; the match ended in a 3–0 loss for Sint-Truiden.{{Cite |title=Club Brugge 3-0 STVV |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/03/05/belgium/pro-league/club-brugge-kv/sint-truidense-vv/2039169/ |publisher=Soccerway|date=5 March 2016 }} At the end of the season, Angban picked up a total of 8 yellow cards and was sent off a total of 3 times. ====Loan to Granada==== On 22 July 2016, it was announced that Angban would be joining Spanish side [[Granada CF|Granada]] on loan for the season. Angban is the second Chelsea player to join Granada on loan, with the first being [[Jérémie Boga]].{{cite web|url=http://www.granadacf.es/noticia/angban-musculo-para-la-medular-granadinista?platform=hootsuite|title=Angban, músculo para la medular granadinista |publisher=Granada CF |date=22 July 2016}} On 16 September 2016, Angban made his debut in a 2–2 draw against [[Real Betis]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/09/16/spain/primera-division/real-betis/granada-club-de-futbol/2282941/ |title=Real Betis vs. Granada 2 - 2 (2016/09/16) |date=16 September 2016}} ====Loan to Waasland-Beveren==== On 28 July 2017, it was announced that Angban would be joining Belgian side [[Waasland-Beveren]] on loan for the season.{{cite web|url=http://www.waasland-beveren.be/2017/07/waasland-beveren-versterkt-zich-victorien-angban/|title=WAASLAND-BEVEREN VERSTERKT ZICH MET VICTORIEN ANGBAN|publisher=Waasland-Beveren |date=28 July 2017}} ====Loan to FC Metz==== In July 2018, it was announced that Angban would be joining [[FC Metz]] in French [[Ligue 2]] on loan for the season.{{Cite news|url=http://www.fcmetz.com/2018-2019/actualites/equipe-pro/victorien-angban-arrive-en-pret|title=Victorien Angban arrive en prêt !|last=sgobbi|date=27 July 2018|work=Football Club de Metz|access-date=25 August 2018|language=fr}} == International career == Angban has represented Ivory Coast at U17 level. Angban represented his nation and scored at the 2015 African Under-20 Championship finals.{{Cite web|title = Bekanty Victorien Angban|url = https://www.chelseafc.com/teams/on-loan-players/bekanty-victorien-angban.html|website = www.chelseafc.com|accessdate = 8 August 2015}} On 2 October 2015, Angban received his first senior Ivory Coast call up by manager [[Michel Dussuyer]] as they took on [[Morocco national football team|Morocco]] in a friendly.{{Cite news |title=Ivory Coast decline to call up star City pair Milan|Milan]], on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] from {{English football updater|Chelsea}} club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], and the [[France national football team|France national team]]. He plays as a [[defensive midfielder]] due to his ability to break up play, but is considered to have all-round ability, as well as possessing physical power and athleticism, with France manager [[Didier Deschamps]] describing him as "a complete midfielder." After suffering a broken leg as a young player, Bakayoko joined the academy at [[Rennes F.C.|Rennes]] at the age of 13. At 14, he was turned down by the [[Clairefontaine (football)|Clairfontaine]] academy. His senior career began at Rennes where he made 24 appearances before moving to [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] in 2014 for £7 million. In his first two seasons at the club, Bakayoko made 31 Ligue 1 appearances, but was a regular starter in the [[2016–17 Ligue 1|2016–17 season]], contributing to Monaco's Ligue 1 title win as well as being named in the [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League|2016–17 UEFA Champions League squad of the season]]. In 2017, he joined Chelsea for £40 million. Bakayoko made his first senior international appearance for France in March 2017. ==Early life== Bakayoko was born in Paris on 17 August 1994 and played for Paris 15sème O at the age of five. Aged nine, he played for CA Paris Charenton before moving to Montrogue FC 92. As a young player, Bakayoko suffered a broken leg which stopped him playing football for eight months. In 2008, at the age of 13, he joined the academy at Rennes.{{cite web|last1=Holyman|first1=Ian|title=Makelele made Chelsea target Bakayoko|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/blog/transfer-talk/79/post/3032516/tiemoue-bakayoko-chelsea-and-manchester-united-target-influenced-by-claude-makelele-and-yaya-toure|publisher=ESPN|accessdate=27 June 2017}} At 14, he was rejected by the renowned Clairefontaine academy. ==Club career== ===Rennes=== Bakayoko made his debut for the [[Ligue 1]] side on 24 August 2013 in a Ligue 1 match against [[Évian Thonon Gaillard F.C.|Évian TG]], playing the whole match in a 2–1 away win.{{cite web|last1=Pandey|first1=Kaustubh|title=Scout Report: Tiemoue Bakayoko {{!}} Monaco's midfield engine|url=http://outsideoftheboot.com/2017/03/02/scout-report-tiemoue-bakayoko-monaco/|website=Outside of the Boot|accessdate=27 June 2017|date=2 March 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2013/08/24/france/ligue-1/football-croix-de-savoie-74/stade-rennais-fc/1479069/|title=Evian vs. Rennes – 24 August 2013 |publisher=Soccerway|accessdate=18 December 2016}} ===Monaco=== ====2014–2016==== [[File:Monaco-Zenit (4).jpg|thumb|upright|Bakayoko playing for [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] in 2014]] Bakayoko joined [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] in July 2014 for £7 million,{{cite web|title=Tiémoué Bakayoko signs for AS Monaco on a five-year deal|url=http://www.asmonaco.com/en/article/tiemoue-bakayoko-signs-for-as-monaco-on-a-five-year-deal-65340.html|publisher=AS Monaco FC|accessdate=18 July 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170825062311/http://www.asmonaco.com/en/article/tiemoue-bakayoko-signs-for-as-monaco-on-a-five-year-deal-65340.html|archive-date=25 August 2017|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} and made his debut for the club on 10 August 2014 in a [[Ligue 1]] match against [[FC Lorient|Lorient]]. He was replaced by [[Valère Germain]] after 32 minutes in a 2–1 home loss.{{cite web|last1=Butler|first1=Michael|title=Monaco v Lorient: Ligue 1 – as it happened|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2014/aug/10/monaco-v-lorient-ligue-1-live-mbm?page=with:block-53e7c419e4b060867783c157|website=The Guardian|accessdate=27 June 2017|date=10 August 2014}}{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/08/10/france/ligue-1/association-sportive-monaco-fc/football-cub-lorient-bretagne-sud/1686691/|title=Monaco vs. Lorient – 10 August 2014 |publisher=Soccerway|accessdate=18 December 2016}} His early substitution by Monaco manager [[Leonardo Jardim]] created a strained relationship between the two, with Bakayoko saying: "From then on, something was a little broken between him and me". After his debut, Bakayoko didn't start another match for over two months, with the remainder of his season blighted by injuries and inconsistent form.{{cite web|last1=Doyle|first1=Paul|title=Tiemoué Bakayoko: a deft midfield monster who could become a superstar at Chelsea|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/jul/17/tiemoue-bakayoko-chelsea-midfielder-monaco-claude-makelele|website=The Guardian|accessdate=18 July 2017|date=17 July 2017}} Difficulties between Jardim continued, with Bakayoko feeling unfairly treated by his manager who had become frustrated at Bakayoko's progress, questioned his attitude during training and was critical of Bakayoko for sometimes being late for meetings. ====2016–2017==== {{Quote box| width=25% |align=right |quote="Makelele helped me greatly. When he arrived at Monaco I wasn't a very, very good player, but I had a lot of discussions with him. He gave me a lot of advice and he allowed me to play my style of football more simply." |source=– Bakayoko on the advice he received from [[Claude Makelele]]}} Following his first two seasons at Monaco, in which he made 31 Ligue 1 performances, Bakayoko decided to change his behaviour to fulfil his potential, which included moving from a luxury villa to an apartment and changing the colour of his car from pink to black. Additionally, he began boxing, changed his diet and improved his strength. He was helped by former France international [[Claude Makelele]], who had been appointed director of football at Monaco in 2016,{{cite web|last1=Charles|first1=Andy|title=Claude Makelele named Monaco's new technical director|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11816/10122017/claude-makelele-named-monacos-new-technical-director|website=Sky Sports|accessdate=28 June 2017|language=en}} on how to improve his football and take care of himself off the pitch. Bakayoko also sought advice from his former youth coach at Rennes, Yannick Menu. As a result, and with [[Jérémy Toulalan]] and [[Mario Pašalić]] having both left the club in 2016, Bakayoko became a regular starter for Monaco, helping the club to the Ligue 1 title in the 2016–17 season and named in the 2016–17 UEFA Champions League squad of the season. It was a decisive season for Bakayoko. Not only had he established himself as an important part of Monaco's team with consistent performances, he had fewer injuries and his application during training was no longer criticised. During the [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|2016–17 UEFA Champions League round of 16-second leg match]] at the [[Stade Louis II]] on 15 March 2017, Bakayoko scored the final goal (it was his first ever [[UEFA Europa League]] or [[UEFA Champions League]] goal) with a header from a [[Thomas Lemar]] free-kick to help Monaco secure a vital goal against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]. Monaco won 3–1 and won the tie on the away goals rule (aggregate score 6–6).{{cite web|last1=Shamoon|first1=Hafez|title=Monaco 3–1 Manchester City (agg 6–6): Monaco win on away goals|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39248906|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=9 November 2017}} During an interview, Bakayoko said a recurrence of an knee injury from 2015 leading to a crack in the [[Meniscus (anatomy)|meniscus]] caused him a lot of discomfort during his final season at Monaco: "People don't know but throughout the whole of last season I suffered because of my knee. I really had to grit my teeth in every match."{{cite web|last1=McLeman|first1=Neil|title=Chelsea's Tiemoue Bakayoko lays bare injury woe|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/chelseas-tiemoue-bakayoko-lays-bare-11046017|website=Daily Mirror|accessdate=20 May 2018|date=24 August 2017}} ===Chelsea=== [[File:Chelsea 4 Watford 2 (Tiémoué Bakayoko).jpg|thumb|upright|Bakayoko playing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2017]] On 15 July 2017, Bakayoko signed for [[Premier League]] club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on a five-year contract for a fee around the margin of £40 million,{{Cite news |title=Bakayoko is a Blue |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/07/bakayoko-is-a-blue.html |publisher=Chelsea Official Site |date=15 July 2017 |accessdate=15 July 2017}}{{cite web|last1=Rice|first1=Simon|title=Tiemoue Bakayoko confirms Chelsea legend was major influence|url=http://metro.co.uk/2017/07/17/tiemoue-bakayoko-confirms-chelsea-legend-claude-makelele-played-major-role-in-his-development-6784766/|website=Metro|accessdate=18 July 2017|date=17 July 2017}} making him the club's second most expensive signing at the time, after [[Fernando Torres]].{{cite web|last1=Thomas|first1=Lyall|title=Tiemoue Bakayoko seals £40m Chelsea transfer from Monaco|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11668/10949875/tiemoue-bakayoko-completes-40m-chelsea-move-from-monaco|website=Sky Sports|accessdate=22 July 2017|language=en}} He made his Chelsea debut in a 2–1 away win over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in the Premier League on 20 August 2017.{{cite web|last1=Spencer|first1=Jonathan|title=Chelsea manager Antonio Conte praised the "commitment" of his team in a "moment that is not easy" as they bounced back from their opening-day loss to Burnley by beating Tottenham at Wembley|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40914668|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=9 November 2017}} On 5 February, he was sent off for the first time in his Chelsea career, in a 4–1 loss away to [[Watford FC|Watford]]. Bakayoko was given his marching orders for two bookable offences, one on [[Étienne Capoue]] and the other on [[Richarlison]], both in the first half.{{cite web|last1=Banks|first1=Tony|title=Watford 4 – Chelsea 1: Conte on the brink, Bakayoko red card, Deeney swears at fans|url=https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/914889/Watford-vs-Chelsea-Conte-sack-Bakayoko-red-card-Deeney-swears-fans|publisher=Daily Express|date=6 February 2018}} Bakayoko failed to impress in his first season. He was criticised for his performances by fans and pundits alike, with games against both [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], where he was sent off after only 30 minutes, and a 3–0 away defeat by [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on the last day of the Premier League season being singled out as two of his worst.{{cite web|last1=Slagle |first1=Joel |url=https://www.footballparadise.com/tiemoue-bakayoko-anatomy/ |title=Tiémoué Bakayoko – The Anatomy of a Failed Signing |date=4 April 2018 |accessdate=14 May 2018 |publisher=Football Paradise}}{{cite web|last1=Mokbel |first1=Sami |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-5355275/Chelsea-fans-turn-Bakayoko-red-card-Watford.html |title='You’re f****** s***!' Chelsea fans turn on Tiemoue Bakayoko after blundering midfielder was sent off at Watford |date=5 February 2018 |accessdate=14 May 2018 |publisher=The Daily Mail}}{{cite web|last1=Boon |first1=Richie Inter victory |date=28 July 2018 |accessdate=28 July 2018 |publisher=football.london}} ====Milan (loan)==== On 14 August 2018, Bakayoko signed for [[Serie A]] club [[A.C. Milan]] on a season-long [[Loan (sports)|loan]] for a fee of €5 million with an option to make the move permanent for €35 million.{{cite web|url=https://www.acmilan.com/en/news/media/2018-08-14/official-announcement-tiemoue-bakayoko |title=Official announcement: Tiémoué Bakayoko |date=14 August 2018 |accessdate=14 August 2018 loan|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2018-08-14|language=en}} His career in Italy did not get off to a good start, and he was labelled 'confused’, ‘a disaster’, and ‘messy' after a poor performance in a [[UEFA Europa League]] game against [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]], in which he gifted the Greek side the opener in a 3-1 win.{{cite tempo reale|access-date=2018-12-02|language=en}} ==International career== Bakayoko was called up to the senior France squad for the first time to face [[Luxembourg national football team|Luxembourg]] and Spain in March 2017 after [[Paul Pogba]] withdrew through injury.{{cite news|title=Le Monégasque Bakayoko remplace Pogba chez les Bleus|url=http://sport24.lefigaro.fr/football/equipe-de-france/fil-info/le-monegasque-bakayoko-remplace-pogba-chez-les-bleus-850887|accessdate=18 March 2017|publisher=sport24.com|date=18 March 2017|language=French}} He made his debut on 28 March 2017 against the latter, replacing [[Adrien Rabiot]] at half-time of a 2–0 friendly home loss.{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2017/03/28/world/friendlies/france/spain/2381549/|title=France vs. Spain – 28 March 2017 |publisher=Soccerway|accessdate=28 March 2017}}{{cite compared to [[Yaya Touré]] due to his strong all-round qualities of pace, intelligent reading of the game, ability to intercept passes and accomplished tackling, passing and dribbling,{{cite web|last1=Yokhin|first1=Michael|title=Tiemoue Bakayoko: Meet Monaco's midfield general being squabbled over by Manchester United and Chelsea|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/tiemoue-bakayoko-meet-monacos-midfield-general-being-squabbled-over-manchester-united-and|website=FourFourTwo|accessdate=27 June 2017|date=24 January Griezmann|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-transfer-news-bakayoko-12808194|website=Manchester Evening News |accessdate=27 June 2017|date=29 March 2017}} as well as being physically powerful and athletic. He plays as a defensive midfielder in the [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|centre]] of the pitch, breaking up attacks and making driving forward runs, with only [[Gabi (footballer)|Gabi]] and [[Danny Drinkwater]] breaking up more attacks during the [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League|2016–17 Champions League]].{{cite web|last1=Gordon|first1=Jamie|title=Who is Tiemoue Bakayoko? £35million Chelsea target set to replace Nemanja Matic|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/2569337/tiemoue-bakayoko-monaco-midfielder-chelsea/|website=The Sun|accessdate=27 June 2017|date=23 June 2017}} Bakayoko's manager at Monaco, [[Leonardo Jardim]], said: "He wins a lot of balls, brings balance to the team. He passes the ball well and wins his duels. That is Bakayoko's role."{{cite web|last1=Bhardwaj|first1=Vaishali|title=Bakayoko scouting report: How he will fit in to Chelsea's midfield|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/tiemoue-bakayoko-chelsea-scouting-report-how-will-he-fit-in-to-midfield-a3575386.html|website=London Evening Standard|accessdate=18 July 2017|date=29 June 2017}} France manager [[Didier Deschamps]] described Bakayoko as "a complete midfielder", and said: "He has an important athletic presence, he's good at recovery, he scores decisive goals and is able to project himself."{{cite web|last1=Surlis|first1=Pat|title=Tiemoue Bakayoko's rise with Monaco and Chelsea role examined|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11096/10930291/tiemoue-bakayokos-rise-with-monaco-and-potential-chelsea-role-examined|website=Sky Sports|accessdate=18 July 2017|language=en}} His manager at AC Milan, [[Gennaro Gattuso]], said that Bakayoko plays as a deep-lying midfielder in an atypical way, because sometimes prefers to point and go past the opponent instead of launching the ball, so creating a numerical advantage in favor of his team.{{cite web|url=https://www.milannews.it/le-interviste/gattuso-a-rai-sport-grande-partita-difensiva-piatek-e-un-cecchino-bakayoko-importante-per-noi-322410|title=Gattuso a Rai Sport: "Grande partita difensiva. He has two older brothers, [[Eden Hazard|Eden]] and [[Thorgan Hazard|Thorgan]], and one younger, [[Ethan Hazard|Ethan]], all of whom are footballers. ==Early life== Kylian Hazard was born in [[La Louvière]] and grew up in [[Braine-le-Comte]]. His mother, Carine, and father, Thierry, were both footballers playing in Belgium. His father spent most of his career playing as a semi-professional with [[R.A.A. Louviéroise|La Louvière]] in the [[Belgian Second Division]].{{cite news | url = http://www.leparisien.fr/sports/les-hazard-une-famille-de-foot-13-05-2011-1447493.php | title = Les Hazard, une famille de foot | date = 15 March 2011 | accessdate = 19 December 2011 |work=Le Parisien | language = French }} He played mainly as a [[defensive midfielder]]. His mother played as a [[Striker (association football)|striker]] in the [[Belgian Women's First Division]] and stopped playing when she was three months pregnant with her eldest son Eden Hazard.{{cite news |url=http://www.lavoixdessports.com/LOSC/2010/01/29/article_avant-d-etre-partagee-entre-lille-et-len.shtml | title = Avant d'être partagée entre Lille et Lens, la famille Hazard a cultivé son jardin secret |date= 29 January 2010| accessdate = 19 April 2011 | publisher=La Voix des Sports | language = French }} After playing football, both parents became sports teachers. Thierry retired from his position in 2009 in order to devote more time to his children. Kylian is the third of four children. His eldest brother [[Eden Hazard|Eden]] previously played for [[Lille OSC|Lille]] and now plays for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in the [[Premier League]]. His other elder brother, [[Thorgan Hazard|Thorgan]], joined Eden at [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2012, before moving to [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]] in January 2015, and had previously progressed through the youth ranks of Lille's [[Derby du Nord|biggest rivals]] [[RC Lens|Lens]].{{cite news|title=Thorgan Hozard joins Chelsea |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10268~2859608,00.html |work=[[Chelsea F.C.]] |date=24 July 2012 |accessdate=24 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120726143551/http://www.chelseafc.com/page/LatestNews/0%2C%2C10268~2859608%2C00.html |archivedate=26 July 2012 |df= }}{{cite news | url = http://fr.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=955072.html | title = Eden Hazard, protection rapprochée | date = 21 November 2008 | accessdate = 10 April 2010 | publisher = [[FIFA|Fédération Internationale de Football Association]] | language = French | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090501150142/http://fr.fifa.com/worldfootball/clubfootball/news/newsid=955072.html | archivedate = 1 May 2009 | df = }}{{cite news|url=http://www.footgoal.net/suite.php?selection=21280 |title=Eden est entouré de professionnels |date=27 November 2007 |accessdate=10 April 2010 |publisher=Foot Goal |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081105084607/http://www.footgoal.net/suite.php?selection=21280 |archivedate= 5 November 2008 |df= }}{{cite news|url=http://www.lensois.com/article-1911-l-interview-decouverte-de-thorgan-hazard.html |title=L'interview découverte de Thorgan Hazard |accessdate=10 March 2010 |publisher=Lensois |language=French |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100313121407/http://www.lensois.com/article-1911-l-interview-decouverte-de-thorgan-hazard.html |archivedate=13 March 2010 |df= }} His younger brother Ethan currently plays in the youth academy of [[A.F.C. Tubize|Tubize]], where Eden, Thorgan and Kylian all played earlier in their lives.{{cite news|url=http://www.footlille.com/breve-23662-.html |title=M.
