final squad.{{cite news|title=Pasalic loan move to Monaco|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/07/pasalic-loan-to-monaco.html|work=Chelsea Official site}} He made his debut for Croatia on 4 September 2014 when he replaced [[Mario Mandžukić]] in a friendly home victory over [[Cyprus national football team|Cyprus]].{{cite news|title=Mario Pašalić Profile|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/teams/on-loan-players/mario-pasalic.html|work=Chelsea Official site}} In May 2018 he was named in Croatia’s preliminary 32 man [[Croatia national football team|squad]] for the [[2018 World Cup]] in [[Russia]]http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb but did not make the final 23.{{cite news |url=http://hns-cff.hr/en/news/18052/head-coach-dalic-presents-24-man-croatia-squad/ |title=Head coach Dalić presents 24-man Croatia squad |website=hns-cff.hr |publisher=Croatian ChievoVerona|Chievo]], on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. He is primarily a [[Forward (association football)|striker]], although he has also been deployed as a left [[Winger (association football)#Winger|winger]], as an [[attacking midfielder]] or in the hole behind the striker. ==Early life== Piazon was born in [[São Paulo]], to António Carlos Piazon, a commercial representative, and Marizabel Domingues, a lawyer. He had a financially secure upbringing that allowed him to focus on both school and football at the same time. Both of Piazon's parents took an active role in his career. He grew up with his sister Juliana, who is three years younger than him{{cite news|url=http://www.chelseaindia.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=27&t=781&start=0|title=Piazon sister|publisher=ChelseaIndia|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140116080351/http://www.chelseaindia.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=27&t=781&start=0|archivedate=16 January 2014|df=dmy-all}} and was a [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] supporter from an early age, aspiring to play for them some day.{{cite news|url=http://pitacodogringo.wordpress.com/2011/06/13/interview-with-chelsea-signing-lucas-piazon-full-version/|title=Piazon Biography|date=11 June 2011|accessdate=11 June 2011|publisher=pitacodogringo}}{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/boy-from-brazil-set-for-life-at-chelsea-2672129.html|title=Brazilian to Stamford Bridge|date=11 June 2011|accessdate=11 June 2011|work=The Independent}} When he was young, Piazon's family moved to [[Paraná (state)|Paraná]]. Piazon's football skills began to blossom at age eight. He developed an interest in [[futsal]] (indoor football) like other Brazilian footballers (such as [[Zico]] and [[Ronaldinho]]). He began playing for [[Coritiba Foot Ball Club|Coritiba]]. At the age of 11, Piazon made the switch from [[Indoor soccer|indoor]] to the field. ==Club career== ===Youth career=== Piazon began his professional career with [[Coritiba Foot Ball Club|Coritiba]]. He made an impression with them becoming top scorer in every youth tournament he appeared in. In 2007, he moved to neighbouring club, [[Clube Atlético Paranaense|Atlético Paranaense]]. He again turned out, as Atlético reached the finals of the U-15 Copa do Brasil in 2008, which they eventually lost to [[São Paulo FC|São Paulo]]. São Paulo became very impressed with his performance and made an offer. At the age of 14, Piazon left his family behind in Curitiba and joined São Paulo. In May, he began to attract the attention of international scouts when he helped guide São Paulo through the Brazilian qualifiers for the [[Manchester United Premier Cup|Premier Cup]] (Nike Cup). It was around this time that he was also called up by Brazil's U-15s. In August, São Paulo travelled to Manchester for the Premier Cup finals. In the Group stage, Piazon scored in the 3–0 win versus [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]]. São Paulo then went on to beat [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] in the final match. ===Chelsea=== In early 2011, Chelsea secured the services of Piazon by means of a pre-contract, having to fight off the interest from a number of the world's leading clubs, including Italian team [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]].{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/8568660/Brazils-best-young-footballers-no-long-available-on-the-cheap.html|title=Brazil's best young footballers no longer available on the cheap|date=10 June 2011|accessdate=8 July 2011|work=The Daily Telegraph|location=London|first=Jon|last=Cotterill}} On 15 March 2011, São Paulo announced that Piazon could only play for the Chelsea senior team after 20 January 2012 when he became eligible to obtain a work visa, but he would join in the 2011 summer transfer window. Chelsea announced ten days later with Piazon passing a medical in London in early March 2011. It was reported that Chelsea paid in the region of [[Pound sterling|£]]5 million to acquire Piazon, which could rise to £10 million depending on several clauses.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/mar/15/chelsea-brazilian-teenager-lucas-piazon |title=Chelsea strike deal to sign Brazilian teenager Lucas Piazon|date=15 March 2011|accessdate=8 July 2011|work=The Guardian|location=London|first=Dominic|last=Fifield}}{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/timvickery/2011/04/will_piazon_stand_out_at_stamf.html|title=Will Piazon stand out at Stamford Bridge?|date=11 April 2011|accessdate=8 July 2011|publisher=BBC Sport}} He was transferred to Chelsea during the 2011 summer transfer window and started playing for the reserves.{{cite news|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2324419|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130425084522/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2324419|dead-url=yes|archive-date=25 April 2013|title=TERMS AGREED FOR YOUNG BRAZILIAN|date=25 March 2011|accessdate=25 June 2014|publisher=Chelsea F.C.}} In an interview, he stated, "[I chose Chelsea because] I like the [[Premier League]]. I think my way of playing and my skills are more suited to the Premier League."{{cite web|url=http://www.givemefootball.com/premier-league/chelsea-starlet-im-not-kaka |title=Chelsea teenager Lucas Piazon rejects Kaka comparisons |publisher=Give Me Football |date=21 October 2011 |accessdate=2 November 2011}} Piazon made his debut for the reserve team against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], thereafter saying, "I am able to play in the Youth Cup now." "Everybody knows I am here to play, so my main aims for the season are to play as many youth games as possible and hopefully feature in the reserves as well, and I want to win the Youth Cup." He also stated, "I am enjoying the company of [[Ramires]], [[Alex (footballer, born 1982)|Alex]] and, of course, [[David Luiz]] is my best friend here. He is so funny and always joking so it's nice."{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2514375 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20140625123649/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2514375 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=25 June 2014 |title=Youth Report: Chelsea 4 Fulham 2 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=12 November 2011 |accessdate=25 June 2014 }} Piazon scored his first reserve goal in an away victory against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], just before full-time with a solo effort, inside the box before firing it into the net.{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2552711 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20140625123644/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2552711 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=25 June 2014 |title=RESERVE REPORT: ARSENAL 0 CHELSEA 4 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=21 December 2011 |accessdate=25 June 2014 }} He has scored twice in five games for the reserves and once in six for the youth team, most notably the winner in the [[FA Youth Cup]] tie against [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]].{{cite web|url=http://www.givemefootball.com/premier-league/chelsea-sign-up-brazilian-starlet |title=Chelsea sign up Brazilian starlet |publisher=Give Me Football |date=26 January 2012 |accessdate=26 January 2012}} He won the FA Youth Cup on 9 May 2012 against Blackburn, although failing to score in the match. On 20 January 2012, his 18th birthday, Piazon obtained a [[work visa]] and became eligible to play for the Chelsea senior team. On 26 January 2012, he signed a contract extension that will keep him with the club until 2017.{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2589434 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130425105748/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2589434 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=25 April 2013 |title=Piazon Signs Extension |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=26 January 2012 |accessdate=25 June 2014 }} After impressing at Under-18 and Reserve level, Piazon was given the number 35 shirt, which was previously worn by [[Juliano Belletti]]. He was an unused substitute on the Chelsea bench, on 31 January 2012, in their 1–1 league draw against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]]{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/16695854.stm |title=Piazon makes bench |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 January 2012 |accessdate=31 January 2012}} and on 5 February 2012, in the 3–3 draw against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16779082 |title=Chelsea v Man U |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 February 2012 |accessdate=5 February 2012}} Former Chelsea manager [[André Villas-Boas]] said, after the [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] game, "He [Piazon] has trained more with the first team, which is very good for him. He's made great progress since arriving and in the last two games was on the bench. Unfortunately, he had no opportunity to enter, but has done a great job in the reserves team. He is a player that we have high hopes for."{{cite web|url=http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/avb-chelsea-have-high-hopes-lucas-piazon-2687411 |title=AVB: Chelsea have high hopes for Lucas Piazon |publisher= Tribal Football |accessdate= 2 September 2012}} On 10 May 2012, Piazon was named Chelsea Young Player of the Year in his first season. He was part of the side that won the FA Youth Cup Final 24 hours earlier. "I am very happy and I didn't expect this. It has been a fantastic week for me. David Luiz and Ramires have helped me a lot here as when I came in I was alone. I hope to be at Chelsea a long time and I will keep working." he said.{{cite news|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2767955 |location=London |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |title=Piazon pick up Chelsea award |date=25 June 2014 }}{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} Later that week, he was named on the bench on the final day of the season, in a home game against [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] which Chelsea won 2–1, but was not involved in the game.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17973169 "Chelsea 2–1 Blackburn"] BBC Sport. 13 May 2012. Retrieved 22 May 2012. He told that he's looking forward to continuing his development and would like to make the breakthrough into the senior side, saying "I hope to be in the main group, train with them every day and if I have a chance to play some games." He went on to say that he's "always dreamed of playing for Chelsea."{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11095/7884927/|title=Piazon living Chelsea dream|date=9 July 2012|accessdate=9 July 2012|publisher=Sky Sports}} ====2012–13 season==== The pre-season prior to the start of the [[2012–13 Chelsea F.C. season|2012–13 season]], Piazon was given a chance to prove himself by Chelsea manager [[Roberto Di Matteo]] after being taken on tour in the United States, came on as a substitute in three of the four matches, making his senior debut in the 4–2 win over [[Seattle Sounders FC|Seattle Sounders]].{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2853452/title/match-report-seattle-sounders-2-chelsea-4 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130119114156/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2853452/title/match-report-seattle-sounders-2-chelsea-4 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=19 January 2013 |title=MATCH REPORT: SEATTLE SOUNDERS 2 CHELSEA 4 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |accessdate=19 July 2012 }} He scored his first goal in his second senior Chelsea appearance, the equaliser to earn Chelsea a 1–1 draw against [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] at [[Yankee Stadium]]. Afterwards, he spoke of his delight: "It was good for me, it was special, to score in my second game", said the forward.{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2857424/title/match-report-chelsea-1-paris-st-germain-1 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130119052844/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2857424/title/match-report-chelsea-1-paris-st-germain-1 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=19 January 2013 |title=MATCH REPORT: CHELSEA 1 PARIS ST-GERMAIN 1 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |accessdate=23 July 2012 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2857441/title/piazon-a-special-feeling |title=PIAZON: A SPECIAL FEELING |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |accessdate=23 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140102182122/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2857441/title/piazon-a-special-feeling |archivedate=2 January 2014 |df=dmy-all }} Piazon came on in the 3–2 defeat to the MLS All-Stars in the [[2012 MLS All-Star Game]]{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2861129/title/match-report-mls-all-stars-3-chelsea-2 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130119010819/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2861129/title/match-report-mls-all-stars-3-chelsea-2 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=19 January 2013 |title=MATCH REPORT: MLS ALL-STARS 3 CHELSEA 2 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |accessdate=26 July 2012 }} and was an unused substitute in the following fixture, with [[Fernando Torres]] taking his place in a 1–0 loss to [[A.C. Retrieved 23 December 2012. ====Loan to Málaga==== During the 2013 January transfer window, Piazon was loaned to Spanish [[La Liga]] side [[Málaga CF|Málaga]] until the end of the season.{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/188425.html |title=Piazon joins Malaga on loan |publisher=ESPN |date=15 January 2013}} He made his debut for Málaga on 24 January 2013, coming on as a substitute in the 4–2 home defeat in the [[2012–13 Copa del Rey|Copa del Rey]] quarter-final against [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]]. On 16 February, he assisted [[Javier Saviola]]'s winner in a 1–0 home win against [[Athletic Bilbao]].{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/348289/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/statistics/id/367077/statistics.html |title=Vitesse Arnhem 3–0 PEC Zwolle |publisher=ESPN FC |date= 22 September 2013}} In the following Eredivisie fixture, against [[N.E.C. (football club)|NEC]], Piazon scored the winner for Vitesse in the 92nd minute, from outside the box, which ended 3–2 on 29 September.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/statistics/id/367069/statistics.html |title=NEC 2–3 Vitesse Arnhem |publisher=ESPN FC |date= 29 September 2013}} On 19 October 2013, he scored a brace and assisted [[Patrick van Aanholt]]'s winner, as Vitesse came from 2–0 down to win 3–2 at [[SC Heerenveen|Heerenveen]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/statistics/id/367054/statistics.html |title=SC Heerenveen 2–3 Vitesse Arnhem |publisher=ESPN FC |date= 19 October 2013}} On 24 November, Piazon scored two penalties at [[Go Ahead Eagles]] in a 3–0 win.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/statistics/id/367025/statistics.html |title=Go Ahead Eagles 0–3 Vitesse Arnhem |publisher=ESPN FC |date= 24 November 2013}} In Vitesse's fixture away to [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]] on 7 December, Piazon scored another goal as Vitesse convincingly won 6–2 to stay at the top of the Eredivisie table.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25287088 |title=Vitesse Arnhem hammered PSV Eindhoven to keep their place at the top of the Dutch table. |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 December 2013 |accessdate=9 December 2013 }} ====Loan to Frankfurt==== On 24 July 2014, Piazon joined [[Eintracht Frankfurt]] on loan for the [[2014–15 Eintracht Frankfurt season|2014–15 season]].{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2014/07/piazon-loaned-to-frankfurt.html |title=Piazon loaned to Frankfurt |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=24 July 2014}} On 2 August, he scored his first goal in a 4–2 friendly win against [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]]. ====Loan to Fulham==== On 31 August 2016, Piazon joined Fulham on a season-long loan, joining Chelsea teammate [[Tomáš Kalas]].{{Cite news |title=Piazon in temporary Fulham switch debut and scored his first goal for the club in a 2–1 [[EFL Cup]] defeat against [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] on 21 September 2016.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37357714|title=Fulham 1–2 Bristol City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 September 2016|accessdate=21 September 2016}} On 17 January 2017, Piazon's loan at Fulham ChievoVerona|ChievoVerona]].{{cite web|url=https://www.chievoverona.it/en/highlights/news/official-lucas-piazon-giallobl%C3%B9|title=OFFICIAL: LUCAS PIAZON IS GIALLOBLÙ|publisher=A.C. ChievoVerona|date=31 January 2019|accessdate=8 February 2019}} ==International career== Piazon has represented Brazil at both under-15 and under-17 levels. At under-15 level, he helped his team to second place in the [[South American Under-15 Football Championship]] of [[2009 South American Under-15 Football Championship|2009]] in Bolivia, being the top goalscorer with ten goals. At the under-17 level, during an international game for Brazil's U17 squad against Paraguay, Piazon scored an extraordinary goal when he kicked the ball with such force that it broke through the side netting of the goals, in a game which they went on to lose 2–1. In the [[2011 FIFA U-17 World Cup]], he scored in a 3–3 draw against the [[Ivory Coast national under-17 football team|Ivory Coast]]. ==Style of play== A tactical player, Piazon is known for his [[Dribbling|flair]], [[Passing (association football)|passing]], [[Shooting (association football)|powerful shooting]], [[Direct free kick|free-kicks]], [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty kick]]s, reading of the game and [[Association football positions#Attacking|clinical finishing]]. Piazon commented on his playing style, "I'd say my playing style is different from typical Brazilian forwards. When you think about these, you think about dribbles and flashy moves. My football is simpler and more direct. It's more like a midfielder playing up front. I like to pass quickly. I don't hog the ball and I don't tend to run with it."{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/8568660/Brazils-best-young-footballers-no-long-available-on-the-cheap.html |title=Piazon Style |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=5 February 2012 |accessdate=5 February 2012 |location=London |first=Jon |last=Cotterill}} The media have often drawn comparisons between Piazon and Brazilian playmaker [[Kaká]], as the pair possess similar attributes and natural technical finesse. Piazon also somewhat resembles Kaká. However, Piazon has rejected comparisons saying: "I don't think [we are similar]", Piazon says of Kaká. "My style and his style are different because I am a [[Winger (soccer)|winger]], or a [[second striker]], and he is a [[Midfielder|central midfielder]]. He went on to say, "I don't think the comparison is because of our style. I think it is because we both played at São Paulo and maybe we can look similar on the pitch sometimes."{{cite web|url=http://www.sambafoot.com/en/news/24902_lucas_piazon___i_don_t_think_i_resemble_kaka_.html |title=Lucas Piazon: "I don't think I resemble Kaká" |publisher=Samba Foot |date=5 February 2012 |accessdate=5 February 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.givemefootball.com/premier-league/chelsea-starlet-im-not-kaka |title=Chelsea starlet: I'm not Kaka |publisher=Give Me Football |date=5 February 2012 |accessdate=5 February 2012}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 24 February 2019}}{{Soccerway|lucas-domingues-piazon/180825|accessdate=26 May 2018}}{{cite web|title=Lucas Piazon » Club matches|url=http://www.worldfootball.net/player_summary/lucas-piazon/2/|publisher=World Football|accessdate=19 August 2015}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"| Club !rowspan="2"| Season !colspan="3"| League !colspan="2"| National Cup !colspan="2"| League Cup !colspan="2"| Continental !colspan="2"| Other !colspan="2"| Total |- ! (UTC) | nationalteam-update = March 21, 2019 }} '''Christian Mate Pulisic''' (born September 18, 1998) is an American professional [[Association football|soccer]] player who plays as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]] or a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] for German club [[Borussia Dortmund]] on loan from English club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], and the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States national team]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/christian-pulisic/413835/|title=Christian Pulisic|publisher=soccerway.com|accessdate=January 24, 2016}}{{Cite web|title = Christian Pulisic – USMNT – US Mens Soccer Official Site|url = http://www.ussoccer.com/players/2014/03/15/05/12/christian-pulisic#tab-5|website = www.ussoccer.com|access-date = January 26, 2016|archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20160130192112/http://www.ussoccer.com/players/2014/03/15/05/12/christian-pulisic#tab-5#tab-5|archive-date = January 30, 2016|dead-url = yes|df = mdy-all}}{{cite web |last1=Caley |first1=Michael |title=Can Christian Pulisic Possibly Live Up To The Hype? |url=https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/can-christian-pulisic-possibly-live-up-to-the-hype/ |accessdate=January 14, 2019}} Born in [[Hershey, Pennsylvania|Hershey]], [[Pennsylvania]], Pulisic began his professional career at Borussia Dortmund, where, after fast progression through the team's youth academy, in which he featured in only 15 youth games, he was promoted to the senior team in 2016, at age 17.{{cite news |last=Uersfeld |first=Stephan |date=January 5, 2016 |title=U.S. youngster Christian Pulisic trains with Borussia Dortmund first team |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/borussia-dortmund/story/2780485/us-christian-pulisic-trains-with-dortmund-first-team?src=com |publisher=ESPN |accessdate=January 2, 2019}} He featured sparingly in his first season at the club, but his involvement increased dramatically in the following campaign, where he was a mainstay in the Dortmund team that won the [[2016–17 DFB-Pokal]].{{Cite web|title = USA's Pulisic a fast-rising talent at Dortmund|url = https://www.si.com/planet-futbol/2016/01/21/christian-pulisic-usa-borussia-dortmund|website = www.si.com|access-date = January 26, 2016|first = Liviu|last = Bird}} After two seasons of first-team football at Borussia Dortmund, Pulisic moved to Chelsea in January 2019 in a [[Transfer (association football)|transfer]] worth [[Euro|€]]64 million ([[United States dollar|$]]73 million/[[Pound sterling|£]]58 million), making him the [[List of most expensive association football transfers|most expensive American player of all time]]. Pulisic holds several [[Bundesliga]] and Dortmund records; he is the youngest non-German to score in the league, the youngest player to score two Bundesliga goals, and is the youngest player to appear and score for Dortmund in the [[UEFA Champions League]].{{cite news|title=Christian Pulisic scores again to become youngest player ever with two Bundesliga goals|url=http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/story/christian-pulisic-scores-again-to-become-youngest-player-ever-with-two-bundesliga-goals-042316|accessdate=April 23, 2016|publisher=Fox Sports|date=April 23, 2016}} A U.S. international, Pulisic has scored 9 goals in 24 games for his country. He has appeared and scored at every [[United States Soccer Federation|youth level]], and made his senior debut in March 2016, at age 17. Later that year, Pulisic featured at the [[Copa América Centenario]], before he became the youngest person to appear and score in a [[FIFA World Cup qualification|World Cup Qualifier]] for the United States. Pulisic has also featured as team captain; their youngest ever. ==Early life== Pulisic was born in [[Hershey, Pennsylvania]], where he spent the majority of his childhood. His parents, [[Mark Pulisic|Mark]] and Kelley Pulisic, both played collegiate soccer at [[George Mason University]] and his father also played professional [[indoor soccer]] for the [[Harrisburg Heat (NPSL/MISL)|Harrisburg Heat]] in the 1990s and later became a coach at both youth and professional levels.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bbiY0Sk1G0g|title=Das American: Christian Pulisic's Spectacular Rise|first=|last=VICE Sports|date=November 9, 2016|publisher=|via=YouTube}} Pulisic lived in England for a year at the age of seven, playing for the youth team of [[Brackley Town F.C.|Brackley Town]]. When his father was general manager of indoor club [[Detroit Ignition]] in the mid-2000s, Pulisic lived in Michigan and played for Michigan Rush. After the family returned to the Hershey area, Pulisic grew up playing for local [[U.S. Soccer Development Academy]] club PA Classics and occasionally training with local professional club Harrisburg City Islanders, now known as [[Penn FC]], during his teen years. Pulisic's grandfather, Mate Pulišić, was born in Croatia on the island of [[Olib]].{{cite web|url=http://www.croatia.org/crown/articles/10920/1/Christian-Pulisic-rising-USA-soccer-star-in-Germany-has-Croatian-roots.html|title=Christian Pulisic rising USA soccer star in Germany has Croatian roots|website=www.croatia.org|accessdate=February 23, 2019}} Pulisic applied for Croatian citizenship after moving to Germany (and the [[European Union]]) in order to avoid having to apply for a German work visa. He got an offer to play for the [[Croatia national football team|Croatia national team]], but declined to do so.{{cite news|title=Pulisic nikada neće postati Pulišić|url=http://slobodnadalmacija.hr/sport/domaci-nogomet/clanak/id/307420/pulisic-nikada-nece-postati-pulisic|accessdate=November 11, 2016|publisher=Slobodna Dalmacija|language=Croatian|date=March 31, 2016}} Pulisic has a cousin, [[Will Pulisic]], who has also represented the United States at the under-17 level, as a goalkeeper, who also plays for Borussia Dortmund.{{cite news|title=U.S. under-17 keeper Will Pulisic set to join cousin Christian at Dortmund|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/borussia-dortmund/story/2835198/us-u17-keeper-will-pulisic-set-to-join-cousin-at-dortmund|accessdate=April 18, 2016|publisher=ESPN FC|date=March 22, 2016}} ==Club career== ===Borussia Dortmund=== In February 2015, [[Borussia Dortmund]] signed 16-year-old Pulisic and assigned him first to their U17 squad and in Summer 2015 to the U19. After scoring 10 and assisting 8 in just 15 games with the Dortmund youth teams,{{cite web|url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2016/01/31/who-us-international-christian-pulisic-and-how-did-he-make-borussia-dortmund-first|title=Who is US international Christian Pulisic, and how did he make the Borussia Dortmund first team at 17 years old?|work=MLSsoccer.com}} Pulisic was called to join the first team over winter break.{{Cite web|title = Der nächste Schritt für Passlack und Pulisic|url = http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/642270/artikel_der-naechste-schritt-fuer-passlack-und-pulisic.html|website = kicker online|access-date = January 26, 2016}} ====2015–16: Breakthrough season==== In January 2016, while with the first team in the winter break, Pulisic played the second half of two friendly matches, scoring one goal and assisting another.{{Cite web|title = Christian Pulisic scores in Dortmund win|url = http://sbisoccer.com/2016/01/christian-pulisic-scores-in-dortmund-win|website = Soccer By Ives|access-date = January 26, 2016|language = en-US}} On January 24, a day after making his debut on the first team bench, Pulisic played 90 minutes in a friendly against [[1. FC Union Berlin|Union Berlin]], scoring a goal and assisting another.{{Cite web|title = Christian Pulisic scores second friendly goal of month for Dortmund|url = http://sbisoccer.com/2016/01/christian-pulisic-scores-second-goal-of-month-for-dortmund|website = Soccer By Ives|access-date = January 26, 2016|language = en-US}} He made his Bundesliga debut in a 2–0 win against [[FC Ingolstadt 04|FC Ingolstadt]] on January 30, 2016, coming on as a second-half substitute for [[Adrián Ramos]].{{cite news|title=American 17-year-old Christian Pulisic makes Bundesliga debut for Dortmund|url=http://www.espnfc.us/borussia-dortmund/story/2797405/american-christian-pulisic-makes-bundesliga-debut-at-age-17|accessdate=January 30, 2016|publisher=ESPN FC|date=January 30, 2016}} On February 18, Pulisic made his [[UEFA Europa League]] debut as a second-half substitute in a 2–0 victory against [[FC Porto]].{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2016/matches/round=2000659/match=2017168/index.html|title=Dortmund deal Porto heavy blow|work=UEFA.com}} Pulisic made his first Bundesliga start on February 21, against Bayer Leverkusen before eventually being substituted for [[Marco Reus]]. He made his second Bundesliga start on April 10, against [[FC Schalke 04]] in the ''[[Revierderby]]'', playing 73 minutes before being replaced by [[İlkay Gündoğan]]. In response to Pulisic's performance against Schalke, team manager [[Thomas Tuchel]] said, "He's a teenager in his first year of professional football. His first two games in the starting eleven were in Leverkusen and here today in Schalke – not the easiest of tasks. It shows our huge appreciation that we see him as a full time player on our team. He was a valuable substitute against Werder Bremen and Liverpool. He has looked really good recently which has been proved today. It is completely normal that he could not have played with this pace and this intensity for over 90 minutes."{{Cite web|url=http://screamer.deadspin.com/christian-pulisic-is-more-than-just-the-next-hyped-savi-1770345385|title=Christian Pulisic, The Latest "Savior Of American Soccer," Is More Than Just Hype|last=Redford|first=Patrick|website=Screamer|language=en-US|access-date=April 12, 2016}} Pulisic scored his first Bundesliga goal for Borussia Dortmund on April 17, opening the scoring in a 3–0 home win against [[Hamburger SV]]. It made him the youngest non-German and fourth-youngest player to score a goal in the Bundesliga, at just 17 years and 212 days old.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/borussia-dortmund/story/2852892/christian-pulisic-youngest-non-german-to-score-in-bundesliga|title=Christian Pulisic becomes youngest non-German to score in Bundesliga|work=ESPNFC.com}} With his goal against [[VfB Stuttgart]] on April 23, Pulisic broke another Bundesliga scoring record by becoming the youngest player to score two goals in the top-flight league. The game also marked his first yellow card in the Bundesliga, as a result of a challenge on [[Emiliano Insúa]].{{cite web|url=http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/story/christian-pulisic-scores-again-to-become-youngest-player-ever-with-two-bundesliga-goals-042316|title=Christian Pulisic scores again to become youngest player ever with 2 Bundesliga goals|work=FoxSports.com}} ====2016–19: DFB-Pokal win and departure==== [[File:Pulisic170727-2.jpg|thumb|right|Pulisic during a training session with [[Borussia Dortmund]] in [[Bad Ragaz]], Switzerland]] In the [[2016 International Champions Cup]] friendly pre-season tournament, Pulisic scored in stoppage time against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] to send the clubs into penalties.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/match?gameId=446686|title=Dourtmund vs. Manchester City Recap|work=ESPNFC.com}} During his first competitive appearance in his second year with the club, Pulisic became Dortmund's youngest player ever to play in the [[UEFA Champions League]].{{cite web|url=http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/story/christian-pulisic-looked-great-in-his-first-ever-champions-league-match-091416|title=Christian Pulisic looked great in his first ever Champions League match|work=FoxSports.com}} The following weekend he scored his first goal of the season and provided two assists in a 6–0 victory against [[SV Darmstadt 98|Darmstadt 98]],{{cite web|url=http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/story/watch-christian-pulisic-score-for-borussia-dortmund-as-the-americans-hot-streak-continues-091716|title=Watch Christian Pulisic score for Borussia Dortmund as the American's hot streak continues|work=FoxSports.com}} one day before his 18th birthday. In a September Champions League group stage game against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], with Dortmund trailing 2–1, Pulisic came on as a second-half substitute and helped set up [[André Schürrle]]'s late goal, allowing Dortmund to earn a 2–2 draw.{{Cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/borussia-dortmund/story/2960753/borussia-dortmund-christian-pulisic-describes-assist-on-andre-schurrle-goal-an-amazing-moment|title=Christian Pulisic describes Andre Schurrle leveller as 'amazing moment'|access-date=September 29, 2016}} In a substitute appearance on October 22, Pulisic assisted one goal and scored the equalizer against [[FC Ingolstadt 04|FC Ingolstadt]], who were last place at the beginning of the day, to salvage a draw, coming back from 3–1 down.{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/borussia-dortmund/story/2978874/christian-pulisic-dortmund-showed-good-heart-to-fight-back-for-draw |title=Christian Pulisic: Dortmund showed 'good heart' to fight back for draw |work=ESPN FC |date=October 22, 2016}} On January 23, 2017, Pulisic signed a new deal with Dortmund which would keep him at the club until 2020.{{cite news|url=http://www.bvb.de/eng/News/Overview/Borussia-Dortmund-also-tie-Christian-Pulisic-to-the-club-for-the-long-term|title=Borussia Dortmund also tie Christian Pulisic to the club for the long-term|date=January 23, 2017|accessdate=January 23, 2017|publisher=Borussia Dortmund}}{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.com/soccer-transfers/story/3044743/christian-pulisic-extends-borussia-dortmund-deal-until-2020|title=Christian Pulisic extends Borussia Dortmund deal until 2020|date=January 23, 2017|accessdate=January 23, 2017|publisher=ESPN FC}} On March 8, 2017, Pulisic scored his first UEFA Champions League goal in a 4–0 victory over [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] in the round of 16, making him BVB's youngest ever scorer in the competition at the age of 18 years, 5 months, and 18 days.{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.com/borussia-dortmund/story/3078280/christian-pulisic-becomes-borussia-dortmunds-youngest-champions-league-goalscorer|title=Christian Pulisic becomes Dortmund's youngest UCL goalscorer|date=March 8, 2017|work=ESPN}} Pulisic also assisted one of [[Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang]]'s goal in the win, advancing Dortmund to the quarter-finals.{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/soccer-insider/wp/2017/03/08/christian-pulisic-scores-in-uefa-champions-league-details-video/|title=Christian Pulisic scores in UEFA Champions League: details, video|work=Washington Post |date=March 8, 2017}} On August 5, 2017, Pulisic scored the first goal in the [[DFL-Supercup]] against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]].{{cite web|url=https://sports.yahoo.com/miss-dortmunds-bartra-hands-bayern-german-super-cup-205017688--sow.html|title=Miss by Dortmund's Bartra hands Bayern German Super Cup|date=August 5, 2017}} ===Chelsea=== On January 2, 2019, Pulisic signed with English club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] for a fee of €64 million ($73 million; £58 million), in a deal that will see him stay at Dortmund on loan for the remainder of the 2018–19 season.{{cite news |title=Christian Pulisic: Chelsea sign Borussia Dortmund attacker for £58m |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46734487 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=January 2, 2019 |accessdate=January 2, 2019 }} This transfer made Pulisic the most expensive American and Borussia Dortmund's second-most-expensive sale of all time, behind [[Ousmane Dembélé]].{{cite news |last=O'Hanlon |first=Ryan |date=January 2, 2019 |title=Christian Pulisic Is Headed to Chelsea. Is American Soccer Ready? |url=https://slate.com/culture/2019/01/christian-pulisic-usmnt-chelsea-soccer-winning.html |work=[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]] |accessdate=January 2, 2019}} ==International career== Pulisic has represented the United States at the U-15 and U-17 levels. He captained the U.S. U-17 national team at the [[2015 FIFA U-17 World Cup|2015 U17 World Cup in Chile]], where he had a goal and an assist in three games.{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/u17worldcup/matches/round=271783/match=300298362/match-report.html|title=FIFA U-17 World Cup Chile 2015 – Matches – USA 2:2 (2:0) Croatia – FIFA.com|work=FIFA.com}} Pulisic scored 20 goals in 34 games with the U17's during his two-year cycle with the team. On March 27, 2016, Pulisic was called up to the Senior team by coach [[Jürgen Klinsmann]] ahead of a [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – CONCACAF Fourth Round|qualifying game]] against [[Guatemala national football team|Guatemala]].{{cite web|url=http://www.ussoccer.com/stories/2016/03/27/15/57/160327-mnt-klinsmann-adds-zusi-and-pulisic-to-world-cup-qualifying-roster|title=Zusi, Pulisic Added to MNT Roster Ahead of Qualifying Match vs. Guatemala, Presented by Liberty Mutual Insurance, in Columbus|publisher=}} Two days later, he made his debut in that match, a 4–0 win at the [[Mapfre Stadium]] in [[Columbus, Ohio]], as an 81st-minute substitute for [[Graham Zusi]]. He became the youngest American to play a World Cup qualifier.{{cite news|title=PULISIC MAKES HISTORY AS USA BEAT GUATEMALA|url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Tournaments/noblmd28-pulisic-youngest-ever-usmnt-player-to-play-world-cup-qualifier-aged-17.jsp|accessdate=April 18, 2016|publisher=Bundesliga|date=March 30, 2016}} Before appearing in that match, Pulisic had been eligible to play internationally for [[Croatian national football team|Croatia]].{{cite news|last1=Straus|first1=Brian|title=Pulisic cap-tied to U.S. after playing in WCQ|url=https://www.si.com/planet-futbol/2016/03/29/christian-pulisic-usa-cap-tied-croatia-world-cup-qualifier|accessdate=October 6, 2017|work=[[Sports Illustrated]]|date=March 29, 2016|language=en}} Pulisic was included on May 21, 2016, in the squad for the United States' hosting of the [[Copa América Centenario]].{{cite news|last1=Floyd|first1=Thomas|title=Pulisic included as USA unveils Copa America squad|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/66/united-states/2016/05/21/23770382/pulisic-included-as-usa-unveils-copa-america-squad|accessdate=May 28, 2016|date=May 21, 2016}} A week later, he became the youngest player to score for the United States in the modern era, when he put home a late goal in a 4–0 friendly win against visiting [[Bolivia national football team|Bolivia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Bundesliga/noblmd33-javier-chicharito-hernandez-and-christian-pulisic-chasing-records-at-the-copa-america-centenario.jsp|title=Chicharito and Pulisic chasing records at the Copa America – bundesliga.com|publisher=|accessdate=August 31, 2016}} On September 2, 2016, Pulisic recorded two goals and an assist in a [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification]] match in a 6–0 victory over [[Saint Vincent and the Grenadines national football team|Saint Vincent and the Grenadines]],{{cite web|url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2016/09/02/us-player-ratings-christian-pulisic-steals-show-qualifying-rout|title=US Player Ratings: Christian Pulisic steals the show in qualifying rout|work=MLSSoccer.com}} becoming the youngest person to score in a World Cup Qualifier for the U.S. and the youngest player ever to score a brace in U.S. history.{{Cite web|url=http://www.ussoccer.com/stories/2016/09/02/22/51/160902-mnt-players-enter-record-book-as-team-steps-closer-to-hex-in-6-0-wcq-win-at-st-vincent|title=USA Players Enter Record Book as Team Steps Closer to Hex in 6–0 Qualifying Win at St. Vincent|website=www.ussoccer.com|access-date=September 3, 2016}} In the following match against [[Trinidad and Tobago national football team|Trinidad and Tobago]], he became the youngest American to start a World Cup Qualifier match.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/united-states/story/2945175/christian-pulisic-sets-record-as-youngest-american-to-start-world-cup-qualifier|title=Christian Pulisic becomes youngest U.S. player to start World Cup qualifier|work=ESPNFC.com}} On June 8, 2017, Pulisic scored both goals in a 2–0 World Cup qualification victory over Trinidad and Tobago. In the last two matches of [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – CONCACAF Fifth Round|2018 World Cup Qualification]], Pulisic scored a goal in each match in a 4–0 victory over [[Panama national football team|Panama]] and a 1–2 defeat to Trinidad and Tobago to finish the [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – CONCACAF Fifth Round|fifth round]] as the top scorer with five goals. Despite this, the United States failed to qualify for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]. On November 20, 2018, Pulisic became the youngest player to captain the United States national team in a friendly defeat to [[Italy national football team|Italy]]. Pulisic was 20 years and 63 days old.{{cite web | url = https://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Bundesliga/why-christian-pulisic-is-the-right-man-to-captain-the-usa-usmnt-dortmund-517955.jsp | title = 10 reasons why Christian Pulisic is the right man to captain the USA | publisher = bundesliga.com | accessdate = December 2, 2018}} ==Style of play== Pulisic is a modern-day number 10. His low center of gravity allows him to dribble at high speeds.{{cite web|url=http://www.faceoffootball.com/scout-report-on-christian-pulisic/|title=Scout Report on Christian Pulisic|first=|last=Shashi|date=March 28, 2016|publisher=}} Recently, he has played more of a winger role for Dortmund. His adept weak-foot skills allow him to play on either side of the field. Because of his style of play Pulisic is known to be a subject of fouls by opponents.{{cite web|title=U.S.'s Christian Pulisic 'not going to change' style in face of multiple {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2016}} {{spanish name|Quintero|Quintero}} {{Use British English|date=May 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Josimar Quintero | image = | image_size = | caption = | fullname = Josimar Aldair Quintero Quintero{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1997|02|3|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Guayaquil]], Ecuador | height = 1.63 m | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Lleida Esportiu]]
(on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) | clubnumber = | youthyears1 = 2005–2013 | youthclubs1 = [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] | youthyears2 = 2013–2017 | youthclubs2 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | years1 = 2017– | clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2017–2018 | clubs2 = → [[FC Rostov|Rostov]] (loan) | caps2 = 0 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2018 | clubs3 = → [[Betis Deportivo Balompié|Betis B]] (loan) | caps3 = 6 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2018– | clubs4 = → [[Lleida Esportiu]] (loan) | caps4 = 13 | goals4 = 0 | club-update = 16 March 2019 | ntupdate = }} '''Josimar Aldair Quintero Quintero''' ({{IPA-es|ɟʝosiˈmaɾ kinˈteɾo}}; born 3 February 1997) is an Ecuadorian professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Lleida Esportiu]] on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. ==Club career== ===Chelsea=== Born in [[Guayaquil]], Quintero moved to Spain with his family at the age of five.{{Cite news |title=Chelsea set to sign Barcelona starlet Josimar Quintero: "The new Antonio Valencia" |url=http://www.101greatgoals.com/blog/chelsea-set-to-sign-barcelona-starlet-josimar-quintero-dubbed-the-new-antonio-valencia/ |publisher=101 Great Goals |date=21 April 2013 |accessdate=30 September 2017}} He joined ''[[La Masia]]'', the youth academy of [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]], at the age of eight. In 2013, it was reported that [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and [[Tottenham Hotspur]] were interested in securing his services,{{cite web|title=Meet the 'next Antonio Valencia' who has 'agreed' to swap Barcelona for Chelsea|url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2013/04/20/meet-the-next-antonio-valencia-who-has-agreed-to-swap-barcelona/|publisher=HITC|accessdate=4 October 2017}} but Quintero opted to join English club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in July 2014.{{cite web|title=Josimar Quintero|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/teams/on-loan-players/josimar-quintero.html|publisher=Chelsea F.C.|accessdate=4 October 2017}} However, due to paperwork and visa issues, Quintero was unable to play a competitive match for Chelsea until he turned 18.{{Cite news |title=Josimar Quintero |url=http://thechels.info/wiki/Josimar_Quintero |publisher=TheChels.info |accessdate=30 September 2017}} During the 2014–15 under-21 campaign, Quintero became a key figure in [[Adrian Viveash]]'s starting eleven, featuring eighteen times and scoring once in all competitions. He scored his first goal for the Chelsea academy in an [[UEFA Youth League]] encounter against Portuguese club [[FC Porto|Porto]].{{cite web|title=South American Chelsea prospect Josimar Quintero nets first goal since Barcelona exit|url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2015/09/29/south-american-chelsea-prospect-quintero-nets-first-goal-since-b/|publisher=HITC|accessdate=4 October 2017}} Following his debut season in England, Quintero transitioned from a winger to a central midfielder. On 5 July 2017, following reports suggesting Quintero was ready to leave Chelsea, he joined Russian club [[FC Rostov|Rostov]] on a season-long loan.{{Cite news |title=Loan move for Quintero |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/07/loan-move-for-quintero.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=5 July 2017 |accessdate=30 September 2017}} On 20 September 2017, Quintero made his Rostov debut during their cup tie against [[FC Volgar Astrakhan|Volgar Astrakhan]], replacing [[Žan Majer]] in their 2–0 away victory.{{Cite news |title=Volgar Astrakhan vs. Rostov|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2017/09/20/russia/cup/volgar-gazprom-astrakhan/fk-rostov-na-donu/2582119/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=20 September 2017 |accessdate=30 September 2017}} On 2 January 2018, Rostov removed Quintero from their official squad list.{{cite web|publisher=[[Russian Premier League]]|url=http://rfpl.org/players/Kintero-Kintero-Hosimar-Aldair|title=Quintero Russian League registration page|date=2 January 2018|language=Russian}} Following his return from Rostov, Quintero joined Spanish club [[Betis Deportivo Balompié|Betis B]] in January 2018 on loan for the remainder of the campaign. The deal also included an option to purchase Quintero at the conclusion of the loan spell.{{Cite news |title=Josimar Quintero, third winter signing of Betis Deportivo |url=http://realbetisbalompie.es/es/noticias/cantera/10782/josimar-quintero-tercer-fichaje-invernal-del-betis |publisher=Betis Deportivo Official Site |date=17 January 2018 |accessdate=17 January 2018}} On 4 March 2018, he made his Betis B debut during their 3–1 away defeat against [[Mérida AD|Mérida]], replacing Jesús Pozo in the 79th minute.{{Cite news |title=Mérida AD vs. Real Betis II |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2018/03/04/spain/segunda-b/merida-ad/real-betis-ii/2540040/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=4 March 2018 |accessdate=10 March 2018}} On 10 August 2018, Quintero agreed to join Spanish third-tier club [[Lleida Esportiu]] on a season-long loan.{{Cite news |title=El Lleida Esportiu i el Chelsea FC acorden la cessió de Josimar Quintero |url=http://www.lleidaesportiu.cat/node/7496 |publisher=Lleida Esportiu Official Site |date=10 August 2018 |accessdate=10 August 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 14 October 2018.{{Cite news |title=J. Quintero |url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/josimar-quintero/420563/ |publisher=Soccerway |accessdate=30 September 2017}}}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|National Cup !colspan="2"|League Cup !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |valign="center"|[[FC Rostov|Rostov]] (loan) |[[2017–18 FC Rostov season|2017–18]] |[[Russian Premier League]] |0||0||1||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||1||0 |- |valign="center"|[[Betis Deportivo Balompié|Betis B]] (loan) |[[2017–18 Segunda División B|2017–18]] |[[Segunda División B|2ª B – Group 4]] |6||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||6||0 |- |valign="center"|[[Lleida Esportiu]] (loan) |[[2018–19 Segunda División B|2018–19]] |2ª B – Group 3 |1||0||2||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||3||0 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !7!!0!!3!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!10!!0 |} {{reflist|group=lower-alpha}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{Soccerway|id=420563}} {{Lleida Esportiu squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Quintero, Josimar}} [[Category:1997 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Guayaquil]] [[Category:Ecuadorian footballers]] [[Category:Association football midfielders]] [[Category:FC Barcelona players]] [[Category:Chelsea F.C. players]] [[Category:FC Rostov players]] [[Category:Real Betis B footballers]] [[Category:Lleida Esportiu footballers]] [[Category:Ecuadorian expatriate footballers]] [[Category:Ecuadorian expatriate sportspeople in Spain]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in Spain]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in England]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in Russia]]
